title: Great location
text:
Ok, let’s start with the positives. 
Good location, just far enough from Times Square, close to many eateries on 9th Avenue & walking distance from most tourist attractions. 
Staff helpful. We had an issue with the tv & within minutes the engineer was there, gave the box a wiggle & job done.  Rooms are of a good size with 2 double beds which were comfy. Bedding & towels clean, shampoo etc. there for you. A small gym, which my son & I used. Very helpful doorman who arranged a cab for 5 at $135, considering it cost $87 for a yellow cab from the airport including additional charges so we had to get 2 cabs. 

Some negatives
Rooms dated, poor lighting (no ceiling light in main bed area, only a bad very yellow lamp), no facilities to make a hot drink, only from reception area & only from 7am-10am, very little a way of sockets to plug chargers in so it was a bit of a juggle. Can be noisy at front of hotel from traffic noise, corridors smelt of fish in the evening

title: Basic city hotel
text:
Basic city hotel. Very dated and dark interior. Clean rooms and friendly staff. 
There was a sink/microwave area in the room 
Was a good base as a quick overnight stay in NYC before travelling elsewhere. Breakfast wasn’t great, just coffee and a breakfast bar.

title: Just what we needed in a great location
text: Went with my daughter - only really used the bedroom, not the restaurant or anything else, but the bedroom was very nice and functional. There was a constant low hum from outside but I think this is just New York and general city noise. It was very comfortable, just what we needed for our dad/daughter sightseeing trip.

title: Yellow Stained Sheets & Filthy Bath
text:
Mixed reviews tell me some rooms are better than others. Sadly our room was terrible.

Room 705

1. Pillows and sheets had yellow stains.

2. Bath is filthy, shower does not work properly and only a trickle comes out.

3. Room is dusty, cupboards worn, wall paper peeling and damaged skirt boards.

4. Beds really uncomfortable. Mattresses seem to be broken with a large dip in the middle.

5. No heating control for the room. Have to keep opening & closing the window to balance the temp.

6. Loud noise from the kitchen area from 3am to 5am every night.

Left tip every day for maids, we had nice clean pillows & sheets next day but then they changed back to yellow stained?

Reception apologised & said it would be looked into. Nothing happened.

Great location but you're playing russian roulette with the rooms by the sound of the reviews.

I've raised a complaint with my holiday provider to get a refund on the hotel including the daily service charge. If that does not work I'll go the section 75 route with my credit card.

title: THE ICONIC BELVEDERE
text: I have been a guest at the BELEVEDERE HOTEL for over 30 years. I call it my home away from home.As I am an avid theatergoer. It is the perfect location to all of the theaters on the great white way. The entire staff is so efficient and welcoming.The rooms are beautifully appointed, and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is quite large, There always seems to be an issue with slow elevators; but for the excellent cost of a stay in New York City I can deal with it easily So many great restaurants in the Hells kitchen area and an easy walk from the 49th St., 50th St. subway. With so many excellent hotels to choose from in New York City I’ll always go back to the Belvedere.

title: Great location for a family trip to NYC
text:
Very centrally located close to Times Square and the theatre district. We stayed in a double double room as a family of 4 with 2 teen daughters.

Positives: 
Location- very central, near to good eateries for breakfast (we liked Carnegie diner) and dinner.
Michael on check in was friendly and helpful.
Room size was decent: 2 double beds, bathroom with shower over bath and toiletries provided (shampoo/conditioner and lotion in large non removable bottles), large walk in closet with safe, small kitchenette with microwave and fridge (we didn’t use as ate out but great to have).
Coffee and hot chocolate and nutrigrain breakfast bars provided every morning- no queues when we were there (Easter 2024)
Beds were comfortable. 
Wi-Fi was fast and effective 
Maid service was efficient and non intrusive
Porters were friendly and helpful at getting cabs and storing luggage.

Negatives:
The room was warm all the time. We had an A/C unit on the window which was effective at cooling the temp but too noisy to sleep with it turned on.
That being said we didn’t complain about the heat so it wasn’t unbearable.
Room decor is v dated- clean but dated. Think lots of dark wood.
Bathroom is small but shower pressure effective and temp good.

Hotel great for a central base for a family of 4 to explore NYC.

title: a pleasant stay!
text: The Belvedere Hotel is an older hotel in a good location in not too busy an area. The room I stayed in was spacious. As you enter the tiled foyer, [the rest of the room is carpeted]  on one side is a kitchenette with a microwave and a refrigerator along with a sink. There is no coffee or tea service nor any water provided. Opposite this is a nice sized closet which contains adequate room to hang coats. The safe and hairdryer are also located here along with an ironing board and an iron. A luggage rack is below this. There was a nice king sized bed and there are windows on two sides of the room. There are blackout curtains on one window but they do not close all the way. The shades on the window provide the blackout but they really need to be replaced. The edges were all frayed. The other window had the wooden type venetian blinds. The room was very clean. The bathroom was a nice size with a tub and shower but there were no decals on the floor of the tub to prevent a fall or any grab bars to hold on to while showering. This bathroom may have been recently renovated since the tile design looked fairly modern and I have seen it in other hotels. The water pressure was good and the water was hot. The towels provided were adequate but have seen better days and are small for the average person. There is a wide screen TV and a nice desk area with a comfortable chair but there are no extra outlets of any kind, USB or otherwise. This made working difficult. The bed was very comfortable but I was looking for an extra blanket and there was none in the closet. There was an extra pillow there. I could not find any way to adjust the temperature in the room. It was comfortable enough so I didn't bother to inquire. The lobby of the hotel is large, the concierge on one side and the check in area on the other. There is a business center in the lobby with two computer screens and a printer. I don't know if there was a charge for using it. In the morning from 7-10a, there is a coffee service in the lobby which provides only coffee and hot chocolate and you are entitled to one granola type bar. There is no hot or cold food available. There is also no restaurant on the premises but there are many in the area which do take out. The back of the hotel connects to a Brazilian steakhouse but this is a separate entity and not associated with the hotel. The elevators in the hotel are small, accommodating 4 people, less with large luggage items. My advise is if you would like to stay here, book directly with the hotel and not thru a third party. There is also a facility fee which is $20/day plus state and city tax daily. In summary, it was a nice stay in a convenient location and I would recommend and return.

title: Hôtel fatigué!  Bon emplacement.
text:
Nous y sommes allés en début mars.  Le prix pour être si près de Times Square est plus qu'acceptable (695$ us pour 4 nuitées).  Il est situé sur la 48 ouest, entre les 8e et 9e avenues, donc à quelques enjambées du lieu mythique...  Vous êtes tout près de M&M, de Hershey, des Krispy Kreme, etc.  Au coin de la rue, il y a une épicerie qui offre aussi un buffet pour emporter (très pratique et surtout moins cher qu'un restaurant dans Hell's kitchen.  Si vous y tenez, allez sur la 8e, au sud de la 48e rue: il y a d'excellents restos.

Revenons à l'hôtel.  Le check in a été rapide, le personnel avenant.  Nous avions demandé une chambre avec deux lits doubles et cuisinette.  Bien qu'il y avait tout ce dont nous avions besoin, nous avons constaté que le personnel de ménage faisait les coins ronds.  Nous avons trouvé des objets sous les lits, derrière les bureaux et commodes.  Tous les robinets de la salles de bains fuyaient.  La salle de bains est petite et encombrée par toutes les serviettes et les rouleaux de PQ...  Il y avait des cheveux dans la baignoire et sur le lavabo (pas les nôtres, va sans dire).

Nous avons appelé au service 3 fois pour des ajustements: la lampe sur le bureau avait une ampoule grillée (et l'abat-jour avait survécu Tchernobyl); le mécanisme du coffre-fort ne fonctionnait pas; le chauffage fonctionnait au max (pas de thermostat dans la chambre).  Le personnel de la maintenance est venu chaque fois corriger la situation. 

La tapisserie décolle et est souillée à plusieurs endroits., il y avait des tâches au plafond et sur le tapis. 

Bref, c'est extrêmement défraichi.  Par contre, les deux lits étaient propres.

À partir de 7h, on vous sert un café et des barres tendres au lobby.

Le check out s'est passé sans problème.

title: Aceptable y bien ubicado
text:
Es el tipico hotel señorial pero antiguo. Ventanas aislan mal del frio. Aire acondicionado muy ruidoso. Camas comodas y personal muy agradable.
Microondas y un pequeño fregadero. Tanbien tiene nevera. Lo mejor, la ubicacion. 
Pese a todo, lo recomiendo.

title: 3rd time and still as lucky!
text: 3rd time staying at The Belvedere and already booked to come back next year.  Although I've had 2 occasions in an executive room and this time it was a standard, you could see the difference but it was still clean and warm. They provided me with a kettle (can't live without a cup of tea) so I'm not sure why people complain about that, all you have to do is ask? I have never experienced anything but helpful friendly staff and I love the fact they have a laundrette and I come home with a case full of clean clothes. Looking forward to next January!

title: Enjoyable stay.
text: Little bit disappointed with the member of staff at check in, robotic and quite unwelcoming. The room was a good size and the bed large and comfortable. The air conditioning was strange to say the least, it couldn't be controlled as there was no controls in the room!!! The boiler had to be manually adjusted by a member of staff? The location was ideal and apart from the first staff member we met everyone else was really nice, couple of times 1 of the lifts was out of order which was mildly annoying but by and large I'd recommend the hotel.

title: Overall ok
text: Overall 4 out of 5 due to bath and shower which were not working properly. The shower had little pressure and bath didn't hold the water in. Other than that it was very good location close to Subway, and places to eat. Also it was quiet at night! We liked the 9th Street for food. There was amazing place for bagels and good taco place. On the other side on 9th and 47th Street in the corner breakfast was good and reasonable price.

title: Repetiremos
text: Habitaciones limpias, camas súper cómodas, la ubicación espectacular. El desayuno de cortesía por las mañanas un detallazo. Está un poquito anticuado, pero estuvimos súper bien, cuando volvamos a NY, sin duda por precio e ubicación repetiremos. La Chica jovencita de la recepción es un encanto, nos asesoró en algunas cosillas, gracias

title: OK, but skip due to the bell staff
text:
Brief stay with this hotel selected on my behalf. Hotel is dated, but well located. Free coffee was nice in the lobby but there were long lines. As a high last minute rate was booked on my behalf, I received a nice upgrade to a very large room considering it’s NYC. Ventilation unit was loud and room was very dated, but still nice. Front desk staff were kind and helpful. 

Weird experience with the bell staff similar to other reviews, with them explaining that tips were required if you stored a bag, and that it was mandatory for them to deliver it to your room and you couldn’t just pick up the bag. I always tip bell staff, but I’m not sure why my small bag needs to be held hostage for an hour wasting my time instead of just handing it over in the lobby so I can carry it up myself. Tolerable stay overall, but not sure I’d voluntarily stay here given the poor service from the bell staff and better options available at that price point.

title: Great location for shows
text: Great location in the Theater District! Room is spacious and well-appointed, very clean. Really appreciate that they use permanent shampoo, etc. dispensers to avoid all the small plastic bottles that are so harmful to our environment!!

title: Would stay here again
text: Would highly recommend. Rooms are abit dated but very big. About 4x the size of other hotels we have stayed at in New York. Amazing location only a 5 minute walk to Times Square. Room was clean, we didn’t have a lot of interaction with staff but when we did it was pleasant.

title: Avoid!!
text: We saw a package deal trip to NYC which included this hotel and once I looked at the photos on it's website and here on TA we had no concerns to book. Sadly these photos are not a true reflection of the accommodation we arrived to and I would advise anybody else to avoid this hotel. We were travelling for my friend's 60th birthday and when we were checking in the lady on reception was very abrupt so this was the first disappointment. When we got to the room, we were so upset to see it's condition. Holes in the wooden furniture, dated bathroom, single glazed window that seemed to be stuck open, no proper air conditioning, old electrics, dirty curtains and carpet. It was minus 7 in temperature in NYC and there were only sheets on the bed and no duvets. The heating unit was attached to the window with tape and located behind the curtain! Health and safety nightmare! Thankfully I had stayed in NYC before so I found the Westin on booking.com and checked us in there and we swiftly checked out. The male on reception when we checked out didnt offer us any other room so I imagine this is what the condition is of all of them now. We are out of pocket and this caused undue stress on a special trip but once we got to the other hotel we were just relieved. I advise anyone who may have booked this hotel on a package to find alternative hotels before you go. I have informed our travel agent but I'm not confident we will receive any refund.

title: Soso
text: Rooms were old.  Window air conditioner. Old bathroom.  Bell service non existent. They offered a discount to parking which was very far away as well as not communicating properly with parking so getting the car with discount takes about 20 extra minutes.  Staff were not friendly.

title: Poor experience
text:
Very poor experience.

* window broken reported 3 times. Finally on day 2 they fixed it [not] the breeze was very strong from the gap. That bad I got a cold on my back. 

* safe did not work. Had to wait for maintenance to fix this.

* on arrival the attitude  of the lady receptionist was TERRIBLE  don't know how she has a job.

Positive points 

* central 
* luggage handler was very polite and very helpful. As arrange our cab to airport.
*  not Recommended for a family in my opinions.

title: A bit dated
text:
Stayed as a family of 5 paid for a double and a 3 . The 3 was really just an average double room where two of my girls had to share ?  So they charged me for 3 but I really should have just been charged for a standard double room  as there was no third bed. 
No facilities for making hot drinks in your room , they provide a small kitchen but no kettle didn’t make sense to me ? 
Basic rooms are very basic they have heating but not air con.  Windows are old filthy and drafty. 
On a plus note staff are helpful and friendly and hotel is in a great location.

title: Great location
text: Brilliant location. Staff were lovely. Bed was very comfortable and the room was so warm we had to open the windows. Bathroom was a little dated but the shower was powerful and hot. Only bad thing i can say really is that i don't understand being charged a deposit per night, that makes no sense to me at all and put a bit of a downer on my trip as i was there on a budget to celebrate my birthday.  I also thought the resort fee was a bit cheeky as it was not mentioned in my booking at all. The hotel should state these things up front in their prices.

title: quiet,  lovely room
text:
great location, clean and comfy... nothing fancy but would definitely stay again.
coffee ,hot cocoa and granola bars in lounge in am 
only issue is elevators . small for number of guests so need patience or take the stairs as we did from 3rd floor.

title: 4* Hotel Experience
text:
Retuned 27th December after staying at the Belvedere hotel in NYC!
Lovely guy on reception when we got there. Checked us in quickly and told us where everything was. 

Room had 2 double beds, kitchenette with microwave and fridge. Iron and hairdryer in the cupboard.
Bathroom had shampoo and conditioner. 

Room was spacious, clean and well equipped.

Fantastic location to explore and  convenience shops less than a 5 minute walk away. 

Coffee and cereal bars downstairs every morning if you want.

Cleaners came in every day and did a great job.

All staff were so friendly and warm. 

Only a couple of issues. Would have liked a kettle in the room and cups. Hadn’t been prewarned about the $300 security deposit that’s taken at check in and returned at checkout. 
Also, lifts are very slow. 

Would stay here again!

title: 4 nights in New York
text:
Myself ,my 16 year old daughter and my friend stayed here 8th -12th December. We were originally booked in another accommodation but it was closed so love holidays booked us into this hotel.. 
I’m so glad they did as we had a lovely stay here 
Hotel is clean staff are friendly and helpful doormen are cheerful and helpful.
Coffee and a breakfast bar you can have in the mornings.

Beware there is $300 hold put on a debit/ credit card for incidentals and the tax amd fees are taken off when u check out . 

Good location a 5/10 min walk to Times Square .

Rooms were very comfortable with a kitchenette I think u can hire a kettle but not sure how much for.
Overall we had a fab stay here met lots of friendly people in the lift going up and down to our room which was nice. 
I would definitely stay here again

title: Clean, safe and convenient!
text:
This hotel is clean, safe and convenient to Broadway shows and Times Square. Central Park and Grand Central are a bit further but walkable ( and I’m 70!).
Hotel staff were good. Easy check in and check out, same cleaning person four days in a row—she was very sweet. 
I wish they could modernize the elevators!
Breakfast is limited to coffee, hot chocolate and little granola bars. There was a line for coffee every morning. 
The room has a fridge and microwave. So we bought stuff each night that we could heat and eat. Nice. I’d definitely stay again.

title: Check internet before booking
text:
It’s like a hotel from the 80s, the bathroom is disgusting not clean at all and staff are rude. 

The front desk on arrival only interested in getting the hiding charges of $300!!!

On the plus side it’s in a great location, central to most places. 

All depends on what you’re looking for from your stay in NYC.

title: ok hotel, but nothing more
text: It was an OK hotel, but nothing more. A bit noisy on the streets and with the AC. A bit strange on the answers I got to have change for the laundry at the lobby. But not bad as well and  close to public transport.

title: Horrible hotel, great location
text: 12/4/23 - 12/8/23: The hotel is very dated and we stayed in a King bed standard room #1113. The bed covers were stained and we took them off the bed and put to the side. The furniture is broken and scratched up. First day there we checked our bagage with the bell hop and went exploring. When we came back around 4 PM (check in time) we put the bags in the room and went out again. Then upon our return the room temp was approximately 85 degrees with NO thermostat. So we called the front desk and a mechanical/maintenance person arrived. She opened the vents and turned down a steam valve and said that might fix it. It did not, so I had to turn the valve all the way closed and since the valve seat was bad we still got heat. So I had to turn on the window air conditioner, for the entire stay. Then the shower would run warm, to freezing cold and then to scalding hot. The coffee machines were taken our of the rooms when Covid hit in 2019 and there was a 'coffee station' that sometimes actually worked! The coffee was not good. The bell hops/door openers did not open doors for us after we did not tip them to open the doors, it was not a problem as I have been opening doors for a long time. The front desk staff is not friendly and upon arrival we were told there was a $21.xx a day "Facility Fee" for the internet, GYM and the Coffee machine. We had spotty internet service and bad coffee and did not use the GYM. I protested to my companies provider which was Beneplace and they said they had no control over extra fees but said in the invoice "all fees paid". The only good thing was the location to Broadway and Times Square. This is worse than a Days Inn and not what we expected for $1800 plus. The internet is full of bad reviews on this place due to unsanitary conditions and the Facility Fee. I trusted Beneplace and was disappointed. This is the first time I have written such a bad review but I feel like people need to know!

title: Superb for a short break.
text: Fantastic place for a short stay. When we arrived, we were a little disappointed as the place looked dated and tired. Staff were lovely though. Doormen and Bell Hops were really helpful. Everywhere was lovely and clean and a nice powerful shower. Room service cleaned the room each day. There was a small kitchen sink, microwave and a small fridge just by the door into the room. The one criticism is that there is no kettle, although they do give free coffee and a snack next to the Lobby between 7 and 10am each day, and there are a couple of small stores at each end of the block that sell decent Coffee for around $2.50 a cup. Would stay there again.

title: Felt like I was staying at a Motel 6.
text:
Great location but it is so in need of a facelift!  I felt like I was staying at a motel 6.  Furniture in the lobby was old, worn and dirty.  Rooms were sparse.  King room, 2 pillows, 2 plastic cups.  The furniture in the room is old and beat up.  The bathroom has the shampoo on the wall,I much prefer a small bottle that has not been opened.  Who knows what is in those bottle hanging on the wall?  There was no place to put a bar of soap, it looks so bare.  The shower needs a good scrubbing, especially in the corners. There is nothing about the room that makes it any special experience.

I was lucky enough to have a decent air conditioner.  My daughters room had a window unit which was terrible, and she had 2 double beds (who has double beds anymore), and the mattresses were old and worn, lumpy and needed replacing.  There were 4 of them and they consistently got 3 bath towels.  The rugs needed replacing.  There is not any literature about NYC and all there is to do.  The baseboards where the rugs meet the baseboards are dirty and dusty.  Honestly I could not wait to get out of there and get back to my own place.

I was just so disappointed with everything.  There is not a restaurant on site, they serve coffee and tea in the morning from 7 to 10, and small granola bars that have a sign next to them - take only one please.  For $500 a night - I think that is so cheap.  I still have not figured what I am paying $20 for the amenity fee for??  I was going to ask but frankly I forgot.

Honestly the hotel is in a great location.  But that is it.  There are many hotels in the area and I will be sure to stay somewhere else.  Sad state of affair at the Belvedere.

title: Stanze vecchie
text: Metto due stelle semplicemente per la posizione, ma appena arrivati apparte il personale poco simpatico e gentile, ci hanno dato una camera che forse era degli anni 60 piena di polvere e vecchia, abbiamo chiesto subito la sostituzione e ci hanno dato una più pulita e più recente (anni 80) delusione totale per la posizione niente da dire ad un passo da Times Square

title: Run Away
text: I couldn’t escape fast enough when I checked into my room.  The hallway was smokey.  The carpets were filthy and the room was dismal. Triggered an asthma attack.  Within minutes I returned to the Front Desk and complained.  They refused to reimburse me for my $700 night.  What a shock as the reviews and ratings were so positive.

title: Great Stay for my sons 21st
text:
I disagree with the negative reviews.  We had a great stay, great location.  Friendly staff, rooms were clean, towels changed daily.
Quieter than we thought when windows closed, It’s New York so expect it to be noisy at times. 
Try Roxy Deli for breakfast or lunch and Virgil’s BBQ for dinner

title: Avoid if you like to sleep!
text:
I’ll start with the positives.
Amazing location. That’s it!
Room extremely dated and not the cleanest.
1st night we didn’t sleep one bit,noise from the street was unbearable and the fact they have the air con unit in the window means that it can’t be closed so it’s a no win situation.
Maintenance came to try resolve and we was told that if we wanted to move we had to wait until next day after check out to see what was available. We did not want to hang around for that as we’re in NYC and had lots of stuff planned.
I’d avoid if you can and book something cleaner and have a room where you can actually sleep and not feel like your on the street!

title: Disagree with bad reviews
text: This place is in a great location for walking or subway stations if going further.  Our room was clean,  we could control temperature and beds were comfy. The carpet needs replacing and furniture a little chipped but the positives FAR outweigh the negatives. Every staff member we encountered were friendly and helpful. Other reviews complained about elevators but we never had a problem. I would highly recommend and would definitely stay there again.

title: Fantastic Hotel - perfect location.
text: fabulous hotel, amazing room, so comfortable, 2 blocks away from Times Square. Fantastic skyline views from our room on the 14th floor. Jerry the porter couldn't have been more helpful and check in staff were very pleasant too . Would definitely recommend !

title: Old NY feel in a great location with great customer service.
text: The Belvedere is an older hotel with lovely charm - from the exterior of the building to the older elevators, to the USPS drop boxes next to the elevators on each floor. While it may not have some of the bells and whistles hotels with higher stars do, we found the place to be charming, the staff to be incredibly responsive, and were very comfortable during our stay.  The location could not have been more ideal for a Christmas in NYC weekend, central to Rockefeller center, Broadway, Radio City Music Hall and the subway for locations further away.

title: Would use again.
text: Very clean, changed towels every day, cleaned room daily.  Centrally located, large comfortable rooms, staff very good in particular the valet who organised to keep our luggage and booked us a taxi to airport at keen rates, he was most helpful and excellent at his job, think his name is Mahendra.

title: Terrible Staff
text: First impressions didn't take off too well. The Indian guy on front desk was rude, absolutely no manners and was just interested in getting our deposit and taxes from us as soon as we walked in. No friendly greetings, just a grunt. Door staff never uttered a word to us either the whole time we were there. Rooms probably looked half decent in the 90s , the noise from the street below was unbearable and we all ended up wearing earplugs just to get some sleep. The lifts were a nightmare, small and always full. Takes you about 3 or 4 tries just to get up or down. Bathroom was old and tired and carpets need renewing in the rooms. We loved New York but sadly this hotel let our stay down badly. Staff need training in customer service. In short, the place is a s**thole. Try elsewhere is my advice 👍🏼

title: Meglio x strada
text: Sporco nulla funzionante blatte per i corridoi che entrano nelle stanze dalle fessure tra porte e pavimento….ci hanno fatto pagare x servizi mai utilizzati…e per finire grandissimi maleducati tutti .ripeto cm da titolo meglio x strada..vergognosi

title: Boa localização, mas péssima limpeza
text:
Os funcionários da recepção são atenciosos, chegamos muito cedo e guardaram nossas malas, assim como no dia de ir embora que saímos do hotel no final da tarde.
O quarto tem carpete e atrás do móvel da tv havia muita poeira, no banheiro haviam dois chuveiros e um deles estava cheio de bolor. A limpeza não é adequada. Havia muita sujeira debaixo das camas. O quarto tem um bom tamanho. Tem uma pia, microondas e frigobar, mas não tem talheres e pratos. 
O café da manhã, é extremamente simples, com café, café descafeinado e água quente para fazer chocolate quente ou chá e uma barrinha de cereais por hóspede. 
A localização é excelente. 
Cobram taxa de resort de 20 dólares por dia.

title: Great location
text: Perfect location to walk to many sites. Nice little neighborhood. Felt safe. Clean hotel. Friendly staff at front desk. Elevator was very slow. Only two small elevators with a long wait many times to get on. Overall we would stay here again. If you're able - request a lower floor so that you can opt to take the stairs if need be.

title: Dated needs revamp but comfy bed
text: Dated room, a dangerous window on the 14th floor can open fully. Bathroom appears unclean due to peeling enamel on the bath, dirty shower head and meldew marks. Carpets dusty at the edges and dated, furnishings dated. Positive the bed is comfy and location good.

title: Hotel na Times Squares, caminhada a pé para Broadway, 5Th ave , Rockfeller
text:
Eu fiquei pela primeira vez nesse hotel em 2010, ou seja 13 anos atrás . A localização é incrível, você faz tudo a pé com crianças broadway. TimesSquare, Rockfeller, 5th.
Dentro desse hotel tem um restaurante incrível com comida excelente brasileira , picanha , churrasco , pão de queijo , feijão preto . Para as crianças que precisam se alimentar melhor e não comem qualquer coisa foi nossa melhor solução .
Mas o ponto negativo não tem café da
Manhã , não existe serviço de quarto no hotel e o restaurante dentro do hotel não abre pela manhã .
No inverno , tem que sair cedo p tomar café aos arredores .
No quartos : lençóis limpos, toalhas sempre trocadas . Quartos são enormes .
Tem uma pequena academia que foi muito útil . 
Após a reforma o hotel está com uma
Ótima recepção .

title: Great Location
text: Property is really close to a wide variety of food options, multiple coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. Train station is really close for a nice easy commute to other areas in the city. Everyone we interacted with at the hotel was really nice, shout out to Jerry! The room was incredibly clean, including the mattress. The mattress did leave a lot to be desired comfort wise though and wasn’t the most comfortable sleeping experience and the shower head/water pressure really needed some work. It’s a pretty small room, so a larger family may struggle to navigate the space, but I would definitely stay here again. Good price, great location and nice staff.

title: safe, clean, location location..
text: Clean. safe. perfect location. highly recommended. very close to Time Square and all NY restaurant, Recommending Platafrma Brazilian restaurant at the hotel. Rooms  clean. easy access to all main attractions and is not overpriced like the rest of those hotels in NY city

title: Da ritornarci
text: Ho trovato ottimo questo hotel. Praticamente in centro, camere pulite, personale gentile. Nella stanza erano presenti: cassaforte, ferro da stiro, microonde, frigorifero, balsamo e crema corpo a dispenser. Apprezzabili le barrette ai cereali e le bevande calde offerte gratuitamente al mattino. Si può raggiungere con la metropolitana o con il taxi che però è piuttosto costoso

title: Awful place!
text: Doormen are very rude! Telling us I HAVE to tip? I tip based on service and there’s was none existent! I opened the door myself and took my own bags to my room?? Rooms were ok but the carpet was absolutely disgusting and filthy! The air con unit was so loud we couldn’t use it and there were police and ambulance at the hotel due to guests??

title: Très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé pour un 1er séjour à NY. Les chambres sont spacieuses le coin cuisine est un plus ( j’avais suivi les conseils des autres voyageurs et emporté couverts et gobelets ) . Le café le matin est assez sympa.
Par contre une meilleure insonorisation des fenêtres et un  rafraîchissement serait vraiment nécessaire.
Le personnel est assez souriant et sympa.

title: Très belle expérience.
text:
Super hôtel. 
Très sympathique, très propre, personnel au petit soin. 
L'hôtel est très bien situé dans times square , en plein Manthan. Je recommande vraiment cet hôtel surtout pour des voyages en familles ou il y a des chambres deux lit double.  Très contente.

title: Wouldn't stay here again but location is great
text:
Room was an ok size but very dated. carpet was threadbare! bathroom needs an upgrade, the shower was very poor. Pillows were uncomfortable and the bed very creaky and uncomfortable
 There are no tea/coffee facilities unless you go down to the lobby very specifically between 7-10am. the hotel is however in a prime location for times sq, Broadway, basically everywhere you want to be. the front desk staff barely crack a smile and other staff there are quite abrupt. my biggest complaint has to be the smell of the bedding and towels. no effort whatsoever has been put into making the laundry smell remotely nice. it was awful, stale and musty. not acceptable in my opinion

title: Great location
text:
Stayed after a cruise . Great location right by Times Square and broadway, very busy hotel but fine . They offer coffee in the mornings 
Rooms are great size. No kettles in rooms but has a microwave and fridge. Last day checked out and left cases and went out they were safe enough and the door men were very helpful.Would stay again. 
.

title: A good snooze in a good spot
text:
Good location (your a short stroll to Time Square and subway) and good service at checkin. Hotel is wonderfully old fashioned (in a good way) and adds character to your stay.

Room was spacious and clean, TV was a little poor for reception but if I need entertainment I just need to stick my head out of the window (which alarmingly you can do with ease).

title: Good hotel, good area for first time in NY
text: Our original booking was for their sister hotel, Americana Inn, and we were transferred here for the same price. So glad we were. The bed was so comfy, we had a great view from the 16th floor, and it was nice & clean. Limited interactions with staff but they seemed nice and helpful. The area was great for the first time in New York, close to the subway and Broadway shows. Felt pretty safe in the area, except for one interaction on our last night but that was obviously no fault of the hotel and was a few blocks down. The only downside was there was no coffee or tea in the room, and it was only available until 10am. Otherwise no complaints. I would definitely recommend!

title: Pratique pour se déplacer facilement
text: Situation très centrale dans midtown. A 10 mn à pied de times square. 5mn d'une station de métro. Mais en contrepartie... même en étage élevé le bruit de la rue est présent... mais c est New York ! La chambre quadruple est correct. La salle de bain reste petite pour 4 avec WC dans la salle de bains. Un petit frigo et un micro ondes sont présents ce qui dépanne le soir ou le matin

title: Sconsigliato in tutto
text:
Personale scortesissimo alla reception! Non si impegnano minimamente a farsi capire, a tratti anche scocciati ed aggressivi.
Stanze antiquate: moquette sporca, doccia nella vasca sporca, condizionatore per riciclo dell’aria rumoroso, ascensori lentissimi. La sua sola fortuna è la posizione. Sconsigliato

title: Not bad but could be better
text: Hotel was a great location, close to Times Square and places to eat and overall was comfortable and clean, room was in need of a update though and was quite noisy. Reception staff weren’t very helpful and looked like they couldn’t be bothered not even a smile was always a bit awkward having an encounter with them weren’t interested in the guests at all, doormen though were helpful with bags and taxis.

title: Could do better
text:
I'll start with the good - 
This hotel has a good location for the Theatre district and Times Square. The concierge/doorman was very helpful in procuring a taxi for us when we left. The rooms are adequate There are a lot of places to eat in the nearby vicinity.
However - 
Be aware that the moment you arrive the unhelpful receptionists are demanding $300 per room as a security deposit ( I doubt whether there are $300 of items within the room!)
They are similarly demanding of the $20 plus taxes per day room tax, when you check out, in addition to the actual cost of staying.
The receptionist are most unhelpful - they couldn't even direct us to a leaflet stand when we made enquiries about a coach tour- they never smile, let alone wish you'd "Have a nice stay" and do not direct you to any of the hotel's facilities, such as bar areas, lounges etc.
There are no tea or coffee making facilities within the rooms. They may have a microwave but no plates, cups etc.
They do offer free coffee and tea but this is only available via one machine and only between the hours of 7am and 10 am with queues. Not good for those who need a beverage on waking and before showering.
Tis is the only hotel I've stayed in which does not have an information pack telling you about the place.
The air conditioning is also noisy
The hotel generally could do with updating
This could be a much better hotel, if it spent more time and money on its guests rather than trying to grab money as soon as they arrive

title: Terrible
text:
Room wasnt great and that was after an upgrade
Lodged a complaint about bugs appearing in the bathroom and not dealt with acodingly by poor managers on the night shift not telling the day shift to have the room deep cleaned.
Got no refund or compensation for our ruined hotel stay after paying a lot of money
Wouldnt stay there again

title: Right in the heart of New York
text:
Excellent place to stay. 5 minutes walk from Times Square, and all New York has to offer.
Good size room, clean and very comfortable.
Breakfast not provided, but plenty of local eateries, so not a problem.
Staff very helpful. Taxis always available outside hotel door when needed.
I can not rate highly enough for a good , clean comfortable room, at very reasonable prices, right in the centre of New York.

title: Soso. Clean bed. Room was not swept for second night. Dirt on floor.
text: Rooms and bathrooms are older.  Shower curtain didn’t work well since it didn’t close all the way.  The discount for parking almost did not happen because front desk pretends to give it but doesn’t until you deal with managers.  Overall bed was fine some pillows were flat and some were good.  AC is a window unit lopsided in the window.  Bellboy is only a door person

title: Next to Theater District, Very Pleased with Accommodations
text:
Allowed us to check in early with no surcharge which was deeply appreciated after long trip. Front desk staff very helpful. Received a updated room which worked out well. Due to short stay, requested only refresh of towels. Close to Theater district without paying Theater district prices.  Subway stations and Time Square within easy walking distance. Best to use elevators at end of hall for the pair in the middle bog down during checkin and checkout time. Upon exit, the front doorman was very helpful in securing a taxi. 
Only issue was complementary breakfast bar of coffee & granola bars. Best to visit one of the bakeries in the immediate area (8th or 9th Ave) for morning java. Also, plenty of restaurants in immediate area (Sombrero Restaurant just up the block).  
On future visits to NYC, Belvedere will be top of list.

title: Maravilhoso
text:
Excelente Localização excelente
Atendimento especializado com foco na cortesia
Quartos maravilhosos
Amenidades do quarto foram essenciais na estadia..
Café da manhã satisfatório
Facilidade e presteza nas informações da recepção

title: Felice scoperta
text:
Quando siamo arrivate, purtroppo ci hanno comunicato che le nostre stanze avevano letti matrimoniali e non letti separati; poi ci hanno detto che era obbligatorio versare 20$ al giorno per il Wi-Fi (palestra ecc), compresa nel prezzo c’è una micro colazione (1 snack, caffè, thè, cioccolata).
Gli ascensori sono solo due e bisogna avere un po’ di pazienza, ma d’altra parte in vacanza si può anche perdere un po’ di tempo.
Le stanze e i bagni, in base agli standard newyorkesi sono abbastanza grandi, nel bagno ci vorrebbe qualche base di appoggio per i beauty-case. Le stanze, purtroppo, hanno la moquette, che io farei abolire in tutti gli hotel.
La posizione dell’hotel è ottima vicino Times Square, vicino la metropolitana, Empire State Building e altro. Io ero al 17^ piano e la vista sullo skyline è impareggiabile, meravigliosa.
Nel complesso mi sono trovata bene e ci tornerei volentieri.

title: Tijd voor renovatie!
text: Belvedere Hotel is ideaal gelegen: dicht bij Times Square, Hell's Kitchen en Central Park. Het is een oud gebouw met een bijzondere stijl. De kamers zijn groot en goed uitgerust. Maar er zijn toch wel een aantal verbeterpunten: de ramen houden het stadslawaai niet tegen wat vooral heel lastig is wanneer je toch wil slapen in the city that never sleeps. Bovendien maakt de airco in de kamer een ontzettend kabaal, je moet het ding afzetten om te kunnen slapen. In de badkamer is er een ligbad/douche met douchegordijn, wat toch echt niet meer van deze tijd is. Maak daar gewoon een inloopdouche van met een glaswand! De verlichting in de kamer is ook compleet verouderd en onvoldoende. Zorg voor goede leeslampjes bij de bedden! Het vasttappijt in de kamers vond ik gewoon vies. De bedden zijn wel heel goed! Het personeel in de lobby is behulpzaam maar niet iedereen is even vriendelijk voor de gasten.

title: Excelente experiência
text:
Localização excelente 
Atendimento especializado com foco na cortesia 
Quartos maravilhosos 
Amenidades do quarto foram essenciais na estadia.. 
Café da manhã satisfatório 
Facilidade e presteza nas informações da recepção

title: Posizione comodissima.
text: Ottimo hotel. A 2 passi da Time Square. Camere pulite, ogni giorno venivano rifatte e gli asciugamani cambiati. Ascensori veloci, non abbiamo mai dovuto attendere. Personale disponibile. Avevamo una stanza al quinto piano che affacciava sulla 48th St, ma non si sentivano rumori stradali. Solo l'aria condizionata della stanza era un po' rumorosa, ma si dormiva tranquillamente.

title: JUSTE PARFAIT
text:
C’était exceptionnel !
Nous avions demandé à être en hauteur et nous avons été au 14 eme la vue était sublime !
Aucun problème d’ascenseur, nous étions inquiets vu les commentaires( ou alors nous sommes moins exigeants)
Le ménage fait tous les jours et bien fait !
Nous avions prévu d’amener les couverts assiettes et verres ( lu également dans les commentaires) donc c’était parfait !
Les personnes de l’accueil ont toujours été vraiment gentilles, on a demandé une bouilloire ils sont venus nous la porter dans la chambre en suivant.
Lave linge top!
Nous étions également inquiets du bruit de la clil( vu les commentaires) mais au contraire nous avons été impressionnés par le calme, c’est vrai que les journées étaient intenses il ne nous fallait pas de berceuse le soir!
Emplacement au top! Très central, c’est vraiment bien et toutes les lignes de métro sont directes.
Bref, séjour au top!!!
Nous y avons passé 11 nuits, nous avons beaucoup visité et alternéavec des journées plages ( coney island, rokaway, Sandy hook) 
Nous avons vu un match de basket et de base ball. 
Un seul regret le summit qui a l’air exceptionnel 
Bref!!!! Concernant l’hôtel nous vous le recommandons vivement et nous reviendrons sans hésiter !!!!!

title: Wonderful surprise in Time Square
text: We were absolutely delighted with our stay at The Belvedere! We were staying for a week and looked for a reasonably priced hotel. We booked early and received a good discount and on check in asked for a quiet room. Our average daily rate was under $200 and some nights was only $169 - amazing for NYC! We received a fantastic king room on the 15th floor that was large, quiet and clean! The staff was so responsive and polite and responded to all requests quickly and professionally. The hotel is next door to a sweet little Mexican restaurant with $5 margaritas all day and was a great way to end long days of walking around NYC. The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to see shows or be near Times Square which is literally steps away!  The hotel sits between 8th and 9th Ave with tons of restaurants and stores. Had not expected to have such a great stay! Thank you Belvedere!

title: Good Location, Friendly staff
text: A little worn, however great location, friendly staff, bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small and there was an issue with the facets. It would be nice to have some items (coffee pot, mugs, silverware) in the kitchenette.

title: Très déçu à part l'emplacement pas top
text:
Chambre pas très propre douche boucher très bruyant ne pas être pressé pour l'ascenseur une attente interminable pas assez de serviettes 2 pour 4 personnes tous les jours nous avons du demander des serviettes 
Le seul point positif est l'emplacement

title: expensive
text: stayed in 2018, and i think the people at the reception were way nicer snd more polite.  this time in 2022 it was Christmas,  fully booked and no time for the customers. i think the 400 euro per night was too much

title: Night away
text: Check in was quick, I was not interested in a view and asked for a lower walk up floor. Recieved it. Bed very good, room temperature perfect. Next to HK so expect gay bars in the area, many straight also.

title: Bellissimo!
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel x 5 notti a luglio x la nostra honeymoon! Avevamo una camera al piano 12, con la vista sullo skyline bellissima, ho visto dei tramonti stupendi pure da li, la camera era grande e super pulita! Avevamo anche un mini frigo con micronde e cucinino che va beh non abbiamo usato. Qualsiasi cosa avevi bisogno erano sempre diaponibili. Noi all'andata abbiamo preso il taxi arrivare qua dall'aeroporto mentre al ritorno ci siamo fatti prenotare il transfer perchè siamo partiti alle 4 di notte! La posizione secondo me è fatastica! A piedi li vicino hai quasi tutte le cose principali famose!

title: Ótima estadia!
text: Fui com meu filho de 11 anos e nos hospedamos em um quarto silencioso, com uma cama king size que era ótima, travesseiros macios, cortinas que vedavam bem a luz, serviço de limpeza diário e eficiente. Ficamos no 14º andar, com uma vista linda para os prédios de Manhattan. O quarto tem microondas e frigobar, o que ajuda bastante se o intuito é comprar comida pronta para comer em algum momento da viagem. Não há talheres, nem pratos. A localização é excelente, o que facilita bastante a viagem. Pontos negativos: a água do banho escorria um pouco pelo banheiro e há dois elevadores pequenos, que lotam pela manhã (não deixe para descer quando o Uber chegar, senão você pode perder, isso quase aconteceu comigo, por conta da demora para acessar o elevador)

title: Staff are rude beyond belief.
text:
I do not understand how people rate this 4 stars.  The staff were so rude and didn't care less.  I get it, the hotel is in prime position close to everything, they do not have to make ANY effort.  We were booked in for a 5 night stay but our flight was cancelled and we missed our first night.  I phoned the hotel and told them we were not going to get there until a day later.  They said fine and would hold the reservation for us from the day we arrive.  What I didn't realise was that we were also being charged for the night we were not there, that is over $500.  (I am trying to get this refunded but the hotel does not care). When we arrived the next day, we were keen to make up for lost time and keen to get out.  But it took us 2 hours to leave the room because the safe was not working and wouldn't close AND the actual door to the room would not lock so we couldn't go anywhere! The reception staff were really rude and dismissive and really wanted to be elsewhere.  The maintenance person then fixed both issues and we were able to get out.
Concierge were next level rude.  Does the hotel pay them a wage?  I'm guessing they do, so what is the minimum they need to do for their work?  The minimum would be opening a door right?  No.  If you are rude you don't get a tip so if you don't tip the rudeness is escalated by 100.  Upon departure we had a few hours before our train departed so I asked where we could leave our bags.  The concierge didn't speak he just pointed to himself.  I asked again and got the same gesture 2 more times.  I gave up and asked reception who said the hotel will store our bags for free etc etc.  When we went to collect the bags the concierge asked if we needed a taxi, (we didn't) and he dumped our bags outside the storage area and we struggled through the front doors to take them to the side walk.  A hotel guest actually helped us with the doors while concierge rude man just stood by.  Unbelievable.  The hotel offers a free coffee service in the lobby which is a circus, not what I would pass for coffee.  It's just a machine that you press a button for hot dark liquid, it's not a "service".  The one star I give is for the location and the ability to open a window.  We were on the 17th floor.  The building is old, but well kept, our room was clean and newish.  But do not stay here, the staff are SOOOOOO RUDE.

title: Not the best but not the worst hotel in NY city
text: The TV in the room didn't work but was promptly fixed.  The mattress was way too soft. The staff at the front desk was very average friendliness.  There was only one nice man out of a few that we dealt with during our 2 day stay.   Also,  upon checking out, we should have been reminded about validating our parking pass as their garage (which was far away in proximity to the hotel) almost charged us an additional $10/day. Overall,  the stay was okay for an older building.  I don't think I'd recommend it to others.

title: Great hotel
text:
Lovely friendly city hotel fantastic location great staff who helped us loads nothing was to much trouble and there morning hot drinks was a nice touch .
 The room we stayed  was a good size with all basics plus microwave and fridge only down side  was no cutlery cups or plates . And as an English person would of loved a kettle to make a cup of tea haha .
Looking forward to staying again .

title: Very disappointed
text:
Very disappointed, given its location.  For my husband's 60th and not even the courtesy of a happy birthday either.

Rude, unhelpful staff and the facility fee for what?!? which the receptionist demanded payment on checkout!    Awful, awful coffee and no croissants as promised. The lifts are very slow so please bear that in mind on check in and check out.  You need your room key for lobby toilets.    Room clean but bizarre no kettle or even mugs when there is fridge, microwave and sink.  Hope housekeeping liked my white flannel!

title: NON CI TORNEREI
text: La posizione è strategica...a due passi da Times Square, ma è l'unica cosa positiva da sottolineare....Ascensori lenti e sempre occupati(fortuna che ero al 4° piano e usavamo sempre le scale d'emergenza), stanza apparentemente pulita, vetri che lasciavano immaginare che ci fosse fuori, odore di cucinato nei corridoi(intendo spezie e altro), in ultimo discussione con gli addetti al deposito di una maleducazione unica, ci hanno apostrofato come italiani di m...., mai successa una situazione del genere, contando che il nostro intento era quello di aiutare l'addetto reggendogli la porta....da evitare.

title: Hôtel agréable
text: Très bon hôtel idéalement situé au coeur de Manhattan (à moins de 10 minutes à pied de Times Square). Chambre à la déco un peu vieillotte mais très propre avec une vue incroyable (nous étions au 14eme étage).

title: Be careful when you book
text: The hotel is in a great location. You’re not actually on Times Square but your like two blocks away which is fine. The hotel itself is looking very, very tired and it could do with a long overdue upgrade, the carpet in the room was  a bit stained, but the room itself was very clean. The AC unit in the room is quite noisy and you can’t close the curtains to black out the room as the unit is in the way. There  is no bar at this hotel, there is a  very expensive Brazilian restaurant attached to the hotel, which I guess was once part of the hotel facility. I found the staff on reception quite aloof and unfriendly,  Initially as I had just arrived I thought this was a New York thing, but the service  in the rest of York was excellent. Be very careful when you book as there is a hidden facilities charge of $20 per day that they hit you with when you get there, we got charged an additional $160 for a seven night stay .They say this is on their website and you should notice it when you book, but we certainly didn’t as we booked it through an agent, we noticed everyone else was getting hit with the same charge as us as they arrived….

title: Very average,  wouldn't be rushing back
text:
We stayed in The Belvedere for 5 nights in June 2023. Its in a very good location, close to Times Square and the theatre district. Our room however was quite small and very dark and dated(nothing like the pictures on their website). We had a microwave and fridge but would have really liked a kettle. The woman on reception was
not friendly or welcoming on arrival and after a long journey we barely got a smile. All very transactional. The same for checkout, the lady looked like she'd rather be anywhere else and as another guest mentioned "robotic" would be a word that comes to mind. 
All in all the hotel was only ok and I wouldn't be rushing back

title: Dated and none of the pleasures of staying at a hotel
text: If you’d prefer not to stay in a chain hotel and are looking for a local hotel for some NYC charm - do not book this hotel. Book the chain over this any day. I don’t understand all the positive reviews, they’re either bots or folks who have low expectations. If you’d like to be able to get water on a hot day in the lobby (every other hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC offers bottles or a bubbler for free), see yourself in a full length mirror, borrow an umbrella if it rains, get up and down from your room quickly - do not stay here. The rooms are extremely dated, it feels like a boarding house. The picture here in Trip advisor does not look like the rooms I saw. There are strange smells and the smoke detector in my room was wrapped in multiple layers of plastic. I guess the staff doesn’t look for that when turning over the rooms. One of the worst things is the window a/c units - loud as heck. And the amenities say room darkening shades, that is not true and how could light be fully blocked with a window ac? Everything about this hotel is dreary and disappointing. The staff were generally pleasant but they couldn’t offer anything because the hotel is bare bones.  I paid in the range of $250-325 on the various nights I was there, terrible value.

title: Bon hôtel
text: Bon emplacement près du time square. Très chouette hôtel, seul bémol : on entend très fort les bruits de la ville. Pas de petit déjeuner, mais café disponible (gratuitement) a partir de 7h. Personnel très accueillant.

title: Holiday 5 Days  in NYC this location hand to Metro Busses and bars
text: Great Location and large rooms very busy but friendly .. staff helpful and security is great.. Hells Kitchen is good food and Bars easy walking to Metro and Busses the rooms are large and comfortable

title: Dated rooms
text: This was our first visit to New York and upon arriving at reception where the staff were very friendly it seemed very nice in that area, when we got to our rooms it was a different story, the room was dated very dark and dreary & i thought we were actually staying at the Hotel Cortez , the website pictures didn’t look like our rooms, our friends room was the same tired and dated room like ours, the only good thing was the location was great.

title: Perfect location
text: Absolutely lovely hotel. Staff were lovely and friendly. Very central. Rooms were modern and clean. Quiet enough at night. There's a diner a 4 minute walk around the corner for breakfast. Definitely one of the hotels I would go back to. Felt very safe here. Perfect location if you're going to a broadway show.

title: No me agrado
text: Los empleados son poco amables, deje olvidada mi chamarra y escribí un correo pidiendo apoyo y no me contestaron, la tina no funcionaba, las camas son cómodas y se hizo bien la limpieza, no dejaron las ventanas abiertas y había mucho ruido no lo recomiendo

title: Excellent Stay, Will Return
text:
Excellent stay. This was my third stay at the Belvedere Hotel and it was flawless. Nine of us stayed in four rooms. All were clean, spacious and comfortable. There was always plenty of hot water, the housekeeping was first class and the fridge and microwave were very useful. We were on the 9th floor and never once had to wait for a lift, although occasionally we did use the staff lift at the end of the corridor. We took advantage of the coffee and breakfast bar in the foyer each morning which was a good start to the day. Toiletries were provided in every room. 
The staff were pleasant and helpful and always easy to find. The airline lost our pushchair so every morning they made enquiries on our behalf.
The location was great for Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. The nearest subway was just around the corner.

title: Second Visit to this Hotel
text:
This was our second stay at The Belvedere and I would definitely stay a third time.

The hotel is clean and the room we had (427) was a decent size and very quiet.

We were able to use the stairs so avoiding the lifts. Coffee and a cereal bar is provided at breakfast time.

The location is fantastic, short distance to Times Square and all of Broadway.  We easily walked to Central Park, Grand Central Station and the Circle Line Boats and Hells Kitchen.

title: buen hotel
text: muy buen hotel, limpio, habitaciones amplias, luinosas, comodas. Tiene una pequeña cocina con microondas, heladera, muebles que hace muy practico el dia a dia.   muy bien ubicado a pocas cuadras de Time Square, metro y teatros.  Cerca de Delis y Market Food abiertos hasta tarde. Volveria y lo recomiendo

title: Ett standard hotell med bra läge.
text: Se till att ni väljer superior. Första natten hade vi standard rum och det var mycket slitet. Superior var renoverade. Pentryt hade inga bestick eller porslin. Det som drar ner betyget var hissarna som tog en lång väntetid och dubbelsängarna som inte var tillräckligt breda. Läget är toppen.

title: Great location! Value for money
text: Me and my friend stayed here in March for 5 nights, great location, only a couple of blocks away from Times Square! Rooms a little dated but still comfortable. No kettle in the room only microwave. Bit random? But they do offer complimentary coffee in the morning in reception. The door men where friendly also. Nice little break. Good price too!

title: Super hôtel !
text: Nous étions en famille, dans une chambre avec deux lits doubles. Personnel vraiment agréable et sympathique, hôtel super beau avec une vue sur les immeubles voisins qui reflète toute la magie de New-York et une vue de nuit au top ! Mais surtout l'hôtel est très bien placé à deux minutes de Times Square et donc pas très loin du métro, un super plan ! Bref je recommande les yeux fermés !

title: A midtown gem let down by a front desk dragon at check out.
text:
I had a fantastic stay at this mid town hotel. Overall the staff were delightful  but were let down by an incredibly rude front desk manager upon check out.  

Why let down your whole Hotel experience with a surly, rude and robotic check out experience? 

I had nothing but good things to say until this morning. 

My check out  experience was appalling 

What a shame that this hotel chooses to indulge this staff member’s behavior. She is a real piece of work. She is as friendly as a parking meter.

Otherwise, this is a gem of a hotel. Location is great. Everything works as expected. Elevators are slow at peak periods but it’s not the end of the earth. Just use the secret one at the end of the hallway. 

Housekeeping is a standout. 

Beware the front desk dragon!

title: Convenient to Theatres, Times Square but Have to Get to the Lobby First
text: I have a thing for historic hotels- they are grand and flamboyant and pretentious. The Belvedere looks just like this from the outside. However, the lobby is cramped, the morning breakfast area even more so, and couldn't get my historic fix anywhere in the building. Except with the elevator, which was small but art deco. However, half the time, the elevator was not working. The reception staff seemed unconcerned with long-check in lines or malfunctioning elevators but the bellmen/doormen were excellent.  And the room was just right for a stay in Manhattan, where you are not going to spend much time in anyway.  This is a good hotel for the money and very close to everything central Manhattan, but I didn't get my Art Deco Hotel fix here.

title: Le bon endroit
text:
Hotel très agréable au cœur de Manathan .Personnel très convivial et compétent .
Au cœur de New-York vous pourrez visiter sans trop utiliser les transports parfait pour flâner dans les rues et avenues

title: Great return visit
text:
This was our second visit to the Belvedere as a couple. Stayed in a room on the first floor. Room was spacious with two double beds. Although close to the road and lift the room was fairly quiet. Check in was quick and easy, all staff were polite and friendly. Room was cleaned daily during our 5 night stay. Bathroom was modern with a good shower. Having a fridge and microwave was also a benefit. 
Location is perfect for midtown. We have already booked this hotel again for our next stay.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text:
Chambre un peu vieillotte, mais hôtel très bien placé! Il dispose d'un petit frigo, un micro onde et un évier. Très pratique.
Personnels très gentils. Chambre faite avec soin tous les jours.
Ils offrent des barres de céréales et café, chocolat ou thé le matin.
Isolation de notre chambre pas au top. On avait l'impression d'avoir les fenêtres ouvertes sans cesse.
Je recommande cet hôtel

title: Super rapport qualité prix
text: Super emplacement... café offert avec une barre de céréales.. frigo et micro onde dans la chambre, pratique pour réchauffer les plats achetés au supermarché et la laverie dans le basement de l hôtel est super si vous êtes venu avec une petite valise..n hésitez pas à envoyer un message à l hôtel pour être si possible dans les étages élèves pour avoir une super vue... seul bémol toilette dans la salle de bain

title: Great location. I’d recommend this hotel
text: Overall was a good stay. The hotel is a bit old, and we had few issues (problem with a window that wouldn’t close, no AC in one of the 2 rooms we booked, the bathtub paint was pulling). But staff was nice and accommodating, and the location is perfect! I was pleasantly surprised since didn’t expect much

title: Prima hotel hartje Manhattan
text: Prima hotel in hartje Manhattan. De kamers zijn klein zoals gebruikelijk in New York, maar netjes en worden goed onderhouden. Het personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Een taxi naar de luchthaven regelen kan je aan hun overlaten. 's Morgens gratis koffie in de lobby. Kort bij metro gelegen, dus goede uitvalbasis om de stad te bezoeken en op kleine wandelafstand van o.a. Rockefeller en Times Square.

title: Bem localizado. Não foi ruim, mas precisando de melhorias. Custos extras não avisados.
text: O hotel no geral é bom, quarto grande, bem localizado, mas os recepcionistas não são os mais simpáticos. O hotel cobrou 20 dólares/dia pelo uso do wi-fi e por um café/chocolate servido no lobby, quando achei que eram cortesia. Não fui avisado do custo extra, que achei caro. As camas, embora grandes, estavam com o colchão já desgastados, fiquei com dor nas costas.

title: Beware of staying here unless you have time to fight for a clean and sanitary room!
text: Strict on 4:00 checkin which is fine. Lobby nice, booked through a third party (for the first time) and the review I will give is less than stellar.  We read a lot of reviews and many stated the rooms were dated.  We would have been fine with dated as this location was close to everything we needed.  We had two rooms both in same condition on the 16th floor. It wasn’t until day three of our stay we discovered there were actually clean rooms.  Our room was filthy!   We didn’t have any heat and the air conditioner in the room was so moldy it could have made us ill by the end of our stay (if we would have used it). The window would open all the way which would have made it dangerous for children.  We called about heat and the engineer that came to our room late at night was shocked at what he found (with the mold, filth and lack of a heater) and said he would have management contact us and send up a room heater.  None of this happened!!  We spoke to a manager about the stay and filth of our room and Georgia (customer NO service) stated “we should have said something”. I said “we did!”  She took $100 “resort fee” off of one of our rooms and told us to take it up with the company we booked through as this is all she could do!  So we did just that and VIO reported that when they contacted the hotel, it was reported that the “customer was already compensated”.  Wait what?  I don’t think that is appropriate.  Georgia said we requested a “standard room”!  To which I replied “is standard filthy”? ?????  Needless to say there are nicer rooms and apparently if you book third party and you get a disgusting room, you have to complain to get something better.  How about you just don’t use those rooms until you upgrade?  I wrote Georgia a letter and filed a complaint with my credit card company so we shall see.  It has been 4 weeks and I haven’t heard from Georgia which is not surprising based on my experience with her while on property.  Great location but terrible customer service and beware of filthy rooms!  The picture of the room on the website is no where close to the quality of room we received.  Beware!  I am a Marriott/IHG brand person and took a chance on a Boutique hotel and was disgusted to say the least. Oh and Georgia said if I would have said something earlier then they would have moved us as the hotel wasn’t full.  Wait so you couldn’t automatically put people in better rooms?  We had to complain?  While we are traveling?  We chose to travel for 8 hours and plan to stay at your hotel and you literally don’t care and give us a garbage room hoping we don’t complain?   Idiotic!  There is so much more I could add but if you are there now or are going in the future and you get a nasty room then say something!  We didn’t even have the room attendants come in and clean everyday because, based on current conditions, we didn’t want additional filth coming to our room.  I hope I can post pictures at the end of this review!!

title: Overall great experience
text:
Great hotel for location to Broadway shows. Each theatre is within 4-5 blocks of the hotel. I spent 6 nights in room 505 and will share pros, cons and tips.

Pros
Location
Quiet
Comfortable bed and pillows
Hot water every time
Microwave and frig
Doormen
Large lobby to wait
It exceeded my expectations based on previous reviews

Cons
Elevators
Did I say elevators
Wait did I mention the elevators
Impossible to get an elevator in the morning/checkout time
Check in was not smooth as I waited 3 hours for an early check-in but kept saying they didn't have the room style available. First person wouldn't bother to help so finally went to another person who got me into another room style and upgraded me which was so appreciated.
Overall, I knew about the elevators so expected it and thought my stay was REALLY good!
The A/C unit is noisy but you can get past it.

Tips
The store at 8th Ave and 48th is the stop for water and snacks
There are no utensils or dishes. I brought utensils and a bowl and a coffee travel mug so I can make oatmeal and hot chocolate in the room.
Try the elevators at the end of each hall if the others are overwhelmed. Sometimes you can get away with it:)

title: Very well located, nice experience
text:
Ideally located just a couple of streets away from Times Square, this hotel was a nice place to stay. We stayed there for a week, we had a room at the 11th floor which enabled us to have an astonishing view!  Bedding was OK, so was the bathroom. Very clean too. 
Only drawback: 3 elevators and despite that, we sometimes had to wait quite a while before being able to go down.  In the morning, free coffee/tea + cereal bars are available in the lobby. 
Receptionist at check-in and check-out was definitely not very nice, but let's say she was tired... ;-) 
Overall good experience. Would recommend!

title: Good, centrally placed hotel
text:
Spent a week here in March. We are a family of four, two adults, a teenager and a kid. Fairly sized room, small kitchenette and a decent sized bathroom. Very good and easy to use WiFi. The room was clean and tidy. We had a great view over the Manhattan skyline.

Many attractions are on a walking distance from the hotel, and several subwaystations are close for those who aren’t

On the downside, no breakfast and a bit noisy, but very effective, air-conditioner

title: Central, comfi and clean
text: Pretty good hotel next to the Times Square. enough subway station around if needed and because it's in Hells Kitchen there were even more restaurants and bars! Bed was huuuuuge and comfi, bathroom clean. A little dated but the hotel lobby was nice. We didn't have breakfast and just went around the many bars to pick something up. We were on the 11th floor, view was acceptable (but we didn't expect much tbh). Some night were a bit noisy when people came back. Most sights we went to were in walking distance, the Rock, MOMA, Broadway and Empire.

title: Idéalement placé
text: Idéalement placé au cœur de Manhattan, à proximité de times square, cet hôtel dispose juste à côté d'un délicieux restaurant mexicain. Les chambres sont spatieuses, les lits un peu mous à mon goût. Attention pas de petit déjeuner proposés hormis boissons chaudes et barres céréales, ce qui n'est pas suffisant pour arpenter la ville, c'est un peu dommage mais ça permet un rapport qualité prix indéniable

title: An excellent hotel for location and great service.
text:
If I could state this hotel’s greatest strength in one word, it would be ‘location’. It is located a walking distance from Central Park, Times Square, and most Broadway shows. We stayed in a room with two double beds which were comfortable. The bathroom was clean with ample hot water and mirrors. The room also had a microwave and small fridge just in case you bring home leftovers and want to heat them up the next day.

The TV in our room did not work, nor did the phones. Because we planned to spend most of our time out seeing Manhattan, this was really not an issue. I am sure most rooms had functioning TVs. If they were like ours, they were a little dated and small so if relaxing with TV shows is a part of your vacation plans, maybe look elsewhere. 

The staff at both the front desk and front door were courteous and extremely helpful. We asked for extra towels and blankets which were both brought up immediately (I did need to go to the front desk to request due to the broken phones). The doorman also gave us great recommendations for restaurants. 

I know there are likely ‘nicer’ hotels around but none at this price point. For our needs: a clean and comfortable hotel, with friendly and helpful staff, at a reasonable price, and in a great location: this hotel is highly recommended.

title: Nice comfortable central place
text:
Good place, it has a friendly vibe in the heart of theater district, 8th ave, we stumbled on good local places like kung fu kitchen on 8th right around the corner - great dim sum type dishes  and noodles - and Moms Burgers on 9th, West End Grill on 8th. It was a good base. The A/c was necessary on a cool March weekend, it’s the kind that blows smoothly and we never used heat. I guess cumulative heat rises, we were on 12th floor, good view looking south. 
They do have morning coffee but with slowness of two crowded elevators, they need to rethink not having coffee in rooms -prob some kind of outlet or fire issue, or cleanup issue? There should be a way to figure out how guests can have hot coffee on demand in their rooms. We did not try the Brazilian steakhouse on ground floor. The beds were comfortable. Cleaning staff excellent. It’s a busy place, the staff keeps it running great. I would stay again

title: Besties happy and spoiled!
text: My best friend, and I were in the city for a show and booked for Belvedere for two nights. The staff were so friendly and accommodating. Our beds were extremely comfortable, and the room size was fabulous even outside of New York! We will definitely visit again thanks everyone for making it a great trip!

title: Se lavan las manos ante problemas
text:
El jueves de la semana pasada nos salimos como todos los días hacer turismo y cuando volvimos ya a la noche, resulta que nos habían tirado una bolsa con bebida y cómida que teníamos cerrada en lo alto del mueble de la tv. Hablamos con la jefa nos pidió un día para investigar, al cual le dijimos que sí, y al siguiente día los chicos de la recepción nos dicen que les comunican que no había tal bolsa y que se lavan las manos vaya. Y si que la había!!
No tenían derecho a tocar nada personal de nuestra habitación.
Asique muy decepcionados en este aspecto.
Ojalá no le pase a más gente como a nosotros.
Hemos pasado 5 noches en este hotel.

title: Fabulous Location
text: The location of this hotel could not be better! It's so close to everything but also not a crazy busy street either! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. There is a $20 facility fee per day, and the hotel also holds $300 on check in however it is refunded on check out, minus the facility fee. The hotel is dated but the room was clean, we were on the 16th floor and had a decent view, there was some noise from the city so bring earplugs. It was a good size and the bed was comfortable. Toiletries were provided daily, on our final night the hotel had installed refillable toiletries which was great. Our room had a fridge and microwave, but no coffee or tea-making facilities. The blinds didn't completely cover our window so it wasn't completely dark to sleep. Overall a great stay and I would recommend this location and hotel.

title: Basic hotel in a great location
text: We selected this hotel for the location. We were disappointed upon arrival when we learned, despite having confirmed our room earlier that day, that the room they had required that we move the next day. No one wants to have to change rooms in the middle of a hotel stay, so we were pretty upset.  The first room they gave us was an executive room w/ two beds.  It was so run down and lacked so many basic amenities: Nowhere to plug in a USB, no blackout shades, there was a beat-up old desk that looked like it was taken from the Goodwill reject pile, a closet with one of those awkward doors that made it so you couldn't really easily access things in the closet without navigating around the door, full-length mirror was in the bathroom so it fogged up after a shower and you couldn't really use it when getting dressed, a tiny bathroom counter and nowhere to put your toiletries, beds that felt kind of soft and thin, and awful pillows. They thankfully upgraded us to a superior room which is the same layout but way better appointed including:  a bathroom counter, USB plugs, a full-length mirror in the room, a better closet, better beds, and a black-out curtain.  The pillows still are horrible!  Rooms have a kitchenette with zero cups or plates - it is just a fridge and a microwave and nothing else. The staff was nice enough. Two small elevators and almost impossible to use in the mornings during check-out time.  One was broken for most of our stay.

title: An affordable place to stay in the city
text: Stayed in the Belvedere in November'22 with my mam and sister for 3 nights in the city. Check in was fast and efficient, with very friendly staff. We were told we had been upgraded, but i'm pretty sure the room was the same as we had originally booked. For NY, the room was a good size with two double beds (a little on the narrow side, but comfy). Nice bathroom with tub and shower. Plenty of sockets in the room as well as a little kitchenette with fridge. The hotel is in a excellent location and is minutes from Broadway, Times Square and the Rockefeller area. Central park is about a 10 minute walk as well. There are loads of great places to eat in the area. If you go to the end of the street and turn up left there is the Times Square Diner which we ate in repeatedly. It was packed all the time with locals so it's usually a good sign. I'd definitely recommend the hotel for a stay in the city. It's affordable and central for all sightseeing. Will be returning

title: Custo benefício bom
text: Ponto forte do Hotel é sua localização, perto da Times Square, mas longe o suficiente do agito. Hotel antigo, com decoração e equipamentos antigos, staff padrão NY, eficientes e diretos. Limpeza e arrumação ok também. Vale a pena se conseguir bons preços.

title: Family trip to NY
text: Good value, very friendly helpful staff, great location.  We shared a room, four of us and beds were a little small but rooms were clean and well furnished. Would definitely stay here again and recommend

title: Super
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, à 5 minutes à pieds de Times Square, mais avec l'avantage (selon nous) d'être dans une "petite" rue perpendiculaire à la 8ème avenue, donc très calme 👌
Les chambres sont spacieuses, la literie super. 
Très belle vue depuis le 15ème étage 😍
Service de bagagerie gratuit pour laisser les valises à l'hôtel le dernier jour avant de retourner à l'aéroport. Top !
Je recommande

title: Melhor custo benefício
text:
Hotel ótimo, bem localizado próximo à estações de metro ,centro comercial e principais teatros de NY.
Hotel com quartos amplos e com uma mine cozinha.
Crítica apenas aos elevados que demora um pouco devido o grande fluxo de turistas.

title: Great Value and  Location.
