text: Great value for location and convenience. Spacious two bed room with far end location away from noise and distractions. Excellent remodeling job for an older hotel. Would highly recommend for theatre goers and times square activities.

title: Beautiful nostalgic hotel with very affordable rates
text: Excellent clean rooms, spacious, and wonderful staff. We stayed for 5 days and were very happy with tye rates and overall experience. Fantastic location, we will be staying at the Belvedere again!; wonderful restaurant on the premises and a lovely old school New York ambience.I’m passionate about New York City and the right hotel does make a difference. Much love from Tulsa, Oklahoma.

title: Average hotel
text: This hotel was good but average. I didn’t enjoy waiting for elevators. the rooms were good but I didn’t find the beds comfortable. I don’t recommend staying on any of the lower floors. I didn’t enjoy looking out the window which is something I like to do because the view was horrible. I hated how the rooms  didn’t have a fridge. Besides the chiller was fairly hard to open. That annoyed me very much

title: Great experience
text: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Belvedere. We saw a show on Broadway and it was a short walk from the theater, many restaurants, and other attractions. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Abysmal customer service, standard accommodations, great location.
text:
Abysmal customer service, standard accommodations, great location. 

First, note that the hotel will try to bleed money from you as you will be required to pay $20 (plus tax) per room per day at the time of checkout for a “facility fee” that was NOT disclosed at the time of reservations (the manager Nancy also inaccurately stated we had signed a contract stating such). Steep price for what should standardly be included in the nightly rate: Wi-Fi, fitness center (which we didn’t use), coffee in the lobby for a few hours, and other services most people won’t use (local phone calls, receiving mail/packages). For two rooms, two nights this was an added $90. For internet, essentially.

When we booked it was noted that checkout was at 12noon, however when we checked in they told us it was an 11a checkout (must have recently changed as 12noon was crossed off in pen and rewritten as 11a on the paper with the room key). When checking in they said we could request a 12 noon checkout the morning we were leaving- however when we called at 7am the morning of checkout, Matt at the front desk asked us to email him our reservation info showing proof of a 12 noon checkout, and then told us it was “hotel policy” that only one of our rooms could check out at noon (but if we booked the two rooms on separate reservations, it wouldn’t have been an issue). Not something you want to deal with at 7am when you’re previously told it should be no problem. 

The water temperature in the shower was either ice cold or scorching hot, with no in between- we had to avoid the water while lathering up and then splash the water on ourselves to rinse off to avoid burning our skin. 

Pluses:
Great location, and convenient having a mini fridge and microwave in the room.

We won’t be staying here again. Overall, there are plenty of other hotels, I would not recommend to waste your time at the Belvedere. It’s disheartening when you’re a guest and the customer service is so terribly rude, inconsiderate, and inconsistent. If Nancy and her staff were to treat their guests with a little more respect, this would be a 3-4 star review.

title: Super!
text: Lage absolut top! Betten sehr bequem. Zimmer ansonsten okay. Fenster undicht und deshalb auch die Geräuschkulisse entsprechend laut, Großstadt eben. Mit Oropax aber in Ordnung zum schlafen. Von den Nebenzimmern bekommt man aber nichts mit. An Black Friday zu einem top Preis über Booking gebucht. Wir waren zufrieden.

title: Semplicemente favoloso
text:
Un scoperta favolosa.
A due passi da Time Square  comodo per raggiungere molti punti,e nonostante tutto molto tranquillo. 
Ottima la pulizia, letti comodissimi,tutto il necessario per l'igiene personale compresi gli accappatoi. 
Personale cortese.
Son certa che al prossimo viaggio a NY ci fermeremo nuovamente qui.

title: Verouderd hotel op een uitstekende locatie.
text: Verouderd hotel op een uitstekende locatie. De receptiemedewerkers zijn behoorlijk nors. We hadden een specifieke type kamer gereserveerd voor onze kinderen, dit was echter niet mogelijk volgens de medewerkers van The Belvedere. Na tussenkomst van ons reisbureau (Connections) is dit een dag later rechtgezet zonder een woordje uitleg of excuses. We hadden eerder het gevoel dat wij totaal in fout zijn gegaan om naar onze duurdere en betaalde kamer te vragen, we kregen 10 minuten om de foutieve kamer te ontruimen en te verhuizen,... hospitality heeft voor mij een andere betekenis. De bar van het hotel hoort bij het aanpalende "all you can eat" Brazilian-style restaurant. En ja, je kan er ook "a la carte" eten.... maar dan wordt je naar de bar verhuist en op hoge krukjes geparkeerd, zowel de bar als het restaurant zijn niet echt een aanrader. De 3 liften ter beschikking van de hotelgasten zijn behoorlijk verouderd en regelmatig buiten dienst, gedurende ons 5 daags verblijf vertoonde er elke dag wel eentje een defect, best wel lastig voor onze kamer op de 16 verdieping... De kamer (standard king) op de 16de verdieping is sterk verouderd t.o.v. de kamer op de 12de verdieping (standard double room), de foto's op de website geven een mooi beeld van de mogelijkheden van fotoshop! De ramen zijn verouder en sluiten het geluid niet meer af, best lastig met een brandweerkazerne om de hoek. De verwarming in onze kamer is niet te regelen zodat we de ramen moesten open zetten of de lawaaierige airco aan zetten, niet echt ecologisch in de maand december! Ik had in het begin van mijn beoordeling 3 bolletjes gegeven aan dit hotel, maar na het lezen van mijn eigen beoordeling heb ik dit bijgesteld naar 2.

title: Good location- Tired
text: Rated 4 instead of 3 because of the good price and location. Convenient to museums, theater, shopping and Central Park. But, soft bed, dented furniture, uncomfortable chair. Secure with doorman. Nice common spaces. Hotel restaurant extremely expensive. No coffee in the room.

title: Try to avoid if you can’
text: Dissatisfied with this one! Smelly bathroom!No coffee station, bath gel empty…. Front desk lady didn’t think it was a big deal and handed us a few small packs of body gel! NO FREE HOT BREAKFAST! The room looks like it was made up by housekeeping who really hates their job!!TV is smaller than what you would want in your kitchen! The location is the only plus but there are wonderful stays literally in every corner near here!

title: Belvedere hotel
text: Used as a base for trip over new year from U.K,in walking distance to time square and numerous food outlets and restaurants, rooms clean and tidy, rooms basic but spacious, had a family of 4 adults and managed ok, some negative reviews regarding only 2 lifts, but if you don’t use between 8,30-9, 11 (check out) around 5 you won’t have a problem, good room service, front off house staff polite and helpful, would recommend to friend and family and will use again

title: Dated but comfortable
text:
This hotel was perfectly placed to explore the city, we were so pleased. 
It’s clean and comfortable, although somewhat dated. 
The pillows were rock hard and no spares in the room. 
Be warned they want $300 on a card when you check in, as a single traveler, I didn’t have a credit card on me and wasn’t warned of this in advance. 
One thing that really did annoy me, was the maid, who was always loitering outside the room on the 7th floor. Every single day she asked when I was leaving, thanks lady but I don’t want to constantly be reminded of when I’m leaving the day I arrive and every day thereafter. 
The 2 central lifts are VERY busy and the wait for these made me late for bookings a few times. I did use the ones at the end of each corridor a few times. 
There’s no crockery or cutlery in the room but reception did have some paper cups!

title: Un excellent rapport qualité prix.
text:
La qualité du service est excellente 
La literie est très agréable.
Les salles de bains sont modernes et bien équipées.
Le petit déjeuner correspond à un petit déjeuner d'un 5 étoiles.
Je recommande fortement l'hôtel belvédère Fourati.

title: Magnifique
text: hotel très sympa. Chambre magnifique avec très belles prestations. Personnel charmant. Petit déjeuner très complet. Prix tout à fait honorable pour ces prestations de qualité. Hôtel très bien situé dans le centre-ville et calme

title: Close to everything
text: My go to in Manhattan. Close to everything! Lovely large rooms with ver fast wifi. Excellent service from Mike at the front desk. He got me checked in early and with a minimum of fuss. My only gripe would be that is no longer tea or coffee available in the room. Otherwise fantastic

title: Location close to Times Square
text:
This Hotel is situated close to Times Square so good walking distance and location. 
The hotel is a little older so not quite as up to date decor & facilities. The room we had was not perfect there was a loud noise from either heating system or similar which caused us not to sleep for long & the fridge ended up freezing our water. The shower pressure wasn’t the best, & loft access in a morning was frustrating due to it being busy, but overall it done us for our trip. 
The room itself was clean and tidy, housekeeping also spoke, didn’t have much dealing with desk staff but the doormen were also helpful. I would recommend this hotel for a stay.

title: Magnífico
text: Es un hotel estupendo, muy céntrico, cerca de todo. Es un tres estrellas pero he estado en algunos de cuatro bastante peores. Las habitaciones son amplias y cómodas, con todo lo necesario, plancha, microondas, fregadero, nevera, vestidor. Las vistas son muy buenas, la temperatura de la habitación se regula muy bien. El personal es muy agradable y servicial. Hay un servicio de café gratuito por la mañana, pero no se sirven desayunos. Definitivamente recomendable, un grandísimo acierto.

title: Christmas Trip 2022
text: This was our fourth visit staying at hotel. Since our first visit the hotel has either changed hands or under new management. Not sure but it is not the same. Very pushy in the morning so they can get in and clean, very loud in the hallway while trying to rest. Maids walked in on us twice. Bed and pillows were very hard and uncomfortable.

title: Good score for locality
text:
Decor is a bit dated. Room is spacious and well lit Bathroom had a bath and a wall mounted unmovable shower head - I missed a hand held shower- and sink was small. Small kitchenette had a microwave and a small fridge - but no kettle or mugs or utensils 
Its best feature is the locality - close to Metro and walking distance to Times Sat and Broadway

title: Great hotel near time square
text: Quick walk to Times Square but away from the chaos and loud noises! Never heard our neighbors. We don’t use house keeping so can’t say much there. Front desk was nice enough. Good size room, bathroom is on the smaller side. Shower pressure is okay water gets very hot which I love. The building and rooms are very warm, we prefer to sleep in the cold and had the ac running even in winter. Has a good size fridge and microwave. Elevator was slow and took up to 10 min only from 8-930am didn’t have any problems outside of that time. We were on the 16th floor and we stopped at pretty much every floor on the way down in the morning and the elevators are tiny so only about 6 people fit very snuggly. Would definitely stay again!!

title: Good hotel for first time Traveller in NY
text:
The room itself was very nice but it was still to here the street noises even I was on the seventh floor 
Good location when you are first time in NY … next to time square … low point toooo loud toooo crowded tooooo dirty …  much better in financial district next time when I visit NY 
Big downside for me no breakfast no room service 
Staff was ok

title: Quality hotel, great location
text:
Good hotel for the price and location. We had a pleasant room on the seventh floor, which had a nice view out on to the street, plenty of space, a fridge, microwave and decent bathroom. Its location couldn't really be better - you're within 5-10 minute walk of Times Square. We went to see Hamilton and got there within 5 minutes. 

I see a lot of complaints on trip advisor about no tea or coffee facilities. Yes, that's a little disappointing, but they make up for it by offering free hot drinks and cereal bars in the lobby every day. I actually quite enjoyed the trip downstairs in the morning to pick up some drinks and cereal bars for me and my wife each morning. It's a nice was to socialise and to get moving, ready for a busy day exploring the city. 

Hotel staff were helpful and pleasant, the rooms were clean and nicely presented. Just up the street are a few nice bars and restaurants - I'd recommend the Mexican two minutes up the road for late night Margaritas! 

If you're coming to New York for lots of exploring, you couldn't get a better location. Pick here and have a really pleasant stay.

title: A dive hotel masquerading as a boutique hotel
text:
The positive quality - its location and proximity to Broadway shows and Times Square. That is about it. 
The rest of the qualities - extremely pricey, staff not super friendly, smoke detector missing in room, roach on bed, horrible sewage smell emanating from bathroom constantly, noisy, and overall poor experience. This is a very expensive Motel 6 in a good location. I recommend looking elsewhere.

title: Aller à cet hôtel rien que pour Imani et Caroline !
text: Sa localisation est parfaite, au cœur de Manhattan ! Côté équipements c’est pas très jeune mais le sourire des réceptionnistes Imani et Caroline vous font vite oublier ça, en plus elles sont super serviable ! Merci à elles de m’avoir aider à mieux découvrir certains endroits de New-York !

title: Veraltetes Hotel in sehr guter Lage
text: In verschiedenen Bewertungsportalen werden Sie oft überschwänglich positive Bewertungen für dieses Hotel finden. Die Lage ist für einen New York Besuch hervorragend!  Alles andere ist mangelhaft. Womöglich sind die ungerechtfertigt guten Bewertungen dem Umstand geschuldet, daß die Verfasser von ihrem New York Erlebnis begeistert waren. Die gute Lage des Hotels ist offensichtlich. Abgesehen von der völlig veralteten Zimmereinrichtung funktionierte in meinem Zimmer eigentlich gar nichts so wie es sollte: Die Wasserhähne und Dusche war kaum zu bedienen, die Wasser-Temperatur nicht wirklich einzustellen. Der Fernseher ging ständig aus, womöglich wegen Instabilität des Netzes, die Klimaanlage war sehr laut und nicht richtig einstellbar,  Das angebliche Hotelrestaurant (brasilianische Küche) gehört nicht zum Hotel und  bietet dem Hotelgast nicht viel. Es gibt kein Frühstück, keine Bar, keine Getränke im Zimmerkühlschrank, lediglich eine Kaffee-Ecke bis morgens um 10:00Uhr. Die Fahrstühle sind alt, klein  und langsam,  Für fast 300 Euro/Nacht in einem Executive Zimmer (je nach Saison ab ca. 180 Euro/Nacht) bietet das Hotel sehr wenig!

title: NEW YORK E SEI IN UN FILM
text:
The Belvedere Hotel, premetto che ci siamo trovati molto bene e riassumo brevemente i motivi del nostro benessere:
check in: le ragazze alla reception sono molto disponibili, veloci e ti spiegano tutto - avevamo prenotato room only mentre ci siamo trovate la sorpresa di una mini colazione inclusa nel prezzo (giusto un caffè e uno snack ma sufficienti per iniziare la giornata)
check out: altrettanto veloce e senza problemi, per 7 notti abbiamo pagato 80 $ cad.
camera: pulita e grande a sufficienza per trascorrere una vacanza lieta nel senso che quando si va in una grande città si cammina molto e alla sera si necessita relax e la camera corrisponde ai requisiti di un turista che  e alla sera si vuole rilassare, quindi letti grandi, un mini salottino e un piccolissimo angolo con microonde e lavandino (che non abbiamo mai usato). le pulizie sono effettuate tutti i giorni con cambio asciugamani puntuale ed efficiente.
noi eravamo all'8.piano e l'ascensore non era molto veloce
posizione: si trova sulla 48th street quindi vicino a Times Square, in un viale un po' defilato dal "circo" di Times Square, un vialetto tranquillo e poco rumoroso; l'ingresso come l'arredamento interno ci ha ricordato un po' i film degli anni 20, un po' vintage ma veramente gradevole. Abbiamo trovato comoda questa posizione perchè è al centro di Manhattan e quindi ci spostavamo velocemente. 300 m. c'è la Subway , comoda da prendere per raggiungere Uptown o Downtown (noi per la verità l'abbiamo usata poco) .

title: Underwhelming - Seek out better options
text:
Pretty Meh - doesn't really seem to be trying.  
A couple of issues started even before checking in; we had a senior relative traveling in from another state arriving before us.  Hotel staff was very resistant to allowing them to check in without putting their credit card down for the room incidentals, even when I called them directly to give them my card as both the individual who held the reservation and was accountable for all charges.  Check-ins ultimately went fine, the room was a decent size but desperately in need of an update.  The pillows were among the worst I've slept on in the last several years and it feels like this has been surpassed in quality by basically every mid-budget chain out there.  They now charge a "resort fee" in addition to your room rate but added on in the small print - perhaps they could use a bit of the resort fee to replace a few pillows.  Checkout presented another issue - did not have time to stop at the front desk on checkout, and called to give them the card for the resort fee.  We were told that there was no way to change it to a different card than had been presented on check-in despite talking to multiple people.  Either they truly don't care, or they have absolutely no delegation of authority to anyone working to managing customer care, or their systems are trapped in the 1990's with the room quality.

title: Hôtel à 2 pas de Time Square, au calme
text:
Très bien situé, au calme, personnel très agréable.
pas de petits déjeuné sur place mais bon café en libre service. Épicerie à 2 pas, qui prépare de délicieux déjeuné que vous pouvez ensuite amener dans la salle de repos 
Que des bons souvenirs !

title: Returned again but less facilities for increased price. Restaurant still not open even for breakfast.
text:
Returned again for marathon weekend so prices increased somewhat.
Nice spacious comfortable rooms. Microwave & fridge included but no tea/coffee making facilities which is disappointing.
Was provided with a kettle when asked for. 
Clean towels each day and free coffee in reception each morning.

If it’s busy there’s always a wait for the lifts so use the quiet one on right of reception.

title: Great place!
text: Location was excellent - near to Times Square, subway, all the main things. Staff were very friendly. Room was spacious but a bit dated. Turned off air con due to the noise. Great view from window (16th floor). Only thing missing was a kettle and cups in room for a cuppa

title: super vacances
text:
Hôtel idéalement bien situé pour visiter.
Proche de Times square et de Broadway.
Restaurants à proximité et un rooftop juste à coté.
Au calme, chambres bien insonorisées. Literie confortable.
Salle de bain fonctionnelle mais un peu vieillotte, mérite un rafraichissement.
Personnel agréable et professionnel.

title: Brilliant hotel, awesome location
text: This hotel is lovely, awesome location (close to everything), friendly staff, room was exactly how it appears in photos, was lovely and clean and just overall we had a great experience staying here. It was also so quiet! For being in the heat of Manhattan we couldn’t believe how quiet our room was. Would recommend this hotel, for sure!

title: Poor First Impression But the Room is Fine
text:
I’m not used to arriving at a hotel that has check-in at 4:00 p.m. to find out that the room isn’t cleaned from the 11:00 a.m. check out.  I made an early request for a room on the second floor.  We did not get into our room until 5:00 pm.  While the check-in person was apologetic, it’s not appropriate to tell the customer that the room will be ready in 15 minutes when it was nearly an hour later.  There were other rooms available on the 3rd and 4th floor, but we were told the second floor which is perfect for my friend who doesn’t take elevators.  The manager tried to deescalate by telling us that 4:00 p.m. is check in time and there were other rooms available.  I explained to her that we were initially told the 2nd floor around 3:00 p.m.  Despite that, she kept reiterating that there were rooms available on 3 or 4.  I don’t consider this good customer service.  In fact, that’s argumentative.  

The room itself is adequate and clean.  On the larger side for NYC.  They have bath robes.  So, the accommodation is fine.

title: Très bon hôtel proche de Times Square
text: Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel pas loin de Times Square et de plusieurs stations de métro. Nous avons eu l'agréable surprise d'être surclassés. Le chambre était spacieuse avec kitchenette et salle de bain. Le personnel était agréable. Pas de petit déjeuner mais du café, thé et chocolat chaud et des barres de céréales. Le seul bémol. Le manque d'ascenseurs qui fait que parfois on passe 10 minutes à attendre qu'il arrive.

title: Great Hotel Wonderful Location
text:
Great Hotel and Great Locations
We visited this super Hotel from 30/10-3/11
Great location our room was very comfortable with a superking size bed very clean and maintained great room attendants really looked after our room . The only down side was a lack of restaurant you could get a coffee in the morning but unfortunately it was Luke warm but having said that the location was within many eating places around to offer for whichever money you had   The front of house staff were all extremely helpful from the ladies on the desk to the doormen and the lovely guy who sorted suitcase storage we could not fault any all were ready to help to make your stay easier and enjoyable .

title: Old yes but comfortable
text:
So, having read mixed reviews was a bit unsure.
However, rooms while not modern are really big for NYC. We had a room with 2 doubles on 14th floor - amazing views!
Comfortable and quiet in a wonderful location with restaurants and bars in side streets of hell's kitchen.
Lifts were absolutely no problem at all once during our 5 days.
AC is loud and obviously old but really not terrible.
Beds made daily and room cleaned daily. 
My only real issue was no tea or coffee making in room which should be standard in any accommodation these days.

title: New York 🗽
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per 4 giorni, posizione comoda, vicino a time Square,noi eravamo al 17 piano con vista grattacielo.la stanza era grande,il bagno pulito,peccato che il doccino spruzzava ovunque,cmq ho trovato pulito e il letto era comodo e grande.personale gentile

title: Très bien situé
text: Très bien situé. Bon hôtel, café offert le matin, propre. Literie à revoir, le reste est très bien. Au calme, petit frigo dans la chambre. Salle de bain vétuste, mais reste fonctionnelle, et propre. Hôtel calme.

title: Seriously Underwhelmed
text: This hotel states it’s a 3.5 Star and I would sort of agree with that assessment, at a push. The rooms are large but very dated and worn out to be honest. If I had paid the price of a Holiday Inn Express then maybe I would have been happier as that is the quality. From a positive perspective it is very close to Times Square if that’s your thing and the staff were very friendly but in retrospect there are other hotels in the area that would offer better value and for the price I paid I would have at least expected bottled water and tea/coffee making facilities in the room!! I am not sure if it is a new thing or I have missed it previously but I noticed in NY they now charge a "resort fee" in addition to your room rate but added on in the small print. This fee is for use of the gym, tea & coffee in reception and WIFI!! Basically, whether you use them or not its compulsory and a charge for items which was previously included in the rack price.

title: Perfect home base for a night in NYC!
text:
Visiting NYC for daughter’s 18th birthday.  The location of the hotel is perfect, close to Times Square, Broadway, and Central Park.  They do validate parking with a nearby parking garage, which we thought was very reasonable, especially overnight.  The hotel staff were all so very helpful and patient.  Our check in was not till later and it was so very easy to store our bags, worry free for the day until we came back much later to check in after all our adventures.  Coming back from a tiring day, we were quickly given our room, taking into account our kids would probably like a room on a higher floor with a better view. I didn't even have to ask!  The room was very comfortable and updated.  The coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby in the morning was wonderful and appreciated!  I would definitely recommend and stay here again in the future.

Thankyou to everyone who made our stay so pleasing!

title: Great location for our 5 night stay
text:
We stayed here as a family of 4 (in 2 rooms) and it made the perfect base for our stay in the city as the location is central without being overbearing. 

A short walk in one direction and you hit Times Square, a short walk in the opposite direction and you’ll be in the middle of Hells Kitchen with endless food options (that are much cheaper than the Times Square locations!) 

The hotel staff were super friendly at every interaction we had with them. And the free tea/coffee’s in reception 7-10 were a lil bonus too! 

We were on the 8th floor and the lifts were painfully slow and always full from higher floors. Our rooms were both dated in terms of decor and furniture with one of the beds being very creaky, but nothing that was too bad.

As a side note - I would highly recommend the deli on the corner of 9th Av/48th Street. Just a short walk from the hotel and has lots of food/drink/snack options, including hot drinks and deli sandwiches. A super handy stop-off on the way back to the hotel after a long day of walking!

title: Absolutely superb
text:
This was our second stay at this hotel (first was 15 years ago) and although we were impressed the first time it has improved. 
The location is good - easily accessible from airport and a few tran stops to the centre , the room we had wad comfortable, quiet and spotless.  The breakfast is superb with enough choice for anyone. Then there are the staff who are friendly and helpful
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will certainly book this hotel on our next visit to this fantastic city.

title: Mr
text:
The location of the hotel is awsome. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park etc.
The hotel is very dated
Elevators are ridiculously slow
The staff was not helpful at all. When we asked for directions to get to ground zero one employee googled it then gave up and asked another employee who gave us vague directions. We headed out and couldn't find our way so we stopped and asked the concierge at another hotel and were given proper advise and guidance. It was not difficult to get to.
I would not stay at this hotel again as there are many other options in that area in the same price range.

title: Three Night Visit
text: Our experience here was good although the hotel is starting to show its age.  The elevators were so so and there were only two of them. Good location within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square.

title: Great location, will stay again
text: We had a good experience while we were here.  The staff was friendly.  We could hear street noise, but I feel that is expected in NYC.  It was an easy walk to the theaters and Times Square.  I felt we were a little off the beaten path.  Easy walk to Hells Kitchen as well, where they have many great restaurants.  The room was comfortable and was all around a good stay.  I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC.  The only inconvenience would have been the line for the elevator during peak times and one time during our stay 1 of the 2 elevators was shut down for maintenance, but I'm glad to know they keep up with maintenance.

title: Tired hotel lacking warmth
text: We are staying here for 3 nights, so far we have only had one night but it is more than enough to write this review. The hotel is very tired and in need of a major upgrade. At check-in yesterday evening we struck the rudest woman I think we have ever come across. It forced me to become very short with her, which I must say I was disappointed in but it had been a huge day of travel at that point. A welcoming persona is needed, no matter what. The room has plenty of space but was dingy. We were fortunate to have a nice city view. However, there is no soundproofing, so you hear every horn, siren and idiot on the street, and we were on the 9th floor. We could also hear the TV next door, hence earplugs are essential at the Belvedere. They probably should supply them as standard! There are two main lifts but only one was working. Just hopeless to get a lift down. Others have alerted to this mess. There is a third lift at the end of each floor. We had a bit more luck there, still, had to take the stairs down several times. The AC units are noisey, as many have said. Again, the earplugs are needed. At the moment, there is an air drying machine blasting the hallway outside our door. The smell out there is like vomit. Something must have gone on but the noise is horrific. It is only about 5pm, heres hoping it wont be all night. Others have said the hotel would struggle to meet its 3 star rating. From someone who has travelled the world, stayed in many 3 star hotels and submitted hundreds of reviews, it is not a 3 star hotel, two at best. The big positive is the location. It is close to Times Square and subway stations, plus walking distance to many shops and attractions. For the cost, you could do much better. Look elsewhere.

title: The worst hotel I ever stayed in..
text: The bed was so small that our feet were hanging out of it above the ankle. TV channels were freezing. Air con was loud as a truck going on and off throughout the night. We were on the 9th floor, low ceiling, no view which was the least bothering thing. There were only 2 lifts in front and there was always a long queue , they were stopping at every floor. Awful, it came to a staggering 550 US dollars /day. The worst and the most expensive hotel we ever stayed in the US.

title: September at Belvedere in NYC
text: We loved our stay at the Belvedere. Everyone who worked there was polite and helpful. We were upgraded to the 17th floor. Large refurbished room. An international clientele. The location is central to everything in Midtown. Would happily stay there again. Recommend.

title: Excelente hotel para amigos / familia
text:
I want to praise both the hotel and its employees.
The attention is carried out in excellence.

Excellent location.
Despite being very close to Times Square, the street manages to be quite quiet.

Subway stations nearby.
Restaurants and supermarkets nearby.
clean and nice rooms

title: Rita C.
text: Furnishings as pictured above; classic well-built hotel; great location; nice interactions with staff. Our 12th-floor room with a nice view and king bed cost about $515, which included taxes and a “non-waivable” facility fee which had not been part of the original price (not exactly truth-in-advertising). My main complaint was that the drapes were not designed to close, so forget about shutting out the city lights or the sunrise.

title: לא ממליצים
text:
הגענו משפחה של 6. 
לקחנו 2 חדרים. 
החדר של ההורים בקומה 17 היה סביר (מזגן רועש). 
החדר ל-4 הילדים בקומה 11 היה ישן ומסריח מאבק.. הוילון לא היה תקין ולא נפתח.. זרם חלש של המים באמבטיה. 
יש 2 מעליות שלא מצליחות לעמוד בעומס של הלקוחות וצריך לחכות דקות ארוכות למעלית. 
בקיצור- לא ממליצים

title: Vacaciones en NY
text:
Excelente el hotel, la zona ideal, la habitación, el servicio, el personal todo, la limpieza y cuidado, resulta impecable!!!  Es silencioso para descansar, y en Times Square cerca de todo: subway, teatros, restaurantes.
Graciassssssss
Claro que volveríamos!!!

title: Happy stay
text:
Great location and friendly staff. 
We were on 17th floor with lovely skyline view. Would give 5 stars if the hotel rooms were refurbished.
In the morning you can get yourself coffee, tea or hot chocolate. 
Short distance to Time Sqare and subway.

title: Horrible. Black mold covered AC. Manager doesn’t care and won’t do anything about it.
text: When we arrived at 2:30 we were told to come back in one hour to check in. we arrived at 5:00 and weee told 5 more minutes before we could get to our room. After another 20 minutes we got to our room to find the AC out of the wall and a drill and parts on the floor. We then had to move to another room. We tried to talk to the manager about this and get some compensation but he totally dismissed us and said they were "too busy." When we got to our second room we discovered the AC vent was FULL of black mold, a very uncomfortable amount. We called the manager again and he was not interested in hearing us out and just wanted to push us on to yet another room not understanding the frustration we already had and the danger of the black mold. He refuses to compensate us and does not care about the safety of the guests. We will be disputing our charge with our credit card and we will calling the NYC department of health.

title: Perfect location
text: My husband and I stayed here on a recent trip to New York. The location is perfect, just a short walk from Times Square & Broadway. From reading previous reviews I was a little nervous but I couldn't fault the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and the small kitchen in the room was a bonus. Staff were friendly and helpful. The lifts were small but we never had any issues. We never waited long for one. If like us you only use the room as a base whilst you are exploring this amazing city then I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: In need of fixes
text: The second room we got was nice.  The first room's A/C had more noise than my window seat by the wing on the jet to LaGuardia.  The elevators are small and one was out of service.  Front desk person was kind of rude.  Was charged more than reservation indicated on arrival for reservation booked through TripadvisorPlus. The location is good and the second room was OK. A/C still noisy, but tolerable.  Overall, can't recommend.  There are places with better maintenance and friendlier staff for the money.

title: Solo la posizione si salva
text: La camera che ci hanno assegnato era vecchia e sporca, quando l'abbiamo fatto notare ce ne hanno assegnata un'altra poco meno vecchia ma altrettanto sporca. La mattina successiva abbiamo chiesto una pulizia approfondita, tanti sorrisi e tante scuse, ma al nostro ritorno non era cambiato nulla, sinceramente ci siamo sentiti un po' presi in giro. Dopo ulteriori lamentele ci hanno offerto un upgrade, ovviamente a pagamento, come se non bastasse quello che già avevamo speso per quella sistemazione terribile. E' decisamente un posto da evitare.

title: Ottimo hotel in zona Times Square
text:
Hotel in posizione perfetta, 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square!
Camera grande e spaziosa ma non modernissima. La pulizia buona e  il letto comodo, condizionatore presente, ottima vista dalla finestra della camera, presenza anche di un microonde e di un frigo.
Personale sempre disponibile e gentile, grande professionalità, la hall è molto accogliente!
Unica pecca il bagno piccolo e datato.
Personalmente mi sono trovato benissimo, l'hotel offre anche diverse opzioni come una sala internet, un ristorante, una palestra ecc.
Ottimo hotel in posizione centralissima!

title: Very nice hotel located near public transportation and attractions, but not o. A crazy busy street.
text:
Very convenient location, steps from Times Squares but not in a busy street. 
The rooms are clean and well maintained.
Friendly staff.
There are a lot o restaurants options just around the block on 9 Ave.
Laundromat at the corner helps a lot on long stays

title: Buona sistemazione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 4 notti.
L’hotel è accogliente e pulito. Il personale è cortese.
Le stanze sono spaziose e dispongono di frigo, forno microonde, asse da stiro.
Posizione ottima a pochi minuti da Time Square e dalla zona dei teatri.
L’unica nota negativa è la colazione che praticamente è inesistente ( caffè e barrette confezionate)

title: Nice, comfortable stay
text:
Having been to NY many times, our original hotel had closed down after the pandemic, so was re booked into the Belvedere. Location is great, just off Times Square, and close to 50th Street subway, so a good base to explore.
Checking in was quick, but as with many reviews, the staff seem to be low on people facing skills, and it does come across.
We had no issues with the lifts, and rarely had to wait for one to arrive.
The room was ok, if a little dated, but clean and comfortable. However, there is a microwave and fridge but no kettle or cups, which is odd for any hotel these days. 
The bathroom was clean, but a little cramped, however functional.

All in all, a pleasant stay, the location makes the hotel a place where I could return.

title: 50th Birthday 2022.
text:
Visited the belevedere hotel aug 2022
What a disappointment when we opened the bedroom door 
Dated to say the least 
Not the picture you see on the web site 
False advertising i would say .
And the bathroom 
This place is for infants as its that small 
Shower curatin ...really in 2022
Bath is tiny 
Rooms are dusty
Wallppaper hanging of the walls 
.
Only good thing is its quiet in the hotel 
Unless you have a front room .where you hear all the traffic .

Rooms need updated to the picture which you see online as the rooms are a joke .
WONT BE BACK TO THIS HOTEL

title: Très bien
text:
Très satisfaite de l’hôtel, chambre propre, lit très confortable, nous avons prit le king size. Personnel souriant, disponible.
Excellent emplacement, proche du midtown, des stations de métro et à quelques rues de central park.
Petit bémol : l’isolation est à refaire dans les chambres car nous entendons tout ce qu’il se passe à côté !

title: A Night in NYC
text: This is a nice, affordable hotel.  It was clean, staff was efficient and was in an excellent location.  The hotel told us to park at a lot that was further than those that were closer by & did not offer any kind of discount.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Belvedere NYC - decent hotel
text:
Pros
Lovely room. Comfortable bed. Rooms cleaned, towels changed/ beds made daily. Good location if you want to be near Times Square, Broadway, Hells Kitchen.
Cons
Aircon noisy. Needed to wait to use lift as always busy.
All but 1 member of staff at reception cracked a smile.

title: Hôtel impersonnel
text: Première nuit à New York et accueil sans sourire, froid et très distant, Une fois arrivés dans la chambre... on ne peut que constater l 'hygiène déplorable de la chambre et de la salle de bains...l aspirateur ne doit être passé qu une fois tout les mois, et je n ai pas apprécié les serviettes de bains douteuses. Fourniture des serviettes de bains insuffisante pour 4, nous n avions que 3 serviettes. Le petit-déjeuner est inexistant, il n y a que du café et des barres de céréales de mauvaise qualité. Il faut également prendre en compte de longs délais d attente pour obtenir un ascenseur. Hôtel très cher comparé aux prestations promises.

title: Enjoyed so much
text: We loved this hotel!  Our room was a king and was clean, had a nice view and had what we needed.  There was a microwave, fridge, hairdryer, good water pressure, double shower head, blow dryer and coffee/tea near the lobby in the morning.   We were able to walk to the Paramount Theater to see the Phantom of the Opera, the Empire State Building, Times Square and was in a very safe location near a lot of food.  We didn’t have a car, so we had easy access to transportation to visit lower Manhattan and even Central Park.  The staff was amazing and helpful.  A lot of people complained about the elevators, and the only thing I found is that they are small.  We stayed on the 12th floor and didn’t have to wait for elevators, like others stated.  All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay, and should we return, will gladly stay here again.

title: Good location
text:
If we could rate a 3.5, we would.  

Pros: Spacious rooms with kitchenette (microwave & fridge). 
We were on the 16th floor- rooms 1604 & 1606 and had a nice view of Times Square (ball drop).  Security outside all night.  We were able to store our luggage until check-in.  Staff was friendly. They offer valet parking and a discount at a local structure, however, due to location you may be able to find street parking.  Please note- you’ll have to move your car by 8:30am. About a five minute walk from Times Square. Hotel and rooms were clean. 

Cons: The air conditioning was faulty.  Fan kept stopping in the middle of the night and room making room a bit warm.  The beds are firm and not super comfortable. There were lamps and a clock on the tables next to the bed but one of the lamps was not plugged in (clock either) and the other’s plug was cut off with wires exposed.  I don’t think there as an outlet available.  The decor was a bit outdated.  When we were checking out, the bathroom sink was clogged.  The bathroom looks like one you might find in a house with a tub and older shower. 

All in all, I would recommend the Belvedere. Location was good and room was spacious. We don’t spend much time in our rooms except for sleeping so for value and location, it was reasonable.

title: Avoid if you can
text:
This hotel is lucky to be clinging onto its 3*’s. 
We needed two beds in a room so our options were limited. The trip was for our sons 21st so we opted for a superior room, and requested a room on a high floor with a view, although this wasn’t guaranteed it didn’t seem it would be a problem. 
When we arrived at reception, no friendly smile or welcome: I politely repeated the request and explained the birthday, and was told this one ‘has a view’ and ‘do you know how many people I’ve checked in today?’ The man couldn’t have cared less! The room didn’t have a view so I called down to reception and was told we could be moved tomorrow if we wanted, but we would have to be without a room at all, for all of that day if we decided to go ahead!! 
It was more like a poor motel, fittings were dated (not boutique) and badly damaged. The air con was very noisy, and the room two doors down had been sealed by police for investigation! 
One lift didn’t work for the duration of our stay and the other was VERY slow. 
Mid stay, I found an ice machine in the lobby, but we had no ice bucket in our room, so I asked at reception if they had something I could put ice in to take to the room, again totally uninterested staff, and they handed me w laundry bag for the ice!!
Concierge seemed more friendly when spoken too, but we had arranged airport shuttle with them via email. Once we paid for the booking there was an additional clause that stayed a 30 minute time slot for us to be waiting outside for, if we were late each additional 30 minutes would be charged at $25. Luckily we got through passport control quickly and our luggage came through promptly, so we were within the time allocated. However, we were left standing outside on extreme heat for over 50 minutes as our shuttle never arrived. Luckily a kind police man ended up calling them for us TWICE, to make sure then eventually came. If this wasn’t bad enough the driver then told us he hadn’t eaten since breakfast so was going to stop to get some meat? After driving us round and round a dull car park at a Wendy’s, he decided to just leave us parked at a gas pump, while he walked over for his food. 
Positives, fridge worked we’ll, it was a  quiet room when the air con wasn’t running. Location good.
I would not revisit this hotel, and would advise you to look elsewhere.

title: Wow! What a Find!
text: A prefect stay in a perfect location for Times Square.  Great price and a spacious beautifully appointed room.  There is a restaurant attached - a Brazilian Steakhouse.  I only stayed one night but this is a comfortable place to spend several nights.  I have stayed in a number of hotels in this neighborhood and so far this is the best all around.

title: Excellent service and ideal location to Times Square and Broadway shows
text:
Jacob at front desk was so nice and the other gentleman works evenings. Everyone that works here is so nice and friendly. The rooms were very nice ,clean and very quiet.
The best part is the location, location, location. They are 2 blocks from Times Square and Broadway shows.  A few blocks from Rockeller Center. I will definitely  here again.

title: would consider elsewhere
text:
Family trip to the East Coast, settled on Belvedere based on reviews and location. Right off the bat we had issues. One of two elevators non-functional which made morning trips to the lobby a nightmare. Room smelled like mildew. Safe was locked and not working. Bathroom sink clogged and not draining. Pillows were hard and incredibly uncomfortable. Two full sized beds felt incredibly small.

After the first night complained to front desk about the various issues, and the receptionist was actually quite attentive which was much appreciated. Within 15 minutes, engineering came up and fixed the safe, fixed the sink. Housekeeping immediately came by with an array of softer nicer pillows. These efforts made for a better stay. Couldn't do anything about the mildew and we were already fully unpacked with busy itineraries so didn't want to move rooms

Most of the staff was quite friendly, except one female receptionist who appeared very annoyed whenever any service was requested

The rooms are very cramped and the AC was not as effective as had hoped. The soap bars were very small slivers, almost one time use, and noticed housekeeping did not replace them after use. The only available water was from a vending machine in the lobby that did not accept credit cards so bills were required. I believe this was also the only area one can get ice

I did like the shower, it was a nice very functional shower. 

Best thing about this place is the prime location. The location was awesome. 

Not sure I would come back, at least not with kids or in mid summer. Believe for the price, amenities should be a little better. I know its an old building and maybe these issues are typical of many NY hotels at this price level, but other than a few small perks, was pretty unimpressed

title: Súper!!!
text:
La primera impresión debido a la atención fue muy buena, todo lo demás fue mejor. Nos toco la parte remodelada del hotel y la habitación nos fue súper cómoda y todo dentro de ella funcionó a la brevedad. Más allá de esto , la ubicación es ideal.
Todo el personal del hotel fue súper amigable dispuesto a ayudar en todas nuestra inquietudes. Cuando llegamos bien temprano por la mañana nos ofrecieron un cuarto para dejar el equipaje y poder empezar a recorrer ny sin perder un segundo. Tuvimos un baño a nuestra disposición para equiparnos y a rumbear. La recepción excelente, Jacobo nos recibió de manera amena, la señora del breakfast un amor y el Resto del personal del hotel igual!!! Relación precio-calidad-ubicación-atención……….inmejorable.
A tres minutos del Times Square!!!
Volveria!!!!

title: If you want an unfriendly hotel with no atmosphere and no facilities this is it.
text: I stayed here 20 years ago. I remembered waiting an eternity for the lifts then and nothing has changed. It feels like you’re checking into a penitentiary rather than a hotel. No welcome at all from the front desk. No bar in the hotel, no complimentary water… nothing to recommend it particularly.

title: Birthday trip
text:
We stayed here in an upgraded room for 5 nights in December and it was great! 

We chose this hotel and many others have reviews of sharing the hotel with homeless people and we didn’t fancy that on my 30th Birthday celebrations. 

The hotel was in a great place and really easy to get to Times Square or shopping from. 
I felt safe walking alone on a night time to go grab some food or drinks. 

There’s a Starbucks just behind to hotel and over the road next to the fire station, which is handy for breakfast. 
The hotel breakfast is a cereal bar, fruit and hot drinks machine. 

The beds are big and comfy, the shower is great and the rooms are clean. 
The tv has some great channels but who’s in New York to watch tv? Haha 

The staff are really friendly and helpful and you can leave your luggage with the concierge on your first/last day depending on flight times. There’s also a toilet and bathroom for you to get changed and cleaned up depending on when you need to leave. 

Overall I would stay here again and I’ve already recommended it to a few friends who have booked it for this year. 

TIP: 
If you’re from the uk use your jetlag and get up early, everywhere is so quiet and the sunrises are beautiful. 

Photo attached is the sunrise from the hotel if you go left toward time square.

title: Posizione Top, ma il resto.....
text:
E' stato l'albergo dove abbiamo alloggiato per 4 notti a New York.
Si trova praticamente a pochi passi da Time Square , e dal centro di Manhattan.
La zona a dire il vero, non è propriamente delle migliori, molta sporcizia, gente strana  e/o pazza , e mancanza di spazio sui marciapiedi per camminare ,a differenza di altri settori nelle vicinanze (anche la strada parallela , per intenderci).
Colazione praticamente inesistente, servizi inesistenti,  uno dei due ascensori principali perennemente rotto (eravamo al quindicesimo piano).

Vista top dalla finestra dell'albergo.

Un piccolo appunto finale (mi hanno chiesto 91 dollari, al termine dell'alloggio per farmi riavere i 300 dollari di cauzione che avevano preso). ma esattamente per cosa??

title: Go the Extra Mile  - helpful concierge and shuttle by Communter Apple Inc. to bring lost bag to airport 😃.
text: Shout out to the concierge and Commuter Apple Inc. airport shuttle service who went out of their way to bring a forgotten bag back to the airport just in time!  Highly recommend this hotel and the shuttle service.  Reasonable cost, the vans are on time, looked clean and safe with polite and helpful drivers.     Concierge booked this service with no hassle and was helpful to contact and coordinate with the shuttle during the panicked of trying to locate our bag. If you need transportation I highly recommend this service during your stay.    The hotel itself is clean and quiet and my son and I felt safe and well advised during our stay.   Also a 5 minute walk from all the action in Times Square and walking distance to Central Park.

title: Parfait !!!!!
text: Nous avions réservé une chambre avec deux lits doubles et cuisinette .Hôtel conforme à la description ,propre chambre faite tous les jours,calme malgrés un hôtel bien rempli. Proche des transports(ligne direct de JFK) et de Times square  On a apprécié tous les matins,la machine à boissons chaudes avec des barres de céréales dans le hall de l 'hôtel. Pas de vaisselle dans la cuisine mais je l avais lu dans les commentaires donc j ai prévu . Je recommande cet hôtel et j y retournerai avec plaisir 😉

title: Affordable, clean stay, close to everything!
text: The Belvedere Hotel is a great option for anyone wanting to be close to Times Square! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was very clean. Having a small kitchenette in the room with sink, fridge, and microwave is an added bonus! There is a small grocery store steps away from the hotel where you can get food, Subway station is very close too. Concierge is very helpful and doormen were great. Can't say enough good things about it. Only downside: slow and small elevators.

title: Perfecta ubicación
text: El hotel está ubicado a 2 cuadras de times square, en una calle tranquila, por lo que dormir no será un problema. En la zona está lleno de lugares para comer y supermercados, alguno de ellos 24 horas. Las habitaciones (reformadas) son espaciosas, las camas cómodas, aire acondicionado, heladerita y microondas. El baño espacioso, ducha con buena potencia. La ubicación buenísima, con líneas de metro a 2 cuadras. Ofrecen café, té y barritas de cereales gratis todas las mañanas. Es un hotel muy grande y tiene 2 ascensores que están muy solicitados a lo largo del día, por lo que alojarse en los pisos más altos puede ser un problema. El servicio de housekeeping por más que limpiaban la habitación correctamente, cada día se olvidaron de dejar toallas o papel higiénico o amenities. El check in fue bastante tedioso por la poca simpatía de la persona en recepción. Igualmente, recomiendo y volvería.

title: Never Again!
text: Dirty room, deadbolt lock was completely busted, one working elevator for 19 floors, refrigerator was barely cold and shower knob wouldn’t work well and went from hot to cold. Kay was friendly when checking in, but that was the extent of good things. It’s a very old hotel and the bathroom is tiny with no space to put any of your items. This hotel refused to give us our money back when Covid hit so we used our room credit which expired at the end of this year. Pretty pathetic that they wouldn’t refund any money during a WORLDWIDE pandemic and I asked multiple times. Would never return to this hotel and would not recommend.

title: El mejor Animador Dani
text: Lo mejor, la animación, especialmente Dani un chico fantástico, súper amable los niños le adoran, buen chico y además llegará muy lejos por su carácter, le doy un  10. Sigue así Dani. Yo creo q llegará lejos.  Por lo demás respecto al hotel todo correcto.

title: Little Gem Just A Block away from Timesquare
text:
This hotel is little Gem, just a couple of blocks away from Timesquare. Its a perfect location, if you want to avoid hustle and bustle but still near main attritions. It's a bit older and dated, but it's very well located and clean. Very easy subway access. It's around the corner from many good restaurant choices and just a couple of blocks to Times Square/theaters. Price is reasonable for the area.

Staff is super friendly.  Being group of 11 travelling together, hotel arranged van for Airport , which was very easy.  Special thanks to Concierge Allketa , who helped us booking airport van and with all directions for subway. 

The room service was excellent and freshened the room while we were out and replaced all towels and stuff that was needed.

Checking in and out was quick and easy. We will surely return and recommend this hotel.

title: Séjour décevant
text:
Nous avons séjourné 5 nuits à l'hôtel Belvedere De New York. Nous avions 2 chambres. Nous n'avions pas imaginé à quel point l'hôtel était vieillissant. 
Les parois sont si fines que l'on entend les voisins. Les clim à l'extérieure s'entendent à l'intérieur. Les chambres ne sont pas faites tous les jours. Devoir faite son lit dans un hôtel de cette catégorie, ça ne nous était jamais arrivé. Et avoir une cuisinette sans  couvert, ni verre, ni assiette est tout aussi surprenant
Le seul point positif est sa proximité avec les stations de métro en plein centre de Manhattan.

title: NYC GET A WAY
text:
The Belvedere was great
  The location is  close to everything.  Just 2 blocks from Times Square and Hells Kitchen's restaurants.  Rockefeller Center is also close by as are the subway stations. Staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were stylish and clean.  Would definitely stay there again

title: Average at best
text:
Lobby furniture is shabby and rooms are just average, however, very conveniently located which is worth something.
There are some areas in the hallway that have  notable odor that isn't at all pleasant.

title: Memorial Day weekend we stayed 3 nights
text:
This was our first visit to this hotel as our regular one did not reopen. We were presently surprised at the remodeled updated king room. The shower was amazing. Microwave and small refrigerator were a bonus. The staff was outstanding and very friendly and helpful. Shout out to Jerry the doorman👍

Location location location!!! Easy walking to everywhere! 

Only negative and it was not a big issues was there were only two small elevators. So it took time to get one and many times you had to pass one because it was full.

We parked our car a few blocks away at the garage they have discount with which was $45 a day. At check in they gave us directions and help our bags until check in time. 

I was very pleased with out first but not our last visit here.

title: Muy bueno
text:
No sé por que tiene algunas opiniones malas. Para mi fue muy buena experiencial Fui con miedo porque si te pones a leer las malas opiniones pareciera que es un desastre. Pero les aseguro que nada mas lejos que eso. Algunos dicen que es "ruidoso". La verdad no se que esperaban de un hotel a una cuadra y media de Times Square. 
Mi experiencia fue MUY BUENA, la habitacion estaba limpia, amplia, comoda, tenia microondas y heladera, el baño imnpecable, la ducha excelente, la calefaccion bien, es decir, todo muy bien. Para nada "antigua" como dicen algunos. Pore el precio esta perfecto (no es de lujo, lo cual es perfectamente compatiblñe con el precio de un hotel que salis, das dos pasos y estas en el centro del mundo). La ubicacion  es para mi, inmejorable.
El trato del personal fue bueno en todo momento. 
La unica critica que le haría es que yo tenia el checkin a las 16:00 y tuve que esperar hasta mas de las 16:30  (no se si ya eran las 17) porque no me entregaban la habitación, y uno llega cansado de viajar, asi que cada minuto de retraso en el checkin es mucho. Eso deben tener en cuenta para mejorar. El resto, yo le daria 5 estrellas. le bajo una por lo del checkin.

title: Near Times Square!
text: A neat hotel, with a great USP- right next to Times Square. The room was rather basic but good enough for our family of three. The staff (bell desk and front office) was efficient and helpful. The view from the window was pretty average. Among the missing amenities was a water kettle which is normally available in all hotels.

title: Hotel ist ok, Lage ist TOP
text:
Das Hotel hat eine tolle zentrale Lage. Die Zimmer sind Ordentlich, die Gardinen könnten mal getauscht werden.
Sehr praktisch die kleine Küchenecke mit Kühlschrank und Mikrowelle.
Nettes Personal... würden wieder kommen.

title: So  Many Choices for Hotels in NYC, But We Always Come Back to the Belvadere
text: Our family has stayed at this hotel over a dozen times in the last 5 years, and there is a reason we keep coming back. The service has always been outstanding, the rooms super comfy (and not super tiny like most NYC hotels), and the location. You are in the heart of Times Square in less than 5 minutes. There are so many subway drops minutes away. We love ALL the dining options in Hells Kitchen, and that  great little bodega right at the corner. It is also SUPER quiet, and a great nights sleep is had by all. The beds, and bedding, are so cozy. Did I mention the customer service. The fellas at the door always greet you with a smile, and are quick to make sure we are helped (from the moment we get dropped off at the hotel until the time we have to leave and head back to the airport.) Yes, there are a zillion other hotels in the city, but we always come back to the Belvadere Hotel

title: We keep coming back!
text: My sisters and I travel together a lot, and we travel to New York City with some regularity.  We have stayed at several different hotels, but once we discovered the Belvedere, we stopped looking.  This is a terrific gem in a location positively perfect for the theater-goer in you.  It's just a few blocks from Times Square, though you will not get the noise associated with it.  There are restaurants galore in the surrounding blocks and easily walkable to both Rockefeller Center and Central Park.  The staff is accommodating and friendly, the rooms clean and updated.  Location, location, location is really key here.  We'll be returning in the fall!

title: Outstanding service!
text: We stayed for a week.Disappointed at first as the rooms are not updated but we 3 were out most of the time. Clean! lots of hot water! we made 3 requests about the air conditioner , towels and blankets and someone was there within a few minutes. Our room had no view as it was in the 3rd floor, which turned out to be a GOOD thing as my cellphone fell out the window in the middle of the our last night with $ credit cards, ID and vaccination info and boarding pass attached. The staff ( especially Shabad, on night duty) were on it immediately and in the morning, the doorman (David) happened to know the owner of the building next door that was empty and being renovated. He even had the phone number. The owner was nice enough to come early. By 8:00, he had retrieved my things in time for our early flight. Whew! Everyone was beyond helpful for our entire stay. As we left, we remarked how much the place had grown on us!

title: Old & Frumpy Hotel
text:
The Belvedere is an older building, and the room I stayed in was not as nice as website pictures suggested (maybe other rooms have been renovated?). The old furniture, old carpet, outdated bathroom fixtures, and loud A/C window unit made my room feel frumpy rather than charming. I tried the Belvedere because it was cheaper than my usual NYC choices, and I felt like “I got what I paid for” in terms of ambiance.

That said, the Belvedere is not a bad hotel. It’s just old. A large school group and a few family groups staying there resulted in some long elevator wait times, but the staff was friendly and my room had a microwave and fridge. The hotel is also a short block away from the 50th Street C/E subway station, very close to attractions in Times Square, surrounded by great eateries in Hells Kitchen, and a 10-ish minute walk from Central Park. If you’re not too fussy about ambiance and decor, then the Belvedere is probably a smart choice as long as it remains competitively priced.

title: Great location
text: Just back from 4 nights ,  room was bigger than expected and had a great view over midtown (as shown in the photo )Manhattan, it was clean and we had no issues with air conditioning or showers etc. As has been mentioned before they really could do with either more or else faster lifts  and on a couple of occasions we took the stairs down from the 12 th floor rather than waiting any longer. Tea and coffee are available downstairs in the morning and and  any staff we encountered were helpful and friendly, The location is excellent with just being five minutes walk from the bright lights of Time Square (for breakfast I would really recommend Times Square diner just around the corner from the hotel on 8th avenue )

title: Great location... Love the neighborhood.
text: Great location; 48th and 9th. So you're two blocks from Times Square which is awesome, and yet far enough away that it's quiet at night.  Hell's Kitchen is a great neighborhood, and the Mexican restaurant next door is awesome.  I'm giving it four stars for two reasons: The parking garage is quite a bit away from the hotel. As I drove in, it was a little inconvenient to have to leave to park the car and then Uber back. It's a little too far to walk when you're carrying bags, or not 100% familiar where you're at.  And then the other reason is just that the rooms are pretty small. I know that it's listed as being 350 ft² which sounds like a good size, but when I compare it to something like the Warwick--feel the room is small in comparison. There is a little bit of dead space that encompasses where the sink and refrigerator are; at other hotels. Those are built into the actual room space, so the room and bathrooms are bigger as a result.  But the staff with the exception of one person was wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. I would consider coming here again but maybe with a smaller group or alone--two double beds can be challenging to accommodate a group of three to four. Whereas queen beds would be better/more comfortable when sharing a room.

title: Don't Stay Here
text:
When we got into our room the first thing we wanted to do is change and freshen up for dinner.  The drapes in our room wouldn't close so we phoned the desk.  Someone from Engineering came up and couldn't figure out why the curtain wouldn't move on the rail.  We said it was unacceptable and asked for a new room, so he said he'd talk to his manager.  Forty minutes later, still with no response I went down to the desk.  There was one person working who said she was the manager and it was with her, but she was busy.  I complained that we were trying to go for dinner and had already missed our reservation so she said to go and they'd get us a new room while we were gone.  When we got back they had a room for us and we moved at 10 PM at night.  By then we were exhausted and went straight to bed, and at that time I discovered a large hairball in the bed.  I was too tired to complain and swept it out onto the floor and went to sleep.

The room was small and badly appointed.  There's no coffee maker or clock, and the HVAC is so loud that my ears were ringing when I got up every morning.  The beds have a very thin blanket between two sheets (no bedspread), and the pillows are rock hard solid foam.  There's no room service, even though it's attached to a restaurant.  This place is basically a Motel 6 with a doorman. 

The elevators in this hotel are a total joke.  They're too slow and small for the size of the building.  If you're heading out during the busy period of 9-10 AM you may wait 2-3 minutes for an elevator only to find that it's completely full and you have to call another one.  We were on the 10th floor (out of 16) and it was difficult to even get on.  On more than one occasion I saw people getting on at lower floors going up, willing to ride all the way to the top and all the way back down just to get on.  One of those people was a bellman who said he had to do it regularly.  When I asked him why he didn't use the service elevator at the other end of the floor, he said it was for housekeeping and maintenance only and he wasn't allowed to use it. 

They advertise package drop-off on their website.  My wife had 3 things shipped to the hotel.  For two of those, it took more than one person looking, and almost 10 minutes or searching just to find the package.  If you're actually going to advertise that you provide that service, you should at least be competent at it.  They aren't, and clearly have no filing or record system.  On those two occasions that they couldn't find the package their automatic response was "are you sure it got delivered".  One time an older Indian gentleman was working the desk and couldn't find the package so he asked my wife who delivered it.  She said USPS, then had to explain to him that it meant "US Postal Service".  Seriously???  

I couldn't decide on 1 or 2 stars, but gave them 2.  The showers were hot and had good pressure, and the location is excellent with no external noise 10 stories up (not that you'd hear it over the air conditioning). We stayed here because it was cheaper than it's competitors, but you get what you pay for.  I wouldn't stay here again, especially while Covid 19 is still lingering as you have to spend far too much time crammed into elevators for it to be safe.

title: Great stay; Super convenient
text:
I stayed here with my wife and 2 kids.  We had 2 double beds (Executive)
Pros: 
- room was definitely big enough for all our stuff
- great location near Times Square; multiple restaurants nearby; close subway
- staff was friendly and helpful (it got busy very busy when I was checking in...but I was patient; desk clerk gave me an upgrade for being nice and waiting)
-elevators got busy on occasion, but there were 3 elevators and didn't have to wait long

Cons:
- drain stopper was broken in our bathtub so it made baths difficult (we never called maintenance, just made the kids take showers instead)

Overall, it's not a super fancy hotel.  But it was affordable and exactly what my family needed.  We only used it to sleep in, so we didn't need all the frills.  Location was the biggest reason for the selection.  Would happily stay there again.

title: Stay away, far away.
text: Immediately upon walking in, we notice there’s probably about 20 people waiting for a clean room minutes before 4pm. After a half hour of waiting, the number is easily at 50-60, waiting for clean rooms. I get that everyone is short staffed, but having that many unclean rooms is unacceptable since check out is at noon. If the hotel starts having a shortage, they shouldn’t be allowing so many late checkouts. We waited over an hour for a room, and had essentially no time to get ready for dinner at 6pm. When we finally got to the room, I got a disingenuous apology from the hotel manager and mumbling about giving us an “upgrade” which barely looked different than the one we booked, and faced a dark alley. This was after asking to get the resort fee refunded, after we heard another clerk do it for another customer who too had waited over an hour. (As a side bar, it seems this is how they always operate as the lobby was full the next night around the same time, same situation). I was worried since housekeeping was so behind that the room wouldn’t feel clean, but it did. The bathroom felt a little cramped but I’ve seen worse. The outlets on the night stand barely held the chargers in, but at least the bed was pretty comfortable. You need a phd to figure out the shower, good luck. It’s also slippery, which is scary for someone who is expecting. Going to echo everyone else in that the elevators are absolutely awful in that they’re super slow, or not working at all (not to mention cramped). This was extremely frustrating, I was somewhat grateful we were on the 3rd floor only for this reason. One thing to note is that there was no street noise where we were, which was nice. Overall, I wouldn’t recommend staying here. I think the staff were sort of rude - but understandable if they’re constantly facing angry customers due to poor management. I would avoid it.

title: I would stay here again and again
text: This place was amazing - only downfall was no coffee pot in room - but they have it in the lobby.  Staff incredible - helped us get a cheaper car back to the airport.  Always there to open doors, etc.  Room was super clean and large!  the location is amazing to times square rockefeller and hell's kitchen!!   nothing bad to say about this place!!  NOTHING!

title: Dont plan on showering...
text:
Went on a short trip to NYC with the kids. We were basically looking for a place to sleep and shower before leaving in the early AM.
Before leaving in the AM we tried to shower but the drain was totally clogged. We were in a rush and didn’t have time to wait around. I mentioned it to the front desk while checking out but from the reply it didn’t seem like anyone was going to do anything about it. 
VERY disappointing.

title: Great value gem
text: Recently had a 6 night stay at this hotel for a vacation in New York. The hotel is in a fantastic location for the Broadway theatre and visiting Times Square. The rooms are large by New York standards. We had an older room but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small but clean and the hot water good. The kitchenette in the room was not useful as there are no dishes etc but it is a good area for storage of bags etc. There is a good size closet with iron and hair dryer and safe. The hotel staff could not be friendlier or more helpful especially the doormen who are always there to open the door or help with your bags. The hotel supplies a tea and coffee service each morning and treats you to a complimentary muesli bar which was a surprise. In terms of value for money it cannot be beaten and we would definitely stay again. If you want a basic hotel that is clean, comfortable, in a great location and with good service you can’t go past it.

title: Maleducados, hotel viejo y malo.
text: La situación es lo único bueno de este hotel. El personal terriblemente maleducado y descortés, no hay ni buenos días, les hablas y no te miran a la cara. Parece que les molesta que le preguntes algo. Definitivamente, no volvería. Por cierto, bastante viejo y para que te limpien la habitación tienes que pedirlo y no te sacan ni la basura…

title: My new favorite place to stay in NYC
text: I booked this hotel the night before leaving on a cruise. I've stayed at several hotels near the pier. The Belevedere Hotel was by far the best place I've stayed. In most hotels in NYC you can barely walk around the bed. In other places, we've barely had room to move around our luggage. The room was large and very nice. There is a mini-kitchen with a microwave and sink (can't remember if there was a fridge). The location is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful. This will be my new hotel of choice in NYC.

title: Charming older hotel with a great location
text: Great location, charming older hotel close to Times Square in the theater district which was key for us so that it was close enough to walk back at night after seeing a show. Elevators are small and the bathroom is small, but the room is spacious with a lovely city view.

title: Fabulous Location for Broadway Shows!
text: This was a mother/daughter trip and our first one to NYC. I read a million reviews of a ton of hotels. I kept coming back to The Belvedere and decided to go for it. This hotel was everything we needed! Apparently there are two styles of rooms. We had a "renovated" style. That probably made all the difference.I heard NYC hotel rooms can be super small ... this wasn't. We had two double beds and still plenty of room for luggage, etc. We did not spend a lot of time in the room but we were comfortable and the room was great. We loved the city view (but do be prepared for city sounds ... honking horns, etc.). The bathroom was great. We had a walk in shower and the BEST water pressure I've had in a long time! There was a nice size closet with great storage. There was a small

title: Amazing stay and great location!
text: This hotel is located in a great location close to Times Square and so much else.   We were greeted by the doorman and the very friendly staff.  Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  It had definitely been updated.  The bathroom was large enough for our needs and clean.  Jacob was on staff that weekend and was increadilbly helpful and friendly.  He gave us several restaurant recommendations (which we took and loved) and made us feel very welcome.  Check in and check out was smooth.  We were pleased with the parking arrangements (only a couple blocks away).  Jacob clearly explained the parking validation process and called our validation in when we were ready to leave.  We rate 5 stars for him alone!  We would definitely stay there again.  Location, price, comfort and service - we felt experienced it all!

title: Belvedere, NY.  Great location, great place to stay.
text:
First time in the US, and we spent a week in this hotel.
Room was spacious, two double beds.
Kitchenette was simply a sink, small fridge and a microwave.
Making a coffee or tea required boiling water in a paper cup in the microwave first, a small el. kettle would have been so appreciated!
Bathroom small but perfectly appointed.
Staff very helpful and polite. 
The Cafe seems to be closed.
The business centre has 2 PC's and a printer/scanner.
Internet access was slow.
The hotel has it's original terrazzo flooring in the lobby and lifts, and it is quite spectacular. 
Overall a very plesent stay, and we would stay again if in NY.

title: Do NOT stay here . . . . .
text: We saw the reviews and pictures the hotel posted and it looked great. We got there and the room we were given was AWFUL! Couldn't close the bathroom door because of where the toilet was situated. After complaining about the room the moved us to a much nicer room (redone), but still not wonderful. Apparently there's two level of rooms  - redone and not. As we left they bell hop put us in a cab that we later found out was unlicensed (limo type thing). Upon arriving at LaGuardia the transportation authorities pulled us over for questioning. There's just WAY TO MANY great hotels in NYC to risk staying in this one.

title: Great location and lovely time
text: Lovely hotel close by Rockefeller & Times Square. We were in a corner room on the 14th floor with great views of the city. Room was very comfortable and quiet. Bathroom was tiny, but most older hotels are. Elevators are very small, but we never waited long for one.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Was in town to work the boat show. Boss booked the hotel. After reading some of the reviews I was a little guarded. But it was a pleasant stay across the board. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Lobby was welcoming, Elevators were a little small, but is actually better to limit riders during covid times. We had the room with 2 double beds. room was on the smaller side but clean and beds were comfortable. Rooms were definitely updated at some point. Bathroom was plenty big. Room had a little kitchenette with wine fridge, and micro wave. (there was no coffee maker, as depicted in some of the pictures I saw) however they do offer commentary coffee in the lobby. There are no ice machines on the floors, but there is one in a room on 1st floor along with vending machines and computer terminals. Location is fantastic for attending plays, or a quick walk to times square. There are soooo many restaurants to chose from all within walking distance. My bride and I talked about bring the kids to see a play in the future and we will definitely book another stay here.

title: Great hotel
text: Very nice hotel with a doorman and everything. Very fancy and old school feel to it. The room was a good size and the bathroom was adorably tiny. We were on the 11th floor and our room 1112 had a great view on the Times Square ball drop. If we came on New Years we would request this room. It was a perfect view right between two buildings. This was central to everything that we wanted to see and do.

title: Excellent location
text:
Location. Location. Location!! This hotel is in the perfect spot for a trip chock full of theatre. We were in town for 5 days to see 9 shows and I was super pleased with these accommodations.
By NYC standards, the rooms are huge. Our room had two double beds, a desk, a kitchenette, a closet, and bathroom. And still extra space! The bathroom was a little cramped, but it was clean. We had a great view from the 15th floor.
The staff was friendly. We had an early flight in and while our room was ready, we didn’t want to pay $75 for early check in so they held our bags for us.
It’s January, so there are less tourists in the city than usual, but I’ve stayed in other midtown hotels where the lobby is always crowded and loud. Not the case here.
