I hardly encountered anyone other than staff in the lobby. I never had to wait for the elevator, hoping for an empty one to arrive. It was amazing.

The only negatives (which are not dealbreakers for me):
The noise. Not the street noise (it’s NYC, of course it’s noisy) but the noise in the next room. Every conversation, every toilet flush, we could hear it all as if they were in our room with us. It was a little unnerving at times.
The thermostat. We were lucky to be able to control it, but one degree up had us suffocating with the heat, and one below seemed to kick on the AC. I’d happily sleep in an ice box, but my sister wanted the heat. There was no happy medium and I spent the nights melting into a puddle of sweat.

I can’t wait to come back and stay here again. This is hands down the best place I’ve stayed in NYC so far.

title: Basic accommodations at reasonable rates
text: This hotel is not super fancy, but is has the basics. For the price, its a good deal. It is old, but well kept. The bathrooms are small and furniture a bit dated, but still….a really good deal. The main elevators are a bit slow and very dark, but we found the secret solution. There’s another elevator to the right of the main bank, down the hall. The hotel location is great. Nice and safe and it’s easy to walk to everything, If you are on a budget, this is a great bargain.

title: Great Location, Great Service, Great Value!!
text: Before we arrived, I was a bit worried due to the mixed review I read here. This hotel exceeded my expectations! The location cannot be beat for the price; it's only a couple of blocks from Time Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was roomy and clean, the beds were comfy, and we had zero issues during our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel. The only nit picky thing I would say is that there is only coffee offered in the morning, no juice or milk or breakfast. However, again, for the price, I'm completely satisfied.

title: My go to hotel in NY
text: I visit NY frequently and the Belvedere Hotel is right at the top of my list. The location is terrific. Close to the theater district, Times Square and subway stations yet on a quiet street so you’re not right in the middle of it all. The rooms are decent sized by NY standards and fairly priced.  The hotel is very clean and getting an elevator, even though they are small is not a problem. All of this is great but the biggest asset to this hotel is the staff. Every single person you encounter goes out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay. I’d like to give a special shout out to Ricky at the front desk. I hope the mgmt of the hotel realizes what a great employee Ricky is. He remembers guests and is so cordial and polite I can’t say enough nice things about him. I would definitely recommend the Belvedere when looking for a NY hotel.

title: Avoid. Avoid.
text:
Got there late at night and was refused entry to the room after the room both wasn’t ready and they didn’t accept our booking name change that we’d made in advance. 
The member of staff (who we didn’t get the name of) was severely rude and made us call the U.K. (where it was 2:30am) to confirm the change. 

Once we got in the room it was dirty and their was a half-eaten trifle in the fridge!! The shower head wouldn’t stay up and the toilet wouldn’t flush properly. 

The one good thing was the location, it was 2 blocks over from time square and just a 2 minute walk which was particularly ideal for us having been visiting over new year. 

On exit the concierge to store our bags in between the time of checkout and leaving in our taxi was also rude, not even saying a word and proceeding to virtually chuck our bags at us. On the other hand, I do believe that there was some kind and more thoughtful members of staff, such as the doorman who was very nice. 

Overall, I would avoid as seems there are similarly priced hotels that could offer better value. I don’t believe every experience at this hotel would be like ours but I can only speak from our own.

title: Si salva solo per la posizione
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato in questo hotel dal 24/12 al 02/01, di questo hotel si salva solo la posizione vicinissima a Times Square poi per il resto stendiamo un velo pietoso.... la camera datata e decisamente troppo calda visto che il riscaldamento è sempre in funzione e alla nostra lamentela del troppo caldo ci hanno detto di accendere il condizionatore che per di più faceva un rumore infernale ... stiamo scherzando? La pulizia lascia a desiderare visto che i mobili e le lampade erano pieni di polvere, il bagno è un buco e anche questo è rimasto fermo al 1960... non prendete il loro transfer per l’aeroporto perché a noi è stata fatta ricevuta da 75$ ma ne abbiamo pagati 88$ e alla mia richiesta del
Perché la risposta è stata vaga. Il tour operator con la quale abbiamo prenotato ci ha venduto il pacchetto con la colazione e al nostro arrivo abbiamo scoperto che per via del Covid non veniva servita ma che servivano uno pseudo caffè e del the con delle barrette ai cereali ( non più di 1 a persona) e anche qui non so se ridere o piangere.. concludo dicendo che se tornerò a NY eviterò questo hotel senza alcun dubbio, cercate altro!

title: Worst Experience Ever
text: We are frequent customers of the Belvedere Hotel but something happened since we were here last. Our first room was freezing cold, they don't give you a real blanket just a bedsheet, the internet, TV and electronic safe all were non-functioning, and heater made clanging noises all night. We asked to change rooms, thinking the fact that we had a corner room was the reason for the freezing temperature. In our new room for 2 hours and the internet has dropped twice. The charging station for cell phones is dead. We can turn the TV on but can't change channels or do anything else, so we are stuck watching Kelly Ripa. The morning coffee service is disappointing. We are never coming back here.

title: Nice place in Dublin
text: Well located - close to transit and a quick walk to shops and centre core.   Had the best sleep of my vacation here. Beautiful duvetS.  Clean, helpful staff, room had tea and kettle and milk pods so we could settle in.  Very nice hotel and would recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed at the belvedere this week, excellent location , 5/10 mins walk from everything you need in New York, friendly  and helpful staff , rooms clean and spacious, would definitely recommend and will be staying there again when I return to New York

title: Great trip
text: I would stay again here 100/100 times. The bellmen were super helpful storing our bags before our room was ready. Got a notification two hours before check-in that the room was ready. Staff was great, helpful, and courteous. The twin beds were super comfortable and the water pressure was great. I did not experience an issue with the elevator. The location cannot be beat. Easy access to everything NYC has to offer. Great place to stay.

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text: Hotel is in a great location, walking distance from broadway and Times Square, no more than 10 minutes away.  Hotel staff all very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are spacious and comfortable. On check in the front desk staff made sure our parties rooms were close together, even giving us an upgrade to superior as one of the rooms wasn’t quite ready for us, excellent service! Loved this hotel!

title: Great Little Find
text:
The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that hotel rooms and elevators could use a little updating. Other than that I just returned after a 4 night stay with my friend and was very pleased with the whole experience.  Rooms are a good size with a small fridge and micro if you need one!
The location is great! Between 8th & 9th street.  Walking distance to most everything in theater district.   The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating.  I asked if they had an extra lamp as I felt room was a little dark and they had one in the room when I returned from dinner.  Housekeeping did a great job.  Room was always clean and anything extra we needed, we left a note and it was there. The doormen were always there and very friendly.  Loved the free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby every morning. Price was very reasonable considering the location.  We would definitely stay again.

title: Great Location, basic hotel
text:
Pros-Location is great, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen and Theatre district, Bryant Park is all walkable. Rooms are comfortable. Microwave and mini fridge. Upper floors have a good view and windows do crack open a bit which was nice to let the cooler air in, it was about in the 40's when we were there. 
Con's -No coffee in the room, you do need to go downstairs for coffee, it was actually good coffee considered it came from a machine. There is a good store if you make a right when exiting the Hotel. Great coffee, bagels and sandwiches . There is no restaurant or cafe or bar at the hotel. There is a very expensive Brazilian Restaurant attached to the hotel. A rum and coke will cost you $20. 
Overall a good hotel if you want a good location and basic hotel.

title: Very good choice and here is why..
text: The reason is, you get a nice little kitchenette with microwave oven and small refrigerator. That helps when you are trying to save some money on eating out. However, there is no coffee maker in the room. They do have complimentary coffee, off the lobby in the morning, which is covered by their "resort fee", which i am not fan of these fees at all, but a number of properties tuck them in. Your stuck with it, unfortunately. Back to the positive- the staff was very helpful to me. Mike at the front desk really took care of getting me a terrific room. Tariq in maintenance was very helpful with fixing the shade in the window that had malfunctioned. Sonya in housekeeping brought me a digital alarm clock (there was not one in the room) and was very helpful with it. So while there were a few minor issues, the staff addressed them quickly and professionally. I was also thankful for the little special they were running on saving 30 percent off. Thank you Belvedere, for that.  I do recommend this property, highly. I would definitely stay again.

title: Really nice hotel
text: We have stayed here twice and would highly recommend.  Hotel is clean, spacious and conveniently located.  Walked to Broadway, wonderful restaurants, St. Patrick’s, TimesSquare, Central Park, etc.  We took the train to Penn Station from New Jersey and it was also walkable to the Hotel.  We went to see Mrs Doubtfire which was fabulous.  Lots of really good places to eat in the area.  If you are interested in any tours they were selling tickets at every corner.  However, you need vaccination proof EVERYWHERE!

title: Great spot, great hospitality, bigger room than expected
text:
In the theatre district, right down from Times Square, great spot! Staff at the front desk were helpful.  Room was bigger than expected, in NYC.  Concierge was helpful with information about the city.
Cleaning staff was thorough.  Will stay here again!

title: Great location.
text: We loved the location of this hotel. It was close to Times Square and Hell's Kitchen with every type of restaurant you could want yet on a pretty quiet street. The staff was excellent and accommodating. We requested a roll-away which arrived promptly as the beds were only doubles. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The windows need to be replaced. They were foggy and interfered with our view. My only complaint would be there were no coffee makers in the rooms requiring me to head to the lobby for some java in the morning, a fact that I had to discover on my own and I had to change out of my PJs. Lastly on our departure day we requested a cab to JFK and the doorman ordered a private car costing us an extra $30 ($80 total) and cash only.  We would have preferred a cab.  Overall we enjoyed our stay.

title: Pretty Good
text:
Five nights in this hotel on an upper floor.  It's a bit older and dated, but it's very well located and clean.  Very easy subway access.  It's around the corner from many good restaurant choices and  just a couple of blocks to Times Square/theaters.  Price is reasonable for the area.
 I did have a couple of nits that knocked off one star for me: 
          No coffee maker in the room.  Come-on, even Motel 6 will give you that!  Plus, while coffee is available downstairs, its only available for limited hours in the morning.  So its down the block to either 8th or 9th avenue for you to a neighborhood bodega if you want some.
          The only available ice machine is on the ground floor (we were on 15).  Plus while the "art deco" style ice bucket was nice, there are no plastic bag liners for the ice bucket.  So you're putting the ice cubes directly into the bucket, the same as the last guy.  Did the staff actually wash the thing since the last guy used it?  Beats me but I doubt it.
          No conceierge.  My wife and I have visited NYC many times and rarely use this service, but it would have been nice.  There's a desk, but no one home; ever.

title: Not Our Problem seems to be their motto. Avoid this hotel. Rude service.
text: Don’t stay here, as their motto appears to be Not My Problem. Had as issue with the beverage vending machine, I used at the front desk clerk’s suggestion. It was not working properly and dispensed the wrong item. The hotel managers response was “not our problem.” All I wanted was the displayed beverage or my $2 back. Instead the manager gave me some legal mumbo-jumbo as to why she wouldn’t help or offer me a refund. Instead she wanted mr to call a random 800 number, and we all know how that goes. I give this a hotel a D based on their lack of customer service and ownership of issues that happen on their property.

title: Loved This Hotel
text:
A group of 6 girlfriends from Detroit between 67-68 y/o old stayed here last weekend. We had all attended the same elementary school. I knew about the hotel from having stayed there years before
With my sister, so I booked the hotel for all of us. It was clean, staff was responsive and pleasant. The hotel was bustling with guests. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant so I cannot comment on it. It was near the Broadway plays we wanted to see on 45th street in Midtown Manhattan. We could walk. And we took yellow cabs to other places at low costs. Room prices were reasonable. Each of us paid about $360 total with tax for 3 nights. That’s about $120 per night for 1 person. We had 3 people in one of our rooms and the hotel was able to fit a rollaway bed in the room with two double beds. Hotel was quiet and the perfect place to stay, except for no handrails in the bath tub. We requested rubber mats for the tub floor and they were sent up immediately. Rooms were cleaned by housekeeping each day and each room had a microwave oven and refrigerator. I will definitely stay there again.

title: You can't ask for a better location!
text:
We just returned a couple of weeks ago for the reopening of Broadway (Six the Musical and Hamilton--OMG! they were both very, very good) and wanted to thank the staff at the Belvedere for once again, providing us with a comfortable stay.  This was our 6th (I think) stay there and every time we stay at the Belvedere I am reminded how much I love the hotel and its great location.  

At the corner of 8th Avenue there is a small store that stays open really, really late (til perhaps 4am?) that sells snacks, sandwiches, cokes, beer--maybe even wine.  Returning to our room after a show (literally a 5 to 10 minute walk on streets filled with enough people that we feel safe)  there are scores of bars and restaurants and pizza places all along 8th Avenue.  Best of all is you're close enough to walk to everything and feel safe but far enough from Times Square that you can't hear the noise.  If its your first time visiting or haven't liked the last places you stayed at in NYC, I think you ought to try this place.

title: Above and Beyond
text: The very best front desk crew, especially Jacob. Jacob was a travel guide for us, he loves his city and gave great tips on restaurants and attractions. Room was very clean and the hotel is just blocks from Broadway and Time Square. We were on the 9th floor and our room was quiet. I would stay in this hotel again.

title: Fire Alarm
text:
I am not sure that we will return.

The front desk person was very nice at check-in.  Our key would not work for our room on the 6th floor so we had to head back down to the lobby.  We were told the door was not working and an engineer had to take a look at it and given a key to a room on the 14th floor.  When we arrived at that room, it was still being cleaned and the front desk had to send up another set of keys for a room on the same floor. 

After a long day in the city, my family and I were in bed.  We hear a noise and realize it is not coming from outside, but from the hallway, a barely audible fire alarm.  We run out of our room, forgetting our keys and head down the stairs.  An announcement is being shared, but you cannot hear the content in the stairwell while running down them.  In the lobby no one tells you what is going on and the fire department shows up, then leaves and everyone starts to go back inside. No sorry for the inconvenience, nothing from the staff.  We asked for a key and cautiously went back up on the elevator, not the main elevator since those were not working, but a side one, that no one would confirm was safe to ride after the incident.

We would have left right away, however by the time we got a key and were back in our room we would have missed the last train out of the city.  We went to get coffee the next morning and found brown water.

While we did get an early check-in, additional toiletries and baggage storage, after the fire alarm incident I am not sure that we will be back.

title: Nice Surprise Near Times Square
text: This property was a nice surprise for us. We were in town for a weekend and we wanted a reasonably priced option near Columbus Circle. Many other properties had an "amenity fee" that we wanted to avoid. I am a Marriott Titanium member and all of those properties had that fee. We booked an Executive King and ended up on the 15th floor. Elevators were plentiful and fast. Room was quiet and location was very good at 48th and 8th. Microwave and refrigerator in room were nice additions. Would stay there again.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Clean, comfortable rooms (superior double) with elegant design and decor. Staff were exceptional. Location is ideal, close to everything: Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th avenue shopping, Central Park. Times Square Diner around the corner was so convenient. Food was incredible. No Uber or taxi necessary. Everything within walking distance. Location and time are everything in nyc. Will definitely return to the Belvedere. Felt safe everywhere in Midtown, day or night. The absolute ideal location!

title: Wonderful stying in The Belvedere hotel
text:
I’d like to recommend this hotel!
We slept there for 9 nights.
The room was pretty big and clean! 
The best thing is the stuff, Jacob helped us every time that we needed something with all of the attention! 
Thanks u Jacob we will return for sure:)

title: Excellent location and service.
text:
Excellent location and superb service from every staff member we met. The doorman was very helpful giving us directions etc while we were heading out, even lent us his umbrella which came in very handy.

The room service was excellent and freshened the room while we were out and replaced all towels and stuff that was needed.

Checking in and out was quick and easy.

The on-site cafe was closed but there were plenty of restaurants nearby so we were never far from food or snacks.

There is no parking here and the hotel provides this via a third party. If parking is needed, the same parking lot can be found for much cheaper via apps like spothero.

title: Great Experience
text: This was such a nice hotel. The staff was very nice and accommodating.  We had a standard king. Lots of room to store clothes. Closet and dresser and shelves. Amazing for NYC. Very clean. Attractive hallways and room decorated very well. We will recommend and stay again

title: Basic hotel - good for a few days in NYC!
text:
Vintage/ very bare minimum basic hotel. Was Perfect for a few days in NYC. No major complaints. Seems like the usual “issues” with cleanliness. This is not a 5 star hotel. This is BASIC affordable hotel. 

Rooms are out dated and very small. Not a lot of room for luggage etc. Keep this in mind…..
Bathroom was good enough. Shower had a fabric curtain which prob never gets cleaned. 
The bed was okay. Comfortable. The bedding was basic. Asked the cleaners to remove the decorative pillow and decor blanket runner. They were stained and gross. Note, these items never get washed. Room had a safe. The AC was so loud. Sounded like a train was in the room. On and off all night long.  New towels always had something on them. Hair, random food etc. 

Room had a mini fridge, microwave and extra space to hold snacks/dry goods. This was great - keep your water / drinks cold. Bring back left overs from restaurants. Very close to Times Square and amazing restaurants. 

Staff were friendly. No complaints. The bus/ door men looked miserable. Noted they do  open the door every time and overall did a good job…. Were helpful   
Unfortunately they are the first employee for a guest to see and the last as guest depart. They looked like they hated their jobs. Each and everyone looked beyond miserable. 

Right across the hotel is a Salvation Army park. Showers for the homeless on some days. 

Covid notes. 
Not all staff wore masks. It wasn’t forced. Not all guests wore masks. Some signage around the building. We felt like they could have done a better job at this. As you venture out into the city. …. It’s the same everywhere. Thus this is more a social norm. 
No sanitizer in the lobby. Maybe there was. We didn’t see any. 

They can step up their cleaning. Didn’t see many cleaners. 
Good location. 
Lots of adults. Not a lot of kids 
Elevators were  small. Not sure if a large wheelchair would fit in there. 
Would say the rooms are not that accessible for those with disabilities. Not large enough. 

Most likely would not stay there again but would recommend to a friend for an affordable stay. 
We really enjoyed the location and that the room had a fridge.

title: RACIST HOTEL
text: This is a RACIST PLACE . Nancy The girl who is ar The lobby is rude and unpolite with The customers, even she speaks spanish she Only use english with The latin customers , also The beltmen who helped you to carry on your luggage is so rude with the people (the  one that Im posting The photo) , thats why I Would NEVER recommend this hotel never Again because the personal is unpolite and rude

title: Cute and Safe
text: Cute hotel very close to Times Square.   We could see the billboards from our room.  Room is small, but very clean.  Beds could use some upgrades, but its a minor annoyance.   Rates were affordable and all the staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful.  We would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

title: Nice inexpensive option to stay in NYC
text: This is a small, boutique hotel in Hell's Kitchen. Walking distance to a lot of good restaurants, and off Times Square, so quiet. Staff is fantastic, from the front desk to the maintenance staff to the guys at the door. Stayed here about 19 years ago and not much has changed. It needs some updating, and the rooms are pretty small, but very clean and a much less expensive option than others. If you want a place to "stay" in NYC that is not expensive, it's a good option. If you want a place to relax in your room and have a big lobby or restaurant or bar in your hotel to relax in, this is not your place.

title: Vacaciones
text: Viajo mucho y decidí hacer un parón en Salou y disfrutar en familia  el hotel está muy bien limpio personal atento comida buena y en buen estado que dada la experiencia que tengo es complicado que todo esté bien a destacar el equipo de animación genial mis hijos se lo pasaron muy bien y para mí es muy importante de ahí la nota en mi opinión la relación calidad precio es muy buena muy contento

title: (Pre-Covid) Great Stay!
text: We only stayed for one night for our stopover in New York but this hotel was ideal! It was a great location within walking distance of Times Square and location was particularly useful when seeing a Broadway show at night, so we could just walk back to the hotel afterwards. Our room had 2 double beds and felt extremely luxurious. Everything was very clean and modern. Large bathroom with a walk in shower, again lovely modern and clean. Staff at the reception were great! As we were leaving I had realised the postcard I had bought to send home to family in Scotland had a pattered back and so the address wouldn't be seen. The lady at reception went and got a label for me to stick on the postcard for me and even cut it to size to fit the postcard, I wish I had gotten her name as she really went above and beyond to help me. Excellent stay, would definitely recommend.

title: Hotel is not COVID-19 friendly with cancellations
text: We booked a reservation to stay during the New York City marathon to watch a family friend run, before COVID 19. Once the marathon was cancelled and New York had travel restrictions we had to cancel our trip.  The hotel will not give us refund and I was basically told too bad so sad and not compassionate or understanding at all. I had over $1,400 invested and the only concession they will offer is a credit that has to be used at this location in less than a year.  This was a once in a lifetime trip and we have no idea if we will be going there ever and not in less than a year.  I had other trips planned and the hotels were extremely kind and gave a full refund due to Covid 19.  This is extremely disappointing and I would not recommend anyone trying to book or stay here and be treated so rudely!

title: Ótima localização
text: Hotel antigo, mas bem limpo e prático, pois tem uma mini cozinha com microondas e frigobar q quebra bem o galho pra quem viaja pra NYC com crianças. Bem centralizado, somente a duas quadras da Broadway e perto de estação de metrô.

title: A frustrating and sad experience
text: The Hotel closed because of Covid-19 pandemic. Nothing wrong with that, the thing is they charged us full even though they where out of business and cancel our stay. We where expecting a full refund but they are very stubborn and unpolite offering only a one year voucher. Beth Roldan and Belvedere Hotel you should do better. Don’t take advantage of families during such crisis. Shame on you. My mother is 70, my daughter is 13. It was going to be they’re very first trip to NYC. 😓

title: Hote Belvedere
text:
The Hotel is two blocks from Times Square. Around the corner restaurant street.The hotel is conventiently situated near All theatres. We were were in NYC on 10th March 2020 when everything closed due to Covid 19.
The staff were wonderful, attentive and assisted us where possible. The congierges were brilliantThe situation was dire for the hotel staff and by the time we left, earlier than scheduled, most rooms were vacant and staff stood down. The staff showed they cared for the people in the hotel.
I have nothing but praise for the staff who doubled their efforts  during the eventual shutdown of NYC.
The rooms were lovely and serviced well.It was great that we could open a window!
The only downside is the US$35.00 resort fee charged daily.This was for I presume WiFi and breakfast. The breakfast was coffee and muffins/pastry's. The hotel Management perhaps need to look at this, huge sugar load.Toast/Yoghurt and fruit would have been welcomed.
I would go back to the Belvedere in a flash. But do not think I will be there for a while.
Thank you

title: Supportive during COVID
text: We had booked a vacation to NYC and we were forced to cancel due to the Corona pandemic.  Even though we had made a non-refundable  reservation through Expedia, the management of the Belvedere Hotel were nice enough to help us to come up with a reasonable compromise so that our family didn't lose out on our vacation.  Although I have never been to NYC or the Belvedere Hotel, they were extremely fair and understanding during this difficult time and I will most definitely stay at the Belvedere Hotel when the pandemic is over!

title: Nice room in a convenient location
text:
Stayed here for a 4-day weekend that would have been full of theater (until the COVID-19 virus turned everything upside down). The Belvedere is a short walk from Broadway/Times Square. Subway and lots of restaurants are close by; even Central Park and the High Line are walkably close. The "superior king" room had a decent amount of space, comfortable bed/linens, good lighting, plenty of power outlets (AC + USB), ample closet and nice bathroom (shower). All staff interactions were great: desk, concierge, bellman and maid.

It looks like a lot of NYC hotels are padding the bills with "resort fees" that cover things that in other places are included in the room rate: Wi-Fi, fitness room, etc.; here it was over $30/night. The included Continental breakfast is basic (rolls and pastry, coffee and tea), but fine quality and fresh. Only the Wi-Fi was disappointing; my cellphone hotspot had better performance.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
Staff are rude, I recommend booking with another hotel. 

Location is convenient but the staff seem inconvenienced by their guests.

Many other excellent options to pick from that are also in close proximity to timesquare.

title: Lovely Place to Stay!
text: A friend and I booked this hotel based on price, location and reviews. We were NOT disappointed!  The property was in a great location and truly a lovely stay.  The bathroom was typically NYC small, but bearable.  The young lady who checked us in had some great recommendations for places to eat.  Empanada Mamma's - don't miss it!!  The only reason this isn't a five star review is breakfast.  Inexpensive, but incredibly limited. Otherwise, no complaints whatsoever.  Thank you!

title: Really nice hotel located near the theater district of NYC
text: We just came back from a 3 day/2 night stay at The Belvedere Hotel. What a gem of a hotel, from the friendly desk, to the staff in general. The room was very nice and comfortable, quiet too up on the 15th floor. The bed was comfortable, enough room for 2. Having gone to the city during the coronavirus situation, the hotel was extremely extremely clean. As a precaution we brought cleaning wipes just in case anything was missed. Nope everything was spotless, including the TV remote. During our stay, we witnessed the staff cleaning elevator buttons, door handles, door knobs throughout the day. The hotel is a short walk to most theater attractions, it was a 13 minute walk to the bus terminal, and about 15 minutes to Times Square. The only minor disappointing thing was the free continental breakfast, it was coffee/teas and some plain and chocolate  croissants. We ended up going to Dunkin and McDonalds instead. Given the chance we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. I recommend it highly.

title: UN HOTEL, PÉSIMO!
text: Es un hotel totalmente mediocre y muy cutre. El personal de la recepción es muy mal educado. El día 7 de marzo a las 12:00pm quise hacer el chequeo para retirarme del hotel me quisieron poner muy difícil para entregar la habitación. 2 chicos muy MALEDUCADOS!! me dijeron que tenía que pagar la suma de 75 dólares por la sencilla razón de que mi habitación estaba paga hasta el día 8 de marzo, quise irme el día 7 de marzo un día ante de vencer mi estancia y me querían cobrar la suma de 75 dólares. Es algo totalmente injusto y poco aceptable, ya que le deje la habitación con una noche ante de vencer mi habitación. Y aún así me quisieron cobrar. Más dinero. El personal de la recepción eran totalmente indeseables! No volveré JAMÁS a este hotel. Las instalaciones son muy anticuadas las bañeras 🛁 de color blanco y aparentan amarillenta, de lo antiguo. Ponen que tienen desayuno incluido y no es más que un café ☕️ más un cruasán 🥐 No más!! No volvería ni aunque me regalen la estadía. Este hotel no es para nada recomendables. . Desilusión TOTAL!!!

title: Halloween à New York
text:
Excellent hôtel, idéalement situé, proche de Time Square et de plusieurs stations de métro.
Chambres assez spatieuse et propre. 
La vue n'est pas dégagée ( bâtiment de l'autre côté de la rue) 
Personnel attentionné
Petit apéritif offert chaque soir en plus
Je recommande

title: Nice play to stay and play in the city!
text: The hotel is right around the corner from a subway station which makes it very easy to get around.  The staff is very nice and accommodating. The rooms are clean and decent size for NY.  The breakfast is free but lame.  They gave us a great view on the 11th floor so that ws cool.  It is a little loud as the fire dept is a block away but the sirens stop after midnight. Close walk to many sites.  We would stay here again.

title: Hôtel un peu vieillot mais personnel au top.
text: Nous avons passé quelques jours dans cet hôtel. C'est un hôtel un peu vieux et beaucoup de chambres mal isolées. Mais en contrepartie, je tiens à mentionner la gentillesse de tout le personnel en passsant par la réception (avec un manager très sympathique), la conciergerie, le personnel technique et d'entretien. Merci encore à eux.

title: Solo poche cose da salvare...
text: Eccezionale location a pochi minuti da Times Square. Comodissimo il letto king size, Buon livello di pulizia. Per il resto lasciamo perdere... Camera (abbastanza spaziosa, in verità) affacciata sui potenti e rumorosi motori dell'impianto di condizionamento, bagno molto piccolo, improponibile la offerta a colazione: 4 tipi di dolci di infima qualità, caffè e the. Per chi come me non può bere latte e caffè/the non rimane che fare colazione con l'acqua. Ma siete fuori di testa???

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel in an awesome location. Easy walking to the heart of it all Times Square. Subway station, bus,food, everything is right there. Hotel room was spacious and check in and out was so fast and easy. Had a small issue with a clogged toilet, got fixed in 5 minutes flat! My only critique was it was freezing cold outside and there weren't any coffee makers in the room or lobby. Also breakfast was really limited to a few pastries. I will however recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again. Great friendly staff too!

title: Great location
text: Had a long weekend in the Belvedere Hotel. The location was just great, walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockafeller centre and the Empire State Building. Staff were very accomadating and the coffee was great. This is an old hotel but was very clean and friendly

title: Best Hotel for Broadway and Times Square
text: We spent two nights here and it was our base camp for two Broadway plays and exploration of Hell’s Kitchen area. Literally Four minute walk to the World Stage Theaters and five minutes to Times Square, so the location is ideal. Subway stations are a short walk. Located near some excellent Thai restaurants on 9th Avenue. Room was very clean, modern, and beds very comfortable. The free continental breakfast was very spartan, with simple danishes, croissants, and muffins with juice and coffee, and thus the four star rating. We will definitely be returning on our next visit to NYC!

title: Hotel belvedere a new york
text:
Hotel vieillot mauvaise literie salle de bain petite avec WC dedans pas top.
Petit-déjeuner vraiment nul même pas de jus d'orange et de jus de pomme ni lait chaud juste des croissants et des pains au chocolat décongeler et tout-petit pour le prix ça ne vaut pas du tout la peine. 
Par contre il est très bien placé à côté de Times Square et a proximité du métro.
On peut faire beaucoup de choses à pied.

title: Friends Holiday
text: Just back from a lovely stay in a very clean,friendly hotel.Great spot to be able to walk to all the sights.We had requested rooms beside each other and on a high floor by eimail  both were sorted for us on arrival .Hotel very quite and breakfast was grand if you wanted a fast snack .Would stay here again next time in NY .

title: とても良いホテルです
text: チェックインの際にホテルのご好意でアップグレードしてくれましたが、シャワーのみのお部屋だったため、バスタブ付きのお部屋に交換を改めてお願いしましたが、気持ち良く対応してくれました。また、部屋に備え付けのない湯沸かしケトルをお願いした時も、笑顔で親切に対応してくれました。立地はタイムズスクエアは徒歩3～4分のイメージで、地下鉄駅も複数が近くとても良い場所です。料金も安く、機会があれば次回も利用したいと思います。因みにセーフティボックスは部屋にありました。残念だった点は、室内着が洗濯はしてるのでしょうが、染みだらけだった位です。

title: Girls Trip
text:
I can not say enough good things about this hotel. We spent the weekend in NYC as part of my daughter’s 16th birthday gift with tickets to see Wicked. Our group included 4 Mom’s with their daughters. Upon arrival on Friday Jacob at check-in was wonderful and made us feel very welcome. The bellman that helped us with our luggage was great (wish I knew his name) and took the time to explain where a 24 convenience store was located as well as a 24 pharmacy if needed. He also told us if we needed anything to press 0 for concierge, which we did for extra pillows and towels. We received them within 10 minutes of request. Room was spacious and quiet with a beautiful view. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was OK and typical of continental breakfast. Saturday morning we were headed to the Gershwin theater and the same bellman gave us exact directions to the theater which was greatly appreciated!
Upon checkout on Sunday (Jacob was on duty again) we were able to leave our luggage with bell services. The bellman there was wonderful as well (again wish I knew his name as well). He asked about what time we would be back and where we would need to go and he made notations so he could help with a cab when we returned.
After lunch and some shopping we returned to the hotel for our bags. While were waiting In line to be helped (busy at check out time) we had a delightful chat with the concierge about how wonderful Wicked had been and we chatted about some other musicals we would like to see in the future. Before bell services retrieved our bags he had the door man arrange a cab and had it waiting before we even had our luggage.
From beginning to end the staff was wonderful at this hotel. We are talking about planning another trip and we have already recommended this hotel to friends for the comfort, service, and proximity to everything NYC has to offer!!!

title: Gutes Hotel
text:
Wir sind das erste Mal in New York. Das Hotel hat eine super Lage, sauber. Nettes Personal. 
Nahe beim Times Squere. Gute Anbindung zur Metro. Kein Problem vom Flughafen mit dieser ganz einfach zum Hotel zu kommen.
Gerne wieder.

title: We Always Stay Here
text: Walk to shows. Walk to Times Square. Walk to Radio City Music Hall. The Belvedere is blocks away from everything you want to see and do while in NYC. Rooms are spacious, clean, quiet and well furnished. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Stay here. You’ll love it.

title: Excellent location
text:
Arrived at the hotel with our sons 24 and 22.  Booked this hotel so we could guarantee they would have a double bed each.  We were given rooms 613 and the boys 605.  We had to ask to move room as 613 was next to elevator and although you couldn’t hear the actual elevator going up and down, guests rolling luggage in and out, banging their luggage, talking loudly whilst waiting for the elevator led to a very disruptive nights sleep.  We moved to 603 which was so much better. The boys had no problems in their room at all.

Another reason we booked was because of the very positive trip advisor reviews. However, there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room now nor are there any USB charging points. Both of these were quite disappointing. After travelling around New York feeling quite tired it is nice to go back to the hotel and to be able to make yourself a beverage of some sort. However there was no water heating facilities in the room and therefore we could not even use our own tea and coffee. As the room has a kitchenette with microwave and fridge, I would have thought it almost inevitable that a kettle would have been provided. 

We were surprised to find that a Breakfast (muffins croissants Danish cereals porridge) with coffee and tea cold drinks was available from 7 am till 10 am and they really do ask you to leave at 10 am even if you have not finished your breakfast.

The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and polite. The Doormen always saying good morning to you, reception staff very kind and changed the room with no problem at all and really understanding. The rooms were always cleaned well, with any used toiletry items replaced each day.

The location of this hotel is just perfect you are just far enough away from Times Square not to hear too much noise, the occasional fire engine was all we heard, but we were at the back of the hotel.

The room itself was comfortable although not really sure what made it an executive room apart from a bath robe there was nothing else that  I could see that made it an executive room it was pretty standard to me. It would have been much better if the USB charging points and tea and coffee making facilities had been provided. Or at least have somewhere in the hotel you can get coffee during the day.

I would suggest that the bed mattress in room 603 be replaced as it was rather saggy and our backs were starting to ache by the end of our week, and the base cover had collapsed which we only noticed when packing and checked under the bed to make sure we had not left anything behind.

As it was a bit chilly we did ask for an extra blanket for the bed which was provided by housekeeping very quickly.

Overall a perfectly suitable hotel in an excellent location.  Very friendly staff. 

We were able to check our luggage into storage for our final day and the staff arranged a car to pick us up which they said was the same price as a yellow taxi would have been. This was unexpected and very useful as it was a lovely large car to take us to the airport.

We would like to thank the Belvidere hotel for our stay in New York City.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: I have stayed here 3 times. It  is an older hotel, but very clean and good service.And, it is close enough to the Theater District and Hell's Kitchen restaurants, but still quiet. Staff is great, too. And, you can find deals on TripAdvisor, other aggregators.Brazilian steakhouse is adjacent, and they have a modest continental breakfast for $9.99. Suggest heading to 9th Avenue for breakfast.

title: First trip to New York
text:
Loved the hotel! Fabulous location close to everything yet quiet enough for a good nights sleep in the very comfortable beds. WiFi worked well enough for a teenager to stream videos. Upgraded on arrival -12th floor room was beautiful and view from when node nice at night, opulent bathroom, robes and really nice toiletries. Maids left the place spotless daily and every single member of staff were absolutely lovely. 
I’m going to single out Shonda at reception on our arrival. First time in America for my teenage daughter, we’d been travelling for over 14 hours and were tired and a bit overwhelmed. She was so nice - really made us feel welcome. We are already considering a return trip to New York and will definitely stay here again!

title: Clean and safe
text: Room was nicely sized. We were on the 16th floor so street noise was not an issue. Price was reasonable. Staff was not called on much but were good when we did. Nice bathroom as well. Was very conveniently located in the theater district.

title: Bom custo benefício - ressalva café da manhã
text:
Hospedei pela segunda vez no hotel por conta do ótimo custo benefício visto a localização. As instalações são boas, com quartos reformados e a poucos metros das principais atrações de NY. 
Entretanto, nessa segunda hospedagem, fui obrigada a pagar taxa diária de café da manhã. O pagamento obrigatório não seria problema se fosse oferecido um café da manhã de qualidade. Infelizmente, posso dizer que foi o
pior café da manhã de hotel que já desfrutei. 
Sugiro rever a política ou melhorar a qualidade do café.

title: Nice hotel in central location!
text: This hotel is very easy to get to from JFK via public transport.  Our room was clean, quiet, and well appointed.  From five to six PM, they have a wine and cheese hour (a nice perk!)  Breakfast is basic - bagels, danish, cereal, yogurt etc, but convenient.  The staff here were all attentive and helpful.  This is a good choice for a New York trip!

title: Great Hotel Great Staff!
text:
Had an Awesome Stay here! 5 Minute walk to Time square 
Good Staff Helping realy good! They gave us discount on a Seightseeing tour! Helped us with a Transfer to the Airport and Everyday Free coffee! Very good! Next trip to New York i going back to the Belvedere hotel!

title: Sometimes location ISN'T everything.
text: While the location of this property is desirable, unfortunately we couldn't say our recent experience here was.  The first room we were booked into was freezing cold, the curtains dirty and even torn in places and the bed skirt and lounge chair both badly stained.  Both the double beds had deep dips in the middle and looked quite worn.  We demanded to be moved and were met by a very repugnant staffer, who informed us "that's what you booked, that's what you get" and "No-one has informed me of any problems with the room", to which we replied that we were now.  "Someone", who we now realise was a member of the Housekeeping Team knocked on our door and said "they are moving you", before walking off.  The Manager later accused us of refusing to let her in the room--WHEN in fact, A/  She didn't introduce herself B/  No request was made to inspect the room  C/  We had no clue who she was.  The hairdryer looked as though the filter had never been cleaned, the air vent in the bathroom was filthy, there was hair on the pillows before we'd even got into bed.  The desk was terribly scratched and marked.  One of the blinds was stuck closed and couldn't be raised throughout our entire stay.  There were NO AMENITIES in the room, not even a single teaspoon!  No coffee maker, let alone a kettle, which you will find at other properties throughout Manhattan.  There are doormen at the property, however, most could be seen leaning against a pillar in the foyer.  A few homeless people regularly sleep adjacent to the hotel, on the Times Square side of the property, which made us cautious of walking by with young children after dark.

title: Classic NY Hotel near all theaters
text: My wife and I had the pleasure of an overnight stay at the Belvedere Hotel.  This hotel contains the charm of yesterday and all the modern conveniences of today.  The rooms are updated, spacious and comfortable for a mid town motel. Close to all Broadway theaters and Radio City Music Hall.  There is a Brazilian steak house on site and many restaurants and taverns within a short walk.  Friendly and helpful service.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: Excelente ubicacion a 2 cuadras del time square, a 10 minutos del central park, cerca de los teadros, del metro,  de la quinta avenida. Las habitacionea son amplias. El baño viejo. Tiene microonda, la heladera de mi habitacion no funcionaba y no tiene utensillos de cocina. La limpieza no es buena. El desayuno hay que pagarlo aparte y es caro. Como tambien te cobran un suplemento diario al llegar que es significativo.

title: Christmas Time in NYC
text: This was the first timing staying at this hotel.  We needed a change and this was a great choice.  The rooms and hotel were very clean.  The staff top notch. This was so close to everything that we needed to get within walking distance.

title: très bon emplacement mais vieillot
text: Pas loin de Times square, pratique pour faire une bonne partie de Manhattan à pied. Intérieur vétuste. Literie de mauvaise qualité. Chauffage à fond et non modulable, on peut juste ajouter une climatisation par dessus ! Fenêtre = passoire de bruit et de froid. Kitchenette inutile car pas un couvert, pas une assiette pas un verre ... Petit déjeuner cher pour ce que c'est : du pain de mie grillé et des boissons industriels au distributeur !

title: Great location
text: Arrived in NYC much earlier than check I time. The bellman checked our bags so we could roam the city. Arrived back about 3:30pm and Noel was very helpful getting us our accommodation. Our room was on the 5th floor just off the elevator, and was very spacious especially for NYC. Only thing our room lacked was a coffee maker, but we walked to Starbucks 1 block away each morning. Beds were comfortable, pillows were very thin. We called for more blankets as we were a little cold and received them promptly. I also liked the toiletries provided in the bathroom.  Housekeeping was very good each day. Location is perfect for us. SO close to many theaters and fantastic restaurants! We didn’t have breakfast but did partake in wine from 5-6 a few nights, which was great! Wanted to eat dinner at the hotel restaurant but ran out of nights- maybe next time! Mini fridge and microwave came in handy. Our daughter became ill our last night, we were able to arrange a late check out (for a fair fee) so she could rest before heading home. Hoping to return to the Belvedere again in the future!

title: Good price, good location
text:
We spent 10 days at the Belvedere, for Xmas and New Year’s 2019/2020. 
Room is big for NY standards, 22 m2. We’re a family of 4 (adult sons) and stayed all of us in one room. The beds are a bit small, but if you’re an average size person, it’s ok. Wouldn’t recommend this for tall or big persons. 
Bathroom ok and cleaning good. 
The location, in Hell’s Kitchen, 8th ave and 48 street , is great. Very close to Times Square and Broadway. We have stayed other times at Hilton Midtown and Sheraton Times Square. They are both good, but the rooms are too small for 4 people. So staying at the Belvedere was a good solution not to have to pay for  2 hotel rooms.

title: Belvedere
text: Localização excelente. Espaço físico do hotel ótimo.  Funcionários atenciosos. Ótimo espaço nos quartos. No seu entorno há uma variedade de restaurantes. Por ter uma localização privilegiada,pode-se conhecer inúmeros locais caminhando.

title: NIce Hotel close to many popular things
text:
We just stayed at the Belvedere over xmas. There is some construction scaffolding along the front, but we did not notice any work being done (meaning it did not interfere with our stay) very nice hotel. I think there has been mention in other posts about how slow the Elevators are. Yes, at times when it is busy, they are a bit slow. They are not huge, so only so many people can go up or down at a time. Did not bother us. The place is clean, rooms are decent sized, decor is a little art deco and a little updated.
We did not get a chance to try the breakfast, and although I wanted to try to get back in time for a happy hour glass of wine, that never seemed to work either. But I imagine they both are nice.
Staff was friendly, our flight arrived early, and by the time we made it to the hotel we were a few hours before check in time. But, our room was ready and we were able to check in early, which was great.
Location is great. Times Square, Theatres, Subway stops, shopping and restaurants are all within walking distance, yet you are just far enough away from all the noise and hustle and bustle that it is almost quiet as you walk down W 48th to the hotel. 
Our only complaint, and the reason I did not give 5 stars, the pillows on the bed. You have to fix the pillows. I have stayed in many hotels in lots of price ranges and I don't know how or why, but your pillows were not good. Maybe we have ruined it for ourselves, we have the Casper pillows at home, and have had them for about 6 months now (no I do not work for them) So if you do not get other complaints about the pillows, then it must be just us, and ignore my complaint.
Other than that, we enjoyed our stay and should we come back to New York for another visit I imagine we would book with you again.

title: Awesome place to stay close to Broadway
text: Just a few blocks from Broadway in the thick of things. Hotel allowed us to check in early which was great. Room was clean, roomy, and had a view of the city (14th floor). Express checkout, wifi, mini fridge, microwave, and sink. All of the amenities needed when exploring Broadway. Will definitely try to stay again if possible. Excellent location. ~12 blocks to Central park, 2 blocks to subway, so convenient. Note I ranked this as budget as I think $200/night next to Broadway is phenomenal. The hotel is NOT a budget hotel in quality, service, or amenities.

title: NY family trip
text: We truly enjoy the room and experience and was patient with elevator service and ran down stairs interacting with other clients but when my key to my card didn’t work David and Tamara were horrible I reserved everything in my husbands name and had to call him while he was in Times Square and the manager was like you are Lucky I give you a key after I ask her to check the cameras to see if her desk clerk was professional

title: Custo benefício
text: Devido sua proximidade as linhas do metrô, quartos confortáveis (2 camas de casal), limpeza diária e cordialidade no atendimento, não pode se esperar o luxo de algumas redes, mas sem duvida vale a pena!!!

title: A gem
text:
We stayed here for six nights and it was a wonderful property located between Broadway and Hell's kitchen. Easy walking distance to everywhere. The rooms are comfortable,  the service was great and wine and cheese int eh lobby made our stay . 
We srat here every time we visit New Tork and will return again.

title: Excellent location. Charming hotel.
text:
Check in & porter staff were helpful & efficient. We had a Deluxe Double Bed Executive room on 9th floor. Art Deco style hotel location cared on 48th between 8th & 9th. Lovely big room. Beautifully restored, super comfy beds, lovely linen & robes. Nothing too much trouble, asked & got china cups ( all hotels seem to only have takeaway coffee cups in the rooms these days). Needed extra blanket as don’t like the AC on all night, delivered within minutes. 
Lots of delicious eateries all around. Our favourite was the Food Emporium on cnr of 49th & 8th. Supermarket & huge variety of delicious takeaway food, new items each day. You select your own & pay via the weight so very cost effective too. Times Square is only 1 block away & a 10min walk up to Rockefeller tree area too. 15min walk to Central Park & the piers are on the Hudson River side, at the end of 48th, where all the cruise ships come in. Didn’t use the restaurant in the hotel but it seemed very popular. 
We were VERY impressed by The Belvedere & certainly would recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Price has gone up, amenities have gone down
text:
This has always been my go-to hotel in the city, but on our last trip, we booked the Superior room and were disappointed to learn the hotel no longer provides in-room coffee makers. We were told we could go down to the cafe from 7-10am for complimentary coffee, but we often stay out late and sleep in so weren't up in time every day. We also enjoy tea and coffee in the evening and had to find a starbucks that was still open and spend $10 there if we wanted coffee or tea. Even side of the road motels have coffee makers. We could not figure out why they would just get rid of them all together.
Our wifi also NEVER worked. Although we complained to the front desk a couple times and they tried re-booting the router, we could only get service if we went down to the lobby (the wifi seems to work better on lower floors, FYI). Because we were on a higher floor and had no wifi, our phones wouldn't work at all in the room, which was really inconvenient for everything.
The elevators were also consistently having issues while we were there (one just showed you were always on the 7th floor, no matter what floor you were on, and another took over five minutes to go down one floor).
We would have been okay with all of this if it wasn't for the daily $35 facility fee we were charged for services we didn't get or never used. Its for the wifi (didn't work), wine hour in the evening (don't drink), half price off breakfast (our breakfast was included in the price of the room) and the gym (didn't use). We essentially paid an extra $35 a day for nothing. On an already huge hotel bill.
The location is amazing if you like theatre, the rooms are large and clean and the beds are comfortable, but we were so disappointed in the hotel "amenities" and the charge for them, when we decided to extend our stay by a day, we went to a different hotel for our last night and enjoyed elevators that worked, an in-room coffee maker, wifi that worked, a free (hot) breakfast, and only a $5 facility fee.
We were so sad to think our once favorite place (we stayed there four times this year alone and this was the first time we had any of these issues) may now be somewhere we don't return to. 
Belvedere, if you are reading this, please consider reimbursing guests who don't or can't use the amenities the facility fee, and please bring back coffee makers in room for guests.

title: Carnegie Hall visit
text: Stayed here right after Thanksgiving as we were in town to see a family member sing at Carnegie Hall.  The staff was very courteous and the room was well appointed.  Hotel is conveniently located close to the 50th Street subway station and within easy walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Carnegie Hall as well as many other midtown attractions.

title: Well located hotel in New York
text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Belvedere Hotel in the first week of December. It is well located only a couple of blocks from the theatre district and Times Square. We had a continental breakfast included which was good (cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit, coffee/tea and juice). It has a happy hour from 5:00-6:00 each day but the wine was not very nice so we only went once.  It is an older hotel but the rooms were well appointed and nice and warm from the radiator running along the wall. There was also a bath with the shower. There were different pillows to choose from on the bed and the bed was comfortable. The wifi was also reliable. When the front desk person found out we were there for my 5oth birthday she tried to upgrade me but there was only an upgraded room on the 2nd floor so we kept our higher floor. Beware though that it does have a daily amenities fee of $34USD. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Facility Fee
text: Just tell us the price up front.  Pet peeve, I book a room at a hotel in Manhattan I have not been to because it beats the price of my go-to place by $50.  I get three and discover they are charging you a facility fee of $35.  See that pisses me off, Hotel Belvedere.  What facilities?  Wi-fi, gym, business center.  These are not unreasonable fees and it is still less than my go-to but you’ve lost me because I feel I have been lied to and cheated.  The Hotel is fine, location is fine, room is better than my go-to but you’ve lost me.

title: Sfortuna?
text:
Ho soggiornato qui per il mio viaggio di nozze, la posizione dell’hotel è perfetta perchè è davvero vicinissimo a time square per il resto non ho nient’altro di positivo da elencare, la camera più o meno, nel materasso c’era la buca in entrambi i posti quando mi sdraiavo dovevo togliere il guanciale altrimenti assumevo una posizione ad “u” per capirsi, pareti di carta pesta si sentono tutti i rumori del mondo, sia quelli che vengono di fuori quelli dei vicini e quelli del corridoio per fortuna avevo i tappi del viaggio!!!!la pulizia??? Si apparentemente sembra tutto lindo e perfetto, non vi dico lo sporco che c’era sotto al letto addirittura abbiamo trovato dei coni di plastica pieni di polvere chissà da quanto tempo erano lì, mi rammarico di averli trovati soltanto il giorno prima della partenza e di non avergli fatto la foto per caricarla qui. La colazione lasciamo proprio perdere carnetti maffin pane frutta cereali succhi caffè o te (4 stelle????????) boh..io ho girato molto per mia fortuna e secondo me per i soldi che chiedono nonostante New York non sia una città economica si può trovare molto di meglio, dipende sempre quello che uno chiede! 
Quindi alla fine dei conti che dire, io non lo consiglio ma come si dice:” provare per credere”

title: Nice stay in New York
text: Enjoyed our quick stay here to see a Broadway show.  Very close to the theatre district so able to walk everywhere.  Rooms are a good size-we had four traveling with us and was fine.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel Newyorkese a pochi passi da Time Square
text:
Hotel molto grande classico newyorkese, bella hall con personale sempre disponibile a dare consigli su servizio ed informazioni turistiche. 
La nostra camera al 16mo piano era la classica camera nello stile del posto, comoda e calda munita di confort extra, con una vetrata mozzafiato sui palazzi di New York.

La colazione è molto abbondante, non hanno il caffè espresso, nel complesso veramente buona.

La posizione è veramente super, a pochissimi passi da Time Square, e dalla metro come punto di partenza per vedere tutta NY.  Consigliatissimo per chi vuole un riferimento centrale in Manattan, con tutte le comodità (negozi, ristoranti, supermercati, metro, e punti di visita turistica).
Vicinissimo a Rockfeller center, chiesa st. Patrick, 5th avenue, central park, Moma, Radio City etc.

Prezzi all'altezza del luogo e del servizio.

Consigliatissimo.

title: Very happy with our 3-night stay!
text: I've heard all about how NY's hotel rooms are tiny.  I was worried about this but my husband and I had a king room and it was not tiny!  There was plenty of room on each side of the bed for bedside tables.  There was a decent amount of room to walk around the bed/TV stand, desk and window.  The bathroom wasn't right on top of the sleeping area which made it feel even bigger.  The bathroom was modern and a decent size.  Good water pressure in the shower.  The whole room was clean.  There was a separate area near the door with a coffee maker (Keurig with pods), microwave, a small refrigerator and sink.  Perfect!  The closet was a great size for two.  Mini safe in the closet.  We used the room service at 9:30pm one night to get dinner from the Italian restaurant next door.  It came quickly, was hot and had good food.  We did not use the hotel's breakfast deal.  We had a room on the 15th floor which gave a great view, but getting down the elevator was sometimes slow because of it.  And the elevator is tiny.  Our room was at the front of the hotel so faced the street.  Yes there was street noise but where in NY ISN'T there street noise?  I wore ear plugs and slept like a baby.  One complaint:  we needed to use the AC (it was warm while we were there 12/8-11) and it is loud.  Quite loud. But we didn't spend a ton of time there so it wasn't a huge deal.  Staying in the summer and having to use it all the time would be a different story.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, as was the concierge.  Room cleaners did a great job.  There are shops and restaurants right out the front door and the subway is within a block or two.  We would absolutely stay here again.

title: Christmas trip
text:
Stayed here for four nights.
Had a good stay.
Room ok.
Our room was at the front of the hotel.Quite noisy as we were near the Fire department.
Everything was good cleanliness of the room was good.
House keeping good.
Did not eat at the hotel.
Helpful at reception.
Enjoyed my stay.

title: Nice Stay in the Theatre District
text:
This hotel was on the list as providing special rates for participants in a seminar I recently attended, so I gave it a try. I was pleased. This is an old hotel, but the rooms were comfortable and updated. Plus, the big surprise was that I had a great view of the Manhattan skyline from my room #1526, and I didn’t even sign up for a room with a view! Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The location is convenient to Times Square and the Theatre District.

One negative is being charged an extra $30 per day for special services, such as the fitness center, Internet and getting the continental breakfast (no hot food) for $10 instead of $20. One good thing about the Internet, though, is that the wi-fi is secure, and I did like that.

title: Parade promises; our only disappointment!
text: The motel staff were very friendly but that is where the goodness ends. The room was dirty and had a terrible odor.  , no coffee maker in room. When one was provided it couldn't be used with the pods they left. No coffee packs available. The 30+ amenity fee was a joke. A glass of wine and a cookie is hardly an amenity especially if you don't drink. The complimentary breakfast was $9.99 per person ( also part of the "amenities.")  .

title: Good location but be wary of the hidden resort fee
text:
The hotel was fine though on check-in we were informed of a $30 resort fee per night's stay, I think other hotels would have offered better value.
The room was clean and we had a coffee machine in the room, I saw in some reviews that's not always the case. 
The airconditioning in the room (727) was very very noisy when coming on and going off).
The front of the building looks untidy and was covered by scaffolding, it seems this is common in NY.

title: Classic NYC Hotel in the Heart of Hells Kitchen
text:
GREAT find! This hotel felt more sturdy than most in NYC. There are several hotels in Hells Kitchen and near Times Square that feel like a pop-up feel as if they haven't been around for long. They can also sometimes feel cheaply made. This hotel felt like it has been around and maintained splendidly for years: aka why I call it like a classic Manhattan hotel. I lived in NYC for several years and this is probably one of my favorite hotels I have stayed in after moving out of NYC. 

Hells Kitchen is known for their food! So if you want to be close to the heart of the city and want to be within walking distance to some of the best food in the world, then Hell's Kitchen and the Belvedere Hotel are for you! It is close to the CE 50th Street stop on the "Blue" Train Line. 

Our room was very large, clean, spacious, and we had a great view of the avenue from our window. The service was prompt and friendly (proper efficient NYC service). There is breakfast for a fee and you can leave your bags (checked with a Bellhop) so you don't have to bring your bags with you throughout the day. 

Only bummer was the hotel fee: $35 per night (most hotels in NYC have this type of fee, I just don't like the idea of it)

Monday night price: Room, taxes, hotel fee $166.95

I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location!
text: Nice hotel very close to Times Square and the theater district. Very walkable location. Staff was wonderful our room had a fridge and microwave. Rooms were clean and plenty of room. Keep in mind you are in NYC and space is smaller than in other parts of the country. Keeping this in mind the room was spacious . Great price for the location. The Brazilian BBQ restaurant attached to the hotel was outstanding . I wouldn’t bother with the hotel breakfast, 9.99 for a couple of danish. There is a $30 resort fee for each day which is just a way to keep the rates looking cheap. So when you book consider the additional $30. Overall we were happy with this hotel and would stay again.

title: PRETTY LITTLE GEM
text: This older hotel has been nicely renovated inside.  The place itself is covered in scaffolding right now.  The desk staff were nice.  Unfortunately, it is NYC and the $30 Facility Fee is pretty steep for what it is supposed to cover.  We couldn't take advantage of the "free" happy hour due to the timing of our show.  This "discount on the breakfast....well for a bagel and a piece of fruit and coffee...$21.00 was a lot of money.  It was pouring so we elected to stay and eat at the hotel rather than walk to a diner.  I just think that a continental breakfast should be complimentary.  Especially after paying an additional Facility Fee.  As for our room, it was lovely...we received an upgrade, the view was nice and the bed was extremely comfortable.

title: Trato no igualitario
text: Hace un par de semanas estuve alojado con mi familia en este hotel, lo mejor que tiene es su ubicación. Me gustó mucho también la kitchenette que es algo que muy pocos hoteles en esa área ofrecen. Me permitió ahorrar mucho. Lo que no me gustó fue que no me dieron un trato igualitario, no se si fue porque reservé en línea, pero habían habitaciones contiguas a la mía mucho más bonitas. Adicionalmente, mi habitación no tenía calefacción, pedí que me subieran un calentador y lo que me dieron fueron más sábanas, las almohadas estaban muy altas y cuando bajé a pedir otras me dijeron NO HAY! Por la ubicación y por la kitchenette me volvería a quedar aquí, pero para los viajeros les recomiendo que no tomen la habitación 616 y que pidan que les expliquen la diferencia entre habitaciones y el precio.

title: Nice location
text: Close to the main spots, like Times Square and Broadway, rooms are clean and the fact of two double beds in the room were so comfortable..The staff was efficient. They received packages and the price was included in the resort fee of $30 dollars a day for the room. There was a nice wine happy hour at the hotel. I missed a coffee maker in the room and some appliances to use the microwave. I will return for sure. P.S : the windows were very dirty.

title: Great location, OK hotel, check the price carefully BEFORE booking.
text:
We booked this as part of an Expedia hotel / flight bundle based on reviews, price and location. The location IS good, you could see the lights of Broadway from our 11th floor room at the front, which was a spacious "twin" (each bed was a double..) and reasonably decorated. 48th St is quiet but close to everything including subway stations. The front is currently COVEED in ugly scaffolding, but the interior is still good. On checking in I was informed of the 30 dollars per day "facility charge" (immediately reduced to 20 as we had booked a while ago). 

The additional charges covers WiFi which didn't work in our room throughout our stay despite several complaints, a happy hour we were too late for, discount on a continental breakfast that was still as expensive as a cooked breakfast in nearby diners, gym, concierge services  and package reception (if you DON'T provide  this you aren't a hotel) local calls, business centre services and the usual tour / restaurant "discounts" that absolutely everyone provides. In other words, the room ACTUALLY costs $30 more than you expected. It was pointed out by reception that it was mentioned in the small print of my confirmation that I got AFTER I'd booked, and that it would have been even MORE if I'd gone to Las Vegas ..(??). 

It's an OK hotel, but when choosing it, check what you are comparing it with. I did so later and could certainly have chosen better for the eventual price.

title: great stay in NY
text: This is an older hotel, but it has been updated nicely. Our room was very comfortable.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great, very close to Broadway shows and Times Square.

title: So close to the Action!
text: I love staying here! The rooms are always immaculate, and it is so close to Times Square. It is very convenient. I thought that the parking fee was a little steep but it is still better than being towed and fined.

title: Extra charges are steep
text:
This is a great hotel, nicely positioned for Theatre and restaurants and I have stayed here in 5 occasions. 

I was less impressed this time to be stung with 30 dollars per day Of additional charges. 

The fee apparently covers WiFi, a happy hour, discount on breakfast, access to the onsite gym, concierge services, local calls and package reception, access to the business center and a tour / restaurant discount.

In my mind WiFi, gym, concierge and someone receiving a package for me are pretty standard hotel services. 30 bucks a day on top of the advertised room rate feels like a price gouge to me.

Happy to discuss.

title: Clean, Casual, Cofortable & Courteous
text: This is one of my favorite NYC hotels.  It's perfectly located.  It's the best of both worlds -- just minutes from the hustle & bustle of Times Square, yet removed enough for a peaceful stay.  Lots of great restaurants nearby on 9th & 10th Avenues -- just outside the crush of the tourist-packed 7th & 8th Avenues.  The staff (especially the front desk folks) are unfailingly courteous & helpful.  The rooms are tasteful, comfortable & clean.  Good value.  Good overall experience.

title: Só salva a localização
text:
Hotel fca a duas quadras da Times Square. É antigo, os quartos tem coisas bem antigas, o banheiro é ok. O carpete estava bem sujo e tinha traças, deixamos nossas coisas somente dentro da mala e colocavamos ela em pé. O quarto tinha um cheiro bem ruim. O café da manha acho que são 8 dolares por pessoa, e só tem pão. Tem chá, café, sucos, yogurte, pao, croissant mas nao tem frutas, ovos..
Não compensa para quem nao gosta de pao com manteiga, porque apesar de ter muita bebida de comida é bem fraquinho. Não recomendo esse hotel, tem outros na mesma região melhores!

title: Did you see FlashDance?!
text:
Well right across the street from the Performing Arts Center you'll see the Belvedere. This quaint boutique hotel was just what I had hoped it would be for a quick visit to the city.
Located between times Square and Hell's Kitchen (don't worry it's tame and cool) is this little gem.
Though check in was at 4 I arrived about 2.  Figured I'd leave my bag with the bellman and walk around for a bit.  Turns out Ricky was at the front desk and he volunteered to see if there was a room available.  So long as I would accept a room with two beds instead of one king he said he could register me right then. We joked that I'd only be there one night and all I really needed was one bed, so up I went.  Turns out 1221 was an upgrade from the room I booked - no extra charge, nice view.
The room was clean and neat.  ABSOLUTELY THE BEST SHOWER I'VE HAD IN ANY HOTEL EVER!
Given the convenient location I walked to a great deli 48 on 48th, grabbed a bite and returned to the room in time to get a little work done before heading out to meet my friend Sean and seeing David Whyte at the Landmark Center uptown.
By the way, the room service ladies (aka chamber maids) were friendly and efficient as well.
Thanks to them, Ricki and Alina for all your help.
This place is a good value keeper.

title: Gem of a Hotel
text:
After reading several reviews we decided to go ahead and give The Belvedere a try. This place does not disappoint! The Art Deco character throughout was incredibly spot on.
We are originally from Long Island and Brooklyn and neither myself or my husband have been back to NY  from Tampa in years. We arrived early and our room wasn’t ready; however, bell services happily stored our luggage. At the front desk, we asked for food recommendations and the front desk rep ( I think his name was Mike) was super knowledgeable on multiple options. After a few hours of playing tourist, we decided to check back with the hotel and to our surprise our room was ready. We had a deluxe king and this room was fantastic! A wet bar, fridge, microwave greeted us when we entered the room. The space was large with plenty of USB ports all over. A bench, desk, spacious closet, full size bathroom, and robes! Bell services brought our luggage to us within a matter of minutes (I don’t remember the gentleman’s name) but he took the time to point out all of the amenities in the room (this also includes a hair dryer, safe, iron) and was super welcoming. There is plenty of drawer space too. There’s a complimentary happy hour with wine every evening from 5-6pm. This is where we met Jacob, a member of the hospitality team. Jacob is such a nice person and always greeted us with a pleasant disposition. 
The hotel does offer a discounted continental breakfast in their lounge (we chose not to do this), we found a gem around the corner (Times Square Diner). The hotel also offers a discount for the adjacent Brazilian restaurant. 
The location is perfect...we walked through Columbus Circle into Central Park and down through Herald Square. There’s plenty of restaurants, as this is in the theater district and Hell’s Kitchen.
We saw a sign by concierge regarding airport transportation. Ashley at the concierge desk assisted us with transportation (there is a very reasonable fee) for our return to JFK, and the team at the Belvedere helped us with a smooth return experience.
We are planning another trip in the spring and can’t wait to book another stay at The Belvedere.

title: Just what we needed
text: I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay at the Belvedere Hotel this past Sunday after reading not so favorable reviews. Those reviews could not be further from the truth.  I was there to see Lion King at 1pm on Sunday. We took an early train into NYC and went straight to the hotel to check in, knowing our room would not be ready, but they could hold our bags. The attendant at the front desk was very nice and we even got an upgrade from Executive King to a Superior Executive King which was a corner room on the 11th floor.  After the play we came back, our room was ready and we were not disappointed.  Again, the staff was so very nice. When we checked a nice gentleman brought up our bags shortly afterwards and showed us a few things.  The daily wine Happy Hour was a nice treat where they serve 3 different types of wine (blush, white, or red) and cheese.  It was nice to just sit and relax for a bit before we headed out to dinner.  Check out was again seemless and everyone was very nice.  I recommend the Belvedere and I am 100% positive when I come back to NYC for an evening, I will be staying here.  Just a few steps off of Broadway, so definitely a great location.

title: Nice hotel near Times Square
text: Stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference nearby and doing touristy things. Check in was efficient, staff was polite. Rooms are decent size for NYC and clean and comfortable. Mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker in room. Never had to wait too long for an elevator. Free WiFi. Reasonable rates. Near many restaurants, subway, and Times Square. Good experience and would stay here again. $40 Uber ride to LaGuardia.

title: Great location. AWFUL customer service.
text: We loved the location. The hotel is fine. But the first night we saw bugs in the bathroom. And I mean bugs crawling all over the ceiling in the bathroom. They were everywhere. We notified the front desk and they moved us to a smaller room. We had paid for a larger size room since there were 3 of us. When we went to talk to the night manager, her could not have been ruder. He denied that the hotel had bugs and insisted that the room was the same size. He made no apology, and eventually said that "sometimes, some hotels have bugs." He offered nothing to us and accused us of lying about the bugs (even when we had photos of them clearly all over the bathroom). Because it was after 11:00pm, we accepted the smaller room and just moved to it.
