The day manager 2 days later was super nice, but I would definitely never stay here again based on the awful customer service we received from the night manager. That, and the bugs....

title: Excellente expérience
text:
Nous avons séjourné 10 jours dans cet endroit magnifique et luxueux en plein coeur de Manhattan. Nous avions une chambre pour 3 avec une kitchenette.
Nous avons trouvé le personnel à la réception accueillant et chaleureux. Ils ont pris le temps de répondre à nos questions et de nous apporter de l’aide quand nous en avons eu besoin (explications pour un itinéraire, mise au frais d’un traitement médical en fin de séjour...)
Le ménage était fait chaque jour, la chambre était propre avec une vue superbe sur les toits et les immeubles (depuis le 11eme étage). La literie de qualité et très confortable.
Nous avions pris le petit déjeuner, le personnel en salle était attentionné et souriant. Le buffet varié et de qualité.
La Wifi incluse dans le prix de la chambre est performant, le petit verre de vin en fin de journée très agréable.
Nous gardons un magnifique souvenir de notre séjour et nous ne manquerons pas de revenir si nous en avons de nouveau l’occasion.
Merci d’avoir contribué au bon déroulement de nos vacances!  😉

title: The good & the bad
text:
Stayed this past weekend at The Belvedere. 
Great location, close to everything. Made online reservations, rates were comparable. Room size was adequate. Check in was a low point. Asked about special that they were offering online of including continental breakfast, that was not offered when I made my reservation, they could NOT do it! Oh well, opinion drops over a simple continental breakfast offer that they couldn’t possibly do because it HAD to be online and I was there in person.  Given a room by elevator, make sure u ask for one away!
Continental breakfast is NOT worth it, tons of better coffee shops in area. Wine hour? Not worth the resort fee. Overall rate, just ok!
Will I return? Not sure, will check out other options!

title: Super locatie
text: Zojuist een kleine week verbleven in dit hotel tijdens bij citytrip met een vriendin. We hadden zonder ontbijt geboekt, bij aankomst had het hotel het ontbijt aangeboden en ons een kamer gegeven met twee aparte bedden in plaats van kingsize bed waar we tijdens het boeken eerst extra voor moesten betalen. uiteindelijk hebben wij dit dus gratis gekregen. Een fijne aankomst, de kamer was ruim en schoon. De kamer had een klein keuken gedeelte, met een lege minibar. Een kleine maar fijne badkamer met een douche en bad. Echter na het douchen werd dit wel heel glad en het water stroomt tijdens het douchen niet goed weg. Voor de rest lagen de bedden heerlijk en heb je in de kamer geen last van de geluiden buiten. Wel hoor je de geluiden van de gang goed, ik heb hier zelf geen last van gehad. Personeel is vriendelijk en probeert je altijd te helpen. Ik kan dit hotel zeker aanbevelen aan anderen ! In het donker zie je aan het einde van de straat de lichten al van Times Square, metro en eetgelegenheden zijn allemaal op loopafstand. Al met al een topverblijf gehad hier! 👍🏼

title: Amazing Manager
text: The service was so so so amazing. Everyone at the help desk was so helpful. The manager Tamara worked quickly to help us extend our stay and was very accommodating. 10/10 overall the service was great!

title: Good Price ,good location.
text: Rooms are comfortable , and not too outdated. The carpets could do with a refresh , and the aircons can get a little noisy. The Locations is ideal- close to broadway theatres ,  Times Square is a block away and Central Park is also a short jog up the road. Wifi and a glass of wine are included in the hefty mandatory service fee ( $30 per night) , but morning coffee is complementary.  Front Desk staff aren’t the friendliest , and minor requests come across as interruptions to their work. It gets worse with management , who can get quiet defensive. This certainly detracts from an otherwise good Experience.

title: Near Theatre Shows
text: Fabulous location, close to Times Square and Theatre District.  We walked to local restaurants, subway line #1 around the corner.  We enjoyed the happy hour on a few of the days, and the fridge/micro were very handy.  Dishes are not supplied but they did bring us mugs and paper plates when requested. It was a decent property and we would stay again.

title: Marathon Weekend
text:
Over 50 of us stayed as part of a group of runners.
Some of us had a suite with additional amenities such as coffee maker fridge and microwave. A small number had standard rooms with no drink making making facilities and had to haggle with the reception staff.
Standard of cleanliness was very good but unsure about bar and restaurant opening times.
Helpful friendly staff in general. Not much to speak of in terms of views but peace & quiet at the rear rooms. Location is a 5-10 min walk from Time Square and easy to walk to.
Check your credit card holding details because some of our group returned home to find they had been charged the service fee which had been waivered by the tour company??
Recommend?: Yes but shop around
Return?: Yes but 2nd option

title: Poor customer service
text:
I visited this hotel for the New York Marathon as part of a group. We paid a high rate per night for this hotel being as it was the weekend of the New York Marathon which we were taking part in. The group had varying facilities in the room  despite us all paying the same price and when I asked at reception for something to make a hot drink with I was told flatly that the room did not come with this facility. I pointed out that we were leaving early for the purpose of running the marathon and asked if we could just have something that we could boil some water with and was reminded that wasn’t possible. I spoke with the manager who was very rude in front of another guest at the hotel and when I eventually got my point across that we were leaving early and just wanted boiling water or something to make a hot drink he told one of the staff to go and find an old coffee machine for us. We got the coffee machine bought up to us which were had no idea how to use and was not shown how to. We left that morning for the marathon without a hot drink as it was clearly to much effort for the staff to assist us with. 
No bar facilities at the hotel at all either and on one occasion we asked one of the staff the location of a specific local Italian restaurant that was in close proximity and was given completely the wrong directions . The customer service really needs looking at .

title: A very unpleasant experience
text: The airconditioning was very load and the wifi inside the room is very poor. The staff are very arrogant. They seemed to forget that they are in the service industry and is supposed to make their guests happy. Apparently their culture is different.

title: CONFORTABLE ET BIEN SITUE
text:
Nous étions en famille pour une semaine à New York. Nous avons apprécié cet hôtel pour la propreté et le confort des chambres. Nous avions deux chambres pour 6 personnes. Le personnel de ménage était très professionnel et sympathique.
Merci pour ce petit verre de vin offert chaque soir vers 18h aux clients de l'hôtel. 
Un seul petit regret c'est au niveau du personnel de l'accueil. Nous avons trouvé qu'ils manquaient de chaleur, on a eu un minimum d'explications sur nos questions et à chaque entrée et sortie de l'hôtel on était transparent donc nous avons cessé de dire bonjour au bout de deux jours.
Si nous devons revenir nous reviendrons dans cet hôtel.

title: Anniversary Trip October 2019
text: We just returned from spending 5 nights at the Belvedere NYC. Our room was on the 17th Floor, King Executive. We were in town celebrating our anniversary and just love this hotel. It really checks all the boxes for us! This was our 2nd stay, and the hotel is right in the middle of everything with easy subway access. Somehow, our room was so quiet and we never heard anyone else. Love that we had the refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. We saved money but eating breakfast in the room and it was also nice to be able to store leftovers. The staff was wonderful and friendly. We will be back! Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Lovely hotel, close to Times Square
text:
This hotel was perfectly situated within two block of Times Square. It is within blocks of the theatre district, too. So close to   
shops, bars, restaurants and subways. The hotel is older with smaller rooms than we are used to. But no space is wasted in New York. Very clean! It was quiet even though there was an influx of people for the New York Marathon. The staff was absolutely great! Friendly and very patient! The breakfast in the morning is continental and $12.00. If you want a really good breakfast, go next-door to Patzeria! If we return to New York, we will stay at the Belvedere.

title: Good location
text:
Spent the night at the hotel. Check in was fast and staff friendly. Stayed on the 14th floor. Bad location across from the elevators, got noisy late at night and in the morning. 
The room was large but the bathroom was small.

title: Stunning, comfortable
text: Stayed on 14th floor, corner room for one week, amazingly comfortable and spacious room. Good views from 2 sides. Asked for a kettle and it was delivered. Tea in room from then on. Wine hour from 5-6 free and a great way to start conversation with other holidaymakers. Ideally situated for time square, Central Park and Broadway. Definitely would stay again. Art Deco feel lovely decoration

title: Nice but Expensive and not very cheery staff
text:
Spent 5 nights at the Belvedere and really enjoyed the stay overall. It was clean and tidy but there were a few niggles. There are only 2 lifts which means it can take a while getting up to your room and down. The hallways are very hot as they don’t seem to have any ventilation or windows. The rooms too are very warm, we had to keep the air con running 24/7. The week we came was very expensive, at over £320 a night (bad luck on my part due to NY marathon being run at the end of the week). If you got the room for £150 I’d say that’d be the upper end of what’s its worth. For 320 I’d expect a lot more but as I say it was just bad luck. Also, be aware or taxes and ‘facility fees’, these are not included in you’re original quote and are added at the end, adding another $130 to the stay. 
The staff seem a little bit moody and aren’t the cheeriest rays of sunshine. But I have have some sympathy for them as dealing with the public is hell, but then again they did choose to work here. 
Location wise the hotel is awesome. Very close to Times Square, the Rockefeller centre and the USS Intrepid. There’s a great place for breakfast a 5 min walk away called the Westway diner, and the Italian next door (Patzeria) was very nice.

title: New York City in 2 days
text:
I booked this hotel through Priceline, what a nightmare. I attempted to check in,only to discover the money I paid Priceline had not been paid to the hotel. It took an hour and 4 phone calls to get it figured out. The men at the front desk were Wonderful! They upgraded my room for no charge!!
My room was in the 15 th floor and was 
Beautiful!! I will definitely stay again.

title: Regular
text:
É inquestionável que o hotel tem excelente localização, próximo ao burburinho da Times Square, mas não tão próximo, o que mantém a paz dos hóspedes.
Quarto espaçoso, cama grande, confortável, chuveiro bom, ferro de passar roupa e robe no quarto. 
O café da manhã é pago a parte e nada muito atraente, então não fizemos nenhuma refeição lá. 
No dia em que chegamos o banheiro não cheirava bem, o que me deixou mal impressionada com relação a higienização.
Agora o grade ponto negativo, que nos incomodou durante toda a estadia é que o Wi-Fi é PÉSSIMO!!! 
Com certeza foi o hotel com pior Wi-Fi que já me hospedei.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
We got engaged 3 years ago while visiting and staying here and now we’ve came back for our wedding and it was perfect! From the reception staff to the door staff to maintenance staff we met in lifts everyone was so friendly and helpful.
The hotel is not modern by any means but it has charm and that makes it more comfortable. Our entire wedding party stayed here on our recommendation and we haven’t heard a bad word said. Everyone puts on these reviews about the lifts but it actually becomes a lovely ‘inside joke’ about the elevators just taking their time. We’re never in a rush anyway! Perfect location. Walking distance to just about everything. Will definitely return.

title: Very Wobbly 3 Star Rating
text:
I recently stayed overnight at The Belvedere Hotel in New York City.  On both occasions we had a non-functioning bathroom.

On the first occasion brown sludge shot out of the shower.  Thankfully I had not yet stepped into the shower.  The hotel did send up a maid service to clean up the bathroom.  After that, I wasn’t sure I wanted a shower.

Even more recently, my second overnight stay at The Belvedere Hotel proved stressful as the toilet would not flush.  At that point we were relaxing in bed after a very long day.  In the morning the desk manager offered to remove the hotel’s pretty much outrageous “facility fee” of $30.  (And my particular room rate was quite high.)

I have never written a negative review, but this one is deserved.

title: Terrible Experience
text: We stayed at the Belvedere for a single night. The hotel, which may once have been nice, has gone to seed. It is dirty and dingy. But if that were all, I wouldn’t be writing a review. My wife wanted to take a bath so tried to run the water. The spigot wouldn’t turn for her so I did it. Evidently the knob hadn’t been used for some time and was rusted in place. Filthy, dark brown water with clumps began pouring out. It smelled. We couldn’t get the tap to turn off and we were afraid the tub would flood so we called the front desk. They responded that a maintenance person would come to our room within 30 minutes! We explained that by then the bathroom would be full of the filthy water. Realizing no help was coming I tried again and was finally able to force the tap shut. The tub remained full of thick, brown water. Approximately 45 minutes later there was knock on our door. It wasn’t a maintenance person, however, but a maid. By that time the water had mostly drained  - she offered to clean the tub ( which was disgusting). I took pictures and showed personnel at the front desk. They took no action whatsoever.

title: Hesitant to book but was delighted with the location and quality of the hotel
text: The hotel is rated 3.5-4 stars.  Some bad reviews but none of that. ..... We were on the 2nd floor and worried the street noise would be loud, but the AC/Heating system kept us from hearing anything - like white noise.  The Belvedere is in such a great location.  The executive double room was clean and stylish - 4 can share this room - we did.  A short walk to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Tours.  We Ubered to the High Line and Chelsea Market.  So glad we stayed here.

title: מלון טוב במיקום מרכזי
text:
שהינו במלון זה 5 לילות באמצע אוקטובר.
המלון ממוקם בשדרה ה8 רחוב 48, מיקום מרכזי ביותר, כ5 דק הליכה מהטיימס סקוור ו10 דק הליכה לסנטרל פארק.
כשהגענו ראינו פיגומים מסביב למלון, לא יודע אם ישנו שיפוץ או שסתם נשארו.
החדר שקיבלנו בלילה הראשון היה בקומה ה8 ופונה לכביש, והיה רועש בצורה בלתי נסבלת מהרחוב וכל הרכבים והמשאיות שפרקו בו סחורה וצפצפו. ביקשנו לעבור חדר ואכן העבירו אותנו לקומה 17 לצד השני של הבנין, והיה הרבה יותר טוב. החדרים מרווחים, נקיים וחדר האמבט גם הוא נקי. המיטה גדולה ונוחה.
ישנה ארוחת בוקר קונטיננטלית בתוספת תשלום למי שרוצה אך העדפנו לאכול בחוץ בכל פעם במקום אחר, ולא חסר.

לסיכום, מלון מומלץ במיקום טוב מאוד

title: Good stay but wrong credit card reservation.
text: The stay was nice, good location. But when checking out the hotel reserved 300 dollars again for no reason by mistake. I emailed more than 10 times but sometimes i get no reply and sometimes they do but they are not solving this. My credit card company will help me but it will take a few weeks. So i am very dissapointed that the hotel is still not solving this.

title: Disgusting- defecation on bed sheets
text:
I wish I could give this zero stars. This was the worst travel experience of my life and I am a very frequent traveler. When I finally got my room, the bathroom stunk of mold, the towels were filthy with makeup and when I finally went to go to bed I pulled up the comforter and there was a pile of poop sitting on the bed. It was the most disgusting thing I have ever seen. The maid and management clearly didn't clean the room.
I was given a new room, but the management barely seemed to care and didn't take this as seriously as they should have. 
DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

title: Still the best value near Times Square and Broadway
text: Love the place.  Convenient, great people, nice rooms, and decent value.  Have been staying for about 15 years.  The only area where they need to improve is the consistency in housekeeping.  Hope to be back next year.

title: Great location!
text: We were in New York for four nights before a cruise and wanted someplace central to make the most of our time there. We hit the jackpot! We could walk to the Times Square area, to cozy neighborhood restaurants on 9th Ave., or to the subway for most anyplace else. With breakfast available onsite, and free wine between 5:00 and 6:00, we had a great stay.

title: Good, not exclent
text:
The hotel is in a good location. Near 8th Ave and two blocks from Times Square. 

The front desk staff is really helpful and fast. Check in took maybe two minutes. 

Belvedere is not new but it's in good conditions. My room was with twin bed. Space is good, bed are good, bath is good. 

The window was facing 48th Street so it can get a little noisy sometimes. Not so bad. The air conditioner is much worse making more noise than a jet engine.

The hotel has this offer of a "continental" breakfast for $9.99. Don't take it. No sausage, no eggs, no fresh juices. Only apple, banana and bread to eat. Some industrial juices. Cappuccino had the taste of and old sock.

title: Nice hotel, nice location
text:
We stayed at the Belvedere October 2019.  The location is excellent.  Near Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. Within walking distance to Broadway and 5th Ave.
The staff at the Belvedere are very professional, helpful and extremely nice.  For our family, we reserved (2) rooms, 1 King and 1 (2)-bed Queen.  Both rooms were amazing.  Larger than I thought they would be for NYC. I was a little bummed about the $30/night "resort" fee especially with what we paid for the room.  However,  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: OK Hotel
text: Not a particularly inexpensive hotel, but should be. The pillows are dreadful - they're fine if you like hard foam. Rooms are simple and clean, but a bit tired. There was no coffee set-up in the room, but when I called to ask about it, I was told, "we'll see if we can find a spare." Ultimately they "found" us one. It was a bit irritating that one out of the two elevators was usually "out-of-order" which usually made it difficult to get a ride downstairs in a timely manner. On the up-side - it was centrally located to midtown activities and the subway.

title: Cozy in Midtown?  YES!
text: I've stayed in over a dozen hotels in Midtown over the years, and this one is my new favorite.  If you're like me and you don't want to stay right in Times Square, this is a good bet.  I was looking for a place near Lincoln Center, and the Belvedere was about the same price as most of the others in the area and just a short walk away from the ballet.  I was able to get a double-double, not offered in some of the other hotels.  The room was very comfortable and clean and the people were so incredibly friendly - from the front desk, to the bag checker, to the front doorman.  The only problem (nothing that anyone can really solve) was that the street noise was a bit loud during the night with cars blasting music, people on the street, and sirens.  We were on the sixth floor, so maybe it's less disturbing on the higher levels.

title: Nice hotel in NYC
text:
Had a few nights to kill in NYC after backpacking 2 weeks in Europe and we booked this hotel last minute. It’s a great location and very nice. I enjoyed the professional and friendly staff, as well as the laundry room downstairs. 
I couldn’t imagine a much better location, fairly close to everything we wanted to do in Manhattan. It’s impossible to be close to EVERYTHING, and this was about as good as it gets. 
Very nice beds and bathroom. My only complaint was the $30/night “resort” fee. I already paid quite a bit in fees when I booked, but whatever. We went down to do breakfast, but for $10/person, we were a little underwhelmed. But there are lots of good places to get breakfast very near.

title: Superb location, great service, top hotel
text:
We were very grateful to the team at the Belvedere who responded quickly to our email queries regarding our booking which had been made through Thomas Cook before their demise.  Their responses were quick, helpful and even apologetic because we had to pay again for our booking and claim back through ATOL. 

Our room was on the 12th floor, not much of a view unfortunately, but it was quick and easy to reach apart from at 1700 when the fabulous 'wine hour' starts in the lobby!  Free red, white or rose wine for all guests for one hour.  Great way to get guests together and was very popular. 

Our room was big and comfortable, air conditioning was effective as it was very warm despite being the end of September, but it was a tad noisy so we couldn't use it during the night. 

The hotel's location is superb - a few minutes and you have access to all the amazing restaurants and bars in the Hell's Kitchen area.  5 minutes walk in the other direction and we were in Times Square. 

The hotel doesn't have a bar, but there is a restaurant attached to it which has a super, well stocked and friendly bar.  

Breakfast is available in the hotel Café (we didn't bother as there is so much choice outside the hotel, but t was good to know it could be relied on if we needed) 

The helpful door guys arranged a car for a fixed fee of $65 to JFK on our departure. 

The hotel exterior is very pretty too, but unfortunately whilst we were there, it was covered in scaffolding - but we will definitely be back and can't wait to see it in its true glory!

title: My New Home Away From Home
text: This is such a top notch hotel, I loved every thing about it - from Frank at the Front Desk when I checked in to the friendly helpful doorman at the front, also the free happy hour in the lobby - big plus. The deco of the hotel rooms and lobby, very pleasing to the eye. The room I had was very clean and was kept that way by friendly, helpful staff. The Lobby brought to my mind memories of watching movies about grand hotels, the neighborhood around this hotel was so convenient, everything you would need is just two blocks way - delis, restaurants, bakery’s, convenient stores, CENTRAL PARK ! This is the Only hotel I will ever stay for my trips to New York.

title: Location Location Location
text: Friendly helpful staff,  many great near by restaurants,  clean Comfortable rooms.  Wine and cheese every evening from 5 to 6, nice wind down after a busy day.  Close to many theaters and Time Square and shopping.

title: Location, location.
text:
My wife's sister has visited this hotel on a few occasions and keeps coming back, so we gave it a go and were not disappointed. As with lots of NYC hotels this one charges $34 per room per night 'resort fee', but each night the friendly staff serve free wine to residents and that eases the pain. The location is brilliant in our opinion with subway (train) stations very close by, Broadway theatres close by, convenience stores 50m away on 8th Ave and cheaper ones on 9th Ave along with cheaper restaurants. The hotel was very clean, our room was made up nicely every day and had everything we required for a comfortable stay. This hotel is in a quieter area compared to noisy Times Square.
I would go back.

title: Fantastic!
text: My wife, her Godmother’s granddaughters and I stayed in two rooms at the Belvedere Hotel on the 27th and 28th of September; and we were very happy with the facilities and the staff. Everything from the valet parking, to the turn down service at night was excellent. The rooms were very nice, well appointed, and very modern. I do not know if the had been recently renovated; but they appeared very new. The location of the hotel is very central to Times Square, the Theatre District, and only a 15 to 20 minute walk to The Empire State Building. Rockefeller Center is about 10 to 15 minutes away. This is certainly a hotel we will be come back to!

title: Staff are incompetent
text: I had a holiday of a lifetime booked with these and on hearing Thomas cook had gone into adminstration I freaked that I had lost my holiday. Twice I was informed by this hotel, once via email and once via phonecall that all was well. After feeling relied and continuing with other things an hr later I got an email asking for £1800plus or my booking would be cancelled. No discount due to the situation but the most upsetting things was the incompetence of staff. Telling me all was fine. I'm on glad they informed me 5dys before I was due to fly rather than when I arrived at hotel. As a result and principle I've booked with another cheaper hotel who have better reviews. I will never even consider this hotel again. Shockingly bad customer service.

title: Viaggio di nozze
text: Posizione strategica e centrale, personale della reception poco disponibile a farsi capire dai turisti, tant'è vero che non ci avevano detto dei 90€ di tasse dopo i 4 giorni di soggiorno. Wi-Fi nella norma e gratis, camera abbastanza grande, bagno capiente e pulito. Dalle 17 alle 18 possibilità di prendere vino e pezzetti di formaggio per un brek. Lo consiglio per la posizione, noi eravamo al 17 piano, bella vista!

title: Great value - Times Sq
text:
We stayed for 1 night, the hotel in in a walking distance from the subway and the Times Sq. 
The room looks a bit old, and elevators are slow however it was still fine for us. 
The room was spacious, clean, and quiet strong wifi, big bathroom and comfortable bad.
Staff members are superb. 
If all you need is a place to sleep in a perfect location it is the right place for you, not fancy not expensive, great value! 
We will come back.

title: The Hellvedere
text:
The good: Friendly and helpful staff 
The bad: Old and very tired room,
Uncomfortable bed and pillow, leaking faucet, very noisy air conditioning unit. I had to sleep with earplugs.
And for the pleasure; we paid nearly US$500 per night. 
Probably the most we have ever spent on a hotel and the worst standard. We purposely spent more on a hotel to get a good standard but obviously chose poorly. 
So disappointing for our 1st trip to NY.
This might have been a good hotel once. Now it's a tired old has-been

title: Girl’s theater weekend
text: My friend and I booked a last minute room. We enjoyed this tucked away gem within easy walking distance of our shows. The rooms are clean and modern. The bathroom is spacious and it has a small refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. In-room small safe. Reasonable price. We’ll be back!

title: Great place!
text: Great last minute hotel A last minute trip ended wit me staying at a great hotel. Rooms were clean and cozy. I have to admit not a great view but i was just looking for a place to rest and this was THE place!

title: Amazing
text: Great stay at the Belvedere. Me and my partner loved the location. The rooms on the upper floors are newly renovated and offer a beautiful view of the city. Breakfast could be better. Staff is very helpful and welcoming

title: Last time staying here.
text:
This was our second time staying here and both times were booked thru a third party. First time was great with no hidden fees. This time they upgraded us for “free” and we confirmed with the front desk at check-in that our facility fees were covered. However when check-out came they gave us a bill for the daily facility fee anyway. 

My advice if staying here is get everything in writing. If they say they waived the fee, get them to write it down, sign it and date it.

title: Hospedagem perfeita em NYC
text:
A localização do hotel é incrível. Perto da Times Square, a 1 quarteirão e meio. Lojas de conveniência e mercados ao redor, além de uma estação de metro. A rua ao lado, aos domingos, é fechada para funcionar um tipo de feira livre, incrível!
O quarto é grande, ficamos em 4 pessoas juntas e foi ótimo! A acústica era boa, não ouvia quase nada, exceto quando os hóspedes exageravam demais (ficamos num andar que havia muitas famílias com crianças pequenas), mas esse não é um fator que me incomodava.
A limpeza deixou um pouco a desejar, vi que as camareiras só fazem um geral rápido, não arrastam móveis (tudo bem não arrastar todo dia, mas uma vez que caiu uma caneta atrás do criado e encontrei pipoca). Mas as instalações são ótimas. Cama grande, banheiro sempre bem equipado, internet e televisão. Muito bom!
A equipe é incrível e muito eficiente! Logo na hora do check-in, minha mãe ficou com vontade de ir ao banheiro, que para entrar é preciso ter o cartão do quarto, e o concierge entendeu o que ela disse e logo ofereceu o cartão. Além disso, enviei compras para o hotel que se perderam e os funcionários além de me ajudarem a entender o que aconteceu, orientaram para onde deveria ligar e o que falar.
Por fim, como manhattan é longe do aeroporto (JFK), alugamos um carro na chegada porque os translados para nossa família (de 6 pessoas) era caríssimo. O hotel mesmo providenciou uma van por um preço baratíssimo para nós e guardou nossas malas depois do check-out durante um período de meio dia até o horário que a van nos buscaria.
Só uma ressalva para o elevador, que apesar de serem dois, parecia não ser o suficiente para a quantidade de hóspedes. Chegávamos a esperar 15min por um vazio, e ficamos em um andar mais alto.

title: Centrico y correcto
text: Un sitio con una ubicación fantástica el trato es correcto y la hora del vino por la tarde es genial. Esta todo limpio y tiene desayunos bastante buenos. Un poco caro si solo pensamos en trestaciones pero por la ubicación vale la pena

title: Room nice, but still downsides
text: Our room was very nice and we were happy with the cleanliness. However, there were things we weren’t happy with. The air conditioning was very loud and so we couldn’t sleep with it on. There is a facility fee of $34 per night for stuff we mostly didn’t want to use. The WiFi is included in this fee which wouldn’t even reach our room and so was useless. This meant we didn’t use any of the stuff that we had to  pay for. We had a bath in the room one night which we tried to use however the water came out a brown colour. Also we weren’t told that when u give your card details to check in, they take $300 out of your account as a security deposit, which is okay as it’s a deposit but wished they’d have told us at the time as it was a surprise to see my account down by $300 for an unknown reason. Overall, with the rooms being nice and clean, it wasn’t amazing but it wasn’t terrible either.

title: Situación perfecta
text: Muy bien situado. Habitaciones ampluas y comodas con un pequeño armario de cocina, nevera y microondas que se agradece para los dias de cansancio poder calentar algo de cena. Armarii muy amplio para la ropa.

title: Wonderful!
text: Yes- it is an older hotel but to us that was part of its charm. The AC was noisy but again it is a older hotel.  The room was spacious and very clean. Perfect location for seeing the sights.  The staff was extremely efficient and friendly.  Frank at the front desk was so helpful! We will definitely return!

title: Great location and stay
text:
The Belvedere Hotel is in a great location. Central Park and Times Square are within walking distance. The hotel is very clean and rooms (we stayed in a superior double) was very nice and spacious. As with other reviews there is a hotel fee of $38.40. This fee does include a wine social from 5-6 - very nice. Would definitely book here again.
On a side note on 49th St there is a bakery - Donna Belle Bake Shop- highly recommend stopping in here for a treat. We had a breakfast biscuit and a scone.

title: Good location and friendly staff
text:
We turned up and were greeted by friendly front of house staff. The bellmen were very helpful and professional and the rooms were clean and well presented. Because of its location in a built up area amongst other tall buildings means the views aren't incredible as far as NYC goes, but pretty decent in the 16th floor room that we received after requesting a room with a view. Breakfast was decent enough considering it was free as part of our package. Honestly though, if we had to pay $20 each then I'd definitely have sought somewhere out in the city for breakfast each morning.
The hotel doesn't have a pool or its own bar, which is the only real let-down in my opinion.
The location is fine. Far enough from times Square to be quiet, but close enough to be accessible by a 5 min walk. Also there are numerous subway stations near by so getting around the city is easy.
We would highly recommend going on a sightseeing tour and getting an attraction pass. If you use "city sightseeing/grayline tours" thier office is literally a 1 min walk from the hotel so super convenient. 
All-in-all a lovely hotel. Clean and pleasant with helpful friendly staff and decent Aircon which is an absolute must in summertime in NYC.
Would be happy to stay there again.

title: Muy bueno
text:
Estuvimos alojados en el hotel por diez días. La parte de la reserva salió todo como estaba previsto sin contratiempos ni sorpresas. Las instalaciones estan bien,las habitaciones son amplias, las camas confortables y el equipamiento de las mismas resultaron satisfactorias. Todo funcionó sin inconvenientes. El hotel está muy bien ubicado, a un par de cuadras del Time Square, del Central Park ,de la costa del río Hudson y del Metro. Una combinación no menos importante es la de la kichinette   de la habitación del hotel con los supermercados en la zona.
Y como final del comentario deseo destacar al personal del hotel,quienes siempre nos ayudaron y trataron amablemente a pesar de la dificultad con el idioma.Nombro algunos que recuerdo: Alina; Ricki; David; Juanita; Eneida.
Sin dudas me alojaria nuevamente en el hotel

title: Hotel Belvedere: ottima posizione ma qualche sorpresa
text:
La sorpresa più grande la si scopre quando si finisce la vacanza, 208  dollari di tasse per 6 notti!
Nella hall nessuno si sforza di capire una parola di italiano.
Quando si rientra (sudatissimi), l'accoglienza è doppiamente gelida, sia da parte del personale, sia per l'aria condizionata puntata perfettamente sulle spalle degli ospiti.
Gli ascensori sono piccoli e sempre stracolmi, costringono gli ospiti a lunghe attese.
La pulizia delle stanze è carente (un cerotto si è affezionato alla nostra moquette ed è rimasto con noi per tutto il tempo).
Infine il wifi lento e intermittente.

title: Bonne adresse
text:
Bel hôtel bien situé proche de Time square.
Personnel agréable et disponible.
Chambre spacieuse et propre, par contre se ne sont pas des lit king site comme annoncés.
petit coin cuisine appréciable mais pas de vaisselle...
Et petit bémol pour la climatisation qui est très bruyante...

title: Emplacement à deux pas de Times Square
text:
Nous y sommes restés 5 nuits avec 2 chambres doubles. Qualite literie très confortable chambres équipées de micro ondes frigo plateaux de courtoisie. Notre petit-déjeuner était inclus sous forme de buffet qualité et choix très correct.
Une chambre avait une vue sur les buildings de NY appréciable aussi le jour que la nuit, l'autre côté cour ce qui était bien dommage.
Juste un petit point négatif : les ascenseurs sont très longs.
Nous y journerons tous de nouveau lors de notre prochain voyage.
Merci à la réception pour son accueil ainsi qu'aux agents de chambre et petits-déjeuners.

title: Air conditioning was not centralised
text: AC in windows so noisy couldn’t get to sleep after long flight, front desk hesitant to change room until engineer agreed noisy and then reluctantly changed room which was slightly better but for value fir money you can find better!!! Old hotel!! Old furniture And bathrooms old too!!! Would not stay again as my as after going to Orlando in between I had another hotel on my return and that was excellent!

title: Scarso
text:
Hotel ottimamente posizionato a pochi isolati da Times Square, ma è L unica nota positiva. Camere piccole, letti piccoli, bagno piccolissimo nonostante la camera da quattro. Aria condizionata che non si regola a parte la temperatura, e che quindi parte a ventola al massimo in piena notte con un fragore da svegliare noi e quelli delle camere accanto. L’alternativa e’ spegnerla in quanto la velocità della ventola non si può regolare. Bagno “antico”, e non e’ un complimento. 
Personale asettico e supponente, certamente non gentile. 
E come se non bastasse abbiamo “vinto” la camera che affaccia sulla terrazza con le macchine del condizionamento, che quindi allietavano il nostro sonno quando il condizionatore interno era spento. Disponibili a sostituircela, ma a valige aperte chi si azzardava?
Diciamo che con tanta offerta pari-prezzo questa è da evitare.

title: Great location!
text: We stayed here a couple of days before our cruise. It is a couple of blocks from times square and all of the theaters are within walking distance. It is a older hotel but has character, but for the price it is well worth it.  We will be back!

title: Ótima localização!
text:
Ficamos no hotel do dia 14.08 ao dia 22.08, infelizmente os quartos são um tanto diferentes das fotos da internet. Tivemos problemas com o ar condicionando logo no primeiro dia, que foi trocado rapidamente. O cafe da manhã também não compensa pagar, não esta incluso na diária. O atendimento achei muito fraco à recepção, os outros funcionários, não temos o que reclamar. 
A localização é ótima, muito próximo a Times Square, um quadra da estação de metrô e seis quadras da rodoviária.

title: Buon albergo in posizione ottimale
text: Come da titolo si tratta di un buon albergo in posizione ottimale a due passi dalla (fin troppo) vivacissima ed incasinatissima Times Square. La stanza era molto ampia e funzionale (era presente perfino un ferro da stiro e l'asse da stiro nel guardaroba) ed anche un piccolo angolo cottura con forno a microonde, lavello e frigorifero,  di contro condizionatore antiquato e rumoroso. Colazione abbondante ma solo continentale (non quella anglosassone), paradossalmente buoni cappuccini con le macchinette. Nell'albergo è presente una lavanderia a gettoni, un bancomat e dei distributori di bibite e di ghiaccio. Convenzionato con un caro ristorante brasiliano a prezzo fisso con il 15% di sconto. Consigliato.

title: Good location (if you need Times Square) but poor service, old premises and abusive fees
text:
The hotel seems sophisticated in the website but in reality it needs urgent and extreme remodeling. 
What made me most uncomfortable were the carpets, which look like they haven't been cleaned for some decades. Although rooms are of good size but the lobby and social areas are too small for the quantity of guests.
Breakfast-room is really poor and there is no diversity in food. Everything griming and sad, including service.
Also, they apply a strange and discretionary daily fee - mandatory - which is a surprise when you are checking-in and add more then 10% to the room rate that you already paid for. I had never seen this kind of fees before and it can be significant if you are spending a longer stay. 
Do not recomend.

title: A gem in the city
text: The Belvedere Hotel was built in 1923. Yes, the elevators are small and can be slow. The halls a narrow. But the rooms are big, well maintained and comfortable. The staff is friendly. The bathroom has a soaking tub with a rain shower and as well as a pulse shower. The beds are comfortable. The sheets soft. The bath products are first rate. I booked through Delta Airlines. At $138 per night, it was a great deal. Close to the Broadway theaters and good restaurants. I would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect affordable week
text: We visited NYC and stayed at the Belvedere for 6 nights. We travelled as a family of four (2 adults, 2 children) and stayed in a room with two double beds. Loved that the room had a mini fridge and microwave which allowed us to give the kids cereal with milk to tide them over and reheat restaurant leftovers. The hotel is no frills but very clean, staff all lovely, and multiple elevators so you’re never waiting too long. My mother joined us and stayed a few floors up in a single room with a king sized bed. She was also very happy. Highly recommend this hotel - affordable and perfect location - 2 minute walk from the subway and right in the heart of the action of Time Square!!

title: Excellent except
text: We liked just about everything at this hotel.  The location is fantastic; 2 blocks from Times Square but very quiet especially for NYC.  Staff is very friendly & helpful, rooms are updated, plushy and immaculate.  Only complaint:  elevators are horrible-we waited easily 15 to 20 minutes to get onto one of the 2 elevators—obviously they’re aware of this problem because there are signs up advising their patrons to allow for extra time.  Helpful suggestion; but how ‘bout better elevators?

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here for 8 nights. Not a flashy hotel but very well located near Times Square and Theatres and supermarket. We were in a room with two double beds which were a bit small for two people in one and only just enough room for luggage. Clean and tidy room and pretty good bathroom. Location made up fpr the smaller beds. Would stay here again.

title: Une chambre immense pour 4 personnes
text: Un hôtel calme et très confortable comme beaucoup aux US. Le petit déjeuner était parfait, copieux et 2 tarifs proposés. Le personnel a été charmant durant tout le séjour. Nous n'avons eu aucun besoin de transport pour nos déplacements, l'hôtel étant situé en plein Manhattan, à Broadway. Une kitchenette permettait de manger dans la chambre si nécessaire.

title: Bella esperienza
text:
Hotel si trova in posizione centrale, ma in strada non troppo trafficata.
Lo staff molto cordiale e disponibile.
Colazione abbastanza varia, da poter soddisfare tutti i gusti.
Hotel nel complesso ben curato e pulito.

title: Love The Belvedere!
text: Just stayed for 2 nights.  Second year in a row that we've stayed here.  A nice, clean hotel with rooms that are a good size.  Very convenient to the Theatre District and within walking distance of Central Park.  Good restaurants and a fantastic deli nearby.  Front desk staff members are very pleasant and very helpful.  Only drawbacks are that the bathrooms don't have a fan so it gets pretty hot and humid after showering, and the elevators are sometimes slow.  But, would highly recommend.

title: Lovely hotel - fantastic location, beautiful rooms and lovely feel. Just beware of the extras
text:
We stayed here with two young children. The room was beautiful - modern, well- equipped and large. The entrance has a decadent Art Deco feel and the porters are very obliging - useful when you have a ton of baggage (like us!). The hotel corridors and communal areas were spotless and it was situated in an ideal location for Times Square and Broadway and wasn’t far from Central Park. 
There is a daily mandatory fee which includes the free wine hour (lovely wine), wi-fi and breakfast discount (amongst other things) so just be sure you factor this into your budget. 

We would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing location and an overall good hotel
text: We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel August 4-7. We arrived very early therefore our room was not available for check in. The hotel stored our baggage for us without issue. The room was spacious for the four of us. The beds were comfy and everything was in working condition. There was even a mini fridge and microwave. The hotel offers breakfast, the website says it’s 20$ but upon check in we were offered half off that price. You are offered complimentary coffee from the breakfast even if you do not pay for the breakfast. There is also a complimentary wine hour in the lobby from 5-6. The staff were very polite throughout our stay! The location is PRIME. Literally two blocks from Times Square and surrounded by many shops and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Room nice, service Rude, Slow and TERRIBLE
text: Room was fine.  For that reason, you might go here anyhow.  BUT-- lines were very long, staff were rude, and most distressingly, we checked our bags at the desk for several hours on our last day.  My daughter had an iPad in her backpack.  I let the staff person know, he said he would "take care of me" and care of hte bags.  When we picked it up, it was smashed, looked like someone stood on the bag.  The manager said he would review the tape and then later wrote (surprise) that he saw nothing, and then lectured me about how I should have told them there was something fragile (which I did).  I was equal parts offended by the fact that they broke my daughter's iPad, and by how dismissing, rude, coercive, and condescending they were (really, not necessary, and just salt in a wound).  I would NEVER give them my business again for this very reason.  Being decent counts.

title: Perfect Location
text: First I would say the location is fantastic. Very close to Times Square and a large variety of places to eat within a 5 minute walk. Got to the hotel hours before check-in and we were able to check our bags and get to our meeting.  The bellman David was always very pleasant and offered assistance to us many times during our three days in the city.  Hotel room was very clean and offered all standard amenities (shampoos and lotion, hairdryer, refrigerator) as well as a nice bathrobe and safe in the room. I am a neat freak and would say if you are looking for a nice, safe, clean place to stay definitely consider The Belvedere. This will be my go to from now on 👍

title: Great hotel
text: Great location. 10-20 minute walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, etc. Room was good size. SUPER CLEAN. Nice size tv. At least 3 elevators that we saw. Doorman. Concierge. Place to check your bags if you come before check in or stay longer than check out.  2 computers and printers downstairs. ATM, vending machine   ice near computer room. Would definitely come again.

title: Vacaciones en familia
text: Hemos pasado vacaciones en este hotel y la estado genial la comida muy rica y las camas muy cómodas cerca al centro y a port aventura muy recomendable la limpieza perfecta y los animadores muy divertidos

title: Beyond awesome
text:
Read the reviews and was a little Leary but decided all we needed was safe, good location, clean, nice shower, cool and comfy bed!   Well, it is all of that and more.  The air and WiFi work great, the beds are comfy and we had a choice between floor 5 and 17.   The executive king was a great Travelzoo price and room is a nice roomy size, safe, bathroom great (tub shower) and we couldn’t be happier so far!   Coffee complimentary.  2 more days to go but so far so good!  The staff is very friendly and helpful.   You are close to everything, we haven’t even used the subway or uber yet!  Little store on corner of 8th has great breakfast sandwiches and nice Italian restaurant right next door!  If you are here for Broadway or Hells Kitchen restaurants or to have easy access to subway, just book this one, you will be glad you did!  I will be back!  

P.S.  no it’s not the ritz and you won’t have the updated electronic plugs but if you like a fridge and microwave you have that and plenty of storage space for clothes and luggage.  We haven’t made the happy hour yet!

title: Decent Hotel with refrigerators, back-saving cots
text:
Hotels are easy to come by in Manhattan.  What makes this one different is that the rooms have refrigerators.  You can save on expenses when you are in Manhattan by not eating out for every meal.  This hotel charges extra for a breakfast meal so a refrigerator is definitely a value.  While there are any supermarkets in Manhattan, there was a decent sized market just a block away.  Saving money on food allowed us to spend more money on the sites in Manhattan.
I have a bad back and sleeping on a firm bed is a must.  I have been in few hotels that have those firm beds.  The Belvedere was no exception but they did have rollaway beds, unlike many other hotels.  I did pay extra for the bed but definitely was worth the extra money and fit nicely in our king bed room.
The hotel is older but still well maintained.  I would choose it again when traveling to NYC.

title: Awesome as usual!!!
text:
I first stayed in rm 1706 for NYE 2018 and we could see the ball from our room! Excellent hospitality and a truly magical experience for NYE. We love the location in the Theater district but within walking distance of so much. The best! 

We took my kids for spring break and they made sure we had an adjoining room (yay!) The room service was great, beds were comfy, big bathtubs, nice sheets & towels. Super reasonable rates too! We love Hurley’s down the street...it’s our favorite hotel for an easy stay in NYC!!! Wish I had more hotel room pics! Lovely!

title: Great Staff, Value, Location
text:
We stayed 3 nights over a weekend getaway to see a play. I just have to thank the staff for accommodating our wishes for the top floor away from the elevator. When we checked in, our room was next to the elevator. But they promptly gave us another that met our needs. That's customer service: no muss no fuss. 

The accommodations were more than adequate, the size of the room quite generous for NYC. And yes, the view facing south was just beautiful, especially at night. No issues with cleanliness or functionality, though some of the furnishings seemed a bit dated. WiFi and internet access worked fine. A shout out to the bed, which was very comfortable. The continental breakfast for the guests served us well enough. And on the day we left, they stored our luggage after we checked out until late in the day. Here again, the staff did their job efficiently and with good humor.

There were, however, two items that could be improved:
1. The air-conditioner could do a better job cooling the room (and less noisy);
2, The elevators were always busy and packed.

But these shortcomings are more than made up by the professionalism of the staff, the value and location of the hotel. Highly recommended.

title: Ikke pengene værd.
text:
Var på dette hotel i 10 dage i Juli måned 2019.
Vi troede at det var løgn, da vi åbnede døren ind til vores værelse (1028), aircon larmede virkelig meget(66 Db målt på min telefon i ca. 3m afstand). Så den slukkede vi, men det hjalp ikke særlig meget, da vinduerne overhovedet ikke er støjisolerende, hvorfor man kunne høre de andre værelser´s aircon, og kondensvandet fra overboens aircon, dryppede ned på vores aircon. IKKE smart. Vores WI-FI var kun til stede nogle gange, og hovedpuderne er meget "høje", hvilket resulterer i øm og stiv nakke, når man vågner næste morgen. Jeg løftede sengetæppet fra gulvet, for at lede efter noget, jeg havde tabt, og under sengen fandt jeg et gammelt papkrus, hvori der havde været noget meget fedtet mad, IKKE i orden.
Vi hendvendte os selvfølgelig i receptionen, med de ovennævnte klager.
Aircon kunne der ikke gøres noget ved, da viceværten mente, at det var en af de nye aircon, så det var lydniveauet for denne model. Hovedpuderne, var de eneste de havde, men jeg kunne da få et tæppe at folde,kan oplyse, at det ikke virkede. WI-FI kunne der ikke gøres noget ved
Man skal huske, at når man afrejser, bliver der udskrevet en regning på 30 Dollars + tax 2,66 og 1,76 Dollars pr. dag.
Dette kalder de " New facility fee"  og deri er der også fri WI-FI, hvis det altså virker.
Det er ikke en mulighed at fravælge dette ekstra gebyr.
Alt i alt vil jeg sige, at de absolut ikke lever op til de 3 eller 4 stjerner de har, ville højst give dem 2

title: Great place to stay!
text: Traveled to New York for a fun vacation. Our family had 2 rooms. They were able to put them next to each other. Fantastic staff ! Great quiet location in the center of everything. Close to great food and Broadway shows. Everything is within walking distance. We will stay again on our next trip. Thank you for a wonderful stay at your beautiful hotel.

title: Slightly disappointed
text:
Great location to Times Square, Rockefeller, and Broadway. 

Hotel itself was a bit disappointing. Our room was not ready at 4pm as it advertised it would be. Elevators were super small and extremely slow. Rooms are nice but the tv were smaller than I'm use to in NY. 

Concierge was rude and seemed fustrated when asked for airport shuttle and the closest subway to the hotel. Also, did not mention I could get a car the hotel provided to take me to the airport instead of a shuttle.

The porters/bellmen were very knowledgeable and friendly. One of the bellman got the car set up for me to get back to the airport.

title: Good value for excellent location
text: Before I booked, I had questions about the hotel. So I called and spoke with a real person. She was knowledgeable, professional, and best of all, was able to tell me exactly what the total for our 5-night stay would be. So I booked over the phone. When we checked in, the total she had quoted was exactly what we were charged. No unanticipated fees. Our room was perfect for our needs. The beds are medium-firm. The microwave and little refrigerator enabled us to buy a few groceries and avoid a few expensive meals out.  We walked to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, High Line, Empire State Building and shopping on 5th Ave. Subway stations are only a couple of blocks away for more distant destinations. My only surprise was that the concierge didn't seem to know about discounted theater tickets. She was very willing to call theaters and book us for shows at full price. But that is all she does. She either didn't know about TKTS (discounted tickets) or didn't bother to tell us. Overall, we loved the hotel. It made it easy for us to visit NYC.

title: Nice and Quiet
text: First time visiting New York and this was the ideal hotel.  It is very clean, the room was nice and incredibly quiet; the front desk was courtesy and helpful.  The hotel is very close to Time Square and other attractions and subway stations.  The problem we had is that all attractions we wanted to see were on the other side of Time Square, so crossing back and forth was challenging.  There are many restaurants and bars close by along the avenues, as well as stores to grab a quick bite and beverages.  I must warn you that there is a $30 per night facility fee which covers things like wifi, the gym, use of their computer, restaurant discounts, wine hour and other things.  Overall, the Belvedere Hotel made our visit very enjoyable.

title: First time visit NY and a lovely stay at this wonderfully located hotel
text: Read a lot of reviews in advance of booking a 4-night long weekend stay here in June 2019 via Expedia. The attractions of this hotel were its location, star rating v price, room size and options in terms of in-room amenities. Arriving at around 3 pm we were allowed to check in an hour early, and as we had booked the hotel in January when the "Facility Fee" was $20 per day (plus tax) we were given that rate to pay at the desk rather than the current $30 (plus tax). This facility fee I presume is a form of resort tax but regardless every hotel appear to charge it in NY and it comes with different features. Those at the Belvedere are captured on the image attached but in brief include wi-fi (Which tbh was quite weak) leading to my having to revert to 4g roaming at some points), 50% discounted continental buffet breakfast i.e $9.99 v $19.99 which we took up the option of on the last morning but regretted as the offering was quite poor/limited and the breakfast room was very old fashioned feel and depressing feel (no natural light) and a short walk away near Times Square in  Sbarro Resturant you can get a much better-cooked buffet breakfast for only $11.99, access to a fitness centre (not used) and free local calls/concierge and small discounts on local tours. A unique aspect was a free daily wine hour. Again we didn't take up this option but it seemed very popular amongst the mainly older hotel clientele. Though the facility fee price hike didn't apply to us it did seem a bit steep, but it was unclear if this was a seasonal rate etc. The room we had we had upgraded to an Executive Room King Bed in advance of arrival for a small extra charge as this guaranteed an in-room fridge and city view which we saw as a major plus in addition to the generous (for NY) room size, microwave, Tea/Coffee maker. The room included a well-appointed bathroom with complimentary toiletries, in-room safe, iron and ironing board as well as dressing gowns. The bed was very comfortable and every day the room was tided and bed remade without issue whilst we were out. The lifts/elevators were dark and slow but it wasn't a deal-breaker. The reception and concierge staff appeared friendly and approachable and on our day of departure we were able to leave our luggage in a safe room for no charge. Located in a fabulous location (a reasonable 15 min walk to the city cruise pier and 5-10 mins walk from Broadway/Times Square with access to the metro system) and not too tall in term of floors in all I have no reservation in recommending this hotel and would not hesitate to re-book here, as we felt safe and secure in the heart of midtown.

title: Watch for hidden "Facility Fee" of $30 per day
text: Hotel is in a convenient location and is overall ok.  Elevators are extremely slow, so factor that into your schedule.  Front desk is quite rude (even for New York).  But the biggest surprise was the secret daily "Facility Fee".

title: I love this hotel but...
text: I’ve stayed at the Belvedere Hotel exclusively for the past 4 years, beginning with a visit to the city, followed by college visits, and finally to visit my daughter in college.  When I return, many of the desk staff recognizes me and greets me by name (that really feels good).  I love the location and the fact that I can walk to many of the theaters, Hell’s Kitchen restaurants, Times Square, etc, although it is very far from my daughter’s college (NYU), my primary reason for visiting.  The office staff will often upgrade me without me even asking.  Wifi is spotty and the slow, slow elevators are a down side. But honestly, I mostly love everything but the price.  Although the cost always seems lower (at Hotels.com), it always comes out much higher than I planed.  In addition, I have noticed that the price keeps creeping up from one reservation to the next.  While I understand some of it, I discovered another hotel, that is rated about as high as the Belvedere, with the same amenities, but the rooms are almost $80 a night cheaper.  I was amazed at the price difference. I canceled my two upcoming reservations in lieu of staying with them, which made me sad.  I will continue to look for deals at the Belvedere, and would love if some reward for frequent guests such as myself were instituted.  As I said in my title, I love this hotel but since I travel to NYC at least 4-6 times a year to visit my daughter (from San Francisco), the $80 a night savings is too good to ignore.  I hope the Belvedere considers my suggestion of rewarding loyal customers.  Thank you.  Bob Abaya

title: שירות ומיקום
text:
עכשיו חזרתי משהות של 8 לילות ,מיקום המלון מצויין ,השירות אדיב ,חדרים מרווחים ומלון נהדר ,אין ספק שאחזור לבקר במלון שוב !!
נותני השירות במלון עושים את הביקור לנעים וכיף ,חדרים נקיים מאוד .
המלון ממוקם בין שדרה 8-9 ברחוב 48,קרוב לתחנת אוטובוס ולכל תחנת רכבת .

title: Very Hotel
text: My wife and stayed at the Belvedere for four nights for 4th of July week. We arrived in an early fly, they gave us an upgraded room in the 16th floor and check us in at 10:00 in the morning. The room was renovated with really in good working order A/C, this is really important considering how hot is New York in July. The location was great, Mid town with lots restaurants and shops, couple blocks from Time Square and Subway stations also within couple of blocks. There is a daily wine hour in the afternoon with complementary glass a wine between 5:00 and 6:00pm. Check out was also a breeze. We will definitely stay at The Belvedere if we ever come back to New York.

title: Bel hôtel et super emplacement
text: Tout ce qu'il faut, chambres propres assez spacieuses. Micro-ondes et frigo sont un plus. Emplacement proche de Time Square et le mieux c'est qu'il est calme. Personnel sympathique. Je recommande cet hôtel si on veut loger près de Time Square

title: סיום טיול כייפי בארצות הברית עם חגיגה בניו יורק
text: הגענו למלון זה ל 4 לילות בניו יורק ,המחון עם מיקום מצויין ברחוב 48  בטיים סקוור,השירות היה מצויין והחדר טוב ונקי ,הבעיה היחידה היתה במעליות שהיו עמוסות וזמן ההמתנה ארוך ,אך היחס  המעולה מאנשי הקבלה שגם נתנו לנו צ'ק אאוט מאוחר היה שווה את זה

title: Nice Hotel near all tourist attractions
text:
Average is not a bad review so do not be scared off. Average to me means the rooms are nice, its well-kept and staff were friendly and attentive. That is what the Belvedere was, I enjoyed my stay there. 

The only issue was the WIFI, I had troubles connecting, or the connection would fail. My trip was right after Pride and before July 4th so I'm assuming that the hotel was full and busy. WIFI is clearly really important now a days so to make sure it is working well is very important. 

Other than that, I liked that hotel and would stay again. They have a 5pm - 6pm happy hour with wine and cheeses. 24 front desk, kitchenette's, every staff member i encountered was friendly. I had the continental breakfast pastries, yogurt and fruit. I'm an eggs bacon, pancakes person so I only did the continental breakfast once. They do offer hot breakfast, but I try not to eat at hotels on trips.

title: Best place
text: My friend and I have been frequent guests to the Belvedere for about fifteen years now s. We love this place . We are shopoholics and there is no place like NYC and the Belvedere is the best place to stay. Rooms have great beds that are super comfy comfortable. Ricky is always at the desk ready to check is in. Thanks Ricky!!. 5 stars

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text:
This is my go to hotel in New York.  Great location.  Situated on a quiet street but a short walk from Times Square.
Walking distance to Central Park.  Would not consider staying anywhere else.  Rooms are a nice size and the plus is they have a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker.  Great for fixing a simple breakfast before hitting the streets.

title: Convenient location and lovely accommodations
text: We stayed for two nights while we enjoyed touring Times Square and Central Park. Also, it was a very convenient walk to the theater district. I would recommend this hotel for those who wish to see the above listed attractions. It was not a difficult walk to Rockefeller Center either. Very convenient location and many delicious places to eat close by.

title: il top al centro di nyc
text: praticamente a 300 m da Times square e a numerosi locali questo holel anche se un pò datata rende la vacanza al top soprattutto per la bella vista che si ha dalla camera. peccato il segnale wifi molto lento e la macchina del caffè non funzionante ma pulizia ok e staff sempre disponibile. consigliato anche per il rapporto qualità prezzo. unico neo gli ascensori pochi 2 per un grattacielo di 17 piani.

title: Belvedere hotel New York
text: Good hotel to stay in. Lot of traffic in the hotel when we were around but still it was wonderful staying there. The breakfast could be always much better, it was so much sweet, no eggs at all, but all in all we did love our stay. Very centrally located and that is really required.

title: Fair Enough Hotel.
text:
The room was a good size as was the bathroom. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We requested a kettle which was supplied on the second time of asking. We found the housekeeping to be a bit hit and miss.
They have a happy hour when they give complimentary wine and cheese. A nice touch.

The hotel is in a superb position. Times Square, Broadway, Central Park and Empire State Building all in easy walking distance.

Overall the hotel has more pro's than con's and we would happily stay there again.

title: Women’s Week in NYC
text: The location of this hotel is perfect for walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, theatres, and restaurants! The staff was very friendly and helpful! And we thought the happy hour with wine and cheese was wonderful! Loved the hotel. Would stay there again!

title: Alright hotel
text:
It was a deal on hotwire. So I didn't know the hotel until we confirmed.
Good location
Elevators are terribly slow
WiFi is horrible
Water pressure in shower weak
Overall an okay stay but above complaints were frustrating 😤

title: Good, But Can Be Improved
text:
My wife and I stayed 3 nights at Belvedere Hotel while visiting NYC.

The Good:

Price is reasonable for New York City.

Location, location, location ... a few minutes' walk from Times Square, Broadway shows, subways, restaurants ... longer walk to Central Park, 5 Avenue stores.

Old building that has been renovated and well maintained.  Our Executive Room with 1 King bed was a good size with kitchenette (Keurig machine, microwave, mini fridge), a work desk/chair and LCD TV with cable channels.

Free wine happy hour every day from 5:00pm-6:00pm.  Staff were polite overall.

The Bad:

Wifi speed was terrible and was often unusable at various times throughout the day ... nowadays, this is unacceptable and should not be called "high speed internet".

Additional daily "resort fee" for everyone to pay for wifi internet (very slow), business center (not used much by people), fitness centre (we did not use), phone calls (everyone has a cellphone nowadays).

Tiny bathroom with no counter space.  The mirrors get steamed up quickly when taking a shower.  The wash basin faucet did not have an aerator, so water sprays all over.  The bath/shower drain had to be removed to properly drain water.

Hot/warm water would come out of the kitchenette sink faucet even when set to Cold.

The roller blinds do not cover the entire windows and the sun shines brightly through in the morning.

The through-wall A/C unit is very noisy and you need earplugs to sleep.

The LCD TV was smallish (~32") for the size of room.  There is an HDMI port on the side, but you cannot plug in your own HDMI cable because the remote control cannot select the TV source and only controls the Spectrum cable box.

The desk phone in our room had a cordless handset that did not charge (has a charge light blinking all the time) and could not be used to make calls (even if we had wanted to).

When we were checking out, they let a couple of kids run around and screaming out of control around the lobby area.

title: Great Stay!
text: As an Expedia VIP member they did upgrade me to their best rooms complimentary.  Their ice buckets could be a little bigger haha.   My stay was wonderful and my friend even lost his $800 apple watch and the hotel staff found it and kept it in their safe until he came to retrieve it.  Would love to stay again! - Scott.

title: Decent, clean hotel at a good price near Times Square
text: I got a great rate on a Sunday night for a queen room. Less than $200 including tax and fees. That’s pretty good for mid-Manhattan. I was worried the place might be sub par or in a sketchy neighborhood. No issue at all. My room on the 16th floor was recently remodeled. The bed is as nice the decor great, great shower, a great view outside. The staff were really friendly and professional, the concierge told me about the high wire walk in Times Square, which I would have missed otherwise.  I was there solo but there were families of all ages from all over the world.

title: Boa localizaçao, apenas isso.
text: Ficamos no hotel do dia 13 ao dia 18, infelizmente encontramos o quarto muito diferente do que nas fotos que vimos no Website. O banheiro minimo, o ar condicionando muito antigo e muita sujeira. Alem do cafe da manha muito ruim tambem. Nao recomendo.

title: not a nice hotel
text: great hotel for lsight seeing  but manager very rude to myself and friend but not to my husband needed a bit of updating on paint work and new windowswould defo go agin to new York brill place just stay somewhere else

title: Okay place in an okay part of town
text: Not impressed by no means. Room wasn’t cleaned well the first time. Clean cups in room we’re dirty, air conditioning worked but as loud a freight train. Won’t stay there again. If first time in New York as I was, I suggest a stay near financial district or on or near fifth avenue

title: Lo adoré!
text: Muy recomendable este hotel. La ubicación es excelente. El check in, súper rápido. La habitación estaba amplia, la cama muy cómoda, las sábanas bien tendidas, el baño impecablemente limpio, y el aire acondicionado funciona de maravillas. El desayuno no tiene mucha variedad pero no está mal para el previo que tiene. En general ha sido una experiencia muy positiva y valdría mucho la pena repetir.

title: Wonderful location, staff, room
text:
This hotel was wonderful within an easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Terminal, New York Public Library and numerous restaurants. 

We had an Executive King room. It was spacious, the bed was comfortable, had a microwave, coffee maker, small refrigerator. Air conditioning worked well. Washroom was well stocked and our room attendant always did a perfect job cleaning the room and gave us extra towels. 

We had a question about the wifi connection after the first night and the front desk relocated us immediately to another room with better wifi. They went above and beyond every time they could to ensure our happiness and comfort. 

There is a free wine social every evening between 5-6pm that gives you a chance to mingle and enjoy some wine.  While we did not eat at the Brazilian steak house on the property we did hear great things from other guests about it. 

If I come back to New York City I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excelent location
text:
It’s in a really good location, the rooms are really  good, with microwave and coffe maker, the bathroom is a little small.
Clean rooms, good service, good location.
Would not recommend the breakfast.
It has a happy hour (at 5pm) where you can get free wine.
Elevator can get a little crowded.

title: Great experience staying here
text: Stayed here for a week with my partner for my first visit to New York and my first to the USA too. Hotel is in a great location and we got upgraded when we arrived to a Executive King Room, number 1518. Loved the room. It was spacious, clean and really nicely furnished and decorated. We have a stunning view of the city looking out onto the skyscrapers as well as looking up W 48th Street and seeing the hustle and bustle. Room was cleaned every day and the housekeeping staff were very friendly, as were the reception staff. Bed was comfortable. We did have lovely and hot weather most of the time we were there so our room did get hot on a number of occasions and as the air con was very noisy this was not left on overnight. The wine hour was a nice addition and very welcome after a long day of walking and sightseeing. Only downsides were that the WiFi was pretty much non existent and the elevators took a long time to arrive (use the service elevators at each end of the corridors, much quicker and less busy). Overall I loved the experience and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Loved it!
text: First time in NYC and found the Belvedere to be a great hotel choice, location fantastic.. our room was large, bed comfortable, spotless cleaned everyday and all the staff friendly.  Fast check-in, enjoyed the chilled atmosphere of the free wine hour each evening.. I'd definitely recommend and stay here again.  We were on the 15th floor, and for us the view we had really made the experience extra special. Photos are of our room, the hallway and the views.. The Italian and Mexican restaurants just down the road from the hotel are both fantastic too!

title: Rude concierge, no bar
text: This hotel is at most a 2 to 3 star hotel. There is a very small lobby. It  has no social meeting area/bar. The rooms are clean, but small. The Concierge was very rude and did not give me any recommendations for restaurants or sightseeing. She was frustrated because she said she is really there to sell Broadway tickets. She told me if I wanted to know about sightseeing and restaurants I should talk to the front desk.  The location is great. I was very disappointed with this hotel. I would not stay there again.

title: Ikke imponert
text: Hotellet ligger sentralt, men dårlig standard på rommene og frokosten er den værste jeg har fått så langt på mine reiser. I tillegg var hun som jobbet i frokost lokalet meget sur og lite imøtekommende.

title: Terrible
text: Check before booking there is no building work,at 3am we were woken with the sound of concrete drilling,yes its true New Yorkers never sleep! And the hotel manager just kept saying it wasn't his fault even tho it was his hotel

title: Hôtel agréable et très bien situé pour découvrir New York
text:
Je suis très satisfait de la qualité de l’établissement, la situation de l’hôtel est parfaite pour découvrir la ville et le personnel est très serviable, il m’est arrivé une mésaventure et j’ai oublié quelque chose de très important dans l’hôtel, ils ont réussis à récupérer mes affaires et à les faire envoyer par un taxi jusqu’à l’aéroport dans une enveloppe scellée 1h30 après mon départ, même si j’ai quand même raté le vol je les en remercie.
Je recommande vivement l’établissement, qualité prix super !

title: Rude management, dirty room
text:
Have stayed here several times over the years. Service and room cleanliness has gone downhill dramatically while price goes up. There are much better hotels nearby for lower prices.

Bathroom is worn and beds not real comfortable. Bell hops do not help to unload cars, let alone take luggage to room. Desk clerk was rude, confused on hotel policy. Wife had to haul luggage to room while I parked car.  Valet service missing.

title: Spacious Room
text: We were upgraded free to a King executive room.  Updated hotel, very informative staff and so helpful.  I would stay again!  This is super close to Broadway shows.  The hotel stored our bags at checkout and helped us get a cab to the airport.

title: Great location
text: We travel to ny every year in May as a combined business/ personal trip. We've stayed in number of hotels in the midtown area. This year we chose to stay a little further away from Times Sq and chose the Belvedere. We had some issues. The toilet didnt work properly, our room was missing a nightstand and 2nd lamp, and the water pressure was poor. Communication was not good between staff members to resolve these matters. The Manager apologized and said he would have moved usto a different room. But, no one did. He commented that the hotel has a good location. I knew that, that's why I booked us there. I wasnt expecting the other issues.

title: Updated Rooms
text:
We have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years. Since we were here last the rooms have been renovated and updated. There are many electrical outlets with usb plugs in multiple places around the room! The bath appears to have been stripped to the studs and redone with a great walk-in shower.

The location can not be beat. It is very close to a subway station and to Broadway theaters. The street is quiet.

The biggest downside is the Wi-Fi! Do not expect to get any work done with it! I was barely able to check my email as it is SO SLOW!!!!

Head Down the block to 9th Ave and you are on resturant row!

title: Muy regu
text:
El personal de la recepción y la conserje, increíblemente amables! 
La habitación es muy cómoda y el baño muy limpio.
La ubicación es excelente!
Pero el desayuno y peor aún, el personal de la atención en el breakfast es malisima! Mala clase todos, aunque hablan español no les gusta atender a los huéspedes que no saben inglés, son descorteses, poco amables, no hay muchas opciones de comida y ninguna de las que hay, son saludables!
Si no bajas temprano a desayunar, tal vez no encontres porque se acaba y no reponen.

title: Great location
text: An older hotel on the west side. Located across the street from the Performing arts school.  It was perfect for us as we were there to see Broadway shows and we were in walking distance. Good size room and we had a skyline view. Great products in the bathroom and wonderful and early room cleaning service.

title: Belvedere Hotel
text: Room was nice, not nearly as small as I would have expected. All staff were helpful. Great location. No complaints other than all of the dryers in the laundry being out of service. Breakfast was fine, mostly assorted breads, yogurt, fruit and cereal. Ours was free with our room but I don’t think I would have paid if it wasn’t free.

title: Off the beaten path
text: This hotel has a great location - close to Times Square but not IN Times Square. Our room is very nice however the bathroom is very small. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the beds are very comfortable. There’s a small market at the corner so you can get things there and use your room fridge too. Saves a little money there!

title: Hotel de bajo perfil y ruidos
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado
Los colaboradores todos muy serios
Recepcion serios hasta parecen estar enojados pero ayudan y solucionan
El portero no sonrie, no te abre la puerta, no saluda, etc no se para que esta.

No me parecio que a la llegada te cobran un fee de 30 usd por noche, nadie te avisa que te lo van a cobrar y tienes que decidir justo ahi. Es un abuso 
Las camas esta horribles, colchones de resortes muy viejos.

Elevadores lentos

Habitaciones humedas con alfombra.

Se escucha todo el ruido de la calle y a parte hay una obra de construccion justo enfrente del hotel.

Definitivamente no regresaria y buscaria otra opcion mejor por el precio de este.

title: Ok for a couple of nights
text:
The hotel is very clean, but extremely dated. Looks from the decor that it's not seen any replacement/refurb since the mid 80's! We were told we'd been upgraded on arrival to an executive room..... don't know if this is a cunning ploy to make you think you are getting a better deal.... the room size was good, no issues, and have to say the bed was extremely comfortable.

Good points: Excellent location in Theatre district. Very easy to get around from- subway station only 2 blocks away.
It's very clean, and the front desk staff/concierge extremely friendly and helpful.

Bad Points: 
The breakfast is Continental only. It's $11.50 with tax..... it's cereal and toast!!!
