The bellhops stand and watch you get wet unloading your luggage from the cab, but come the time you need to leave the hotel or use the luggage store, they readily expect a tip for moving your case 5 feet.

The facility fee is a rip off.... it's basically a fee for services you'd expect in any European hotel!

title: 5 nights in New York
text: We started at this hotel for 5 nights as a family of 4 at the end of May. Hotel is dated but clean and in an ideal location around 10 minutes walk to Times Square. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful and our request for a high floor was answered. The only problem we encountered was as there was only 2 lifts for 17 floors, they took a while to arrive and stopped at every floor. Would recommend for holidaymakers looking for a no frills hotel and we certainly enjoyed our stay in New York

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in May with my two teenage children in a room with 2 double beds.  This hotel is in a great location, 10 minute walk from Times Square.  We had a grand executive room and was spacious.  However, the beds were small, not big enough for 2 teenagers.  However on asking the staff put in a guest bed.  I objected to paying a facility charge for things we didnt use.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is very close to Times Square, like 7-8 minute walking distance. The room was spacious with microwave and a little refrigerator. There are many places to eat at good price, markets, train and buses are near. The bad: toilet was uncomforatble, and you have to pay a $30 fee for services. If you find a good deal, you can pay the fee. Wi-fi is good, but we didn't like the restaurant.

title: Prima hotel
text:
We stayed in Belvedere Hotel with a family of 5 and booked 2 rooms. The room my brothers and I stayed in was spacious enough for the three of us but the beds were to small for them. Their were too tall so they didn't fit in the bed. The room was clean.
Breakfast is limited and every day the same. If you are not on time then there is no cutlery. 
The location of the hotel is great, it's very close to times square and all kinds of nice restaurants. 
The staff was really friendly and helpful.

title: Good location, but improvements needed
text: Although The Belvedere’s location is good, unfortunately there are several areas that management needs to address. We were upgraded (according to the woman at Reception to the best room in the hotel) however found, as other reviewers have noted, that the a/c unit was very noisy and the WiFi was very inconsistent. A facility charge of $34/day is assessed which is annoying and if it is going to be charged, the “perks” (ie WiFi) that this fee supposedly covers should work.

title: Goed gelegen, fijn hotel.
text: Van 14 t/m 21 mei hier verbleven, dit hotel lag voor ons perfect centraal in Manhattan, metro en bus een blok of een paar blokken verderop. Vlakbij Times Square, Broadway en op een 20 tal minuten lopen van Central Park. Eigenlijk is alles in Manhattan aan te lopen, maar ik wandel dan ook graag. De kamer was schoon, ruim genoeg en de bedden waren prima. De koelkast, kluis en airco werkten prima. De wifi is gratis en prima. Het ontbijt vonden wij matig, 1x gedaan maar de rest vd week in de stad ontbeten. De staff was zeer vriendelijk, vooral de concierge, een lieve behulpzame New Yorkse dame. Al met al toch zeker een aanrader voor mensen die een rustig hotel zoeken in New York!

title: Great location, not bad accomodations
text:
Our family of 2 adults and 2 teens stayed at The Belvedere for 4 nights in May 2019.  We had booked this stay via Hotwire, and were aware that we would be getting an unrenovated double double room.  The 4 star rating is a combo of 3 stars for the accommodations and 5 stars for location.  

The room was fine - obviously needing some updating (I believe the hotel is planning on completing renovations to all rooms eventually).  The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was small and cramped but functional and the AC unit was loud.  The small fridge and microwave were useful, as we bought some staples from the corner store down the street and Food Emporium a block away, which cut down some dining costs.

There is a $30/day facility fee (which we knew about) which covers free wifi, daily wine hour from 5-6pm , discount on the continental breakfast and discount on some tourist tours.  The wifi was unreliable and kept cutting out.  The wine night was fine - a glass of wine and a few blocks of cheese.  Not worth it for $30/night, especially considering that most of the other hotels in the area do not charge such a fee. 

The location can't be beat.  About a 3-5 min walk to Times Square, 10 min walk to Central Park/The Met, and 7-10 min walk to Rockefeller Center.  Metro station (50th St.) is about a 5 min walk away, so very easy to get to further places (like 9/11 Tribute) by metro.  Despite the hotel's close proximity to Times Square, it was relatively quiet so you could get a decent night's sleep without being woken repeatedly by sirens and other noise (if you can deal with the sound of the AC unit).

title: Wouldn’t recommend
text:
Currently staying here, told the reception and showed an email from my confirmed booking that a facility fee was not mentioned at the time of booking but the staff didn’t do anything about it.
Can’t make use of the ‘facility fee’ anyway as the WiFi doesn’t work on the 14th floor, feel like it’s a scam on top of what we’ve paid and I come from a tourism management background and know how things work.
Aircon is noisy, and we are kept awake at night.
Would not stay again, staff haven’t rectified our problems so far and the facility fee is a joke, would not have been a problem if we’d known it before hand but it wasn’t mentioned at time of the booking when we chose to stay here and also 30dollars a night for a WiFi code which doesn’t work is ridiculous.

title: Hotel carino a pochi passi da Times Square
text:
Ciao a tutti, ho soggiornato qui per 6 giorni dal 28 al 4 maggio 2019 e mi sono trovata bene. Appena arrivati alla sera (21:00) abbiamo effettuato il check-in in pochi minuti e ci hanno spiegato tutti i comfort dell'hotel lasciandoci anche un biglietto come promemoria. La camera era al 9 piano e devo dire che anche se era piccola era comoda e ben disposta. Non abbiamo usufruito della colazione in hotel, con solo 10$ a testa, perché abbiamo trovato un supermarket "the food emporium" vicinissimo all hotel e molto comodo per fare colazione, internazionale e non, e una piccola spesa prima di iniziare a visitare NYC. L'albergo è molto curato e pulito. Personale accogliente. Dispone di phon e cassetta di sicurezza. Inoltre al suo interno c'è anche la cassetta dove poter inviare le cartoline. L'unica pecca di questo hotel è stato l'ultimo giorno, quando effettuato il check-out, abbiamo dovuto lasciare le valigie in una stanza in reception e abbiamo dovuto dare una mancia di 10$ per due valigie. C'è anche il servizio "taxi" che ti porta all'aeroporto, mi raccomando procuratevi soldi in contanti perché con il bancomat o carta ti aggiungono una tassa di quasi 10$ in più al costo del viaggio totale che noi purtroppo abbiamo pagato. Inoltre l'agenzia dove abbiamo prenotato questo hotel ci ha detto che in loco ogni giorno dovevamo pagare, oltre già al pagamento della camera, anche una tassa ti 35$ che alla fine prendono tramite la carta di credito quando fai il check-out. Questo per i servizi che offre l'hotel (palestra, wi fi etc.) Forse 35$ al giorno sono un po' tanti anche perché il wi fi non funziona così bene.
Hotel comodo per la vicinanza con Times Square.
Comunque tutto sommato lo consiglio.

title: Graduation
text: Hotel is very clean and staff is accommodating. Very friendly and helpful with any questions or advice. Hotel is in a great spot. Close to everything and so many great restaurants.  Room was a decent size. Very comfortable beds. Will stay here again.

title: Clean and accommodating
text: This is my second stay at the Belvedere. Property is located in the best location for tourists! Neighborhood is clean, safe, and pleasant. Very close to theater district, shopping, restaurants, and attractions. Staff are attentive, pleasant, and accommodating to guests. Highly reccomend!

title: situation stratégique
text: bruyant mais on ne peut pas tout avoir, très près de Time square et pas de bruit= mission impossible. Au 14ème étage , fenêtres fermées, il n'y a pas de soucis. Très bon  lit, chambre propre , linge changé tous les jours. Kitchenette, mais armoire vide, pas de récipient, théière, cafetière..... Faire attention à ses affaires: on nous a volé des médicaments et des compeed dans la chambre!

title: Good location, but could do with some sprucing up.
text: The Belvedere is in a very handy location for sightseeing and the building itself is nice. The staff were all friendly and helpful and we liked the 5pm happy hour in the lobby area, with its free wine-tasting. However we do have several suggestions for improvement, or upgrade, from our 7 night stay there. We were on the 14th floor and the wifi signal there was very weak, necessitating visits to the lobby to use our laptop (however it did work better with the mobile phone). The in-room air conditioner was far too noisy to use when trying to sleep, consequently the room could get a bit stuffy overnight. The noise from traffic and night-time roadworks outside the hotel was also quite intrusive. Our bed was quite uncomfortable, as it sagged in the middle and creaked with every movement.

title: Hotel bueno y bien mantenido con buena ubicacion
text: El hotel es limpio, bien mantenido, el personal es correcto y cordial, salvo alguna excepción. Excelente ubicación. Hay que ser insistente con el shampoo, acondicionador y jabón de cortesia, ya que se olvidan de reponer, lo mismo con el cafe y el té de cortesia. Habitacion contratada: doble ejecutiva, que la promocionan así: "a custom-designed kitchenette with microwave and refrigerator among other thoughtful amenities", lo que habia en la habitación era un frigobar, una maquina para hacer cafe/te y un microondas. No proporcionaban vajilla, cubiertos, copas, servilletas, set de cocina elemental, etc, es decir en mi opinión no es kitchenette, sino habitacion con frigobar (heladera pequeña), máquina para cafe/te, mas un microondas, lo que imposibilita preparar comida sencilla. Servivio de wifi: bueno, a veces se cortaba o era lento, pero pocas veces. Agua caliente abundante.

title: Bien mais pas top
text:
2 points très positifs : chambre au 14eme étage avec jolie vue et hôtel ultra bien placé.
Par contre, le tarif est relativement élevé sûrement dû à son emplacement.
Et le pire qui est insupportable dans cet hôtel, c’est le manque d’amabilité... peu de sourire, du personnel qui soupire et pas aimable... inadmissible au pays du service.
On passera sur la serpillière retrouvée sur nos affaires dans la chambre...

title: Hotel is a Scam. Do not stay here.
text:
My $929 booking turned in $1235 when hidden fees and taxes were added at reception on checkin. There is NO mention of this in the booking I made DIRECTLY with the hotel itself. 

The so-called "facility fee" is a waste of time and scam. It is not indicated on the booked. . You won't use any of the things they offer, the WiFi is very poor (packet los is 50% in evenings). 

The hotel is in poor to fair condition for the price charged. The bathroom fittings needs maintenance. Towels are small and cheap. Bed sheets are not ironed (which is OK  but again, cheap).

title: WTF is a facility fee!?
text: When we travel to NYC, every couple of years, we try to stay at this well located and full service hotel.  On this trip we encountered something new ... a facility fee.  So, the things that we have always enjoyed (and some we’ve never used) as a part of the nightly fee now cost extra.  This fact was not disclosed until our arrival.  But wait, good news... we were only charged the old rate of $20 a night instead of the new rate of $30 a night!!!!  Everything else about this hotel is fine.  I guess this is the new world.

title: Localização, frigobar, café e microondas
text: A localização é ótima, os quartos são grandes. Eles estavam em reforma e ficamos nas dependências antigas, as quais já foram muito satisfatórias. Tem wi-fi. O fato de ter frigobar e microondas ajudam muito, principalmente quando se quer fazer um lanche no quarto. Fica bem próximo a uma linha de metrô e a Times Square.Hotel silencioso.

title: Good old fashion Charm
text: What a beautiful hotel.  Close to everything.  Room was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable.  Had free appetizers every night.  Staff were friendly.  We received two for one drinks at 5:00 every night.  The breakfast in the morning was excellent and had a wide selection to choose from.  Would stay there again.

title: Great location, nice hotel
text: We spent the weekend at this hotel. It’s only a block from Time Square. Our room was quite nice, more spacious (full tub) shower was a pleasant surprise. It was well decorated and clean with an extra sink by the coffee maker outside the bathroom. Our room had a nice view and you could open the window. The bed was comfortable. The sound through the adjoining door allowed a lot of noise to pass through. I wanted whatever the lady In the next room ordered if you know what I mean.

title: Unfriendly front of house
text:
Cleanish and basic rooms.
Unfriendly front of house staff who have 0 experience in customer service - purely focused on money and the charges we will face when leaving and not welcoming their guests to the city.
Also didn’t appreciate rudely being coughed at for a tip from the bell boy who simply moved our cases 2 metres (not to our room just out of the luggage storage - of course we did tip the bell boy who took our luggage to our room).
Showers were either freezing or boiling.
A lesson in customer service would do wonders for this hotel as it is in a great location.

title: Decisamente scadente, bagno microscopico
text:
L'albergo ci è stato prenotato dall'agenzia viaggi.
L'aspetto migliore è la posizione: a Manhattan sulla 8th Avenue a poche centinaia di metri da Time Square.
Ma le cose positive finiscono qui: la camera era modesta (anche se pulita), con finestre vecchie e che facevano passare i rumori della strada. Il bagno poi era veramente imbarazzante: poco più di due metri quadrati, con il WC attaccato alla porta (per sederci ci si doveva mettere di sbieco, per non sbattere nel muro con le gambe, vedere foto). Oltretutto il bagno così piccolo era in gran parte occupato da una vasca con rubinetti vecchi (neppure il miscelatore, era difficile dosare la temperatura dell'acqua).
La colazione poi era veramente modesta: nulla a che vedere con le ricche colazioni dei paesi anglosassoni. C'era solo cappuccino, spremute e qualche tipo di brioche. Non uova, bacon, ecc. Molto deludente.
Neanche il servizio ci ha soddisfatto: era previsto un pagamento supplementare (ma obbligatorio!) di 20 dollari/giorno per servizi aggiuntivi, totalmente inutili. L'unico servizio che sarebbe stato utile era il Wi-Fi, che però non funzionava per nulla. Mi sono lamentato in reception e - bontà loro - mi hanno fatto uno sconto sul supplemento. 
In conclusione: un albergo decisamente modesto, molto deludente, ho consigliato all'agenzia di depennarlo dalla loro lista di hotel.

title: Albergo buono
text:
Albergo posto molto vicino a time square ed a tre fermate della metropolitana.
Stile classico con molta moquette.
La nostra stanza era pulita con bagno nuovo.
Ci hanno offerto ogni giorno 4 cialde di caffè che potevano essere fatte con la macchina disponibile in stanza. Presenti un lavandino  frigo e microonde.
Non abbiamo gradito la modifica del preventivo di 30€ al giorno x camera x facility feas che consisteva in possibilità di usare fax, Wi-Fi, telefono x chiamate urbane, palestra. Non avevamo richiesto il servizio e ci è stato spiegato solo dopo aver contestato l'importo addebitato.
La colazione però grazie a questo pagamento è costata 10$ anziché 19 più o meno.

title: Very good
text:
La struttura è buona. La zona è fantastica comodissima. Centrale e un buon posto da cui partire per andare ovunque.
La nostra camera
Con letto king size era piccola ma avendoci trascorso poco tempo andava bene. Nella stanza c’e Anche lavandino, microonde e il necessario per caffè la mattina. Proprio sotto c’e Un market per
Comprare il necessario per la
Colazione che in albergo costerebbe 9,95$ per persona. Il fatto di essere al 17mo piano ci ha regalato una vista mozzafiato. Il personale
Gentilissimo (tranne un paio di ragazzi addetti ai bagagli) ci hanno aiutato in tutto e consigliato. In generale una buona struttura ma nulla
Che ti rimanga impresso nella
Memoria. C'è anche la palestra ma noi non abbiamo avuto il tempo di visitarla. Al tuo arrivo nel prezzo c'è anche il vino no-stop tutto il giorno.
In generale voto 7.

The structure is good.  The area is fantastic, very comfortable.  Central and a good place to start anywhere.
 Our room
 With king size bed it was small but having spent little time was fine.  In the room there is also sink, microwave and coffee maker in the morning.  Just below there is a market for
 Buy the necessary for the
 Breakfast at the hotel would cost $ 9.95 per person.  Being on the 17th floor gave us a breathtaking view.  Staff
 Very kind (except for a couple of baggage guys) they helped us in everything and advised.  In general a good structure but nothing
 Let it remain in your mind
 Memory.  There is also a gym but we didn't have time to visit it.  At your arrival in the price there is also the non-stop wine all day.
 In general, vote 7.

title: Du pour et du contre
text:
Nous avons passé quelques nuits dans cet hôtel  dans une chambre familiale située au 7 étage

Le point fort de l hôtel : sans hésitation sa localisation à deux pas de Time square 

Le reste : un problème de plomberie relaté dans d autres avis qui est tout de même gênant la nuit et la clim très bruyante j imagine en plein été cela doit être invivable. Nous avions la chance qu il ne fasse pas très chaud donc nous ne la mettions pas en route. 
Pour les petits dej nous l’avons pris chaque jour à l extérieur en essayant plusieurs formules

title: Super emplacement
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé, central (à deux pas de Times Square tout en étant au calme, proche de Central Park et des lignes de métro). Personnel à l'accueil très agréable malgré notre anglais limité. Nous avons pu faire notre check in dès notre arrivée (12h) avec un surclassement à la clé (nous avions réservé une chambre standard et avons eu une chambre executive queen). La chambre est fonctionnelle et propre, bien équipée. Bonne literie, peignoirs (très appréciable) Le ménage bien fait au quotidien,renouvellement quotidien des serviettes de toilette et articles de douche. Cependant, chambre un peu bruyante le soir car mal isolés. Ne pas s'attendre à des chambres modernes.
Le service de taxi est efficace et à l'heure mais attention aux embouteillages qui augmentent le prix alors que le bagagiste nous avait garanti un prix. Le bagagiste n'hésite pas à réclamer son tips mais chose courante aux USA. 
Pour finir, nous avions demandé une chambre à haut étage, cela a été respecté !
Très bien pour un premier séjour à NY, idéalement situé !

title: Easter Holiday
text: I expected more. The hotel is clean. Small rooms. The fitness center had what is needed. The outside is under construction, would have liked it to be like in the picture. I think it is a bit expensive for the type of rooms. But the location is great. House keeping would make a lot of noise in the morning, if you want to sleep in don’t bet on it. They vacume outside the halls early. If the price were to be lowered I might stay again.

title: Girls trip
text: We had major issues when we first arrived with my credit card. The front desk guy was awesome! We were well accommodated. He even let my girls go into a room as he could see we were tired before the transaction was complete. Kuddos to the manager who came up later to make sure we were ok and brought us a bottle of wine. Very well done!!!

title: Bon emplacement mais.....
text:
Emplacement idéal dans le  coeur de New York,  accueil sympathique et concierge efficace.
La literie est excellente,  la chambre mériterait un petit coup de jeune, la salle de bain est simple et pas a niveau pour ce type d'hôtel.
Le petit déjeuner ne mérite pas le détour,  l'accueil était très moyen, le choix limité, si vous souhaitez un vrai petit déjeuner (made in Usa),  un petit conseil : Direction l'hôtel Riu situé  à une petite centaines de mètres, où pour quelques dollars de plus vous avez droit a un vrai breakfest américain.

title: Great hub for a visit to NYC!
text: We recently stayed at the Belvedere - family of 6 - 4 adults and two teens (15 and 13).  Don't be put off by the scaffolding in front of what appears to be a beautiful old building!  We were told that it's an ongoing project, but there was no work being actively done while we were there, at least that we heard or saw)   Check in was busy as we arrived about 15 minutes before the stated time of 4:00 pm, but Mike W. was great and cordially welcomed us!  We drove in from Boston and chose to "self park".  Jose the doorman gave us directions to the discounted parking garage, and after we unloaded, two of the adults went to park the car - over one street on the next block so a short walk back.  We were assigned connecting rooms (as requested) on the 9th Floor right across from the elevators.  I was a little concerned when we first saw that, but the rooms are in an area of the hotel that "juts" out just a little and enough to give us a long corridor as you enter the room to keep the bedroom area away from the noise of the hallway/elevator - and it did!  Very quite rooms, overlooking W48th Street and one of the rooms had a "side" window where we could see the signs in Times Square two blocks away!  The main focus of our trip was the theater and we were a short 10 minute walk up 8th Ave to the Gershwin Theater.  This hotel is very convenient to not only the Theater district, but Times Square and many other attractions in the area ( Rockefeller Center, Trump Tower, Grand Central and Penn Stations) - all within reasonable walking distance.  We walked up to Central Park from the hotel - it's a bit of a "hike" but fun!  We could hear sirens occasionally, but keeping the AC fan on constantly drowned out most of the traffic noise at night.  The system is a little loud, but worked as "white noise" for us so it was okay!  We did not participate in the nightly "happy hour" or use the gym, so it's hard to accept the extra $30 facility fee and tax that is automatically added to each room, but we were aware of it ahead of time, so not surprised.  It would be nice if they could use a key code for the gym and people who actually want to use it could and other's not be charged for something they don't want or need.  Overall, our stay was great - the staff friendly and our room service was as expected.  We would definitely stay here again and recommend for families traveling as the price was more affordable than most hotels in that area.

title: Hyvä sijainti, huono aamiainen, meluisa
text: Hotelli sijaitsee hyvällä paikalla ja siitä on helppo liikkua ympäriinsä. Aamiainen on vaatimaton, ei kanamunia eikä leivän päällisiä. Hotellin lähettyvillä on paloasema mistä kuuluu jatkuvasti hälytyssireenien ääni huoneeseen (myös öisin). Hotellissa oli ylivoimaista ymmärtää että halusimme tuplapeiton sijaan kaksi erillistä peittoa.

title: Graduation Celebration
text:
The Belvedere has everything you need and is relatively affordable.  The location is ideal for visiting Time 
Square (2 BLS away), locates in Theatre district and within a 4-5 min walk to many shows and close to the TKTS box office on time square for last min shows at a discounted price!  The hotel is 1 blk from what is known as Resturant row!  The Big red Bus starting point is 2 blks from hotel on Time Square.

The Hotel itself is exactly what you see online.  Beds are comfortable but I have slept on better.  The continental brkfst is average, a lot of carbs are offered.  Not our cup of tea but is do able for a quick brkfst.  We walked to Galaxy diner which was great and many selections.  I will be back to visit the Big Apple and will stay here too!

title: Over 12 years of consistent value
text: Not perfect, but great value and we hope to continue to use as our base.  Great location and value priced.  Just need to continue to improve service to rooms.  Desk and bell staff are great.  See you soon

title: Great location
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful with all requests.  The location was ideal for us, within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, many theaters, etc.  Subway stop within a couple of blocks for quick trips downtown.  Rooms are dated, but nice.

title: Mediocre
text:
I booked this hotel on hotwire not knowing which hotel I was going to get... 
pros: 
-Location is pretty sweet only few min walk from times square 
-staff was super nice 
- clean and neat 

Cons:
-outdated 
-beds are not that comfy 
-bathroom is really old 
- no coffee machine or water bottles to purchase in the room...
-35$ new facility fee but its not a new facility at all :/ 

For 300$ cdn a night I was expecting a little more luxury but whatever it did the job...

title: Great Location For City Break
text:
This hotel is situated just off 8th Avenue and is an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and all the Broadway shows. It is also a short walk to the Metro where you can get a train down town to the 9/11 Memorial and Sky Pod.

When this hotel was built (my guess would be in the 30/40's) I would think it was quite grand, but to the modern eye would appear quite dated now.

However the room was a decent size with a big comfortable double bed, bathroom, AC, and kitchenette.

The good bits were its location, cleanliness and big comfortable bed.

The not so good bits were:-
1. The mandatory $22 a night to cover the tourist tax and the so called free amenities, whether you wanted them or not.
This included the free WiFi, wine o'clock 5pm - 6pm, free wine and cheese, use of the gym, and concierge. Which of course is not free as you pay $22 a night!!!!!
2. The kitchenette in the room consists of a sink, microwave, fridge and an ice bucket. No cutlery should you choose to use the facilities and no tea/coffee making facility, although some rooms do have it. In fairness we asked for a kettle which the hotel was happy to provide. We supplied our own tea and coffee.
3. Because of its location it is a noisy place, New York is noisy and busy all the time!!!!! but there is a fire station just up the road and they turn out day and night with their wailers blaring constantly.

Having said all that should we ever go back to NY we would certainly consider the Belvedere, because of its location. There are lots of other hotels on 8th Avenue and they looked horrendous as they look over the main thoroughfare. At least the Belvedere is down a side street and the noise is slightly lessened.

title: 20% discount to restaurant. $34.
text:
When does prepaid not mean prepaid? At a growing list of NYC hotels. Mandatory resort fee due at desk. Period. But hey—it includes a 20% discount to their restaurant and the right to a room key. Can’t beat that.
Beds are doubles not queens. Room clean and quiet. Great location if you like midtown.

title: Great place to stay near times square / theaters
text:
Very helpful staff, concerned about my expectations for the view from my room, breakfast availability, etc at check in.
Continental breakfast was off the lobby, nice space, nothing fancy, but clean, and welcoming. only $10 per person!
Easy walking distance to broadway theaters and times square.
Pharmacy across the street. UPS shipping nearby. Wifi. check check check.
I'd stay there again.

title: Not what is reflected in the picture
text: When I booked this hotel, I thought we would be arriving at this charming older hotel for our stay. Unfortunately, don't expect what you see in the picture because it is completely hidden beneath scaffolding, looks just horrible. While we had a very pleasant experience checking in and talking with the front desk person, when I said how disappointed I was with how the hotel looked from the outside, he said that the scaffolding had been there since he started working there over 2 years ago and he had never seen even one person actually working on anything. To be honest, more than 50% of the buildings in NY had scaffolding on them, it was really very disappointing, especially since this was the first trip to NY for my granddaughter. This hotel is close to Times Square and many theaters, which was a bonus. However, the continental breakfast was not good at all, don't expect anything other two options of fruit (oranges, bananas) three cereals, toast, bagels and terrible small pastries. Just not worth it, save your money and walk to a bakery or breakfast place for better value.

title: Vakantie
text:
Matig hotel. Personeel zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam.

Wat ik apart vind is dat je verplicht bent om een service fee te betalen van 30 USD per dag voor twee personen. Men zegt dat is voor onbeperkt WiFi gebruik van de Gym en het ontbijt?

Het is wel apart dat ik een hotel via Tui boekt expliciet zonder ontbijt??? 

Het ontbijt is overigens wat je krijgt voor wat je betaald zeer beperkt, geen kaas of iets van vleeswaren geen gekookt of gebakken eitje alles jam honing pindakaas en Philadelphia  smeerkaas wat backels en gewoon brood.

Verder in mijn vakantie ga ik echt niet in een Gum trainer doe ik thuis al genoeg.

title: Surprise Trip for my Family
text: My husband and I surprised my son for his birthday with this trip to the city. His girlfriend set it up for us and then we flew in from Florida to surprise him. We flew in early and arrived at this beautiful hotel that was walking distance from Time Square! We thought we would just check in our luggage and come back to check in. But they had our room ready for us when we arrived that morning. That was GREAT!! we were a bit tired and a need rest was great to have before we went out to explore the city for a few hours before my son and his girlfriend arrived. The staff was all amazing! the room was clean and well kept.

title: Great location - tips for your stay
text:
We spent 6 nights at the Belvedere Hotel.  The welcome was great - a door person opened the door and there was no wait at check-in.  The gentleman at check-in was so personable and nice.  
They charge $23 per night for 'special' charges, which includes your internet, access to a very small fitness club and a wine and cheese hour from 5-6 p.m..  This was pretty pricey for what was offered.  There is a continental breakfast for $6.99 per person that includes breads and pastries, yogurt, beverages and spreads.  This is one of the better deals for breakfast in the area (as long as you're okay without anything warm).
There are three elevators. If the line-up for the two in the main lobby is too long, there is a small elevator at the end of the hall to your right.  Never a line-up.
The rooms are a good size for New York, with sufficient light and larger bathrooms that have granite tubs and backsplashes.  The carpets are brown which give a dark/dingey feel to the room.  The televisions are the smallest I've seen in a hotel room, which is okay as you're never really in your room to watch tv.
The beds have to be the most uncomfortable, old, noisy, and riddled with lumps that I've ever slept in.  Reminds me of a college futon! If we weren't exhausted from walking all-day, it is very likely we wouldn't have slept a wink.  Thank goodness for being exhausted from enjoying the city.  Both beds in the room felt the same, so I suspect it's standard for the hotel.
There is air conditioning and heat in each room, and while the fan sounds like an airplane taking off, it provides some comfort in the room.
We had the wine and cheese one evening and it is literally, wine and blocks of cheddar and mozzarella cheese.  Not a cracker to be seen to help wash down the mediocre wines.  We tried it one evening and there was a red and white offered - both being too dry.
Overall, the location is very good and almost balances out the deficiencies we experienced.  You may want to reserve the right to test your beds before you commit to a room.  If you intend to enjoy full days in New York and will be exhausted when you return, all will be okay.

title: Good traditional hotel in mid town
text:
Location was very good if you want to be near Times Square and theatres, but just far away not to be right in the thick of it.  Our executive room was a decent size for New York and had all the amenities you need, such as robes, slippers, hairdryer.  It also had a separate sink outside bathroom and microwave which would be great if you wanted to reheat food or drinks.
Beds were lovely and comfortable and shower had plenty of hot water morning and night.  There was plenty of storage also.  Air conditioning unit fan was very noisy but ok when switched to auto.  
The reception staff were lovely and helpful and check in and out was very efficient.  Sometimes there was a bit of a wait for lifts, particularly for those on lower floors.
Now the negative. Breakfast in the cafe was poor and the decor in there very dated.  It looked like an old function room with horrible red velvet curtains and bar.  They also ran out of plates and cutlery one morning and the following morning the cafe was completely closed.  
There is a $20 daily facility tax which you have to pay on departure for things like WiFi, the fitness centre etc, regardless of whether you use them or not.
Overall, the Belvedere is a pretty decent hotel and I would recommend as a base.  If you want trendy and modern, then this is not for you as it is more traditional.  There is a lot of scaffolding around hotel at moment which detracts from its charm.

title: We slept there
text: In all fairness, I imagine all hotels in NYC feel the need to charge extra for....nothing. Of the long list of provided (for 34.95/night extra) services the only thing I used was the WiFi. But it includes the use of their fax machine!! I was tempted to ask to use it,see if it indeed was in working condition, and to feel like I actually got something out of the ridiculous fee.  The fee included a “discount “ on breakfast. We never used it, as I felt we were donating enough to them already.  Attempting to be fair, I will say the location is good. Clean rooms. Here’s an idea, if you really just want that extra money, simply add it on in the standard price, like the rest of the country does. I mean, if the point is to lure folks in with appealing prices, heck just say it’s $49.95 a night! Then charge $150.00/night “facility “ fee. Why not??

title: Top locatie.
text:
Belvedere is een hotel dat perfect gelegen is op de 48 straat en op loopafstand ligt van Times Square. Vanaf JFK met airtrain en E line (metro) en uitstappen op de 50 straat. Wij verbleven hier 6 nachten. Kamer was dik in orde. Badkamer had wel iets groter mogen zijn. Kitchenette met magnetron is handig (geen gebruik van gemaakt). Kluis(je) in de kamer. Wifi werkte goed. Personeel vriendelijk en behulpzaam. 
Houd bij boeking rekening met het feit dat je per dag 22 USD extra bij moet betalen ivm tax etc.

title: So Close So Good
text: Extremely convenient to Theatre District and a huge choice of great places to eat . Short walk to Rockefeller Centre and pick up spot for the Hop On Hop Off Bus ,, a must do when in New York . Only a couple of blocks from Central park  and in the other direction 2 blocks from the Hudson River and the Ferries .

title: Give us simple 21st century amenities, please!!
text: People can see the great location and deco charm from online pix, but they can’t see baffling details that are missing. Why is there not even a basic Mr. Coffee in a room with a kitchenette? Why are there no lamp bases with chargers? (In fact, we had to go hunting for outlets.) Why does the heat/a/c unit have a mind of its own, and shut off of its own free will? (Maybe because a light warns that the filter needs changing?) It’s a nice place, I’ve been here before, the staff was good, but frankly I don’t know if I’d recommend it again.

title: Pleasant stay in Theater District
text:
A very pleasant week-long stay in NYC's theater district, 8th and 48th. The room was superior--over the 7th floor gets the light over the rooftops, and the modern decor of the room and the good size made our stay nice, day after day.  The maids were flexible, as we never left the room until about 11 or noon, but always came back to a clean, made-up room. The location could not be better, that 50th street subway stop gave us lots of options including the E crosstown.  Lots of restaurants--more expensive on 8th, cheaper on 9th, and classic ones on the side streets.  Personable staff throughout. The refrigerator and microwave expands your food options--you can take home leftovers and have them the next day.

Only a few minor downsides. The WIFI-- awful (only the 7th floor).The elevators are very small and often you have to wait for one that you can get into. Stayed in many places in New York, and found this very homey and stylish, great location.

title: Great location for theater district
text: In a real neighborhood, just 2 - 8 minutes walk from most Broadway area theaters, yet away from the madness and glare of Times Square,  Spacious room, well appointed, very helpful staff.  Our room on the 15th floor had a nice city view.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We actually visited here for the first time in December 2017. We booked the trip for my nieces 18th birthday and me, my sister, niece and nephew stayed here. We was booked here for 3 nights and couldn't fault the hotel from start to finish! The staff were lovely even giving us free wifi as it was my nieces 18th, the room was spacious and fitted the four of us in fine with enough room to manoeuvre. We only really used the hotel as a base so we didn't eat here or use any other facilities. The location was great as well not far from Times Square, we could even see part of it from our bedroom window! I would definitely stay here if travelling to New York again would reccomend to others!

title: Central et fonctionnel
text: hôtel  central et fonctionnel. Avoir une kitchenette avec un four à microonde est un gros plus. Le personnel de la réception est très courtois et fait bien son travail. Chambre au 16ème avec une vue sympa et un King size bed. Bon séjour , je recommande cette hôtel. Si vous prenez un vol à JFK , ils ont un service de voiture à 65 dollars ( moins cher que la majorité des compagnies et taxi jaune)

title: The Belvedere Hotel  --  Book it!!!
text: My friend and I stayed at the Belvedere Mar. 11-13, 2019.  It was awesome!  The room was a Standard Deluxe King, booked through Travelocity.ca.  It was spacious, clean and had a beautiful night view.  The location can't be better.  A quick walk to Times Square, subway stations, Broadway, dozens of restaurants and shops, but still our room was quiet. Room included a microware, fridge and Keurig.   A lovely continental breakfast was only $6.99 per person but there were also many local spots to pick up breakfast on the cheap.  Staff were friendly and helpful and we were able to book a private car to take us to LaGuardia for a great price.  I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it!

title: buena relación precio calidad
text:
Excelente ubicación, a metros de Times Square en una tranquila calle. Habitación amplia, buen servicio de internet. Posee una kitchenette que permite desayunar en la habitación. Cercano a bares y almacenes de comida que permiten ahorrar ya que Nueva York es una ciudad cara. Buen servicio y hay empleados que hablan español, lo que es de gran ayuda para los latinos. Recomendable.
Nuestro viaje fue en Agosto, época de mucho calor, pero el aire acondicionado respondió bien en  la habitación.

title: Great budget family hotel
text:
We booked the Belvedere ‘accidentally’ as we had it confused with a hotel that we had stayed at previously. Here is a quick synopsis as a middle aged couple travelling. We were booked for 5 nights and stayed only one. 

Location:  ok. On the edge of Hell’s Kitchen, easily walkable most places in. I’d town and certainly good access to subway. 

Style:  this is a budget hotel. It’s full of families and travellers looking for a good deal in expensive NYC. The rooms are adequate. Beds reasonably comfortable. Bathrooms nice. Shower head is excellent. We had a king ‘suite’ - essentially slightly bigger than a regular hotel room. Our room smelled badly of sewer. We also had asked specifically for a quiet room away from the elevators and were put directly beside the elevators on a floor full of you g families that let their children run up and down the hallways most of the night, playing and screaming. 

Free breakfast:  very limited selection. Bagels and carbs. Not very clean and frankly a germ fest - people touching the food but not taking it, etc.  I couldn’t bring myself to eat after watching it 🤢

Cleanliness:  the rooms are clean. 

Front desk:  check in was arduous and ultimately, no consideration was given to the requests on our reservation.  We booked directly with the hotel. 

We advised them we would be checking out the next day and they were more concerned about charging us a $75 fee for breaking the remainder of the reservation than the fact that we had a stinky, noisy room.  Lesson learned:  you get what you pay for and don’t ask hubby where we stayed at previously. Right it down yourself 🙂

title: Excellent location
text: I stayed at the Belvedere for 3 nights from January 21st. Excellent location, close to the subway and Times Square. On a quiet street but still close to plenty of restaurants and bars. Room was big enough with a lovely view. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.

title: Great hotel, terrible air con in rooms
text: My partner and I couldn’t fault the staff and service at this hotel and for that reason we won’t rule out staying there next time but we would shop around first because of the air con in the rooms. Overall it’s clean and in a great location, close to all amenities, tourist attractions and several metro lines. We were put in a ‘recently refurbished’ room which was much nicer than we had expected. We loved having the fridge, microwave and coffee machine which gives you the freedom to have a hotel chill night if you’re tired from constant activities. The onsite restaurant and bar is excellent; the room service from the local Route 66 diner was great; the included breakfast less impressive with no plates and very little choice left when we went down halfway through service but that’s not a deal breaker, it’s New York, you can get breakfast anywhere and in fairness if we’d been on a tighter budget we could’ve at least had a bagel at the hotel! The downside was the heating and bedding; a scratchy waffle sheet between two thin sheets which was uncomfortable and an air conditioning unit that sounded like a jet engine and had a blast of artic air surrounding it, even when it was off. The result was that one side of the room was constantly freezing cold and the other too too hot if we put the heat on to try and negate that which isn’t conducive to a decent night’s sleep and is disastrous for your skin. In defence of the hotel, we didn’t bring this up with them, not least because we figured it’s probably the same in all the rooms so we didn’t actually give them a chance to correct it. I’m loathe to be too negative because overall it’s a great little hotel and would certainly become our go-to hotel if the air con was upgraded.

title: Idéalement situé mais sans plus
text: Hôtel très bien situé, personnel correcte. La chambre est telle que sur le site mais pas de sèche-cheveux, savon non renouvelé sans demande de notre part. Pas de chauffage, il a fallu le demander. Nous avons opté pour le petit-déjeuner par facilité mais rien de bien nourrissant ! Le premier jour, déjeuner européen classique mais les autres jours plus de jus, plus de fromage, plus de portions individuelles de confiture ; on met carrément le pot de confiture ou de fromage. Il faut toujours demander de remettre des croissants ou des yaourts sinon le comptoir reste désert.

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed for 2 night here, we went the first night to the reception from 5-6 and had some wine and cheese this is complimentary(awesome). We were upgraded due to being expedia gold, which was very appreciated. The rooms are very nice, beds are comfortable, bathroom was amazing, little kitchen area was handy. Now for the breakfast which was included with the resort fee($30 a day) not such a great deal at all we went the first morning and did not go back. So breakfast they definitely should rethink. All staff was friendly and Yvette at the concierge desk was definitely helpful. Very close to Time Square and a very safe area for walking at all times. We never felt unsafe in the area.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: We stayed for 3 nights and couldn’t fault the hotel at all. Large room with a little kitchenette with a fridge and microwave oven, albeit no kettle. I asked reception for a kettle and had one bought to my room within minutes. Bathroom was decent and bed was very comfortable. Room was cleaned every day and given fresh towels. Everybody in this hotel was so friendly. We only used the bar for a couple of drinks on arrival and found the prices quite reasonable. The location of the hotel is great, a couple of minutes from Times Square. Would definitely recommend

title: Hidden gem in the middle of Times Square
text:
I must say, I'm a bit shocked at my stay at The Belvedere. Not that I was expecting anything bad but it surpassed my expectations indeed.

First off, the staff were extremely accommodating. I had called several days prior and inquired about a potential late check out on my day of departure. Usually hotels cannot offer or promise anything ahead of time due to the forecast of rooms and people may book last minute. However, Irtiza, the Manager on Duty had told me that he would be able to make note in my reservation to extend a complimentary late checkout. I want to thank him for being hospitable and accommodating, even making note of my 1am arrival check in time.

Secondly, the rooms themselves were amazing. The cleanliness factor really stuck out to me. The room was spotless with the proper amount of amenities and towels. There was a small kitchenette area, modern tile bathroom, and the bedroom area was quite large. The bed was comfortable and the heating/ac system worked great.

Lastly, the location. It's a 2 minute walk from the madness and craziness of Times Square but far enough that it provides a calm environment. The area the hotel is in is actually quite quiet compared to a few blocks up near Broadway. It was easy to get Ubers and taxis were outside as well.

I work in a 5-star hotel in the city and was overall impressed with what this hotel had to offer. If I ever had to stay in the city again, I would look here as the prices are fair and competitive to others in the area. The accommodations and presentation of the rooms stuck out to me. Thank you.

title: I came back!
text:
Great hotel well located and close to all you need to be close to in NYC.

Subway is literally around the corner.

Rooms are spacious though heating can be quite noisy.

Bathroom is clean and generators in size.

Staff are great and very helpful!

Will stay here again when I’m next in town!

title: Hotel in NY
text: Great hotel, perfect position, just a few minutes walking from Times Square and the metro station. A very nice and helpful staff. The room was perfect with a complementary little kitchen and all the amenities.

title: situation geographique ideale
text:
Nous avons sejourné en famille avec un nourrisson de 4 mois et un enfant de 5 ans. 
l equipe est tres reactive si il y a un soucis il est reglé dans le quart d heure.
l hotel est vintage mais pas vétuste. tout est entretenu.
il n y a pas de bruit non plus.
le personnel y est tres agréable.
sejour sans accroche

title: CHARMING, CLEAN,  BREAKFAST,  ENJOY THE WINE  TIME...WHERE?
text:
HERE! At a price that doesn't break you. Here's some info for you:
-rooms where clean - sheets and towels can be changed daily upon request
-front desk staff nice and accommodating
-location is an easy walk to Time Square and the Broadway shows 
-the breakfast included was good and had many choices
-free wifi and....
- enjoy the wine on us time..yup..a variety of free wines from 5 to 6  daily 
- people from all over the world stay here

title: Avoid
text:
Good location close to Times Square & theaters. Lots of good restaurants in the area and subway stations are close by. The rooms are comfortable but dated and a bit on the shabby side. The maids were very courteous and accommodated our request for extra towels and blankets. We needed the blankets because the room was cold as there appears to be no central HVAC system. There was no thermostat I could find in the room, just a window A/C unit, but there were air vents in the hallways blowing warm air. They also very helpfully sent up a space heater which we didn't use but it was a nice gesture. The WI-FI is kind of crappy. There is a busy fire station at the corner of 8th & W. 48th. We were woken up several times by the sirens. Breakfast is so-so, bagels & muffins, cereal some fruit and of course coffee & juice. It's included (allegedly) so I suppose you get what you pay for.

I was all set to give a good review until the day of my check out. We walked down to the cafe for breakfast just as we had been doing all week but this time an attendant asked to see my room key. I asked why, and he said something to the effect of "it's busy and we have to make sure other people don't come in." I showed him my key and then he asked if I had a voucher. I said no, we have been getting breakfast here all week and no one had asked for a voucher or a room key until now. He told me I'd need to check with the front desk, so I walked over to it and had a rude encounter with the woman behind it. I told her I needed a breakfast voucher and gave her my room number. She answered that it would be $10. I told her that no, breakfast is included as it clearly states in their Travelocity listing (as of today at least - I have a screen shot). She told me that it was not included and said I could speak to her manager - a classic dodge for service personnel who don't give a s**t and just want to be rid of you. I didn't feel like arguing or speaking to the manager so I just left. It made me angry though that she treated me like some kind of lying freeloader to be gotten rid of rather than a paying guest.

I would have given them 3 stars since the Belvedere is comfortable and convenient despite its shortcomings and considering the price I didn't have high expectations. It's about what you'd expect for what you pay, being one of the less expensive hotels in the area. But I have to take away a star for the inexcusable way I was treated when simply trying to get a cup of their below average coffee and one of their tasteless factory-made muffins before checking out. I will not stay there again.

I'm attaching an image as proof that breakfast is included so maybe the front desk clerk can learn how to do her job.

title: Expect undisclosed fees at checkout
text: Annoying $30 “facility fee” they don’t tell you about until checkout, didn’t use any additional services or anything to justify it, not in prepaid voucher or any paperwork. Room was just ok nothing special at all.

title: Very happy!
text: Cannot fault this hotel at all! When we arrived we had expected a coffee maker in the room but alas there wasn't ☹️ nevermind we went out for a little walk to get our bearings and on returning asked at the desk if there was a possibility of hiring a kettle or something. To our absolute delight we got a room upgrade free of charge! Couldn't thank the man enough!!!! Hotel is spotlessly clean and rooms are of a decent size and with a super comfy bed and a great view! Location is excellent! Highly recommended the zdeli round the corner on 8th ave for breakfast!! Would definitely consider staying here again should we return to New York!

title: Fabulous
text: Spent four days on a birthday weekend. The hotel is in a great location for walking to the sights.  Felt very safe out at night.  The front desk and doorman were friendly, helpful and checked on how we were making out.  Rooms are quiet, clean and have everything you could need.

title: Very mediocre.    Nothing special.
text: It didn’t help that I felt I was “summed up” upon entering the lobby.  Then our “superior room” turned out to be far from “superior”.   I paid the extra $10 bucks for the word “superior”.   Beds were not comfortable, the “luxury linens” were linens.  The “tub and shower” was a spacious shower, no tub.  The people working the breakfast room were nice.  Would I stay again, no reason.  It’s a good location but there are so many hotels to choose from.   I like the ones where I’m greeted with a smile.

title: A good hotel nicely located in Hell's Kitchen. Midtown NYC.
text: I stayed 4 nights at The Belvedere Hotel in the Hell's Kitchen / Midtown area of New York City.  I thought the location was just perfect for me.  A short walking distance of Broadway and Times Square and to be honest if you don't mind walking and the weather is okay (as it was for my stay) you can walk just about all over NYC from this location.  There is also a subway right around the corner from the hotel and a Budget rental car facility a 2 minute walk around the corner in W 49th Street. 9th Avenue with it's many great restaurants is also just a 2 minute walk away.  The room I had (#1102) was on a corner and had views in two directions.  My room was comfortable, clean enough and was well equipped for what I needed.  The internet worked fine about 99% of the time and the shower, refrigerator, heating, TV and lighting were also all good.  There was a safety deposit box in the room but I didn't use it and also a clothes iron.  Staff at the door and front desk were all friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was included in my room rate but I never ate at the hotel, either grabbing something out or giving breakfast a miss in place of a NY brunch.  My 4 night stay with all the taxes; (State Tax, City Tax, NYC Occupancy Tax, NYS Hotel Unit Fee, State Tax Other, City Tax Other and a New Facility Fee, of $30?!), cost US$982 which despite my actual room rate varying from US$125 to US$269 during my stay gave me an 'average' rate of US$245.50 per night, which isn't too bad for NYC.  I would recommend this hotel, mainly for its location and comfort of the room.

title: Mum and daughter trip
text: Hi, my daughter and i stayed in the belvedere for the first time and loved it. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was beautiful, very clean and well stocked with toiletries, coffee etc which was a bonus. The hotel is a great spot, 5 mins from time square so its central to everything. I would definately recommend this hotel to stay and if or when we go back to new york i will be staying in the Belvedere.

title: Belvedere tem um péssimo atendimento e não prestar informações claras
text: Muito ruim. No site do “hotéis.com” informava que café da manhã e Wi-Fi grátis. Mas no momento do check in foi nos cobrada uma taxa de 39 dólares por dia. E para piorar, no café da manhã sequer tinha queijo, prezunto, ovos. Apenas pão e uns sachês de manteiga, cream cheese e geleia. O quarto também cheirava mal.

title: RIP OFF
text: Beware!!!  Old Hotel,  Room too hot, with air conditioner in window.  Too many added charges which are not needed.  $30.00 hidden charge per night for a free breakfast, WIFI, a glass of wine. NOT Needed.  They force you to take it even if you do not want.  So this is not FREE even though they promote it as FREE.   The free so called breakfast is terrible, bagels and juice.  Plus they tax you on the $30.00 even though you paid tax on the entertainment mandatory tax.  Staff does not want to hear anything Antiquated check out.  half hour wait.  Parking was $55.00 when I was told it would be 40.00 Only redeeming factor is the hotel is clean and convenient area.  I will not stay here again.   Too many added hidden charges.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Nos alojamos en una habitación con kitchenette, muy amplia para ser un hotel en Manhattan. Muy bien calefaccionada, limpia y con vista a la calle. La ubicación es excelente, en pleno Times Square. El trato es muy cortés y mucho del personal también habla español. Tuve problemas con internet y como resarcimiento me brindaron el servicio sin costo por el lapso que lo había contratado. Sin dudas lo recomiendo.

title: Management sucks/hidden fees
text:
When I showed up to check out, i was told that there was a fee of $35, first time it was mentioned to me. I obviously said I was not authorizing that payment.

Then they got the manager who came over and pulled out a piece of paper claiming that I signed the paper, I NEVER signed that paper. That was someone else's signature on the paper. I explained that to him he didnt care. Extremely rude on top of this false claim that I signed a contract that I never did.

This hidden fee brings the price up to what the other hotels are in the area. I would just go to one of the others that is actually nice

title: Great Stay!
text:
We were extremely pleased with our stay at the Belvedere hotel.  From the outside of the building, with its beautiful facade, to the well appointed room and lobby we were pleasantly surprised by the 1920's charm of the place. Check in was easy and the staff quiet friendly.  I mentioned it was my boyfriends birthday and was upgraded to the executive king.  The room was a very good sized room for NYC and comfortable.  The only "complaint" we have is that the walls are not sound proof and you can hear pretty much everything in the halls too. 
They offered a free wine hour between 5-6 pm which was a lovely little perk. We also took advantage of the valet parking service which was so convenient for us.  (You pay one price for a 24 hour period).
I would definitely consider staying here again!

title: Steve Ellis
text:
We stay at the Belvedere about every two years when we visit the city to celebrate my wife’s birthday and our anniversary. The service is always outstanding!
This trip we were upgraded to an Executive King when we mentioned our anniversary. David in housekeeping was able to find us the perfect pillows when we had trouble sleeping with the first ones. We both have to have very thin pillows due to neck issues. Everyone on this staff goes to extremes to take care of their guests. The hotel is beautiful, clean and within two blocks of Times Square. But you would never know it because it is so quiet.
The Belvedere is our favorite place to stay of all the places we visit around the country.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: On arrival we found check in to be quick and easy with friendly staff. We went to our room and it was freezing cold. We tried to find a Bar whilst the room warmed but you need to go out. We asked Maintenance eventually and they came straight to our room who said the window was open and adjusted the heating. The following morning we were cold so after a quick visit to reception we told them that the window was broken and kept falling down. The lovely receptionist upgraded our room complementary. The room was fantastic, clean and very comfortable. Every day the hotel has happy hour with complementary wine which was great. The hotel is ideally situated just off Times Square. Fantastic breakfast, very clean, great views of the New York sky line from our room with lovely staff. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend staying at the Belvedere.

title: Sleep deprivation guaranteed but good location
text:
We stayed here for a trip away and we arrived before the room was ready. This was no problem as we were handled well and they offered to take our bags for us. However, upon returning to go to the room the doorman/porter/bellboy refused to allow us to take our own bags. He then carried them to the room and would not leave until we tipped him. However, when he asked for $5 and wouldn't leave until we have this we felt like we'd been held to ransom. We appreciate they work on tips but to not allow the customer any option in what they do or how how much to tip makes the customer experience a very poor one.

The room itself is ok. Bed is comfortable and the rooms are a reasonable size. Unfortunately, the walls/doors are made of paper as you can hear a lot from within the room. Outside noise is low but you can hear other guests talking on their rooms, talking for over one hour at 3am to their friends on their phone and then you have the maids come round to start cleaning rooms. This isn't a problem itself but when they are talking loudly in the corridor with no respect for people who might be asleep you end up with no sleep at all.

The hotel itself is in a great location and you can easily get to all of the sites you'd want to see.

title: Manhattan feels
text:
Love the feel of the hotel , it is my second stay there and once again going there is July 2019
Its in a quiet street and has a few restaurants next door and a deli at the end of the street.
In the heart of Hells Kitchen and all the eatries but tacked away in a quiet street
The 1920s charm is beautiful , great staff at reception and the rooms are so nicely decorated ...Very New York

title: Posizione comoda e pulizia
text: Ho soggiornato con la mia famiglia alcuni giorni in occasione della mezza maratona di marzo 2018. Camere comode e pulite, bagno spazioso, materassi eccezionalmente confortevoli. Personale discreto e gentile. Il plus: tutto il necessario per farsi the e caffè, biscottini e piccola pasticceria a disposizione nelle camere.

title: Best of all worlds!
text: We stayed at the Belvedere overnight because we watched a play on Broadway and it was just perfect. CLOSE TO EVERYTHING and you can’t beat the price!!! The service was great, room was spacious and clean, & bed was comfortable. You really can’t ask for more. We self parked our car in a lot a block away and paid $40 which is the flat daily rate when staying at the hotel. Not bad if you ask me! The only reason I do not give it a 5 star review is because the tub did not drain well while showering and the toilet was quite small - all minor problems. I would definitely stay here again in the future!

title: Lovely little hidden gem!
text:
Me and my husband stayed January 21st - 28th this year and absolutely loved every minute. We arrived at the hotel in the evening around 7 and were greeted by the hotel staff who were all very friendly and welcoming throughout the trip. 

We had previously messaged the hotel asking for a room higher up if possible so we could have a nice view of the city. When we arrived we were told we had been put on the top floor. We were so excited and then got up to our room which was clean and comfortable. The bed was perfect really comfy and lots of room! The view from our room was amazing and it was nice and warm with the weather outside being -10c on arrival.

There was a TV, hairdryer and ironing board with iron. A safe for your valuables and a fridge and microwave in the kitchen (although there didn't seem to be any plates/cutlery). We did get some cutlery from reception one evening after a long day and decided to get Chinese to take back to the room. 

Towels were changed daily and they supply you with soap, shampoo and conditioner.

The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect. Just twenty seconds around the corner from times Square but tucked away from all the noise. We did hear sirens from our hotel room but they are so loud it would be hard to avoid in any local hotel! 

We were just a ten minute walk from the Gershwin theatre to see wicked, about a fifteen minute walk to Madison Square garden to see the Knicks play and a small shop right on the corner should you need anything.

We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant unfortunately mainly because of the price but it did look lovely and had we had more spending money we would have gone down. We did try the breakfast which was fine but I would highly recommend the times Square diner literally right around the corner for breakfast. 

If ever I go back to New York I would without a doubt book to stay at the belvedere hotel. All of the staff are very hard working,friendly and helpful. Thank you for such a lovely stay.

title: I’d definitely come back
text:
Hells Kitchen is a great place to stay in NY. And The Belvedere is a fine place to stay. Rooms are very spacious and clean . A little tired but don’t let this out you off as I’d definitely come back.

Great location and easily within walking distance to Times Square if that’s your thing.

title: Best hotel in the city!
text: I absolutely adore The Belvedere! My best friend and I have come almost every December since 2005 and wouldnt stay anywhere else. The staff is fabulous and the breakfast is the best, such a selection. This is our home away from home!

title: The location is fine, but it's rough around the edges
text:
My wife and I did an overnight in NYC and just needed a room near the Broadway show we were seeing. The Belvedere had decent reviews and seemed affordable. I will say that there were some solid things: it's in a great location off of Broadway and Times Square, close to several theatres and restaurants. There is a wine happy hour from 5pm to 6pm (though the wine is mouth puckering sweet). Though we didn't use them, they did have facilities on site like restaurants and a gym. The staff were kind, too.

For the not so great: the first is the facility fee. Perhaps this is a standard in New York, but it seems affordable comparably until the $20 facility fee is tacked on. It raised the price quite significantly. In addition, the elevator situation is HORRIBLE. I believe there are elevators on either end, but no one used them. The two you see central in the lobby are what everyone uses, and to get up or down from our room was a ridiculous nightmare. The morning we departed, we left our room at exactly 9:00am. We didn't get to the lobby until 9:11am. Spend 11 minutes in an elevator, especially small one. It's not fun. One elevator clearly wasn't working. There needs to be signs directing people to other elevators, especially for a narrow, tall building where elevator are basically your only option.

In addition, the rooms look nice, but the edges are rough. The commons areas could use a clean. We also were on the street, and even 10 floors up, it was loud. The windows were flimsy and leaky. We stuck a pillow in the window to stop a fairly bad draft.

In total, this is probably a 3 1/2 star, but for the area and the other hotel options, they need to raise their game a little. I would probably find another option in the area, but for a short stay, this will probably work.

title: Great Hotel
text: We have stayed here many times great location. Couple blockers anyway and your in the heart of anything you want. Great staff nice little wine tasting every evening if that is your thing. Restaurant is very nice also

title: SUPERIOR SERVICE AND STAFF
text:
When in New York the only place we stay is at the Belvedere Hotel! Why? It's conveniently located to restaurants, theater and the sights. The staff is top notch. The rooms are spot on with a small galley consisting of a Microwave and Refrigerator. They even have an area downstairs to do your own laundry.

Can't wait to visit NY again to experience THE BELVEDERE HOTEL!

title: Overnight stay
text:
This is our second time staying at this hotel.
Check in was easy and we got upgraded to a better room.
Our room was on the 3rd floor. Was a little concerned at first since the room was right next to the elevators. But this was not a problem. Did not hear the elevator at all.
Got to enjoy the free happy hour for a nice glass of wine.
You cant beat the location. So close to Times Square and a short walk from Penn Station.
Will definitely be back for future stays

title: Good location
text: Reasonably priced, and away from all the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  Reminds me of a1950 hotel.  We couldn’t control the heat, so had maintenance turn it off as too warm, but turned bitter cold and cold air comes right in through the windows.  Pretty clean but also pretty dusty.  Won’t change ur sheets unless u leave card on pillow, beds not the most comfortable.  Close to restaurants, etc.

title: Tourist hotel in NYC's theater district shows it age -- and attitude!
text:
Hmmm....It's like a very low-end Holiday Inn. The rooms are small but functional, and if you absolutely need to be in the theater district -- and you have no other option -- then this will suffice.
It's kind of old, but not in a charming way, and it actually reminded me of that weird John Cusac movie where he's dared to stay in that creepy hotel. Needless to say, I was not at all impressed with the rooms, and even less impressed by the price I paid for my stay -- but look, you don't go to New York City to sit in a cramped hotel room, right?
My point is, there are much better values in this neighborhood; I know because I've  stayed at them. I suppose I waited to the last minute and was stuck with what was available. But If you're paying more than $150 for this room, shop around; a block or two away will give you a better view, a bigger room, and a nicer bed.

****And for the record, if you're staying at this hotel and want to store your luggage for later on the day of your check out, and you're already in the lobby with your bags, you tip the person who retrieves your bags WHEN YOU COME BACK, not the guy who accepts them at the lobby (and only if you are so inclined). *****

title: Charming hotel.
text: The Belvedere is a delightful hotel, located close to restaurants, shopping, public transport and tourist attractions such as Times Square and Broadway. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the heating works well and wifi is included. As a solo woman travelling, I want to feel safe and secure. The hotel desk is manned 24/7, staff are very accommodating and helpful. I love the location and quality of service that the Belvedere Hotel provides, which is why I am a repeat customer.

title: They have work to do.
text: We have been staying here for several years now, and I love the location. Unfortunately, each time we come, there are a couple things that should’ve probably had attention. This time around first and foremost, the shower going from freezing cold to burning hot is to say the least uncomfortable. They also now charge a $20 per day “hotel services charge “ for things like wi-fi. It wasn’t a deal breaker but that was new since last year.

title: 1st time in NYC
text: My partner and I travelled to NYC for the first time in Jan, we stayed at this hotel.. I found it to be perfect in every way, I have read that the rooms are dated, not sure I agree, this was somewhere clean, and comfy to lay our heads, the location is just fab, come out the hotel, take left, top of the street you see the large M&M from there its left to Broadway, or right to Times Square, its ideal, and some.. There was noise but hey you in NYC of-course there is street noise.  The reception, concierge, housekeepers all do a fantastic job of running this place...  Nothing was a bother to them at all ... I plan to visit NYC  again as Im now smitten, this hotel will be my place to stay when I do ...  Cant praise them enough

title: Plus jamais...
text:
Séjour en famille 5 nuits, horrible, chambres vétustes au 16 et 17ème étages, saletés, moisissures, bruits, pas de chauffage, pas d insonorisation, pas de changement des draps, pas de produits de toilettes, nettoyage quotidien fait à 40%,travaux dans l hôtel avec des produits nocifs,chambres très petites, lit et salle de bain, malgré une réservation chambre de luxe king size, pas sèche cheveux,pas de pommeaux de douche, clim très très bruyante... La liste est encore longue. Malgré nos remarques à la réception et à l agence connection qui nous a vendu le sejour, à ce jour personnes ne reconnaît la réalité de nos conditions de séjour.
Aujourd'hui, je décide de saisir la commission des litiges voyages et test achat. J ai payé 6000€ pour 4 personnes, nous avions le droits à de la qualité.

title: Una semana y alojada en el hotel belvedere de Nueva York
text: Mi opinión de el hotel Belvedere de Nueva York está en una calle tranquila per muy cerca de Times Square de la 5 avenida. El hotel es tipo aparta hotel. Cuenta con una pequeña cocina muy útil a la hora de poder desayunar en la habitación o incluso cenar si estás cansada. Esta limpio y el servicio es muy atento

title: Calm, good food
text: This hotel is a perfect place to be because of the proximity of Broadway to go to the show , and time square for the shops. Very calm , if you(re above 9 floor , that was my case. I also enjoy the fitness room ,

title: Stunning & Styling
text: Absolutely loved this place as it was very artistically decorated with an old school 20's vibe while retaining all the modern touches one needs and seeks in any lodging facilities. The staff was super friendly and the support was great.

title: totally recommend
text: it was a very nice room with an awesome price and the location was perfect literally a 3 min walk to time square. If we go back to NYC I will be staying here for sure. the room was cute I have been to NYC a few times and this was my fav room not so small like others (however it is NYC so obviously it is not a huge room) The bathroom was nice and had a cute mini fridge and the staff was really friendly.

title: Location is the only thing its got
text: The local is fantastic & the staff are nice but aside from that, don't expect much from this hotel.  It's run down and slightly nasty.  There was so much dust in the vents  the ac unit (which was held in with plywood) it literally was clogged.  Less than zero water pressure in the showers which because of the dust/dirt in the vent the shower wall was permanently black.  They starch and bleach the sheets so much it felt like sleeping on paper.

title: Great location, hotel left me wanting more
text: We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and were able to park our car with them and leave our bags for the day, which was a nice plus. The hotel was very centrally located, but not on too busy a street making it easy to get around. However, the stay at the hotel left more to be desired. While the view was good, the decor in the rooms made me feel like I was in 1980. Perhaps the worst part of the stay were extra fees. Given what we were paying for the room, I was surprised to have to pay by day to park my car with them, and they also topped it with a facility fee.

title: The perfect hotel!
text: Have had the pleasure of staying at the Belvedere quite a few times, and always perfect. The location, the rooms and staff always the best. Kitchenette very helpful too. Can’t wait to go back. So close to subways and many popular nyc attractions

title: Time square
text:
What a great location next to time square and 100 of restaurants around it .
We were able to walk to see the ball drop and see Hamilton besides the Rockefeller center, Central Park and all other tourist spots in manhattan .
Hotel rooms were comfortable and had all basic necessities.
Will highly recommend this jewel

title: Great hotel
text: This is a small hotel really in good position near times square. The staff friendly. Rooms were adequate and clean. Would stay here again. Lots of restaurants nearby but there is a good restaurant in the hotel. This hotel is close to theatre district. It is just off the busy streets. We found it easy to walk to all the attractions. The only down side of the hotel was the noise outside especially sirens. But I think this would be wherever you stayed. Good value hotel for money.

title: Belvedere NYC
text: I frequently visit NYC 3-4 times a year for the last 6 years. This was the absolute worst hotel i have ever stayed at! The staff was so rude I literally thought I was on the tv show punked! No room service. No bar . Rooms are very dated but staff was unbelievably rude ! I would never stay there again even if it was free! Only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location

title: Love this hotel
text: I recently stayed for my third visit in 3 years. The staff is friendly. The rooms are a bit dated but always clean and the beds are very comfy. It's very close to Times Square but far enough that can walk out of the hotel without getting immediately jostled by crowds of people. It's very close to the Theaters so if you are seeing a show it's a perfect location. There are also close subway stops. They did a wine hour in the evening which was nice and unexpected. Would highly recommend to travelers interested in being close to Times Square.

title: Udmærket og centralt beliggende hotel
text:
Selve hotellet var ganske udmærket. Man skal dog være opmærksom på at der kan vlre særdeles meget støj fra gaden her. Brandstationen på 8th ligger lige op ad, så husk ørepropper til natten 😉 men så sover man til gengæld også rigtig godt, da sengene er gode.
Det er muligt at få morgenmad med 15% rabat i hotellets restaurant og den er super fin.
Der ligger shops kun få minutter fra hotellet og alt er i en gåafstand indenfor 15-20 min. i midten af Manhattan.

title: Very good but have to go for the deluxe room
text: Stayed The Belvedere for 8 nights, originally we were booked into a standard room (booked by a travel agent) but found this to be very worn and not comfortable, the bathroom in particular was tiny. The following day I went downstairs to pay for an upgrade given we were there for another week, the very kind staff upgraded us free of charge. The room we were upgraded to was significantly better, roomy with nicer furniture, a more comfortable bed and a much larger bathroom, this is why I am giving it 4 stars, the standard room was more 2.5/5. The hotel is in a great location if you want to do the touristy things, it is very close to Time Square, a short walk to the Rockefeller Centre and only a 15-20min walk to Central Park with many subway stops close by; as this was my partners first time in NYC she wanted to do ‘everything’ so the location worked well. The staff are very friendly and there is a happy hour of free wine every night from 5pm-6pm, this is a great offer but if you love wine these wines probably won’t appeal to you. One lift appeared to be broken when we were there as only one worked which made things a little slow. Overall this hotel gets 4 stars based on the deluxe room and the location, it is well priced but you may find better nearby.

title: Great Place!
text: I love this place! I’ve stayed here 3 years in a row at this time and the stay has always been wonderful. Quick checkin and off to my 17th floor (top floor) room. As usual everything was great. Hot hot water comfortable bed, great coffee machine and fabulous views of Times Square. A quick walk to most broadway shows. The service is great, from the warm welcome to the lovely ladies looking after my room. See you next year! 🍺

title: Great hotel!
text:
