This hotel is only 1.5 block to Times Square, was super clean, and the room had good space, not too small as other hotels. Check in was so fast, no matter we arrived on December 31st. 
We stayed in a 2 bedrooms and everything was perfect!

title: All our needs were met
text:
We are a family of four that spent the holidays and new years in NY. 12 nights at Belvedere. Good experience, happy with all service and staff. Good location to various activities and sights.
Recommend this hotel and we would stay there again.

title: location location location
text:
excellent location close to times square
the hotel is comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpful 
the hotel is and old world charm 
the bathroooms are nice similar to most new york hotels overall good experince at the belvedere

title: Smelly Old Hotel
text: Apparently guest are allowed to cook in their rooms so hallways smell of various foods.  Elevator is tiny.  You must run the air conditioner constantly in the winter if you don't want to roast.  There is no thermostat in the room.  Rooms are run down.  Spend a little more money to get something much better.

title: Sympa
text: Super bien situé près de Time square et accessible depuis l’aéroport avec la ligne E. Accueil sympa sans plus. Chambre familiale confortable mais les lits étaient vraiment étroits dommage.Petit déjeuner sympa et varié ( œufs, lards, panecake, Bagels, croissants).  Les taxes étaient vraiment élevées. On avait réservé via voyage privé et on nous a réclamé 20 eur par jour soit tout de même 120 eur en tout pour internet, concierge, et apéro de 5 à 6h. Il paraît que c’est normal mais moi je ne trouve pas...

title: So nice we came back twice
text:
Listen, there are certainly fancier hotels, we’ve stayed in them.  However, if
you’re looking for a nice place to stay, with some great amenities and central location, The Belvedere is awesome!  The executive rooms feature the wireless internet (good speed) included, as well as a Keurig Coffee Maker, K-Cups, and to-go cups.  Worth the little extra.  Can easily grab anything else you need from the grocery or deli around the corner.  Wine reception each evening was nice.  Z’s deli around the corner is absolutely outstanding for breakfast or any meal of the day to grab and go, and Pattzeria Family and Friends is hard to beat for neighborhood Italian.  Have stayed at the Belvedere for one week in March and one week in November (thanksgiving).  Close proximity to parade route.

title: Super hotel, gerne wieder
text:
Bin zum zweiten mal im Hotel und finde es liegt einfach super und es ist vom Preis her okey. Die Zimmer sind super und von beiden Male hatte ich immer einen guten Ausblick. Die Strasse ist "ruhig" für new york und somit ist für mich das Hotel in einer super Lage. Toller Service vom Zimmer her sowie unten an der Anmeldung. 
Gerne wieder

title: Great location and price
text: Nice sized room with comfy beds. Quaint Art Deco feeling to this hotel just a couple of blocks away from Times Square. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful with walking directions to nearby tourist spots.

title: Hmm - quaint and a great position, but
text: Every day we returned to our room, the door key card failed. On one occasion, twice just after having them activated again. We are here for a week (two rooms) and the gloss is coming off. Dirty corners, odd fitments...

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel in a Quiet Street
text: My family enjoys staying at Belvedere hotel when in NYC. While the general area is busy, the hotel is located in a (relatively) quiet street. It is also a short walk to our favorite ramen place, Totto Ramen. The decor is a little dated but the rooms are clean. The bathroom has a real door that locks and not one of those sliding doors that does not offer much privacy. Mom's Kitchen and Bar at the end of the street is a great place to eat.

title: Great location but very disappointed with hotel
text: The hotel is in a great location. It is close to Times Square. Few things which caused this hotel to receive a bad rating; one - the hotel room was large but not clean. There was hair all over the floor. We also received a room by the elevator which was not a prime location if you are traveling with small children. Lastly, the offer a buffet breakfast for 20 dollars  per person. Save your money. The bagels and bread had mold on them. We ended up leaving and still having to pay. When I told the front desk at check out, they advised that their baked goods get delivered fresh everyday. This is clearly not true. Also, the server behind the counter was too busy eating and drinking coffee. Not a great deal of professionalism. As a result, we will never be patrons of this hotel.

title: Great Location near Times Square and Rockefeller Center
text:
My husband and I stayed at The Belvedere for a quick weekend trip to NYC.  I was very happy with our stay overall.  We arrived about minutes before check in and our room was not ready.  The bellhop stored our bags and we set out to find lunch based on the suggestions from Frank at the front desk.  He was very nice and gave us a few different options on which way to go.  Each staff member we encountered was polite and helpful. 

Once we were able to check into the room, we found an updated, very clean and tastefully decorated room.  It was bigger than expected (the last time I was in NYC, our room was tiny!).  There was a small "kitchenette" area with a microwave, Keuring Coffee maker, sink and small fridge.  There was large closet with plenty of hangers, robes and a safe.  The bed was comfortable.  The bathroom was small, but the shower was a large walk-in (not a tub, which I liked) that appeared to recently updated.  The head was in the ceiling, rain water style, which I did not like. There was no pressure and I had to use the hand held nozzle to wet and rinse my hair.  

There is a facility fee of $20.00+ tax per day to cover the WiFi, wine social hour and some other amenities.  I did not feel this fee was out of line.  I wish we would have been around during the social hour to enjoy some wine.  

The location is great, just a few minutes to Times Square and walking distance to many attractions.  There is a subway access just around the corner and many, many restaurants.

I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Good hotel with a great location
text:
Stayed at this hotel from 7th-12th December, all in all this was a great hotel for our 1st trip to New York. Hotel is located within a 5 minute walk of times square and only 10 mins from things like Rockefeller centre and 15 mins from Empire State building and Macy's. The hotel room was very spacious and very comfortable. Bathroom was a bit dated but again was clean and tidy and done the job. The only thing that we would have liked that wasn't offered in our level of room was tea & coffee making facilities.  

Would recommend and would stay in this hotel again

title: IL EST AU TOP même à 94 ans
text:
Sacré découverte que cet hôtel finalement bien placé au niveau de la 48th street et la 8th avenue, Il est très propre, bien équipé et entretenu, les chambres sont spacieuses et disposent de vues magnifique sur les étages supérieurs aussi bien coté 48th que coté 47th, le personnel en place est très disponible, compétent et à l’écoute.
Les isolations phoniques sont bonnes et les clims un peu bruyante.
L’Hôtel dispose de tous les services d’un hôtel de ce niveau et pratique un rapport qualité prix performant. Pour nous à part la taxe quotidienne service WIFI et prestations spécifiques rien à redire. 
Ici l’équipe est professionnelle.
Le restaurant de l’hôtel Churrascaria Plataforma entité indépendante propose un concept Brésilien grill à la broche et buffet et un bar où l’on peut déguster des cocktails. Nous avons trouvé l’accueil du maître des lieux un peu condescendante, nous n’étions pas en tenue de soirée !
Si nous le pouvons, nous reprendrons cet Hôtel lors de nos prochains voyages sur Manhattan

title: Little gem
text:
This is our last night staying at the Belvedere and I can say is that it’s been brilliant.
Booked a superior 2 double bedded room (room 1007) for my son and myself. Everything is clean and tidy, rooms made up everyday. Reception staff very friendly. We booked for 5 nights but WiFi (which came free with the price of booking) ran out 24hrs before we are due to leave. But I spoke to a gentleman on reception and he extended to our full booking time.
Would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC as it’s an ideal location for Times Square and other sights.
Will be sorry to depart in the morning.
Thank you to all at The Belvedere 
Regards
Christine & Lewis Morgan

title: Excellent Location
text:
Stayed here with my husband for 5 nights in the build up to Christmas. Staff were friendly and welcoming and the room was clean and comfortable. 
Unfortunately I had the most horrendus cold on my trip to new York and one thing I really looked forward to when I checked in was a flu remedy drink to my suprise there was no drink making facilities in the room, however a quick call later and a kettle was on its way up to the room. 
The selection of breakfast was excellant and you can not beat it for location with only a short walk to times square, m&m store and the grey hop on hop off busses start literally at the end of the block. Close central park and Rockefeller centre meaning a short walk a few blocks over to see the tree was a lovely day to spent the evening. Lots of places to eat in all directions. I would love to stay here again

title: Christmas in New York 2018
text: This was our third year in a row to stay at the Belvedere Hotel. It’s close to all the tourist attractions but not too close to all the noise in Times Square. The rooms are clean, excellent staff & excellent restaurant. We’re visiting New York in 2019 & plan to stay at the Belvedere again.

title: This is a very nice hotel
text: The location is absolutely perfect for the theatre district and Times Square. It's a small hotel and quite old but it has retained its dignity and charm. Everything is old and definitely not modern but it is clean and well looked after. The food was good, the service was excellent and the rooms are nice. My only complaint would be the cost and choice of breakfasts.  Essentially, there was very little choice.  Either an overpriced continental or an extremely overpriced full breakfast ($19 if I recall correctly) for a selection from vats of mass produced eggs and potatoes.

title: NYC BDay weekend
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location. You can walk to Times Square, theater district, Fifth Avenue shops, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick’s cathedral etc. I had planned this trip for my bday months in advance and wasn’t sure where to book a hotel. I knew I needed something centrally located so I could walk to everything but still wanted something safe and comfortable since I was traveling on my own. I felt very safe and loved the comfy accommodations and complimentary wine happy hour nightly. Staff was very friendly. Should I do this bday trip again to nyc I will certainly consider staying at the Belvedere Hotel again.

title: Poor
text:
Location good
Cleanliness good
Staff average
Elevators very poor
Heater in room sounded like a jackhammer every time it started
Shower - tub fills with water by the time you are done showering. Does not drain. 
Beds are very soft so not good for your body. 
One and done for this place. Will not repeat.

title: Ideal location
text: This was the second time I have stared at the Belevder Hotel, my last visit was about a decade ago.  Obviously a serious make-over had taken place and the facilities and rooms were much improved.  The staff were attentive, polite and helpful.  Hotel is ideally located for Times Square and the theatre land.

title: Great Location
text: Pros: Great location, cocktail hour serving wine, gym, small kitchenette with microwave.. Steps to subway, shops, Rockefeller Centre, Saks, Times Square, Broadway. Cons: Noisy HVAC system that rattles loudly disrupting sleep. The maid left my door open! I appreciated the compensation for the malfunctioning HVAC and lapse of security.

title: Ok
text:
Negatives first...
First arrived... rude man on the desk when we wanted to know more on the $160 facility fee as we HAD to pay it regardless! We Was not made aware of it and quite frank absolutely pointless as we didn’t use nothing off it! 

Concierge helped when we arrived with luggage and then after that concierge who?? 
Not once did they ever open the door for us they just stood about. 

The room: we had to ask for a kettle, cups and spoons... it has a kitchen but yet only a microwave? So yeah totally not helpful! 
Beds were ok.. bit hard but that’s just a risk you take when sleeping away from home.
Heating was way too hot.. they turned it down but it was still way too hot and had air con on every night. 

Badly stained bath and hairs on tiles

Watch out for the step bit between the floors as through the night you forget and bang your toes! 
Fridge had no light and part of the inside racking missing. 

Good points
Tv
Maid came in everyday 
Good location 
Deli round the corner had nice food for lunch!
Mamas down the road did a fab breakfast! 
One male member of staff on the front desk was sooo funny he kept my dad talking over an hour just talking about everything, it was good knowledge and he was so kind and helpful. 
Safe in room
Toilet flush is amazing in New York! Haha 

I wouldn’t come back to this hotel I would certainly upgrade if I ever came back to New York in the future. But that’s just MY opinion and not everybody agrees but each to their own and that’s my view.

title: Great sleep
text: This hotel was a superb find .I loved the 1920s look of it .it was clean and very nice size for me and my daughter we each had a double bed to ourselves.the beds were so comfy we were fast asleep for a good 10-12 hours a night. Very snug .there were no kettles available for me but I asked for two mugs for our room and was able to boil water in the microwave in the mugs so we could enjoy our coffee that I bought in my suitcase .the staff were friendly and helpful. We loved our stay.they kindly held our bags for free after checkout so we could spend one more afternoon shopping before going back to the airport. Would not hesitate to stay again.Thankyou to the staff at belvedere.

title: Good Hotel in a good location
text: stayed here with friends as we toured the sites of NYC. Hotel was clean, room spacious for NYC, and the staff are friendly and very helpful. Hotel is within walking distance.to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Intrepid and Cruise line ships. Also two blocks from convenient uptown and downtown subways.

title: Great hotel good location
text: Stayed here for 6 nights 24th Dec with hubby and granddaughter.  Lovely spacious room with kitchenette and a fab view of the city.never tried the breakfast as granddaughter is really picky ! But did pop in restaurant to have a look and a good selection available . Got a chance to see Bruce Springsteen coming out of the theatre he was playing in which is just a block away . Added bonus . Also little corner shop near by if needed . Over a lovely hotel and would definatly recommend

title: Albergo stupendo 😍😍😍
text: Ho soggiornato con mio marito e mio figlio di 6 anni  per una settimana dal 28/11al 5/12. Mi sono trovata benissimo ,albergo pulito ,posizione eccellente , disponibili su tutto . All’interno del locale c’è un ristorante brasiliano dove si mangia molto bene . Vacanza stupenda ... lo consiglio a tutti 😍😍😍

title: Buena relación precio calidad
text: Camas cómodas y habitaciones espaciosas para  NY, buena ubicación cercana al metro y la atención es muy buena.  Hay gran variedad de restaurantes en la zona y está a unas cuadras de Times Square y la zona de teatros.

title: A nice hotel in a great location
text:
The Belvedere hotel is a lovely Art Deco hotel within a couple of minute walk of the Theatre district, Time Square and many others.
The rooms are of a very good standard and most of the staff are very very helpful however, the hotel does not deliver on the website promises.
We were a family of 5 inc a child of 7, the site promised coffee makers in every room.  My wife and I were lucky to be upgraded (the hotel obviously wanted the larger and lees equipped rooms)to a room with a very large bed and coffee machine but the other room had nothing but a microwave!!! My wife asked for coffee making equipment for the other room and after much to and fro over "but you were upgraded" and "I'm intrigued by which website you saw that on" they delivered a kettle to the room.
There is a cafe onsite offering free coffee from 06:30 - 11-30 and a buffet breakfast for $19.95 per head.  There is also a restaurant offering all you can eat buffet at $65 per head.
We were there for 5 nights and loved it.  The things mentioned were easily remedied.
We would stay there again.
One word of warning and not for the hotel.  The cost of food and drink is extortionate, £10 for a small glass of wine and $15 - 20 for a burger and chips.  Pay for attraction passes in advance and save lots of money.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo alloggiato in quest’hotel con degli amici quest’estate ed è stato un soggiorno piacevolissimo. La posizione è strategica, a due passi da time square e, per me che adoro girare New York a piedi, posizionato in modo da raggiungere facilmente molti posti . Le camere confortevoli, dotate di un piccolo angolo per la colazione. Una lavanderia posizionata al piano interrato e il ristorante brasiliano in hotel buonissimo. Lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Surprising
text:
We had  very good experience with this hotel. 
Great location , just few minutes from Time’s square ,Rokcefeler Center, Fifth Ave ,etc..
Clean and very comfortable room, with microwave and refrigerator . Friendly and helpful staff.
Very good option

title: Very Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, and Awesome Location
text: We stayed here for three nights the week before Thanksgiving.  The location is excellent and convenient to Times Square and the Theater District.  They have free wi-fi and computer access with a printer.  The staff was always very helpful and valet parking was cheaper than most garages in the area (albeit parking in NYC is not cheap).  We walked everywhere and loved staying here because of the location.  Definitely worth a try.

title: Fast perfekter Hotelaufenthalt
text:
Für unseren ersten New York Städtetrip haben wir uns für das Belvedere Hotel entschieden. Zum einen aufgrund des noch günstigen Preises im Vergleich zu anderen Hotels und natürlich der unglaublich guten Lage zum Times Square.

Bei Ankunft mit unserem Shuttle vom Flughafen Newark wurden wir vom Portier sofort in Empfang genommen, die Türen aufgehalten und die Koffer abgenommen. Hier hatte ich anderes erwartet, aufgrund einiger Bewertungen, aber bei uns war alles prima.
Die Dame an der Rezeption war sehr freundlich, man blockte 300 Dollar auf der Kreditkarte als Sicherheit und wollte pro Tag eine Resortfee von ca 20 $ erheben. Da ich dies schon gelesen hatte, mich bei meinem Veranstalter FTI auch erkundigt hatte, wusste ich, dass diese Resortfee ( und damit auch das WLAN) bereits im Reisepreis enthalten ist. Dies teilte ich der Dame mit und damit war das Thema auch schon erledigt. Also aufgepasst und vorher nachgefragt,  ich denke viele werden sich überrumpeln lassen ;-)

Das Zimmer war sehr nett, gut natürlich in die Jahre gekommen, aber sauber und praktisch. Die Fenster ließen sich etwas öffnen, so dass man auch mal frische Luft bekam. Da wir in der ersten Nacht gefroren haben, haben wir am nächsten Morgen um Decken gebeten, die wir auch prompt bekamen. Gleichzeitig bot man uns an, dass ein Hausmeister nach der Heizung schaut. Als wir abends ins Hotel zurückkehrten, war uns Zimmer gemütlich warm.

Wir haben nur am ersten Morgen im Hotel gefrühstückt, es war ausreichend, aber keine Offenbarung. Wir haben festgestellt, dass egal wo man letztendlich frühstückt - es ist nicht einfach unter 20 Dollar pro Person auszukommen. New York ist einfach nun mal extrem teuer. 

Das Belvedere Hotel würden wir jederzeit wieder buchen, die Lage ist einfach super und das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis wirklich in Ordnung.

title: A Perfect Boutique Hotel
text:
My recent stay at the Belvedere Hotel started off pitch perfect when a solicitous, well dressed hotel manager pleasantly greeted me, reviewed my existing reservation and then somewhat surprisingly, offered me an upgrade to a larger and much better suited hotel room! Within seconds after appropriately thanking him, I was inside a well preserved landmark antique hotel elevator being transported to my newly assigned room, which was located on a top floor of this architecturally vintage boutique hotel. Upon opening the hotel room door and laid out in front of me, was a smartly and tastefully designed, standard sized NYC hotel room along with a window view! Just past the entrance way, I noticed a modern kitchenette that included, a set of cabinets, a built in under counter stainless steel refrigerator, a dark granite counter top, a small round stainless steel sink with matching faucet, a fairly decent coffee maker and a working microwave. In addition, I noticed cutlery, stemware, plates and napkins for a small intimate gathering of possibly three persons as well as a few kitchen-must essentials such as a cork screw, a large ice bucket, a medium sized serving bowl and a large serving tray all in stainless steel! Walking through to the bedroom area I pass a large two door hall closet with a long hanging rack, open drawer shelves, iron, ironing board, wall safe and two white cotton signature hotel bathrobes. Standing now in  front of a king sized bed, which looks extremely comfortable, well made, most inviting and overall, it definitely is large enough for two persons! I then look at the separate pristine bathroom off the bedroom that is perfectly designed yet a little small in overall size.  My week long stay went very well and I must  mention that this hotel serves a terrifically bountiful daily buffet breakfast with enough food selections to please all patrons so this “wow factor”  is definitely worth making the effort to get up for!  In addition, please note that kids will very much enjoy all the breakfast selections, especially the waffles and pancakes! 

In summation: this hotel establishment is supremely run, offers very good accommodations and is located in close proximity to all Broadway theaters. The entire staff at this hotel all worked most assiduously to accommodate me as well as all of its guests which is why I certainly will be booking a new reservation here sometime soon. The only drawback  the facility fee charge (50% of the total room charge), however, I would not necessarily hold it against them as there are so many other NYC hotels that I like as well that charge a daily facility fee. Therefore, as a a caveat to all when booking a room at any NYC hotel please be on the lookout for this sometimes “hidden” charge. I do highly recommend staying at this hotel especially because the entire staff treated me with such enormous respect, which is exactly the way I, as well as all other hotel patrons, like to be spoken to. Special mention to the entire management team for accommodating my requests  while I stayed at the very lovely, hospitable, civilized and memorable,  Belvedere hotel. Jeff M. 

P.s. For those readers wondering…there is no relation, whatsoever, between the “Belvedere” hotel in NYC and the best selling “Belvedere” Polish rye vodka that is produced and distributed by LVMH! 

Footnote: The author of this review has been living without an apartment since early February 2018 and therefore felt that having a small kitchenette in a hotel room where he was staying was probably the most welcomed addition he could ever possibly ask for! 🎃

title: Central location
text: Great hotel, in the Theatre District and close to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre. Only about 6 blocks to Central Park.Only issue is slow Wi-fi and now they are charging extra for it which makes no sense.  Loved the complimentary wine at 5 PM.

title: Belvedere Hotel - a great experience!
text: We stayed at the Belvedere for three nights during a brief trip in November. I absolutely loved it. Most importantly to me,  it was very clean, spacious and updated. Very nice amenities and friendly staff. The bed was very comfortable.  Never visiting the city before, we didn’t realize until we got there how conveniently located the hotel was to many attractions. It was close to the train station, right next to all the theaters, and  a short walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. And it was better priced than many other hotels I looked at. I wasn’t sure exactly what we would get once we arrived but I was exceptionally pleased and will be sure to stay at the Belvedere on my next trip to NYC as well!

title: A great find, you won't regret!
text: We spent 5 nights at the Belvedere Hotel and we so pleased with this hidden gem! The rooms were a great size and nicely appointed. The staff was very helpful and attentive.  The happy win hour is a nice bonus as well! :)  There are a few long time, grandfathered residences  there too which I think only adds to this property.  We would happily stay again and have already recommended to others!  We'll be back Belvedere!

title: Second stay at this hotel
text: Far cry from the first stay which was ten years earlier. In need of some renovations.  The best thing about this hotel was location. Staff were excellent. Rooms were clean.  Lack of electrical outlets.  What they did have was away from the desk. No place to lay phones and iPads while charging. Two of us shared a room and there was only one chair so that left one of us sitting on the bed in the evening.  Spent five nights.  Washroom had poor ventilation.  Steamed up after showering.  Taps seized up in tub and couldn’t adjust from hot to cold .  Had to call maintenance.  They quickly came and fixed it.

title: Prima locatie, schitterend hotel voor een citytrip.
text:
Voor een citytrip is dit hotel schitterend gelegen, dicht bij de meeste bezienswaardigheden in New York. Vele van deze bezienswaardigheden zijn op wandelafstand. 
Het hotel is netjes, de kamers zijn zeer proper en het personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam.

title: Holiday with my daughter
text: Went to New York to celebrate my 60th and my daughters 30th birthdays, stayed for 5 nights on the 16th floor great view and good location so close to everything but really quiet of a night. Lovely breakfast as well very friendly staff.

title: Great location close to Times Square.
text:
We have just returned from a five night stay. We arrived in the  snow storm and  spent four and a half hours in a taxi, not a good start . The treatment that we received from staff at the Belvedere more than made up for this. 

The room was beautiful very spacious and spotlessly clean. The facilities in the hotel were fantastic we had the contintial breakfast the first morning and it was so nice and such good value that we went back every morning . All the staff are a credit to the hotel and nothing is too much trouble . When we arrived we didn’t have a coffee machine and we asked if we could hire one.we were adivised that the room we stayed in didn’t have facilities for a coffee machine however we could have a kettle. We were surprised at how quick this was arranged and we were provided with tea bags,sugar, milk and cups. 

Previously we stayed in another hotel in New York and this was 100 % better. We wouldn’t hesitate in recommending this hotel . If we return to New York we would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Great location, room for three - lovely hotel!
text: Just returning from the Belvedere for 3 nights.  So glad we chose to stay there.  Location is safe and is close to everything you need.  Rooms were spacious for three ladies, bathrooms are nice.  Had a fridge, microwave and keurig although we didn't use them.  Love the wine happy hour from 5-6 such a nice touch after a long day of walking, shopping and eating.  Great hotel!

title: Tremendous location.
text:
WE absolutely loved being ion this location. So close to eateries, Times Square the  hop on & off bus. Everything you might need as a first timer to NY. Staff are great and very helpful. Room's a bit  tired but a lovely comfortable bed & we only slept in it and then headed out to see all the wonderful things we could cram into our day. Walking distance from Central Park & Madison Square Garden. We loved Bryant Park too.
Between 5 & 6pm they serve free wine to guests. Such a nice touch. The red South African went down well. Would definitely book here again if we return to New York.

title: Baño muy viejo
text: En general el hotel y las habitaciones están muy bien pero el baño de mi habitación era diminuto y viejo. Con lo grande que es la habitación es una pena ese baño. Tienen una mini cocina en las habitaciones.

title: A New York Gem
text: I have just returned home from a magical 10 night stay at the Belvedere Hotel ! As I was traveling with my 20 year old son we booked an Executive Double / Double Room.  For a hotel room randomly chosen months before it was way above our expectations.  Clean, roomy and a magical view of NY inclusive of the flashing lights of Times Square.  Close walking distance to all everything we needed to do and see ! Few minute walk to Times Square but hidden away so quiet cosy sleep time ! The staff and ALL the staff were professional, helpful and made our stay in NY so much easier than I thought it would be.  Wish I could remember everbodies names (front desk reception staff were amazing) but to Elvin who opened the door for us (don't know how many times) and Dulcie the housekeeper who would greeted us so happily every morning .... you are gems.  From Brekkie in the morning to a free glass of wine at the end of our days there was everything we required.  As we were busy, busy we also discovered the Patzeria Family and Friends right  next door which catered for great, cheap lunches and dinners whether you just wanted a toasted sandwich, burger, pizza, pasta or a full big feed.  Also very nice bar to sit at if you just fancied a drink. So to the Belvedere Hotel and all your wonderful staff .......... Thankyou ! You made our stay in NY so much more enjoyable than we expected.  A must stay for a visit in that big crazy city.

title: Always a pleasure to stay in this friendly hotel
text: There was a mix up with my reservation and the manager was able to solve it easily.  The front desk is always helpful and we used the Concierge's services as well. She was well informed and very helpful.

title: Posizione strategica
text: Sicuramente a NYC vi saranno centinaia e centinaia di hotel più raffinati e lussuosi di questo, ma la sua posizione é assai valida come base a midtown di Manhattan; infatti è assai vicina a Times Square nella 48th strada in prossimitá della 8th Avenue ed a pochi passi dalla stazione 50 th Street della linea blu della metropolitana. L'hotel ci é parso pulito anche se datato negli arredi, personale cortese ed efficiente sia alla reception che alla concierge. Avevamo una stanza spaziosa e luminosa al nono piano con ampio letto matrimoniale e tre finestre, TV, ripostiglio con armadio a muro dotato di cassaforte, asse da stiro, phon e piccolo cucinino con frigorifero e microonde per la preparazione di piccoli pasti: piccolo market nelle vicinanze. Unica nota dolente un piccolo bagno in cui puó entrare solo una persona alla volta ed ovviamente senza bidé. Da prevedere una tassa giornaliera di circa 20 $ + tasse per una serie di servizi (Wi Fi, accesso centro fitness, chiamate telefoniche locali, fax, degustazione vini dalle 17 alle 18, servizio concierge ed altri benefit).Nel nostro pacchetto volo + soggiorno i costi sono apparsi in linea nel rapporto qualitá/ prezzo.

title: Unforgettable place
text: Belvedere has really nice accommodations, very good location near Times Square and wonderful staff! Everybody always trying to make you feel comfortable and cosy. Excellent meals, good laundry and a great gymn!

title: Un buon soggiorno 👍🏼
text:
Abbiamo passato qui  quattro giorni ... 
zona  centrale , due passi da Times Square 
Camera accogliente , pulita , personale cordiale 
Abbiamo sempre pranzato fuori perché sempre in giro dalla mattina alla sera ... 😉👍🏼
Consigliato a chi non pretende ... e che si muove come noi a piedi !!!! 
Grazie mille per tutto... 👌

title: Excelente ubicacion para la primera vez en NY
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado. A tres cuadras del subte. NY es una ciudad cara. Y como en casi todos los hoteles....este tampoco incluye el desayuno. Pero tiene frigobar. Microondas. Y a diario dejan cápsulas para café y té. Esto es buenisimo xq podes desayunar rápidamenre en la habitacion.internet anda estupendo. Estsmos en piso 15 y las vistas son muy buenas. Lei que ean lentos los asensores.....ya llevo 6 dias y no he tenido problema con esto. Super recomndable y buena relacion calidad/precio.

title: NYC trip with friends
text:
The taxi ride from the airport was an experience. It cost us £63 to the hotel.
Hotel staff very welcoming, friendly & helpful.
Had a twin room overlooking a school, view ok.  Room comfortable & clean. Fab shower. Room had a fridge & coffee/tea making facility & large TV.
The position of hotel is great, just a few blocks from Time Square, easy walking distance also not far from the Theatre to see Wicked.
Little diners around, so you don't have to go into Time Square if you didn't want to.
NYC is noisy with sirens from emergency services, but you get that over the world & you heard them from hotel room but it's not disturbing.
I didn't think much of the breakfast.  20 dollars for breakfast was steep for what it was. Only are there once.
Apart from that, fantastic hotel, I would stay there again & would recommend it.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: I had the privilege of spending 3 nights at the Belvedere.  This hotel is in a perfect location, just two blocks away from times square, yet in a quiet location that makes it enjoyable to come home to after a busy day/night on the town.  Rhis hotel is central to everything; great restaurants, entertainment, the subways.  The rooms are well appointed and clean and a nice size, especially for Manhattan.  The front desk staff are courteous and professional as well as accommodating.  I very much enjoyed my stay at the Belvedere.  This was my first visit to NYC, but I plan on many return trips and the Belvedere will be my go to hotel.

title: Good location off time square
text:
The hotel is two blocks to the west of the northern edge of time square. It is a short walk to time square, Rockefeller Plaza and there are lots of local restaurants on 9 Ave which is only a block away. It is also on the edge of the theater district. 

The hotel it self is a little dated. The rooms are good sized but the bathrooms are really small. The bath tub had a little mold along the lip of the tile line. We had two rooms one that faces south and one that faces north both on the 14th floor. The one that faced south had a better view but also had lots of road noise. Over all the hotel was good with really friendly staff. It is a good value for the location. 

There are two elevators in the center of the hotel which are usually crowded but there are also elevators at each end of the hallway.

title: Lovely hotel, location and staff
text: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. Great central location for theatre land, restaurants, subway and shopping. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We had a continental breakfast every morning and the choice was very good and always fresh. Just over £10 each, which was excellent value. We had a corner room and by NY standards it was huge, great views of the city and the nearby lights in Times Square but far enough away from there. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will stay here again on our next visit.

title: great hotel in a great location
text: My wife and I stayed at the Belvedere from 15th to 25th November.  We arrived late at night and the reception staff were excellent, processing our booking very quickly, which enabled us to get into our room in a short time.  I had planned our visit for our anniversary an had emailed the hotel in advance with this information.  This was acknowledged on our arrival and a lovely room on the 16th floor was allocated to us.  This has a great view over the Hudson river.  There were one or two slight problems with our room, (radiator not shutting off, no kettle, etc.) but these were resolved very quickly.  I have nothing but praise for this great hotel, which is situated 5 minutes from Times Square in a quiet street. The complimentary free wine from 5 until 6 every night was a great way to meet fellow travellers from all over the world and is the first time I have experienced this in the many hotels I have stayed in over many years.  Well done Belvedere, keep it up! Our room was quite large by New York standards with a microwave and fridge.  Very comfortable. I would particularly mention the reception staff, (especially Nick?) who were tremendous.  Nothing was too much trouble for them.  We did not eat in the hotel since there are numerous places nearby for any meals.  I would heartily recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying here again when visiting New York.

title: Location location!
text: We stayed 3 nights . Heart of theater dist. 2Blks from Times Sq.  We could see the lights from our room at night. Beautiful nicely done rooms . Microwave, fridge,sink,storage cab. Windows open for fresh air.lovely beds Parking in same blk on 49th.friendly staff all spoke English you could understand!(maids too)

title: Large Room
text:
Nicely upgraded old classic hotel.  Staff very helpful.  Prices reasonable.
Room was large.  Plenty of counter space in the bathroom.  In-room mini-refrigerator.
Very good buffet breakfast (not included in room price)
Currently (Oct 2018) lots of construction in neighborhood, including the sidewalk in front of hotel, but not a problem once inside.

title: Great hotel great location
text: Hotel was a great price and perfect for my family. Room was recently renovated, clean and  comfortable. Only complaint would be slow elevators. Overall great hotel with very friendly staff and a great location.

title: Great Hotel
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on a recent trip to NYC with my wife and 2 children. The hotel is very central, just off Times Square, within walking distance of most major landmarks.

The room was clean, well presented and with good facilities. The hotel itself was perfect for us although we didn't dine there at all so can't comment on the restaurant. A slight disappointment was the service charge but this is not unusual and you can expect that wherever you stay.

I would like to make a special mention for the reception staff, in particular Jacob, who really made the stay that extra star better. Friendly, great with the kids, and always a beaming smile when we walked through reception and a friendly chat or local recommendation. It's the little touches and extra effort of individuals like this that make a difference to a hotel stay. Every hotel needs a Jacob!

title: Posizione strategica
text:
Ho soggiornato con amici per 5 notti nel mese di Ottobre.
Camera tripla spaziosa, con moquette e vasca con doccino nel bagno.
Non è una struttura nuova ma è in un punto strategico dove metropolitana e Time Square sono a due passi.
Nella nostra camera c’era anche un cucinotto dove volendo si poteva fare colazione (supermercato a pochi passi da hotel)
Consiglio questo hotel a chi non pretende il lusso ma la praticità e vuole un buon prezzo/qualità con camere spaziose.
Personale accogliente.

title: Excellent location
text: Stayed with my family for 4 nights at the end of October. The hotel is situated in a prime position 2 mins from Times Square but on a quieter street. We had a superior double room which was very nice. This isn't a glitzy New York hotel but I would definitely recommend it

title: Second Time Round
text: My first visit to New York was in 2006 and I stayed in the Belvedere Hotel. I was so impressed with the place at the time that I wrote my very first TripAdvisor review about it. Twelve years, and 230+ reviews, later I went back to the Big Apple and stayed here again. I was equally happy this time round. I ended that first review with the line “I wouldn’t stay anywhere else” but nostalgia ain’t what it used to be. So when we decided to go to New York earlier this year the first thing I did was look around to see which hotel offered the best value. Surprise, surprise although I was open to staying anywhere in the Midtown area the Belvedere Hotel offered the best value for us. The location is wonderful just off 8th Avenue so quieter than hotels nearer to Times Square. We always felt safe here too. It is at the edge of Hell’s Kitchen so all the wonderful restaurants on 9th Avenue are easily accessible. Check in was a breeze and, as we had booked before the introduction of their new ‘resort fee’, we didn’t have to pay it:-) A credit card is needed as a guarantee but that’s not unusual. We had breakfast in a local diner the first morning but opted to eat in the hotel every other day as it was better value, and more importantly, offered a great choice of fruit, cereals, pastries, juices etc etc The continental breakfast was $13.95 and the full breakfast was $19.95. Our room was spotlessly clean with crisp bed linen, well appointed and spacious. We also had a little kitchenette with a microwave, fridge and coffee machine. The weather was cool during our time in NYC so we didn’t need to use to A.C. but we turned it on one day and, as other reviewers have said, it is very, very loud. I personally would not have been able to sleep with the noise but it wasn’t an issue for us at the end of October. We never had to wait more than a few minutes for the elevator, there are four of them on each floor. All staff we met were efficient and friendly, especially the receptionist who checked us in, Noel gave us a really warm welcome. There is a wine hour in the lobby every evening of the week which is a nice gesture and a welcome one too after a day’s walking and sightseeing. It is a pity that there isn’t a bar onsite as it would be nice to be able to have a nightcap. We loved our time in the Belvedere and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good-value, safe, clean base in the heart of Midtown.

title: Amaizing hotel in New York. city
text:
When we arrive in the hotel it was in renovation, the first impression was “this wasn’t in the hotel website”, however once inside the hotel everything was different. We have a very pleasant stay at the Belvedere hotel in New York. We got a renewed room where everything was clean and comfortable, the kitchenette is a plus.  Beds very comfortable as well . The staff is very kind and helpful in every time we ask or request a service.

Finally the locations is the best, near of Broadway, restaurantes and conviniences and transit.

I’ll gladly recommend the Belvedere if you need to go to NYC.

title: Noisy / disappointing / disrespectful management
text:
Now I understand why this place has so many 2-star reviews.
Yikes.
At check-in, I asked Frank for a room that's not near an elevator.  He gave me 1126.  Which is 4 feet from an elevator.  Right at the end of a narrow hallway with close packed door entrances abutting the elevator.
The floors are thin and so are the doors/walls, so I heard people thumping by constantly, and the elevator doors slamming.  Ridiculous.  
Tried to address it with the front desk... nada.  
Then, adding to the fun, manager Shonda and the Ops Director Justin were rude and dismissive, when I spoke to them the next day.  
- Justin said he knew about the issue (a day earlier).  I asked him, "Uh, so what did you do abut it?"  He explained that he hadn't yet seen the people involved, so nothing.
- Shonda reported that she spoke to Frank who recalled my request.  And then she stopped, like she'd done all that was required.  And I said, "OK, what about the issue, the whole reason we're talking."  She didn't get it.  So I clarified: "do you think it's weird that I asked for a room not by an elevator and the front desk specialist put me right by an elevator?"  She said, "You weren't by an elevator."  I asked her to clarify.  She said, "well, you weren't RIGHT next to the elevator."
?  
- Justin chimed in with more misinformation and semantic games, saying Shonda was technically correct that I wasn't "directly" by an elevator.  
It was all a bit surreal. 
Guys, helpful hint: wouldn't it have been easier to just put me someplace that's not by an elevator, when I made the request at check-in?  
There was more silliness, and I won't get into all of it.  Quick example: I didn't even use the hotel room... I slept at a friend's place that night, to avoid the noise!  The beds were untouched.  Didn't use wifi or the gym or any other feature... but they were sure to tack on a $22 resort fee for all those services I didn't use.  But this review is already too long.

title: Excellent, despite mixed reviews I'd read.
text: Had read mixed reviews of this hotel, but chose it for outstanding location close to Broadway theaters and very reasonable price for this location. I brought my family for two nights to see Harry Potter parts 1 and 2, and stayed two more nights with my husband to see more plays. I phoned hotel prior to my stay to confirm we would be in one of the updated rooms (reservation was for "executive" rooms) and learned there was one higher level -- "superior." So I upgraded our rooms at $10 per night, also very reasonable. Also requested that we have rooms located near to each other. When we checked in we were assigned rooms directly across the hall from each other and the rooms themselves were very clean and comparable in size to almost all NYC hotel rooms. Nice "kitchenette" area with refrigerator, kuerig, and microwave. We brought regular cups and extra coffee pods so were able to make extra morning coffee. Two mornings we ate breakfast buffet which was exceptionally good and also a reasonable price, with children under 12 half-price -- so a bargain for us. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful. This is an older boutique-style hotel that reminded me of stays in Europe. Would have liked two chairs in room, instead of one, but would have been tight. Walkable to all we planned, even Penn Station. Will stay again when we visit NY. We got great value for our stay all-around. Hotel is still under some renovation, as is much of the street area surrounding. Free wine 5-6 in lobby.

title: Horrible experience
text: I've never had to to pay an advance for a hotel before, even in NYC which I've been to several times now. They wanted us to pay $200 dollars just in case we trash the room. So that's $200 less spending money for your holiday. On top of that, they want $25 a day for the use of wifi, fax machine(?!) and a couple of other things we wouldn't bother using. (It's actually cheaper just to use own phone network for wifi) Hotel rooms dated, front desk staff were already on the defence as they likely have angry people all the time due to expenses, so rude and pretentious. If you want a relaxing and joyful stay in NYC, go to POD 51 instead, they're compact, but clean, modern, and no hidden costs. Awful experience.

title: Great location and a quietly efficient service
text:
We stayed at the Belvedere for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was a shame we couldn’t see the full facade due to scaffolding but we weren’t disturbed by any building noise. We arrived late at 1 am after a delayed flight but were checked in swiftly and also offered a slight upgrade. Our room was very comfortable and of a good size, located on the 3rd floor. We appreciated the comfortable beds and the powerful shower. The small kitchenette was also very useful.
Cleanliness was excellent and all the staff were efficient. 
The best thing for us was the location as we could walk to most places quite easily. Times Square iand Broadway are close but being a little higher and next to Hells Kitchen you also have more choice of “real” rather than touristy places to eat. 
The only reason we are not giving 5 stars is the scaffolding and building work outside and the lack of a hotel bar area - there are free drinks in the lobby 5-6pm which we managed to miss every day, but no obvious guest lounge or bar other than the main restaurant.

title: First time to New York
text:
Two rooms booked one twin one executive
On arrival was offered free upgrade so both rooms were executive rooms
Rooms were clean and tidy but lighting very dim and could do with upgrading to brighter lights
Rooms cleaned daily to a good standard
Heater /fan cooler very noisy could not sleep with it running
Staff very friendly and helpful
Had the buffet breakfast one morning food varied and staff very friendly and helpful
Good location right by tines square and walking distance to various locations

title: Localização perfeita
text: Funcionários simpáticos e atenciosos,  opcao de café da manha com preço justo, localização perfeita, quarto e banheiro limpos . Tem academia boa, hotel silencioso e tranquilo, quarto com camas confortáveis

title: Ottima posizione, ma nulla di eccezionale
text: Ho trascorso 6 notti in questo albergo di recente. Sicuramente consigliatissimo per la posizione ottima (times square si raggiunge in pochi minuti a piedi). Personale gentile. Da menzionare però la camera con un bagno poco spazioso e poco comodo. Spesso cattivi odori nel corridoio provenienti da cucina o camere adiacenti. Nel complesso un albergo accettabile.

title: Great hotel
text:
Stayed with my husband and 2 kids (8 and 11) at the Belvedere for 3 nights in an executive double. It was updated, spacious and clean. The location is perfect. Check in and check out is fast and easy. Staff is great (except one guy at the front desk but the rest was so nice they totally made up for him). 

The lifts are busy in the morning but we took the stairs instead. All other times we didn’t have to wait. 

We will definitely be back!

title: Good location with a few problems
text: This hotel is in a really good location for tourists, we found it easy to get to all of the tourist places and find our way back each day. The room was basic as expected, although the sink had a really big crack in and the flooring needed some updating. We'd asked for a room on a high floor but this wasn't provided and as such, our view was lacking and was really dark. I enjoyed good service at check-in, however upon checking out I was not told about a small charge which was taken from my credit card and spent weeks trying to resolve this. All in all, I would return to this hotel for the location only.

title: Perfect Location
text:
After considering numerous hotels around midtown, we chose the Belvedere for it's convenient location & amenities. We stayed 4 nights in an Executive Double Double on the 4th floor. Our room was spacious, especially for a NYC hotel. We had a Keurig coffee maker, microwave & fridge in the room. I loved the shower with it's extra space,big shower head and lots of hot water.
Our room was clean & updated and check in was speedy & courteous. I usually ask for a high floor room but forgot this time so we didn't have a view at all and it was a challenge to get an elevator going down as the tiny space was crammed with people from the higher floors (we should have taken the stairs).
The location was perfect. Just around the corner from several good places to eat & a few blocks from the theater, subway & Times Square! Thanks to the Belvedere for making our short stay easy & enjoyable.

title: Linda vista de NYC além de ter frigobar
text:
Linda vista de NYC, seja pela manhã ou à noite!
Quartos maiores do que costumam ser ao redor da Times Square.
Possui frigobar e micro ondas.
Fica a 400 metros da Times Square, caminhando.
Super recomendo o hotel!!!

title: Comfortable Hotel
text: We choose this hotel for its location: close to the Theater District, proximity to a subway station and uptown attractions.  The recently renovated rooms are stylish, modern and clean.  There was ample room for 4 suitcases to be placed about the room, even though there was plenty of drawer space.  The beds were comfortable, if a tad small.  Queen beds would be a welcome upgrade; however that would take away space for the suitcases. The bathroom had very little counter space and could be improved with additional shelving above the toilet or below the sink.  The shower had excellent temperature and pressure, with a large shower head.  The staff was prompt bringing extra pillows or items to the room, and helpful upon checkout holding our bags and hailing a cab.

title: Great Location good service
text:
This hotel is right in the centre of New York a short walk from the Cruise terminal and a short walk to Times square.
We had some issues with the bedside lamps, and we had to request a coffie machine.  Our room was on the 14 floor with a great view of the NY lights.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the travel agent within the hotel.  
Right next to the Hotel is an Italian restaurant 'Patzeria Family and Friends' .  Great for breakfast and Dinner.

title: 5 giorni a New York
text: Perché scegliere questo albergo per una vacanza a New York? Perché è situato in una posizione ottimale rispetto alle principali attrazioni. Tuttavia riguardo le altre prestazioni, secondo la mia opinione, non corrispondono alle sue 4 stelle, escluso il prezzo. Capisco che essendo situato al centro di Manhattan, a due passi da Time Square giustifichi un prezzo più alto, ma 270$ a notte( questa è la cifra che ho pagato ad una agenzia turistica  di Atene per affittare la camera) sono secondo me sproporzionate rispetto al valore della stessa. Considerando che nel prezzo non erano comprese le tasse  per le facilitazioni. Poi per quanto  riguarda la posizione, la pulizia, la veduta ok! L’albergo è consigliabile.

title: Nice for one night
text:
Belvedere Hotel

Booked last minute for one night. Check in was easy and staff was pleasant. Lobby was clean and had comfortable seating. 

Room was clean, comfortable and had a nice view! 

Checkout was easy - they slipped a bill under the door while I was sleeping!  

It was convenient to port authority and more.

Would stay here again!

title: Mr Jolliffe
text:
Fantastic hotel
Fantastic location
Great price

But wtf were the owners/managers thinking employing contractors to respray the lift doors between midnight and 4am. I know NY is the city that doesn't sleep but c'mon fellas.

title: Charming convenient hotel with excellent staff.
text: This hotel is so convenient for the theatres and part of the free entertainment was an ice cream at night in nearby Times Square. The hotel provide complimentary wine at 5pm to 6 in the lobby. Just right for before dinner. Staff was helpful securing tickets and other advice. We actually got a picture of Bruce Springsteen on our street signing autographs outside the theatre where he was appearing. Bonus! A few blocks to Juniors restaurant where the cheesecake is great and the breakfast blintzes are delicious. Breakfast is good, convenient, and available at the hotel.

title: Customer Service and Focus
text: When we arrived , a gentleman approached our car, welcome us to the B. gave us information regarding parking $50.00 Valet and if we park our self $40.00, then he told us we could check in even if we are early and that they would we got check in right away, young woman was very professional, did have to put a deposit of $300, that we will get back at end of stay minus resort fee, . got back at 4.00 PM gave us our key, brought up our luggage in 2 minutes. We were on the 8 floor nice view, we had double beds because my daughter joining us, room specious and cleang,  have microwave,  refrig. does not have central air, older building, but the air in room works good.

title: Cumplidor
text:
El hotel necesita urgentemente una actualizacion, los baños son muy incomodos con decirles que tiene lavabo de pedestal chiquitito, no me podia lavar las manos, los elevadores son muy viejos, hace algunos ruidos ocasionales la calefaccion parecidos a unos martillazos, cosas asi suceden en el hotel.
El lado bueno es su ubicacion, excelente, cerca hay un buen restaurant italiano, supermercado en la esquina para cenar en la habitación, muchas cosas. El personal es muy bueno y servicial son un pluss, y limpio, yo tenia temor de dormir con pulgas como se sabe en varios hoteles de la ciudad, pero este estab aceptablemente limpio, lo recomiendo pero agregaria la opcion desayuno, es muy importante en esta ciudad.

title: Short break
text: What a lovely hotel and the staff was exceptionally kind.We were on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet so had peace every night.The breakfast buffet was amazing so much to choose from and staff in dinning room so kind made you feel so welcome.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel was chosen by us because of its location to the theatre district and times square. Both of these are easy walking distance. The unfortunate thing is that the concierge is not operated by the hotel. We booked tickets to "Beautiful" through here and were offered the choice of $169 or $119 tickets. We chose the $169 tickets. Imagine our surprise when we got the tickets at the theatre and we had $119 tickets. When this was taken up with the concierge we were told that the $50 was a booking fee and they refused to even talk to us. When the hotel was approached for support the front desk stated that the duty manager would call. We are still waiting for  that call. My advise skip the hotels and walk to the theatre direct as we did for Pretty Woman. Both shows are great by the way. Yes we expect booking fees but this was deceitful. This is US dollars we are talking.

title: 1 star service at 4 star pricing...
text:
For a four star hotel, I was expecting more than 1 star service.  The problems with service started at check in , where we had to wait 15 minutes to get to the counter. They only had two people working during their busy time which makes little sense to me. Our room was not ready so we gave them our information and went to check our bags with the bell hop.

They had ONE person working at the bell hop station and he was clearly overwhelmed. There we waited for another 15 minutes to check our bag. Don’t get me wrong, he was nice when we arrived but at no point should I be waiting 15 minutes to check one bag at a four star hotel. Staff appropriately.

As for the room, it seemed like a 1980’s style room, very dated, lots of chipped wood, and a very musty odor in the room. It was bigger than other hotel rooms I have stayed at in NYC but the tub was not clean and we found dirty tissues behind the bed when trying to find an outlet (which by the way there are none near the bed)

I did use the fitness center which I did find small but functional. They only had lower pound free weights as well, which should be improved upon. 

Also, when I came back from our show and we went to collect our bag, we had to wait again, and the man who got the bag was downright rude. I gave him the tag, he (very in a huff and puff manner) unlocked the room, got our bag, and I said “thank you” ‘to him, which he did not even acknowledge and walked away. I understand that this is NY but don’t call yourself a four star hotel if you are going to have staff that behaves this way.

title: Great location
text:
We booked this hotel through an agent because it was very close to Times Square.  It is!  On 48th street with Times Square within a 2 minute walk.  It's a good location for first time visitors because it is pretty central to Manhattan with easy transport links.  Be aware though that the hotel charge a $300 deposit on checking in.  We weren't told about that before we got there and it put a dent in our planned spending immediately!!

In addition the hotel offer a free wifi, free wine for an hour a day plus 15% off in their restaurant etc service.  It costs $23 per night and we paid it.  I wish we hadn't because we only really used the wifi.  The restaurant is expensive so the discount is largely irrelevant and the "free" wine is between 5 and 6pm when we were usually out.

The hotel itself is nice with some nice art deco touches.  The room was adequate although no full length mirror and the bath is more of a shower tray.  However, it was cleaned every day and the concierge service was quite good.

We were on the 17th floor at the very top and therefore it was reasonably quiet which was a nice surprise.

Overall a nice, comfortable hotel in a great location.

title: Great location
text: It’s plus point is it’s location,close to The Times Square & within a walking distance of a lot of attractions, restaurants & laundromats. It is an old hotel& the ac unit reminds you of it ,quite noisy.Barring one, the staff was very polite & friendly. The lone employee,unfortunately,was at the front desk when we checked in. He wanted  our credit card,naturally,but must he say also that ‘ I have to check whether you have enough balance to pay your bills’.Is that even accepted behaviour?And he gave us the wrong wi-  fi password . Quite rude, which made our checking- in not  so pleasant.

title: Great NYC hotel!
text: Stayed here for 5 nights with my daughter. Room was clean and spacious, good rates for New York City, too. It’s on a side street so it’s quieter than being on the main streets, but it’s just a couple of blocks to restaurants, Broadway, Times Square. Hotel staff was friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Hace falta mas que una buena ubicación.
text:
El hotel esta ubicado a dos cuadras de Time Square, de fácil acceso al metro u otros medios de transporte.  Pero le hace falta una renovación importante en baños, colchones, ropa de cama, habitaciones de buenas dimensiones que requieren una renovación. El desayuno no estaba incluido y cobran un facility fee de USD 20 mas tax, para acceder a internet y otros servicios que hoy en su mayoría los hoteles lo ofrecen dentro de la tarifa de la habitación. En general el personal es amable, nada para destacar, excepto la mala atencion del Sr Erik quien se encarga de storage del equipaje. 
No lograron dejar un sello en la experiencia.

title: The Hotel is very well located
text: The hotel is well located, our needs as a family were not entirely met as we were put in 2 different rooms and could not be in one room as a family. There were some minor issues with the wi-fi, but overall, the hotel was good, well maintained, kept clean and the staff was helpfull.

title: In a quieter area of nyc
text: My husband and i have just had 5 nights in room 308. On arrival had been upgraded to an executive king. Room clean, well presented.  Only 10 minute walk to times square but quiet enough to be that little bit away from the massive crowds. Housekeepers good and staff professional.  Had a kitchenette but only issue no cutlery,crockery. Only paper cups for coffee and no tea. The airconditioner was so loud you have to turn it off at night to sleep. Overall a 4 star hotel.

title: City trip New york
text: Hotel belvedère in New York is zeer centraal gelegen kort bij Time Squarepants het heeft verzorgde kamers lekker ontbijt happy hour tss 5&6 wijn gratis zeer vriendelijk personeel en juist naast het hotel is een lekker Italiaans restaurant en daarnaast een lekkers Mexicaan in de inkomhal is een ATM aanwezig wat zeer practisch is alles is op wandelafstand en je zelfs gemakkelijk de metro met iemand met een rolstoel aan de balie van het hotel kan je al die informatie bekomen  . Wij daar met iemand kn een rolstoel en ik kan je geruststellen je kan overal naartoe met de rolstoel en de New Yorkers zijn suppervriendelijke mensen

title: A nice hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Belvedere for 2 nights in September.  It is on a nice quiet street but close enough to walk to anywhere you would like to go to in the neighbourhood.  We stayed in a renovated Executive room with two double beds and it also had a small fridge and microwave. However.....there are no glasses, cups, cutlery or crockery to use in the microwave or to make a hot drink. Just some plastic and cardboard cups.  What a shame. No milk, either.  We did request a couple of wine glasses and they were promptly brought to the room. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and everything is clean.  I know the area well and there are plenty of great restaurants and bars in close proximity to the hotel as well as easy access to all the Broadway theatres. I would recommend the Belvedere for it's excellent location, especially for first time New York visitors.

title: Location Location
text:
The Belvedere is close to the Broadway Theatres and Times Square.
Friendly, Comfortable and very convenient. Does a great breakfast.
If you like exploring a city on foot this is a great place to start from and a restful place to come home.
Sirens in the middle of the night can wake you but I guess that's NY!

title: Still an ideal place to stay
text:
The friendly welcome helps to make one feel at home. This was our second stay here, and we were not disappointed. This hotel  has all the basics one needs when visiting NYC. A comfortable room and bed, and a well functioning bathroom. A good position for nearby restaurants. Helpful staff. The hotel also has a breakfast room offering both continental and American breakfasts.
A nice touch this time round was the complimentary glass of wine offered in the foyer late afternoon. Great to make acquaintances and exchange stories.

title: Perfect Hotel
text:
I really enjoyed my stay, me and my two kids.
Everything as described.
We booked for executive and the hotel gave us a better room - superior.
It was very comfortable, big enough and very clean!!  which was the most important to me. I also has a nice view.
Location is amazing. Staff are friendly and helpful.
Breakfast is an option, and they have two classes for your choice. It was very good.
I will definitely come again.
Thank you Belvedere Hotel.

title: Close to Broadway theatres, but quiet.
text:
We booked a Superior Double Double in case we had both of our adult children with us. Both were and it was large enough for 2 parents and 2 adult children for 5 nights.
The staff were friendly and helpful.
The buffet breakfast was a bargain.
The free drinks at 5-6pm were appreciated.
We will be back.

title: It would have been 2 stars
text:
I have previously stayed here twice before and have had no problem, but this time service wa well below average! The front desk staff didn’t even greet us in the morning or asked how our stay was. Secondly the bellman Jerry attitude was sub par, with not even a hello either when we came up to store our bags. He then gave us a death stare when we left without giving him a tip, his service did not warrant a tip. When we came back to collect our bags, Jerry was still there grumpy as and refused to help with our bags. Once again he won’t be getting a tip! The only reason it’s not a two star rating is Frank from the front desk on check in early hours of the morning was so warm and welcoming. 
In regards to the hotel itself the rooms are okay, bed was lump and the aircon was really loud. Only good thing going for it is the location.

title: Great location BUT
text: A very comfortable room in an ideal location but the little home comforts like tea & coffee in room, only 1 sachet each with one creamer and coffee machine had a mind of its own ,worked occasionally, tv in room took 3 days to fix and the lift was extremely slow, only minor details compared to what happened while booking airport shuttle costing 90 dollars the female concierge explained to us this was the best way and would only take 1 :30 to get to airport, after waiting over 45 mins the man on reception rang a number and told me to hold the line while he served other guests, in the meantime shuttle driver turned up saying he was parked the other side of the avenue so we had to run in the pouring rain, shuttle driver then said to us that the concierge was wrong and he said it would take a good 2 -3 hours to get to JFK and it would of been cheaper by taxi. The stress getting to the airport was terrible. Plus we were never told about drinks in the lobby every night, we only found this out while waiting for the shuttle bus

title: Very nice
text:
Hells Kitchen hotel very convenient to subway and Broadway but far from the crowds. This place is very clean, nicely appointed and perfect for a midtown getaway. Stayed two nights, used the small but adequate fitness room. Did not eat there but looked like a good restaurant for breakfast. 

For me, the bed and the bathroom are the most important part of a hotel room and this one gets an A in both departments. Bed was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was NYC sized but very nicely appointed.

title: Pertinho
text: O botel foi reformado e é perto da Broadway. Com acomodações confortáveis e espaçoso é uma ótima opção especialmente se tiver a oportunidade em pegar preços promocionais que ocasionalmente é oferecido pelo hotel.

title: NEW YORK BREAK
text: Hi,stayed at this hotel 17-23rd sept,check in was quick no fuss,we requested low floor and got 2nd so great,receptionist asked for passport and a credit card from wich a $300 fee was deducted in case of damage,apparently this is the norm.hotel was great for us twin double beds coffee and tea usb charger great air con very very clean,didnt use restaurant because we were out all the time.the location is fantastic,five minutes to times square three mins to Hells kitchen great.All the staff are very polite and attentive nothing to much trouble,and the concierge had a great knowledge of local transport and stuff.Great Hotel, would i stay again,YES and i would reccomend it.

title: Happy with my visit
text:
I was happy with my stay here. It’s nothing fancy, but it’s clean, spacious and in a nice and mostly quiet location. The elevators are a bit slow, but I like being active and found taking 10 flights of stairs to be fun anyway, so I wasn’t bothered. A side note, I thought the elevators were super cool the one time I did take it. 
The view from our room was decent, I would recommend if you’re not wanting to pay a huge amount for a basic and clean room to sleep in. I’ll be back soon! Thanks for the hospitality.

title: Belvedere Hotel
text:
This is our third stay in this Hotel for 5 days. The location is great as it is in midtown Manhattan and close to Times Square.
One of the reasons we chose this hotel is that the beds are relatively comfortable and they have mini refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms. However, our experience this time was that the bathroom was very small with no counter space to place your toiletries etc. We had to store our toiletries in our suitcases or in the closet, it was a nuisance to carry things back and forth. The air conditioning/ventilation system is old and noisy. We had to get up in the middle of the night to shut it off so that we could sleep. The lighting could be improved and addition of full length mirrors would be great. I think that this hotel needs to be renovated.

title: Noisy location
text: We stayed here for 2 nights post cruise following a 1 night stay pre cruise at the Lexington.  It was hard not to compare the 2 hotels. Nothing wrong with the hotel if you want to be close to the bright lights and 24 hour noise. The staff did not have the same friendliness of the Lexington staff and the rooms although much larger were in need of a complete refurbishment. The bedding did not appear to have been ironed and the corridors were gloomy. Our first allocated room was next to a lift and office and after hearing the door slam 4 times in a few minutes we asked to be moved which was done swiftly.  It was great for the theatres and restaurants though.

title: Ótima escolha
text: Recepcionista bastante atencioso Quarto grande. Excelente limpeza.  Banheiro ótimo.  Paguei early check-in e pudemos entrar as 7:30 (normal é as 16 hr). Localizacao muito boa perto de bons restaurantes na 9 avenida

title: Good Location
text:
We have just returned from our NYC trip and the location of this hotel is very good as it's central to many of the tourist sites.   First off the room is a good size and VERY clean!  The kingsize bed was perfect after days of walking and walking and walking, so comfortable you fall asleep almost the moment your head hits the pillow!  Our room had a door that would enable it to be a double room if you were to come with kids, but wanted space or a little privacy.  However, that door is not very sound proof, as we could almost always hear our neighbours as they would come in late and loud every night.  The bathroom was pretty big, although I don't understand why there wasn't much space to store your belongings, no shelf, and no ledge on the tub either.  Considering that people are staying for a few days or longer, they do need some sort of area to put their lotions/shampoo/hairbrushes etc etc.  There is plenty of room to put a shelf above the toilet to safely store these.  Other than that, the bathroom was perfect.  We had a city view with a big window that we left open at night to hear the sounds of the city and to let in a natural breeze but the AC system was good and strong if needed.
We only did the hotel breakfast buffet once , it was ok, but honestly I personally don't eat enough to get my $$$ worth out of buffets.  For those interested we ate breakfast next door ( on the left as you leave the hotel ) and it was a nice place ( I will review it separately, this is just an FYI ).
The front desk people were friendly and helpful and so were most of the bellhops.  There was an incident with one over a misunderstanding on our part, he was rude and slammed the door practically shutting my husband's foot  in the door, but other than that, they were nice enough to answer questions and give directions etc.  One other thing though, the elevators are slow, small and very busy during the mornings.  Keep this is mind and maybe ask for a room on the lower levels so that you could take the stairs if you're the type who doesn't like to wait.
For those that plan on spending a lot of their vacation in the uptown area or to hang out at Times Square in the evening, it's a great location, only two blocks from the heart of TS, but you don't get the noise of it, if this makes sense.  This is our third visit to the city and are thinking that next time  we might try a different location to stay, and that would be the ONLY reason we wouldn't come back to this hotel.  We ate at a few restaurants that are very close by and in general loved the area.  Personally speaking, TS is just too busy/crowded/loud/crazy and I much preferred the neighbourhoods of Tribeca or the Village as you could walk on the sidewalks and not feel claustrophobic.  That has nothing to do with the hotel, just putting it out there. If you're worried that you booked and won't like this place, you can rest easy, you'll be happy to stay here.

title: アクセスの良い、シンプルなホテル
text:
チケットとホテルセットのツアーで利用しました。
ブロードウェイなどの観光地も徒歩圏内、遅い時間も比較的明るいですし人通りも多めの地区なので治安は良いイメージでした。
メトロも近くにありますしかなり立地は良いです。

カートリッジ式のコーヒーメーカー
中サイズの冷蔵庫(2lボトル入ります)
電子レンジ(簡易オーブンも可能)
大きめテレビ
ベット脇にアラーム(音がおしとやかなので期待しないほうが吉)
壁に大きな姿見も１つ
セキュリティボックス
広めのクロークなど。
空調のクーラーは冷えるのは早いですが、除湿はできない印象でした。
また、お部屋の布が良いものでした。
ベットシーツの間にあるざっくりとしたインド綿や、バスローブはかなり良い感じでインド綿のシーツを購入したかったです。
(バスローブのみ購入可能)

ホテル全体として、地下に設備があります。
両替をしてもらってからの利用が良いです。
ただ、ホテルもクオーターに限りがあるので基本ですが旅行中にクオーターは集めましょう。
製氷機、
スナックマシーン(お釣り切れなのでコインでのみ購入)、
洗濯機(クオーターで$2)、
乾燥機(クオーターで$1、少なめの洗濯物は高温設定、2回で完全乾燥しました。気にしない人は1回まわして部屋干しで仕上げる人もいるかも程度)

title: fine hotel, great location, helpful staff
text:
Staff very helpful as was the very nice concierge who was able to arrange a musical event for us. Rooms of very good size, good bathroom. Location outstanding as just 
1/2 block from 8th avenue and two short blocks from the subway, and in Times Square and Broadway area. And considering its in a great spot the cost was good as NYC hotels can be expensive. So all in all would go there again and recommend to friends.

title: Go To Hotel
text: I have stayed at the Belvedere many times over the last couple of years.  Close to Times Square and Broadway shows tit is super comfortable and one of the only fairly priced hotels that has two beds options plus a small fridge and coffee maker. Close to tasty restaurants as well. Nice walk to Central Park and museums. Friendly staff and a homey vibe.  I will continue to check with the B first when I travel.  I travel solo most of the time and always feel safe and sleep well.

title: great stay great location
text:
Booked it through Expedia.  Got 50% discount in breakfast and also a room upgrade.  Location is great since ita near Times Square.

Rooms looked good, clean and spacious.  There is some kind of road work in the surroundings but no issues at all.

Breakfast was great. Even served until 11 30am.

title: Good location
text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and found it to be very comfortable.  The room was a decent size as was the en-suiteand was very clean.  We had breakfast there every morning which we thought to be quite reasonable as New York prices can be very high.  The hotel is in a quiet street just round the corner from Times Square where the office for the hop on hop off buses office is situated.

title: Would stay here again
text: Stayed for 6 nights in a deluxe room. Great location in New York City, just off the busy, busy tourist area of 7th Ave so much quieter at night. Short walk to different subway entrances. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was a decent size, it was clean and tidy. Ate breakfast in the hotel once, not a big fan of it for the price so only ate there the once. There are some good local cafes on 8th Ave which serve a good breakfast. This hotel has laundry facilities that you can use yourself-a very big bonus after lots of travelling. Being able to use a washing machine and drier without leaving the hotel.

title: Great hotel- would stay there again
text:
This hotel had many things going for it:
1) great location
2) easy walking distance to many iconic locations including Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square, the Empire State Building, many theatres, and great restaurants.
3) wine happy hour each evening 
4) good breakfast each morning although during our four mornings there, the menu didn't change
5) very friendly and helpful staff
The only negative I had about the place was the room had double beds instead of queen sized ones.

title: First time in NYC from N.S.
text: We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel from September 26 to October 1st. We were travelling with our 10 year old granddaughter and 7 year old grandson.  We arrived early and knew we would have to wait for a room.   This was no big deal for us as we were expecting it.  Rickie at the front desk was great.  When he heard it was our first time in NYC and we had our grandkids with us,  he said he was going to give us a room with a great view. We checked in and stored our luggage and went to see the sights.  We arrived back around 9ish that night and went to the front desk for our keys.
