Front desk sent our luggage up and all I can about the view is WOW!  Kids loved it.  Room was very comfy and clean.  We didn’t have any issues.  Whenever Rickie saw us he would wave and said hello.  We didn’t eat at the hotel so we can’t comment.  I know there was a wine hour but we didn’t get back to the hotel until late.  We loved the location and how efficient and friendly staff was.  Well done Belvedere!!! And thank you Rickie.  We would definitely stay here again and the grandkids said they would too.

title: コスパ◎
text:
ホテルと飛行機だけのツアーで利用しました。

到着時は飛行機の遅延で到着が深夜２時、帰国日も朝４時出発だったのですが、フロントスタッフの方に丁寧に対応してもらえました。

お部屋はNYのこのクラスのホテルにしてはとても広く、スーツケース２台広げても余裕でした。また冷蔵庫や電子レンジ、流し台もあって、節約して部屋でデリを食べるのに便利でした。

南向きの部屋だったのですが、夜はエンパイアステートビルなどの高層ビル群の夜景がとてもきれいでした。

地下鉄駅、タイムズスクエア、ポートオーソリティーのバスターミナルも近く、周辺はレストラン、カフェ、ドラッグストアなどお店もたくさんあり、タイムズスクエア周辺や５番街あたりのホテルより便利な立地だと思います。

ホテルの向かいはアート系の専門学校があり、夜に出歩いても治安が悪い雰囲気はありませんでした。

バスタブの排水が悪かったのを除けば、とても快適に過ごせました。

立地と価格を考えるとかなりコスパの良いホテルだと思います。

title: Birthday weekend
text: We stayed in the Belvedere this weekend.  The room was large for NYC standards, and more important very clean . The staff were very warm and welcoming. It was a great location and I would definitely stay again

title: Great Hotel - Excellent Location
text:
We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel NYC in January this year for 1 week.  Its taken me a while to get to some of my travel reviews, but here it is.

This is a great hotel, in an excellent location, close to everything you need, quiet at night and close enough for sightseeing, either walking or subway.

Reception were more than helpful with any information we needed.

We had an executive room, on a high floor, which I would recommend as it comes with free Wi-Fi and its a bigger room.  The room was so comfortable, clean, warm and had a kitchenette, with fridge, coffee maker (we loved the coffee), microwave, and a flat screen tv.

We didn't eat in the hotel as we spent all our time out seeing the sights, we were a 5 minute walk to Times Square, and all the restaurants needed just on the next block at Hells Kitchen. there's a small shop just round the corner for any bits you might need.

We would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Perfect location
text:
After plenty of research I booked the Belvedere for 5 nights from Sept 16-21.  We arrived at noon and Ricky(?) at the front desk was fabulous.  While our room was not yet ready, Ricky went out of his way to find us a better room that was available within 15 minutes.  What a fantastic first impression he made.  Our room was everything we needed, clean, comfortable, spacious and quiet!  After a day of sightseeing and Broadway, we fell into bed exhausted each night.  Yes, the air conditioner makes some noise but it didn't bother us at all, and with the NYC heat that week, we were very glad it worked so well!!

Every single staff member we encountered was pleasant and downright friendly -full of smiles and helpful tips. The location was perfect. 8th Avenue is busy with lots of shops and restaurants, and quick access to subway stations. The craziness of Times Square was only a block or two away.

 The only negatives are the hot (really hot) elevators.  An upgraded fan system in the tiny elevators would be very welcome.  By using both the main elevators as well as the ones at the end of the hallways, we never had to wait long for a ride!

 I would not hesitate to recommend Belvedere to friends and family and will definitely stay there again for my next NYC visit.

title: Muy bien ubicado
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado, el servicio de habitaciones perfecto al igual que el de recepción, lo único son los 20 dolares que cobran diariamente (estuvimos en otro hotel días antes y no nos cobraron ese importe).
Por lo demás perfecto. Volvería a alojarme sin ninguna duda.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Un hotel bueno, un poco viejo pero cuenta con lo necesario, la habitación un tanto pequeña. Tuvimos un inconveniente con la calefacción pero fue reparado de inmediato. Mucho tiempo de espera en los ascensores.

title: Soggiorno a New York
text:
Con la famiglia abbiamo soggiornato per 4 notti. I punti di forza sono sicuramente la posizione vicina a Times Square ma defilata e la vista che si godeva dalla ns. camera al 14esimo piano. 
Forse un po’ meno la pulizia (abbiamo trovato anche un pezzetto di lego dei precedenti ospiti e la sensazione generale non era al top) e l’abitabilità non esagerata della ns. camera da quattro persone. Condizionatore della camera estremamente rumoroso per uso in notturna.

title: Holiday
text: Hotel location was great and close to shows and Time Square. The room was fine but pillows were a little hard. Would choose to stay again, good restaurants were close by. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The complementary wine in the lobby was a nice touch, we got to meet some nice people from around the world too.

title: Our second stay!
text:
Hi Belvedere 
After our first fabulous stay we are indeed coming back on the 29th September until 11th October.
We were so impressed the first time we decided to rebook. Your hospitality was so warm & friendly.
I even had my friends book with you also & they were very happy as well.
Looking forward to writing another great review!
See you all soon!

Warm regards
Lucinda Bryant

title: Same as 5 years ago
text: A clean hotel in a great spot amongst times square. The room was very old and basically untouched since our last visit  5 years prior. Old carpet and no coffee maker or kettle. No glass cups only plastic. The shower was the worst on our entire 9 week trip barely staying on the same temperature for 10 seconds before either incinerating you or freezing you. Then returning back to do it all again. We requested it to be fixed but clearly it wasn't able to be. The staff are very nice and the cleaner was amazing.  But after 2 times I think we will try elsewhere next time.

title: Nice Manhattan overnight stay
text: conveniently placed near Time Square.  Nice spacious room.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Good cafe for breakfast and not over-priced.  Would definitely use this hotel again.  Currently undergoing restoration to this beautiful facade.

title: No better place or location.
text:
Taking NY city off my wife's bucket list, I looked long and hard for a good hotel. I settled on the Belvedere Hotel and could not have been happier that I did. The hotel was great and the service was second to none. Upon arrival we checked in with "Mike" who was extremely pleasant and professional. We later discovered that Mike was very knowledgeable on the surrounding area and made some great recommendations. When we got to our room on the 15th floor, the room was already very comfortable temperature wise. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom had a great decor and was also very clean and spacious. We looked out the window expecting to see the side of a building but were very surprised to see a wonderful view of the skyline and surrounding buildings. This location of our hotel was only only a block and a half away from Broadway st. and Times Square. An unbelievable location at such a great price. We could not have been any happier with our hotel. In the evening, they have wine tasting from 5-6 and we met some very nice people during this social hour. The hotel does have a full restaurant
near the lobby which made it convenient if you didn't want to go out at night to eat. I will never go to NY again if I cannot stay at this hotel. Kudos to Mike and the rest of the staff for making our stay so wonderful.

title: Good location, very good service
text: I traveled with my mother, sister and niece to see Frozen at the St. James Theater.  The Belvedere is walking distance from the theater.  Its a pretty hotel and the staff was pleasant and helpful.  I asked for more pillows and they were delivered promptly.  I am accustomed to a Sleep Number bed at home, so no hotel mattress can compare, but this one wasn't bad.  I left my phone charger behind when we checked out.  I contacted the hotel Lost and Found and they sent it to me.  The only negative I can think of is that there is construction scaffolding across the whole front of the hotel which has been there for more than a year.  Apparently, they can't get the permits they need to finish the facade restoration (?).

title: Perfect for weekend trip w/family especially if going to shows
text: Did a short trip to NYC with my daughter and another friend/child and we stayed here.  It was wonderful in all ways and I would definitely stay here everytime I come to NYC.  The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very comfortable and had much more space than I would have anticipated.  A room with 2 queens can definitely fit/sleep a family of 4.  As a bonus, they have a happy hour w/free wine.  And the location couldn't have been more convenient for walking to the theatres we attended shows at, as well as Times Square, Rockfeller Center, and shopping.

title: Very good hotel
text:
i have just returned from an 8 night stay at this hotel.
the staff are very helpful and friendly.
the hotel is situated in a great location 7 minute walk from times square and 15 minute walk to central park.
there are subway stations  nearby. 
it is close to all attractions yet situated in a quiet street.
many restaurants and deli's nearby.
the rooms are quiet large by new york standards
you have a tiny fridge which works very good and a microwave 
+ a coffee machine .
between 17:00-18:00 they serve free wine which is quiet nice
i would definitely return to this hotel and highly recommend it

title: hotel trés agréable ...
text: hôtel très propre , très bonne situation  a deux pas de time square toute restauration diverse a proximité , métro a courte distance , chambre spacieuse , personnel très agréable ,très bonne literie , séche cheveux et fer a repassé et planche a disposition , établissement calme .

title: Comfortable, great location
text: Front desk staff were very helpful. Room was comfortable and very clean. Several plugs for charging devices on the desk, but no plugs near the bed. Shower/tub combo was functional and the water pressure was good. Bed was okay. No coffee maker in our room, but there is free coffee available from the cafe on the 1st floor. We did have a small fridge and microwave. Window a/c unit kept everything cool; after a while it becomes white noise. Lots of dining options nearby and just a short walk to Times Square and the theater district.

title: Reasonable accommodation for peak period
text: The accommodation was in line with our expectation for a three star hotel. The room size is fair with a decent bathroom. The shower is in the bath. There was plenty of space to be able to unpack our suitcases. The lighting in the room could be better particularly for reading. The air conditioning was noisy. The gym was good and the breakfast was reasonable value for money. The staff were polite and friendly and always willing to give assistance. The hotel is perfectly situated in relation to Times Square and the theatre district.

title: Fabulous Location, Great Value
text: I recently was in New York for a business trip and stayed at this hotel. It is extremely conveniently located, only around an 8 minute walk to Time Square, and about 12 minutes from Rockefeller Center. It was very easy to quickly grab a bite near Time Square and catch a Broadway show. Furthermore, their business center enables you to do any last minute printing without charges. The rooms are also surprisingly quiet considering that it is located in a pretty busy area of New York.

title: Great independent Hotel
text:
Traveled to New York for US Tennis Open and made this our home base. It was chosen because of its competitive price,good reviews and an excellent location close to all main attractions. Also the rooms looked to have been updated and the rooms had a dedicated sink, refridgerator and microwave a must have on our list since we were traveling with our small daughter. We arrived early just before noon and asked if we wanted to check-in immediately on the 3rd floor or wait for our assigned room on the 9th floor which was considered an upgrade, we booked an 'executive' class double room (one step higher than the standard according to the rates). We chose to wait for later and they stored our luggage without a fee while we started our visit of the city. Once we returned our room was ready and it met all expectations. It was a good size for New York standards with nice decor and a decent view of the city.  The bathroom was nice but really small, larger guests may find it very tight. It was a heat wave outside (95 degrees) and a little warm in the lobby, but the rooms were nice and cool. The two double beds were comfortable and clean, and the room had a nice size closet equipped a iron board and iron. The room was right across the elevator, but we never heard a noise from the hallway, only from the room next door, but never enough to bother us. For the most part it was a quiet room even from the outside activities of New York.  We did enjoy the free wine hour one day. It was easy to get any form of transportation, although walking to one end of the of the street or the other got more available taxis quicker. We enjoyed our stayed, the staff was friendly and it would come here again. 

FYI, there is a building being built next door, no noise issues, but there will scaffolding in front of the hotel for some time. This did not affect our stay at all.

title: Good location, comfortable and quiet.
text: About a 10 minute walk to Times Square.  There is a lot of dinning and Starbucks etc places within a block of the hotel.  Very quiet. Beds were comfortable and had a fabulous view out on the 16th floor window.  The bad is window units air conditioner.  When I was there at the end of October they had record breaking heat and the air unit could not keep up very well.  The elevators were slow but there are additional elevators at the end of both halls giving a choice of 6 elevators.  Like others, I never used the others and may have solved the wait problem.  Front hotel staff very professional and friendly.  Felt very safe in the hotel and in the surrounding area.  Closest subway on next block that goes downtown 49th st., Comfortable and quiet!!!!

title: Muy céntrico pero algo obsoleto
text:
Muy bien localizado en una de las mejores zonas, cerca de Time Square, Central Park, Broadway, ...
No sé si han querido mantener el encanto de los años en que se inauguró pero se han quedado un poco antiguas las habitaciones. Nada más llegar una de las cosas que no nos qustó fue que nos cobrarán 20 dólares al día diciéndote que te hacían descuento en los desayunos y otros beneficios del hotel, no te dejaban opción a decir que no, y eso no lo avisan cuando haces la reserva. Creo que te cobran encubierta la wifi y algún impuesto local. Los desayunos son continental o americano. La diferencia son los huevos revueltos, las tortitas y el beicon. Las almohadas muy altas para mí gusto y no saben lo que es el aire acondicionado centralizado, cada habitación tiene su aparato que hace un ruido horrible. Lo que nos salvó fue que en el sótano tienen unas lavadoras y secadoras tipo películas, con monedas, que nos saco de un apuro.

title: Buon Hotel a due passi da Time square.
text:
Sono stata in questo hotel con la mia famiglia per una vacanza di 10 giorni a New York. 
Lo ho trovato pulito e ben attrezzato. I letti forse sono un po’ piccolini poiché erano una piazza e mezza l’uno... i miei figli sono stati comodi ma noi adulti un po’ meno. Ho avuto problemi con le carte di credito (una si è proprio smagnetizzata ed una non era accettata) e quasi quasi ci sbattevano fuori dall’albergo nonostante sulla carta ci fossero i soldi ... fortunatamente è intervenuta una signora (forse un responsabile) che ha capito la situazione e con molta pazienza ci ha aiutato a risolvere la questione inserendo a mano i dati della carta Che fortunatamente così ha funzionato... 
A parte questa disavventura, nell’insieme è stata una buona esperienza. Come tutte le cose a New York non è sicuramente economico ma per essere davvero a due passi da Time Square ha un ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. Comunque mi sento di consigliarlo.

title: Well worth a visit !!
text: Recently stayed here for 8 nights and would highly recommend the hotel for its position,friendliness and upgraded room. Limited lifts for 17 floors threatened long delays, however this was not a great problem. Plenty of suitable eating places around and Blockheads, nearby Mexican had Margueriters to die for.

title: Buena ubicación mala infraestructuras
text: Su ubicación es inmejorable... Sin embargo se trata de un hotel viejo con un ruido infernal en las habitaciones por los aires acondicionados, no ya de tu habitación, que lo puedes apagar, sino de las contiguas... con lo que te tienes que acostumbrar a descansar como si estuvieras en una sala de máquinas de un barco... La limpieza es muy regular... Perfil hotel que nunca se reforma ni arregla porque al estar ubicado en el centro tiene siempre demanda y además pedir de precio lo que quieras...Por cierto si reservan por un buscador el precio es orientativo... Nada más llegar te indican que te incluyen de forma "voluntaria" por 20 dólares/día por habitación servicios tan  "de vanguardia" como wifi y un descuento de un 15% en el desayuno no incluido que por cierto es caro para lo que te ofrecen.... Además las habitaciones por día no tienen precio fijo oscilan en función de demanda aunque te dan el presupuesto de esto en el check-in... Conclusión.... Sale más caro de lo que tiene previsto el viajero... volvemos a lo mismo... Estoy en el  centro de Manhattan y hago lo que quiero... En otros hoteles en USA tienen este tipo de añadidos pero son más claros y no se incrementa el precio tanto

title: CONSIGLIATISSIMO
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel ad agosto per 6 notti. L'hotel si trova in una posizione centrale, a tre minuti a piedi da Times Square, ma allo stesso tempo in una via tranquilla e non troppo trafficata. Dalla nostra finestra al 16° piano si godeva di un paesaggio mozzafiato e si scorgevano persino gli schermi di Times Square. L'hotel è molto bello esteticamente, e il personale molto gentile e disponibile. La nostra camera era bella, sempre pulita e ordinata, il bagno essenziale (forse un po' piccolino), ma assolutamente funzionale e anch'esso sempre pulito. Ci siamo trovati molto bene e lo consigliamo vivamente!!!
Un consiglio a chi va a New York per la prima volta: portarsi da casa dei tappi per le orecchie perché il rumore esterno della città (ma questo chiaramente NON dipende dall'hotel) è costante giorno e notte e si sente anche in camera, nonostante l'albergo si trovi in una via tranquilla. In definitiva hotel promosso a pieni voti!

title: Returning customers
text: We stayed for 4 nights this August. It was amazing as usual. There are a lot of updates now. There used to be only nice rooms in the top floors but it seems they have remodeled all rooms. The furniture was new more modern now. Excellent air conditioning. New curtains. Bathrooms are new. The showers are great and have great water pressure. The kitchenettes are useful with a Keurig. This is our go to hotel based on location, service, and price. We are used to the area and employees already. Excellent employees. The only negative I will say is housekeeping is way too loud too early, although this was a first for us. Elevator was fine. It was more than enough. Best hotel at the best price hands down!!! 7th stay and will continue. Mr Jasso at the front desk is stellar. ;)

title: Increible ubicación
text: El hotel es algo antiguo, aunque ahora estaban renovando la fachada, y las habitaciones no están nada mal. Al principio estuvimos en una de los pisos de abajo y era algo ruidosa, y nos cambiaron a unos pisos más arriba sin ningún problema (y con mejores vistas!). No cogimos desayuno y no creemos que sea necesario, pues a los alrededores del hotel hay gran cantidad de sitios donde ofrecen mucha variedad. Lo mejor, sin duda, la UBICACIÓN: a escasos 5 minutos de Times Square!

title: Super
text: zeer goede ligging. Veel uitstappen gedaan, heel mooi, Geweest voor 10 dagen waarbij 2 dagen Boston gedaan met de trein een 3tal uren gereden. Het verschil was enorm veel rustiger meer een stad zoals in België. Geef mij maar New York. Een echte aanrader maar Amerika is wel geweldig duur. Duurder als in België.

title: Its ok ... but not as nice as i expected
text: Based on the reviews I expected a much nicer hotel.  Its average. Breakfast was average and expensive. Elevators are really small.  I thought I was getting a really good deal when I booked through hotels.com but by the time they added all of the fees and deposit it was not such a great deal after all.  There is no coffee in the rooms or in the hotel lobby which I didn't like.

title: Helpful people
text: Everyone you talked to went overboard to help with directions and restaurants that were excellent. The in hotel restaurant turned out to be a great breakfast choice and they had free wine tasting at 6 pm

title: Séjour sans soucis
text:
Séjour parfait dans une chambre familiale avec 2 grand lits- pas de problème pour 2 adultes et 2 enfants. La chambre était dans les étages du haut. Aucun bruit et inconvénient. Seule  bémol ( on était prévenu) la clime  était bruyante, donc on essayer de la faire marcher en journée quand on était pas dans la chambre.
Personnel dans le lobby accueillant surtout après avoir revu son tips😏
Je recommande le petit déjeuner- copieux et agréable.
Situation parfaite si vous aimez vous perdre dans les environs de Times Square surpeuplé où bien visiter des spectacles dans les nombreux théâtre d’à côte.

title: 2nd visit, as good as the first
text:
This is our second visit to the Belvedere, and it is still a great boutique Hotel.
They upgraded our room, so we had a slightly larger one. It doesn't matter..both times were good.
The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is walking distance to Times Square and most Broadway shows. Lots of restaurants and bars close by.....easy walk to the subway. And the Hotel is on a very quiet side street.
The room was very clean, and quite comfortable.
They have  complimentary wine each evening.....simple table  wine...but it was fun to sit in the lobby area and see other guests.
We travel four or five times a year....4 or 5 star hotels....certainly , how people rate hotels differs, but  we would happily place this in the 4 star category

title: Lovely hotel.....great location
text: We selected this hotel for its location and it worked out perfectly.  We were so close to Times Square, Central Park, all the theatres and the water front where the Intrepid and Circle Line Tours are located.  The hotel was on a quiet street, had great staff and the room was clean and comfortable.  The kitchenette was handy but fair warning...it has no utensils or plates or anything.  You will have to pick up plastic if you are taking left overs back to the room. It has a spa we didn’t use and and a small business centre.  Their morning breakfasts were good and reasonably priced.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again if we are in New York.

title: Good location  to explore New York
text: Within minutes of Times Square but on a fairly quiet thoroughfare. Clean and comfortable with helpful staff. The Emporium supermarket a few blocks up the Avenue served our self catering needs and we slept well in the comfortable beds. Price was reasonable for what and where it was.

title: Retro fabulous
text: Had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Belvedere in NYC.  Clean, comfortable, great service, very cool retro look to the lobby.  Great neighborhood-Hell’s Kitchen-close to everything in mid-town.  Employees friendly and helpful.  Would stay there again for sure!

title: Posizione perfetta
text:
Centrale ma non troppo 
Praticamente ad un passo da Times Square senza averne il rumore costante 24/24
Abbastanza accogliente e pulito 
Camere ampie e prezzo ragionevole considerando la location 
Non male

title: Belvedere Hotel
text: If you want to get a feel of what it is like to live in New York City stay at the Belvedere Hotel, the rooms are comfortable clean and the Staff are very friendly and helpful. You are within walking distance of all the good restaurants and some of the attractions. You can take the big bus Tour you haggle with the ticket seller the price and what is included. You can go see the air craft carrier which also walking distance. Price for rooms are not bad.

title: Prima hotel, fantastische locatie
text:
Tweede keer dat we in dit hotel zijn verbleven en hebben wederom een top ervaring gehad.

Het hotel zelf is netjes. De kamers zijn er goed en schoon. Badkamers zijn na ons laatste verblijf verbouwd en zijn er erg mooi uit. 

Ligging van dit hotel is echt top. Metro ingang om de hoek, vlakbij Times Square, Central Park op kilometer lopen, Hudson River paar blocks verderop, en in de omgeving diverse leuke en goede eetgelegenheden.

Dikke aanrader voor iedereen die een goed hotel zoekt.

title: Localização Otima
text: Fomos passar um final de semana minha família com bebê, o hotel tem berço e tb tem lençol p ele ...A localização é ótimo!!! Nos quartos tem um pequeno frigobar, microondas e uma pia .Os únicos problemas formam a cama pequena e barulhenta e o ar condicionado bem barulhento tb...

title: Can't beat it!!!
text: I arrived at the Belvedere early for check-in and my room was not ready, but I was informed that I had received a complimentary upgrade to an Executive King room which was very nice and welcome as I was there to celebrate my 50th birthday. I was able to leave my luggage in a locked room and do a little exploring and grab a bite before settling in. The room was very spacious, comfortable, welcoming and obviously had been recently upgraded quite nicely. The kitchenette was very handy as there is a little convenience store literally a minute's walk from the hotel (at 48th St and 8th Ave) which sells fresh fruit (including strawberries, watermelon, blueberries, etc.) and all the staples. The fridge and microwave also came in handy for leftovers from lunches and dinners ... such HUGE portions in NYC... not complaining, haha!  The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. You're literally less than a 5 minute walk from Times Square and the Theater district, walking distance to Central Park, the High Line and sooooooo much more!  But the hotel itself somehow is nestled in a quiet block. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Would I return to the Belvedere?  In a New York minute!! :)

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Very quiet hotel. Set back from the hustle and bustle. Within walking distance to Times Square and the theaters.  The room it's self was good. TV didn't work and they sent someone up immediately.  The front desk people were wonderful specially the lady. I wish I got her name!  She gave us great advice and was so friendly. Maid service did great!  Price was perfect! I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again! Only bad thing was you do hear the fire trucks as the station is right up the block. But it wan't bad at all.

title: Genteel, quaint, quiet
text: Chose the Belvedere based on other reviews, and was very satisfied with the experience.  Quieter location, attentive service, very good breakfast buffet (not included with room), and very walkable distances to theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, etc.  Also convenient to subway for excursions to lower Manhattan.  Very good restaurants within 2-4 blocks, and very helpful suggestions from front desk in that regard.  If you're in good condition you can also walk to Central Park and the Empire State Bldg.  Belvedere is an older hotel and its rooms are of smaller proportions.  Nonetheless, our upgraded room - thank you! - on 15th floor was nicely and newly furnished, with an impressive view to the north.  Minor face cloth shortages were remedied quickly with a call to the desk.  We would certainly recommend the Belvedere and stay here again if we return to the theater district.

title: Bien situé et plutôt pas mal
text:
Hotel assez calme pour NYC. Propre et en bon état général. Les chambres sont spacieuses et dispose d'un espace kitchenette (machine à café - filtres et café fournis-micro-onde et réfrigérateur), pratique pour les petit-déjeuners qui ne sont pas inclus dans le tarif de la chambre.
Son atout principal est sa localisation, proche de Time Square, et des lignes de métro.

title: Excellent Location / Good Value
text: Two separate sets of friends were coming to New York and asked for a hotel reference. This is a tricky business inasmuch as you are recommending a hotel in which you have never slept. Furthermore, your likes may not be to your friends' likes. I narrowed the field by location and price. Then I read the reviews which I have found to be a very reliable guide. I settled on the Belvedere to recommend to my friends. My work paid off. They were all delighted with their accommodations. All said they would stay at the Belvedere when next in NYC.

title: Bonne situation
text: Hotel bien situé,prendre une chambre coté rue (moins bruyante) déjeuné rien d'exceptionnel pour le prix demandé ,notre gros problème ,trois chambre réservée ,la première personne arrive 10 heures avant les autres mal heureusement elle n'as pas la carte de crédit on lui répond alors pas de chambre je lui envoIes les numéros de cartes le réceptionniste le refuse passeport ou argent en liquide le réceptionniste refuse toujours résultat elle dormais dans le hall en nous attendant( 26 de voyage) UN SCANDALE

title: Great Value for NYC
text:
Great Hotel for your trip to NYC. It is located north of Time Square and just south of the Central Park. Mass transit is located nearby as well, but it is totally walkable from Penn Station (which is what we did). The room was very clean with a nice view of the street. The room was also a nice size and included a sink, microwave, and a mini-fridge.  For $250 (taxes and fees included) we could not have asked for more. 

If I had to find a negative I would have to say the elevator was a bit slow, which only was a problem at check out it took 15 minutes to get to the lobby with all the stops and speed. 

They also offer a breakfast buffet which we thought was a bit expensive but it is NYC and it is conveniently located off the lobby so we did not have to leave the hotel. 

Overall we plan to stay here again for any future overnight trips to NYC!

title: Very comfortable
text:
My sister and I stayed here for a long weekend, very comfortable, clean and newly updated. 

The staff is exceptional - from the front desk to the room attendants, we were welcomed as if we were in their home. The concierge was very helpful-suggested some great restaurants and assisted with our theatre tickets.

There is a breakfast room and a separate restaurant on site. Wine is served daily (free) from 4-6 pm.

Saw families, groups, couples here. 

On a side street so no city noise.

title: Mixed feelings about this hotel !!
text:
This is not a particularly cheap hotel and it is true that it’s in a very good position for walking to many attractions in the Times Square area . 
Not the hotels fault but lots of construction going on in the road it is on and it looks rundown . 
Reception old style and a little jaded . 
Our room an executive double double may have been executive at one point , but it’s not anymore and was in need of a refurb . 
We had no view except some air conditioning fans and the window was filthy . 
Wine reception , I only made one and it was served from a serving hatch in plastic beakers !! No alternative for my 16 yr old son that I was travelling with . 
Staff were pleasant especially the doorman who organised a taxi to the airport after we were unable to organise ourselves , imagine our surprise when a limo arrived . 
It was a lovely end to our short stay in NYC . 
I’m not sure I would choose this hotel again if I visited NYC though and felt let down as was looking forward to stay .

title: 5 nights in New York ... visiting from Texas
text: Location is everything with this hotel ... west of the main theaters but walking distance to most attractions, central park and subways in this area. Although an older hotel ... fine for the price. Would definately stay again.

title: Excellent Location
text:
We were at the 14th floor with a very nice view of the city. By night is was very appreciable :-)
The hotel is very well located : 5-6 min from Times Square. Regarding the room it  was clean, with a good size, included a kitchenette.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Belle hôtel
text: Situé à proximité de time square. Propre et bien nettoyé chaque jour. Wifi payant 56 $ pour une semaine Petit déjeuner ok mais pas exceptionnel. Personnel sympathique. Climatisation extérieure bruyante mais ça c’est New York.

title: Agradable estadía
text:
Muy bien ubicado junto a la 7 Av y los espectáculos de Broadway, algo antiguo pero habitaciones bien equipadas (cafetera, microondas, hielera, plancha, etc)
Degustación de vinos entre las 17:00 y 18:00
Agradable estadía

title: Cinque notti
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel al rientro dalle cascate del Niagara e dopo aver trascorso due notti in un altro hotel che ci aveva deluso. All'accoglienza abbiamo trovato Christian, una persona davvero gentile che ci ha fatto un upgrade sia per la camera che in un primo momento era ad un piano basso e poi dandoci la possibilità di avere il Wi-Fi free senza pagare la resort fee. Un hotel standard per New York, letti un po' piccoli rispetto ai nostri ma tutto sommato comodi! Buona la pulizia.

title: Close to Times Square - cute small hotel
text: Cute little hotel near Times Square. We asked for a rollaway bed, and it did the job for our family of five. Valet parking is convenient... and the room was clean and comfortable with a good view of the city. Will stay at this hotel again.

title: Perfecte ligging voor het centrum
text: Zeer goed gelegen hotel op 10 min van times square. Ook talrijke metrolijnen in de buurt. We hadden een kamer voor vier personen. Deze was ruim genoeg. De bedden waren echter nogal smal en elke beweging van je bedgenoot voel je. Ontbijt en WiFi zijn betalend. Ontbijt is ruim voldoende, niets op aan te merken. WiFi werkte perfect. Aanrader voor wie een verblijf in het centrum zoekt. Toch een klein minpuntje: er is geen bar aanwezig waar je bijvoorbeeld ‘s avonds of na een zware dag nog even kan uitrusten.

title: Not overly impressed
text: Quiet hotel. Bell boy was rude and said  "wow" when given a small tip for throwing our bags into the room! Was charged an extra 20 dollars per night for extra bed in room - was aware of this but bed had springs sticking out and was in terrible condition! Told reception but nothing was done. Not sure I would recommend for a family with teenage children.

title: Great for visiting the City
text:
Walking distance to Broadway, Times Square, Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre. I had nothing to complain about. The bed was comfy. The room was not dirty at all. Front Desk, Bell Hops, and Concierge were all readily available. 

The décor is not the most up to date (hard wood maroon colors), but it wasn't horrible, like I've seen other hotels. It was more vintage. It worked for us and I would stay here again, especially for the price, considering the location!

title: Decent hotel decent location
text: The hotels main attraction would be it's location for the price. Situated in Hell's Kitchen it's perfect as a base for your New York stay. Everything is either within walking distance or at least the hotel is close enough to the subway to get you where you want to be. Whilst the hotel isn't the Ritz it's got what you need. The staff were friendly and helpful, there's a bar/restaurant, breakfast room that gives you a free coffee even if you don't have breakfast there which we didn't, free use of the PC and printer (very useful indeed) and I think a gym. The room is basic but comfortable, was clean and had the added bonus of a microwave and fridge. There was also a double usb charging point which was handy. On checkout the hotel were happy to store our luggage until we departed for the airport which was good and the bellboy will also hail you a cab (for a tip of course). You would be wise to go out to 9th and 10th ave's if you do stay here as there are restaurant's and cafes and eateries a plenty, most of which are all independents offering all sorts. Overall an enjoyable stay in a fantastic city, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Bonne situation
text:
L'hotel est bien situé (proche de Time square et de lignes de métro). Chambre propre. Petite kitchenette. Il n'y avait que 3 set d 'essuies et nousétions quatre mais après demande ce fut corrigé (6 sets !)
Le personnel n'est pas très sympathique, surtout le concierge a qui j avais demandé pour me reserver une navette vers l'aeroport et qui m a dit que je m y prenais bien trop tot que c'etait pas le moment. Ils ont quand même consenti à un changement de chambre car la première était plus que bruyante car juste au dessus de l'arriere de l'hotel avec 6 gros ventilateurs de climatisation
Au Check out, il m avait compté un hotel fee de 20$ et des taxes par jours alors que tout avait été réglé par agence (Connexion). Heureusement mon agence a réagit et ce "supplément n'as pas été compté".
Le petit déjeuner n'est pas exceptionnel et est relativement cher (malgré qu'on soit à NY).

title: Wonderful experience
text: Stayed only one night...staff was extremely patient & helpful to store our luggage until room was ready & retrieve it in a very timely manner when we returned.  Check in/out seamless!...& valet parking was very easy & quick to retrieve the car.  (Be prepared for the additional fees & taxes that ALL NYC hotels charge).  Location is perfect for any theater or Times Square visit...a very short walk & bars & restaurants on the way to Broadway.  Rooms larger than other NYC hotels that are priced higher.....& very clean, decorated nicely & having a fridge & microwave in room a plus!  Definitely our favorite hotel when coming to NYC!

title: Viaggio di nozze
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel nel 2015, durante il nostro viaggio di nozze, hotel perfetto, centralissimo, hai tutto nelle vicinanze ma è in un punto molto tranquillo, pulito, personale disponibile.
Lo consiglio assolutamente!!!

title: Ideal Position
text:
As the title suggests, this hotel we felt for our first visit to New York was in the ideal position for the "sites".
From here you could walk in 5 minutes to Time Square and Broadway. We regularly walked to 42nd Street or up to Central Park. Hotel itself had everything you needed and was comfortable, breakfast was good too.I would have given it 5 stars but having to pay for wifi really bugs me!

title: Good Location
text: On a tour with Funtastic Getaways.  Convenient location, room was good size, refrigerator, microwave, small bath but shower was excellent and felt good after walking around in 90*  humid weather.  Located just 5 minutes from Times Square, restaurant row 36th Street and many theaters.

title: Great location
text: We loved how close we were to Times Square and hop on hop off bus stops. Very clean neat and tidy hotel. Semi self contained - had microwave and small fridge but no utensils or plates/bowls. Our room was for 4 people but not enough storage/hanging for 3. We stayed a week so maybe if you only stay a couple of days storage would not be an issue. Free wine every night is a great bonus.

title: Senza infamia e senza lode
text:
Hotel centrale a qualche isolato da time square. Stanza abbastanza confortevole, bagno discretamente piccolo. La nostra stanza era posizionata vicino all'ascensore e per questo un po rumorosa. La stanza era sempre pulita al rientro eccetto un giorno dove abbiamo trovato il letto ancora disfatto, i bagni non puliti e teli da sostituire.Avevamo stanza con wi fi gratuita, ottima ricezione. Se avete la wi fi dopo 5 notti non riuscirete più ad accedere, dovrete richiedere in reception un altro codice d'accesso. Operazioni di check in e out rapide. Vicino reception è presente un servizio di prenotazione di varie attività, noi l abbiamo utilizzato per lo shuttle per aereoporto che consigliamo vivamente (24 $ a testa).
Hotel consigliato

title: Nice hotel
text:
really Nice hotel with good service and concierge which helps us with bookings and taxis.
Breakfast is fine: continent och American breakfast
Perfect location for family weekend
Perfect AC in both lobby and in rooms

title: One night stay
text: Two friends and I made our first-ever excursion from the plains of North Dakota to The Big Apple. We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel, easy walking distance to our evening event at The Copacabana. The room was smaller than we anticipated, and the bathroom smaller than we imagined...but we learned that by NYC standards, the accommodations are spacious. EVERYTHING was comfortable and comforting, from the friendly staff to the plush furniture, so we country mice felt right at home in the big city. The price was reasonable, the service terrific, and the concierge answered our every question.

title: Bom!
text: Bom hotel com boa localização. Próximo a quinta avenida. Café cobrado a parte. Quarto tamanho bom e confortável para 2 adultos e 2 crianças, mais as malas. Limpeza boa. Atendimento cordial (chegamos antes do horário do check inn e foi nos disponibilizado quarto sem custo algum).

title: Reasonably Priced Centrally Located
text:
We selected this Hotel based on price, location, and reviews. There were three of us in this standard room with two double beds. We reserved through Expedia about 45 days in advance and got a rate of $240 per night not including taxes. The actual rate after all of the taxes was about $288 per night. Compared to the base rate of the surrounding hotels this was a deal. We selected the pay the hotel later option. Upon arrival they charge your card $300 for incidental expenses like running a tab from the food services. The charge is later reversed if you don’t rack up any meal charges etc. The staff was very nice from the doorman, to the desk clerk, to the housekeeping staff.  When my kids saw lobby and the elevators they thought of the Disney attraction Hollywood Tower of Terror not in a bad sense but in the sense it evoked old Hollywood style and elegance. The lobby and entrance were clean. The two elevators visible in the lobby were small and slow unlike the rapid fire elevators of the Marriott Marquis where we stayed last year. There are two other elevators down the halls to the right and left of the main ones. Use those they are less crowded. We got an odd numbered room on the sixth floor. The reason why I mention that is the odd numbered rooms have a view to the rear of the property which is no real view if you are on the(I’m guessing ) 10th floor or below. So even numbered rooms might have better views. On the first floor is a buffet and an expensive Brazilian restaurant neither of which we took advantage of. Our room was comfortable. Good Airconditioning and heating. Beds were comfy. TV was about 42 inches ?  There was a desk and chair, and good storage space. Included a refrigerator and microwave in a separate area. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate. Water pressure and heat was decent. Overall a nice room for the price. 
It is located between Hell’s Kitchen and Times Square on 48th Street which is a one way street towards Times Square. It is smack in the middle of he Theater District. Most of the Theaters are a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. We also took a long walk to Central Park from here, and to Rockefeller Center, MOMA, and Grand Central Station. We had to use Uber to the southern part of the city. Hell’s Kitchen which is west of the Hotel has a variety of restaurants you may enjoy. By the way it’s quicker to walk north south than east to west in NYC. You can go two blocks north south in the same time it takes to go one block east to west or west to east!

title: Friendly location
text:
The staff were very pleasant and helpful
The location of the hotel is perfect for ALL activities in NYC.  We will definitely stay there again. Rooms are good size for the city!  Breakfast in their cafe is a great way to start your day!

title: My 8th visit
text: All NY hotels are expensive and this one had increased the price but what can we do! It has maintained the standard, it has good service, the rooms are well equipped,the wifi works fine, it is very clean and comfortable. For me it is very convenient for all the attractions, I can walk to most of the places I want to go to, it is quiet, considering where it is, and safe.

title: Hotel Beldevere
text:
Fuimos a Nueva York en familia y nos hospedamos en este hotel durante 10 días y lo elegimos porque está bien ubicado.  Al llegar , después de 10 horas de viaje , nos dijeron que las habitaciones no estaban listas , tuvimos que esperar y caminar alrededor con el cansancio de un viaje largo. Volvimos a las 16:00 hrs , hora en que supuestamente nos iban a entregar las habitaciones y lamentablemente tuvimos que esperar hasta pasadas las 17:00 hrs. Hubiera sido grato haber llegado y recibido algún detalle de bienvenida (bebida, agua etc..) . Nos encontramos con la sorpresa que también teníamos que hacer un pago adicional diario pero que podríamos obtener wifi gratis , el cual durante nuestra estadía tuvimos muchos problemas con la conexión. Con respecto al personal de recepción , eran amables y tenían una buena disposición. 
En relación al aseo de las habitaciones , no quedamos conformes porque no cambiaban las sábanas cuando dejábamos la notificación para que lo hicieran , no reponían diariamente los productos de aseo para la ducha y a veces encontrabamos papeles para la basura encima . Los ascensores funcionaban en forma muy lenta y a veces estaban colapsados. También quiero mencionar que en varias oportunidades nos tocaban la puerta muy temprano para hacer el aseo y el personal de aseo tampoco tenía un trato amable. 
No quedamos conformes con todas estas situaciones . El desayuno también se paga aparte y hay que salir a buscar lugares alrededor lo cual también quita tiempo.
Atentamente
Viviana Muñoz

title: Super emplacemant
text: A 2 pas de Times Square, rapport qualité prix parfait, service réception génial même pour ceux qui ne parlent pas couramment l’anglais, métro tout près, service de taxi... bref pour visiter New York c’est idéal ! Très contente de ma semaine! 😃

title: Excellent location!
text: We debated on paying a higher price for a hotel in the city, plus parking. We chose to pay for convenience. The Belvedere is a beautiful older hotel! Staff was great, location is fantastic. Going to see Wicked tonight and it’s a 5 min walk!

title: Excellent location steps from the Theater District
text: Fantastic location. One can walk quickly to the theaters and many fabulous restaurants from here. 2 subway stations are super close. It was nice having a fridge in the room, which is a decent size. The hotel itself is really clean. It is an older hotel, but they have done an excellent job updating it. Elevators are quite slow, but you can take the stairs. We managed to be around for the complimentary wine between 5 and 6 twice and enjoyed meeting people in the lounge area. There are laundry machines in the basemet, which were great because after a week of travel, I needed to wash clothes. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel limpo, muito bem localizado. Bom atendimento. Quarto muito Bom com camas confortáveis e um ótimo chuveiro. A duas quadras da Times Square. Apesar de estar localizado no agito, fica em uma rua tranquila, sem barulho. O único senão é o ar condicionado do quarto que é barulhento. Me hospedaria novamente.

title: Una buena opción
text: Lo mejor del Hotel es la ubicación , el personal es amable, las habitaciones son tradicionales , algo antiguas , el servicio de limpieza bueno,  hay un microondas , cafetera y pequeña pileta con un frigobar , lo básico , si se van a quedar varios días no es recomendable para ir con niños

title: Second Visit- surprisingly disappointing
text:
This was our second stay at The Belvedere. Our first stay was brilliant and we decided to book again!
Upon check in for this stay, we were given a king size room when we requested a double deluxe! Not being a couple and requesting same or previous room to last time we booked seperate beds ! When Checking in, I was made to feel that I booked the incorrect room and that the system was right! They did not have any other rooms that we booked available so we had to check in to the king, check out the following morning and recheck in to the correct room type in the afternoon. This wasn’t a good start! We were offered breakfast on the house for the duration for our stay as well as free wifi the length of our eight night stay! The next morning we ventured to breakfast to find  we were not on the list for free breakfast and once again felt like we had to prove we were correct. Our wifi stopped after a few days, then our room keys were cancelled.. when requesting a kettle we were told we couldn’t have one as it’s not available to our room type but were given paper cups and plastic cutlery in compensation. We had a microwave with no cups, glasses or cutlery. Overall,it was unpleasant dealing with most of the staff par select few. It’s a shame as our previous experience was so positive and it’s in a great location! It obviously makes a difference in who you deal with. We concur with previous comments on loud air conditioning in the older style rooms and the kitchenette is a waste of space (if no crockery etc is provided) and they could use that to upgrade bathrooms!

title: Sensaciones encontradas
text:
La mayor ventaja de este hotel es su estratégica ubicación.  A pasos de Times Square y cerca de una estación de metro, permite fácil acceso a las principales atracciones de la ciudad.   
Sus habitaciones son amplias y cómodas, cuentan con un refrigerador chiquito y microondas.  Sin embargo, hay que considerar que no hay a disposición ningún tipo de vajilla, por lo que si no se compra, es imposible usarlo.  
El personal del lobby es atento y permanentemente dispuesto a ayudar.  En nuestro caso, el Transfer que teníamos contratado para llevarnos de vuelta al aeropuerto no llegó a tiempo, y rápidamente nos solucionaron el problema llamando a otro para que no perdiéramos el avión.   Eternamente agradecidos por su rápida gestión.  
Muy diferente es mi opinión sobre el servicio de aseo.  Este no es bueno, lo que se nota, sobre todo, en el baño.  El último día, aún sin hacer el check out, salimos un rato y cuando llegamos abajo recordamos que habíamos dejado en la pieza el cargador de celular.  Al devolvernos, ya estaba el cartel de personal de aseo trabajando en la pieza.  Con el objetivo de no molestar, golpeamos en varias oportunidades, pero nadie respondió .   Suponiendo que estaba vacía, entramos con nuestra llave y encontramos a la chica del aseo acostada en la cama, con el televisor encendido, hablando por teléfono y comiendo.  Esto explica la razón de lo poco prolijo del aseo y lo tarde en que se entregan las habitaciones a los huéspedes recién llegados. 
El check in es a las 16:00, pero, en nuestro caso, nos entregaron la habitación pasadas las 17:00.  Considerando que llegamos a la ciudad después de un vuelo de 10 horas, se podrá entender lo importante que es tener una pieza lo antes posible para ducharnos y reponernos del viaje.  
Si el hotel mejorara su servicio de aseo, sin lugar a dudas sería absolutamente recomendable.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is perfectly located within walking distance to the Theatre District, Times Square and Central Park.  It is a bit dated, but the very clean.  The service we received was excellent.  Our only complaint would be after our initial 3 day stay, our flight was cancelled so we had to book another night.  They tripled the price for our extra night's stay.  We had no choice, but were not happy.

title: A wonderful stay
text: We chose this hotel by chance as it had a deal on. I kept my expectations low but was really pleasantly surprised on arrival.  The hotel was very clean, comfortable, central and friendly. I would definitely return.

title: Perfect location, friendly staff, our go-to hotel!
text: We love staying at the Belvedere when we're in NYC.  The location can't be beat (between Times Square and Hell's Kitchen), but it's off the main road enough that it's quieter.  The Belvedere staff are always so nice, friendly, and accommodating.  For an older (or any!) NY hotel, the rooms are decent sized and are updated.  Our one complaint is usually that the halls tend to smell weird when we're there, but the rooms never do.  We generally just chalk that up to it being an older building.  We'll continue to check for availability at the Belvedere before staying anywhere else in NYC!

title: Repeat Stays, Love Hotel
text: This hotel is our go to hotel when we visit the city to see Broadway Musicals.  Close to Times Square and all the theatres.  Clean and one of the only hotels to get two double beds and a private bathroom.  Very reasonable to rates also.   Very friendly and helpful staff.

title: Good Room, Convenient, few facilities
text:
This hotel is conveniently placed just a short distance from Time Square. An older building the rooms, though small are modern, well decorated and in excellent order and have smart modern bathrooms although our shower was not easy to operate. They have most of the facilities you would expect, safe, hairdryer etc but although they had an electric coffee maker there was no kettle so tea was out of the question. The main problem with the room was the very noisy air conditioning, it was a July heatwave so we needed it but it was very noisy indeed. Sleep was not easy!
A second drawback was the absence of any useable public rooms. There is a small café open in the mornings only that offers a very ordinary looking buffet breakfast, and small and usually overcrowded lobby but beyond that there is nowhere outside your room to meet. And the rooms, with very large and comfortable beds have nowhere to sit except a small desk space.
The staff were mixed, some helpful and friendly some disinterested and off hand. In this day and age having to pay $14 for 24 hours wifi is a liberty.
It suited us OK because of its location, but overall it has significant shortcomings.

title: GREAT LOCATION
text: New York New York!!! Location of this hotel is prime, close to airport andf right in the middle of all the New York action, made for a great New York feel vacation. so close to Times Square. our view from the 16th floor was spectacular, I recommend asking for a top floor room. Beds were comfortable, rooms were clean.

title: Pelo mesmo valor você consegue coisa melhor...
text:
Fiquei com a minha mãe durante 4 dias nesse hotel.
O quarto era razoável, nada demais comparado com os outros hotéis em NYC.
Naquele mês a fachada estava  reforma, o que é normal ma cidade. 
O maior problema era o elevador!!! Cheguei a ficar 15 min esperando no primeiro dia. Para descer usei somente as escadas já que estava no oitavo andar.
Pode não ser culpa do hotel, mas ao fechar o pacote eles ofereciam café da manhã incluso e ao chegar lá não estava.
Enfim, a localização é boa, mas não ficaria nele novamente.

title: Moyen
text:
Chambres banales, vieillottes avec une kitchenette ridiculement petite flanquée dans un coin à l’entree Des chambres . 
Personnel à l’accueil nous invitant fermement  à patienter de 10h ( heure de notre arrivée) à 16h, heure du Check in.... sauf que des 15h d’autres clients ont obtenu leurs clés de chambres alors que nous attendions toujours , nos enfants allongés sur les canapés d’accueil éreintés par le décalage horaire et la chaleur due à la canicule.
Un bagagiste mal aimable au possible qui dicte sa loi et le montant de son pourboire.
Ménage très moyen, il suffit de regarder sous les lits et vous comprenez rapidement que l’on ne nettoie que ce qui se voit ...
Climatisation ancienne et bruyante !
Sinon , situation géographique idéale !

title: Bueno
text: Ubicación estratégica. Habitaciones cómodas, limpias; tienen un frigobsr y microndas que ayuda bastante (aunque te debes comprar hasta las tazas). Cuando llegamos, el microndas estaba sucio; nunca lo limpiaron hasta el 3 dia que me encontre con la persona de limpieza y se lo pedi. Las camas cómodas; aunque amerita un cambio de colchón. Desayuno bueno; nosotros optamos por el continental. Lo que me pareció exagerado es el extra de 20 dolares diarios por servicio de wifi. Lo recomendaria.

title: First visit to Belvedere Hotel
text: We were very impressed with our first visit to the Belvedere Hotel..Location and room were superb.   We were greeted at the front desk with nothing but respect. Ricky made us feel that we knew him for years.   He was very personable, had respect for his guest and definitely accomoodated our needs.  Ricky's interpersonal skills were outstanding.     We will definitely stay at the Belvedere on our next visit because of all the above reasons.   In closing Ricky (keep up the good work,   (We also have a lot of respect for the bellman).

title: Location 👌👌 that’s all 😥
text:
Pros

-The location. It is in the perfect spot to travel in any direction, minutes walk from Times Square and a range of train stations travelling in different locations
- the room was absolutely spotless. We were on level 17 and the views were great. Not a speck of dust and room service did a great job

Cons
- WiFi is not complementary. My wife and I have travelled to Mexico, Canada and a range of US states and this is the first venue in which wifi is not complementary. To add to that, it’s a $13 daily charge. It costs us $5 for daily roaming with unlimited data/usage from our Australian provider, Vodafone, so wifi was a no go
- air conditioning. We had a wall unit which was extremely loud. And if you turned it off then the room would heat up pretty  quickly 

Would stay again mainly for the location and cleanliness

title: Birthday celebration in NYC
text:
My husband and I arrived earlier than we thought the day of arrival, and I was hoping that a room just might be available before the official check in time.  No luck.  The front desk gentleman did indicate we had been upgraded from our original booking (woohoo!!!) ,and he checked both the upgrade and original rooms to see if either were available--a nice touch, I thought.  Since neither were, he indicated we could leave our bags with the bellhop and check back with him throughout the afternoon.  After leaving our bags we did the short walk to Times Square, grabbed a late lunch, and got lost in the excitement of the city.  

When we finally made it back to the Belvedere, our room was ready and waiting, and we felt like we had done something special to get such a room.  A spacious king on the 15th floor with views both south and to the west (we could see the Hudson River!).  Small fridge, microwave and wet bar, and a beautiful bathroom done in a chocolate colored marble tile.  Best of all, the room AC kicked out a very nice temp for us during our entire stay, something I was worried about due to some of the TripAdvisor reviews and the fact that were from Florida and need our AC! 

I would definitely stay here again, especially since the location is so close to Times Square, Broadway/theatre district, and all the restaurants on 9th Ave and on W 46th.

title: Tres bien situé, propre et confortable
text: À deux pas de Time Square, des métros et à proximité de Central Park. Chambre propre&confortable, petit déjeuner fantastique.... position idéale. Les pompiers font du zèle jour et nuit dans le quartier, autant laisser la ventilation activée pour lisser les bruits émergeants. Wifi gratuit efficace. Vin offert de 17 à 18h. Un peu tôt pour en profiter tous les jours !

title: Nice hotel in the middle of the city
text:
Room was big enough for 4 of us, nicely decorated with big windows and a 5 minute walk to Times Square - perfect location!  We could even see the New Years Ball from our window. 
 The evening social was appreciated, a nice uncomplicated way to transition from sightseeing during the day to a more relaxed dinner out.

One complaint is the wifi, which kept dropping and could not be relied on.
Also, I was told by the bell man that the only parking option was valet at $50 / day when I knew there was a self park option just around the corner.  Not sure if he simply didn't know or was trying to up-sell.  Either way, I'm glad I had done my research in advance, saved me $100 over the stay.

title: Convenient location, but nothing else.
text:
Very disappointed with our 2 night stay. Whilst the location was excellent (we walked up from our cruise boat easily, & was very close to Times Square & Broadway) the hotel itself was lacking. Large enough room, but kitchenette has a tiny microwave (nothing else - no plates, cutlery, glasses, nor kettle or tea/coffee!). TV had no remote & wouldn't work without a remote, lights blown in bathroom & bed sidelights don't work. Clock set to random time on arrival & fridge not turned on so took ages for anything to cool once we turned on. Air con is very noisy. Bed is hard & creaky.
Good job we didn't plan on spending more than sleeping time here!

title: UK Review
text:
We stayed at the Belvadere for 7 nights in July. We booked an executive double room.  We were on the 11th floor with good views across the skyline. We had no problem with check in, we were offered 2 rooms and took the one on the 11th rather than 4th floor. Check in was smooth the room was exactly as described with fridge , microwave and coffee machine. We did not experience and issues with the lifts as described by other reviews. The Wi-Fi which was included in the cost of the room was good not as fast as back home but did what a family of 4 needed.

The staff were all friendly and helpful.

The location is great, close to Times Square without the noise, close to the subway to get from La Guardia and also JFK. Everything you need is close by... amazing Mexican restaurant 2 doors up, (The Sombrero) fab traditional diner for breakfast (The Westway) or local shops for groceries.

If I am back in NYC would definitely book again..

title: Love the hotel, Hate the money grab!
text: I have stayed at The Belvedere Hotel at least 6 times over the past 8 years.  I love the hotel!  The location is outstanding if you are in New York to see Broadway shows.  The front desk and bell staff are always professional.  The rooms are quiet and comfortable.  I like having a kitchenette for coffee and snacks.  HOWEVER, I recently booked a stay for October and was very unhappy with the changes they have made to the reservation process.  There is now a "required" facility fee.  Ugh.  Who are they kidding?  Everyone hates those.  Just tell us what the room is going to cost.  "Facility/resort fees" fool no one.  When I booked the "non-refundable, 30 day advance purchase" rate something called "Roomerflex Protection" offered "insurance" at $121.58.  I did not want it.  Never the less, when I booked the room the charge showed up instantly on my credit card bill.  When I emailed the company to protest the charge this was their response, "As a one-time gesture, we have removed your Roomerflex Protection. I have escalated this to our finance team so they may be able to refund you back. Please allow a few banking days for it to reflect in your account."  Why can't I opt out of it when booking a room?  I'm very disappointed that the Belvedere would put their guests through this nonsense.

title: Vale pelos quartos renovados
text: Estivemos em setembro de 17 , pegamos uma excelente tarifa para os quartos renovados , pois o hotel eh bem antigo , o elevador eh muito lento , ficamos no 3 andar e usamos muito a escada , pq esperar o elevador era difícil ... a localização eh ótima para quem busca ficar próximo a Time Square , tem varias opções para comer perto e estações de metrô , o que valeu a pena foi o bom custo beneficio que tivemos na tarifa e no quarto novíssimo , se não fosse isso a minha escolha teria sido outra .

title: Un hotel con molti punti a favore
text:
Decisamente una soluzione interessante, visti i molti punti a favore che sintetizzo:
- ottima posizione, vicinissimo a Times Square e molte attrazioni (Empire, Rockfeller, Central Park) tutte a portata di mano
- molto tranquillo. Nonostante la centralità si riposa davvero bene, silenzioso, bel climatizzato, ottimi letti.
- stanze spaziose, con microonde e bollitore per prepararsi colazione o un caffè
- stazione della metro abbastanza vicina (15 min circa a piedi)
Buona la pulizia, la cortesia del personale solo sufficiente.

-

title: Showtime
text:
A group of four of us came from out of town to go to the theater.
We were here last year and enjoyed the hotel.
They have renovated the rooms and they are clean and lovely. 
They included breakfast.
Service was great .
We will come back next year.

title: Faltou cordialidade e vontade de resolver
text:
Tirando o Stanley, mensageiro, faltou cordialidade das recepcionistas e vontade de resolver pequenas situações que um aventureiro às vezes precisa. 
Bem localizado. Mas as pessoas denigrem a imagem do hotel. Péssimo.

title: Hotel péssimo! Atendimento e cordialidade horríveis
text:
Estivemos neste hotel após 15 dias de viagem pelos EUA e Canadá. Só fiquei nele pois o outro que queria não tinha mais vaga! A experiência foi ruim desde o check in, o recepcionista tinha cara de poucos amigos. O hotel é bem localizado, a única coisa que salva. Não tem serviços de diárias extendidas então tive que fazer uma nova reserva para mais um dia já que meu vôo seria à noite. Fui fazer o check in dessa nova diária (que eu sairia à noite) e a recepcionista me fez mudar de quarto, disse que era uma nova reserva então teria que mudar de quarto!!!! Paguei o mesmo preço pela diária anterior e por essa nova!!!! E os quartos não tinham diferença em termos de comodidade !!!!
Outra coisa, foi o único hotel que cobrou facilities fees, paguei 20 dólares mais taxas por diária... não fiquem neste hotel!!!! Não vale a pena!!!!!

title: Great location
text: We have just had a week long stay here with the family and weren't sure what to expect but the hotel exceeded our expectations. Check in was very easy, we had a room on the 4th floor which was spacious and clean. It was great having a free safe in the room to use which took the stress out of leaving documents and cash around. Beds were made up every day and towels were changed daily, including weekends which was a bonus when there are 4 people in a room! The beds were super comfy, we all agreed that we had our best sleeps here! The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy but I always wear ear plugs so it wasn't an issue for me sleeping. Once you leave the hotel its literally a 2 minute walk to Times Square, its a great base to have if you want to take in the sights of New York but then escape from the hustle and bustle after a long day out.  The restaurant next door does lovely food but you do have to book if you want to eat here on an evening. There is a tube station a five minute walk away with a 24 hour manned booth so you can actually speak to someone about tickets rather than work out the machines. You can get a direct train to the World Trade Centre from here, it cost us $22 for a family of 4 return. We also used the train to get to Coney Island, again it was only $23 return for all 4 of us. You can walk to practically everywhere from the Belvedere, Central Park, Empire State Building and all of the theatre district is close by. We had Wifi in the room which all four of us used (a real bonus for the kids) with only a few minor connection problems now and then. Having a fridge and a microwave was also a bonus, we filled ours with drinks to keep us cool in the heat wave! Check out was quick and easy. Staff were all polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend the Belvedere for anyone visiting New York

title: Super hotel, helpful staff and great location.
text:
Stayed here 4 nights in a spacious, comfortable and very clean room on the 14th floor.  We had a wonderful outlook over the city and could see the Hudson River. The hotel is in a quiet yet convenient location, just a few minutes walk to Times Square. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby, plus several small supermarkets and the 'hop on hop off' bus stop.

Would've been nice to make a tea or coffee in our room when we wanted to, but coffee was provided free in the morning at the cafe.

All staff we came into contact with were very helpful and professional and we would certainly stay here again.

title: Excelente Estadia en NY
text:
Nos alojamos 7 días con mi esposa mi hija hace 2 semanas. Nuestra experiencia fue excelente. Habíamos concurrido con algunas dudas respecto al servicio del hotel, sobretodo por lo leído en comentarios precedentes, pero por suerte no experimentamos ninguno de los problemas que mencionaron otras personas.

Reservamos una habitacion ejecutiva con 2 camas queen, el tamaño de la habitación era grande, sobre todo comparandola con otros hoteles en NY. El estado de conservación de la habitacion, las camas y el baño eran óptimos.

Contar con una cafetera, refrigerador y microoondas en la habitación fue un plus que valoramos.

En cuanto a la ubicación, estas a metros de broadway y times square, pero aún así ha resultado una zona tranquila para dormir (por lo menos a nosotros que nos tocó un piso 11).

No tuvimos problemas con los ascensores, nunca debimos esperarlos mucho tiempo.

La única crítica es con respecto a los 20 usd diarios por el uso de los servicios del hotel (del cual sólo usamos internet). Desde donde reservamos, no estábamos al tanto del mismo. Y la velocidad de Internet no es la mejor. 

De todos modos, volvería a hospedarme en el Belvedere Hotel.

title: Très bonne situation
text: L hôtel est très bien situé pour découvrir New York. Le personnel est très sympathique et répond à nos demandes notamment  concernant le wifi qui nous a été offert pour 3 jours. Le petit déjeuner est copieux, varié et délicieux.  Nous avions pris la chambre de base et c'est parfait vu que nous étions toute la journée dehors. La literie est très bien. Les chambres supérieures sont rénovées mais je pense que le prix ne se justifie pas (nous avons visité les 2 catégories de chambres supérieures). Evitez le restaurant qui donne dans l hôtel. Il est bondé et hors de prix même si c est à volonté. Cet hôtel est une adresse à recommander pour sa situation.

title: Correcto
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado, cerca de times square pero en una calle tranquila. La habitación era silenciosa con una vista linda de la ciudad. Recuerdo que cuando estuvimos alejados hacía frío, sin embargo la calefacción centralizada era súper reconfortante, ya por demás diría. La limpieza era buena. Para mejorar la decoración y el hecho de que el wifi sea pago. Sin dudas es una buena opción en la gran manzana.

title: WARNING - AVOID THIS DANGEROUS AND DUMPY HOTEL
text: Belongings have gotten stolen from the rooms. Rats and roaches running wild. The smell of marijuana and urine wafts through the halls. Loud shouting and noises in the middle of the night. Avoid the Belvedere Hotel at all costs. You have been warned!

title: Convenient Theatre District Hotel
text: Stayed here on a theatre district trip to take in four Broadway plays.  It was convenient to Broadway and its 48th Street location came without the intensity and busyness of hotels directly on 7th, 8th or Broadway.  Staff was friendly, helpful and courteous.  Buffet breakfast was filling, and wine in the evenings was a nice touch.  Elevators were small and slow as with many buildings of this era, but rooms were comfortable.  Housekeeping staff were all great as well.  Recommended for a Theatre District stay.

title: Bom custo x benefício
text: Ótima localização para quem quer ficar perto da Times Square em rua mais calma, checkin checkout rápidos quando não há filas, os quartos estão sendo renovados e sao bem arrumados, roupa de cama, de banho e amenities muito bons. Altamente recomendado.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I loved this hotel. It was quiet enough and staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. AC working properly, and beds were comfy. It’s very close to everything, so if you are looking to walk to time square, Central Park, etc... this is the place. There is a very good restaurant right next door (patzeria family and friends) a recommended place :)

title: Worst experience in NYC
text:
I have always had a wonderful experience in America as far as hospitality goes, most hotels/ restaurants offer immense courtesy and customer service but not the Belvedere Hotel. 
The staff is the most rude awful lot and I have been appalled by the mannerism. 
I stayed with them for four nights. The location of the hotel is great no doubt, it’s centrally located close to Times Square. 
So thumbs up on location and that alone. 

The wifi barely works and after numerous complaints, no body was ready to help out. All we got was- the router is right outside your room and we cannot do anything. 
As evident from other reviews, several travellers have mentioned the same problem with the hotel here on trip advisor, clearly they don’t give any damn and can’t seem to know what to do to solve the problem. 

Guest Relation Services are so poor, they shouldn’t be allowed near guests, literally! 
I called twice and also personally asked a hotel staff member to get my room blinds fixed which were broken, but in 4 days time, nobody could really come up and fix the curtain. Simply wow! 
Other times nobody would answer the call if I ever called the number.

I would like to specially mention the blonde front desk manager whose name I couldn’t get. What a rude unpleasant fellow. I really did want to get his name but as I stood in line just to get his details he managed to piss me off even more with air and how he behaved like he was doing the guests a favour by standing there and helping them. 
What arrogance and whatta horrid man! I couldn’t stand to see his face daily. That’s how uncool he is. 

The tariff of the rooms is way more than what they offer. I would caution everyone, all they offer is disappointment in a bomb amount!

title: בחזרה למלון זה לאחר שנה ,,,מלון טוב ,,אבל ,,
text: חזרנו  למלון זה לאחר כמעט שנה ,,משום מה הפיגומים מסביב למלון עדיין במקומם כשלא עובדים כלל על שיפוץ, היתרון היחידי של המלון זה המיקום שלו ,יש 2 מעליות מרכזיות שבשעות העומס צריך להמתין הרבה זמן ,בקצוה המלון יש עוד מעלית שירות  קטנה שהאורחים משתמשים בה יחד עם אנשי השירותים, ביום השלשי לשהותי  במלון בשעות הבוקר המוקדמות לא היה מים בברזים  בכול המלון רצינו לצאת לטיול מוקדם ,אך לצערנו יצאנו ב 8:00 בבוקר ללא מקלחת ,כשחזרנו בערב  בקבלה הודיעו לנו שהמים חזרו ב 8:30 :) ,לא עזר לנו,,בכלל המלון כאילו קפא על שמריו לא מנסה לשפר או ליעל דברים ,,לדעתי ל2 לילות אפשר להינות לא יותר

title: A well located and comfortable hotel in central Manhattan.
text:
The Belvedere is very comfortable with quiet rooms (for New York). We paid a little extra for a room with a refrigerator and microwave which was useful for our 9 night stay. Our room faced the back of the hotel and was very quiet except for a little air conditioner noise from adjacent buildings, but this was not a problem. We could open the window, which was great if you need fresh air. The rooms was large and comfortable with good service. Ours had a quite spacious marble bathroom.
We did find the two elevators to be very slow, resulting in long waits at peak times. 
We looked at the in-house breakfast but decided against eating breakfast at the hotel as we wanted more of an uncooked continental breakfast.
The Belvedere is surrounded by plenty of places to eat ranging from Hell's Kitchen (9th Ave) through to much more expensive venues east of the hotel. 
The location is excellent for sightseeing, being more or less centrally located between Central Park and Times Square. It is a short walk to Broadway and Fifth Ave and close to subway stations. A taxi to Penn Station is around ten minutes, while a taxi to or from JFK Airport is around one hour, depending on traffic.

title: Uitstekende ligging
text: Zeer goede ligging, kamers zijn vernieuwd en heel proper, meer heb je niet nodig op een citytrip. Ontbijt met voldoende keuzes. Wij zaten op 3de verdieping, wel veel lawaai van de airco-groepen die buiten staan. Binnen de 5-10 minuten zit je op TimeSquare.

title: Trevligt basic hotell med topp-läge!
text:
Hotellet ligger mitt i Theater district, och nära till Hells Kitchen och Times square, med fin New York-vy från alla rum (iaf vån 11) - bästa läget tyckte vår familj med sex tonåringar. Personalen var supertrevliga och hjälpsamma och hotellet har en snabb tvättstuga i källaren om man stannar länge. 
Det finns ett litet gym, med rätt smarta maskiner för många övningar, men ganska slitna. 
Frukosten var bara godkänd, bara minsta möjliga inom varje kategori, kunde välja på Full American Breakfast (ca $20) eller Continental (ca $15)utan den varma maten som pancakes, egg och bacon. Tråkigt bröd och usla croissanter för de som kör på Continental, men prisklassen verkar gälla i området, och det är å andra sidan enkelt att hitta bra frukost runt hörnet. 
För oss som reste som familj var det en lärdom att dubbelsäng (”double” eller ”standard”)betyder endast Queen size, vilket är för smalt för att klämma ihop två tonåringar i under många dagar. Så tipset innan man åker till USA: kolla om ett rum för fyra verkligen är fyra bäddar och inte bara två Queen size.

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel is excellently located for sightseeing trips.  Close enough to be within walking distance to all main attractions but far enough away to be a quiet haven of rest after a busy day.  Rooms were spacious and well presented and staff were welcoming, friendly and nothing was too much trouble.  Would definitely book again 👍

title: A mixed review
text: This was a hard review to write because most of the cons are not easily fixed. Let’s start with the good stuff: the staff was amazing and the location was great!  Now for the cons: this is a really old building (1920’s) which adds some charms but also some downsides. The biggest frustration was the elevators. They are really small and durning peak times it can take a good 10 mins just to get on one. The rooms don’t have central air only a window unit which seemed to have trouble keeping the room cool even in 70 degree weather. The shower head sprayed water everywhere and pretty much got the whole bathroom wet. One of our beds sagged in the middle so that both people rolled right into each other. All that being said these were really minor inconveniences and considering the great location I feel that the hotel was priced very well.

title: Cute Hotel just walking distance from main attractions.
text:
This hotel is just a block away from main downtown attractions.  It is a smaller hotel.  The rooms were great but the bathroom was very small.  The toilet was right against the wall making it a little uncomfortable using.  The staff were pleasant and the room was very clean.  It has a microwave and a fridge and a little sink.  The bed was very comfy and there were always plenty of towels.
