My only complaint was the toilet.

title: Great Hotel let down by poor internet!
text: We loved this hotel for the location quality and room size consider most hotels in Times Square are small.  The staff were helpful.  The lifts are not great and one of the main lifts was out of action.  We were on the 5th floor and there was some street noise but not bad at all.  I require internet for work when I travel all the time.  There were significant issues with their network and internet performance considering it is paid for is substandard and not acceptable for a New York City hotel.  I would defiantly stay here again although I would make other internet arrangements.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel fits the bill for a
friendly and comfortable place to stay right in the midst of the theater district. Staff is very helpful, rooms are clean and restaurants and theaters all within walking distance. I will definitely return.

title: Exceeded my expectations! Friendly Staff and great location.
text:
Check in was a breeze, out executive king bed was amazing. Clean, comfortable and quiet. There are so many good restaurants on 9th ave only half a block from the hotel. We will be staying here from now on when we visit NYC.
Thanks Belvedere Staff!!!!

title: Great location, great value, Awesome breakfast
text:
So you think staying in the Theater District is to costly? Think again. This is a FIND. We walked to 'Hamilton'. 
  The rooms are well decorated, and relatively spacious for moderately priced  NYC. The ambiance is Classic NYC: understated quality but not frivolous. 
  And yes, I pigged out on the breakfast. I bet you will, too.

title: Een aanrader in Manhattan
text:
We kwamen met de metro vanaf de luchthaven en dat is ideaal. De halte zit op 50th street, 2 blokken verwijdert van het hotel. Het personeel was bijzonder vriendelijk.
De kamer was recent gerenoveerd en voorzien van een mooie, moderne badkamer met grote douche, een klein keukentje en een groot bed.
Het ontbijt was erg uitgebreid.
Er zit een brandweerkazerne om de hoek maar daar hadden wij geen last van.
Dankzij de executive kamer hadden de ook gratis wifi en die werkte goed.

title: Good hotel, great location and amazing price
text: I find this hotel in a Hot Deal to stay two nights in NYC waiting for a connection flight. Normally I'm skeptical about hotels in NYC, but this was a great surprise. Front desk was very nice and helpful staff. Very organized and customer service oriented. Rooms are spacious, very clean and comfy. Great beds, 2 queens. Bathroom super clean and big. Good TV. Location is amazing, is placed super near Times Square and have food stores near. For me excellent choice, I will try again.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price!
text: Love this Hotel!  Large rooms, especially for NYC and right in the heart of Manhattan!  Walking distance to Times Square as well as the Theater District.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  Definitely recommend!

title: holiday
text:
Lovely hotel, fabulous staff, clean rooms, Noel on reception is very helpful. Wine hour is a nice little bonus.
Far enough yet close enough to times square to avoid taxis tooting all night long.
The little kitchen bit is fab, has a fridge and microwave, you just need to ask for cutlery, plates and glasses.  Means you dont have to eat out every night. 
Air con might be a bit noisy as it turns on and off during the night obvs dependent on the temp you set it at. You get used to it tho and it didnt stop us sleeping.

title: Great location, quiet & comfortable beds!
text: I took my two daughters to NYC for first visit to the Big Apple. The location to Times Square was great...only a couple of blocks away.The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Because it is an older hotel, there is a window AC unit. It was also nice to have the mini fridge. It would have been nice to have a continental breakfast, but they did have a happy hour from 5 to 6! I would definitely stay here again for our next trip.

title: Seven Night Stay
text: Thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. Our room was always spotlessly clean, and we did not suffer any noise from outside or inside. They were doing free wine in the foyer every night between 5pm and 6pm, which was a nice surprise. We did not eat in the hotel, but the concierge suggested some nice places close to the hotel for breakfast and dinner on the days we wanted to eat local. The only disappointment was the WIFI charges and the tin shed thing they have on the front of the building, but that seems to be part of an epidemic in NY.

title: a eviter
text:
un personnel désagréable . Je pense qu'ils ont oublié le sens du client.    Un gros chantier de construction à côté de l'hôtel n'arrange rien . Discussion sur les chambres réservées et pas sûr que nous ayons obtenu la catégorie choisie.
En fait il ne faut pas les déranger....
Climatisation très bruyante

title: Belvedere is the Best
text: Have stayed at this reasonable, "close to everything" hotel in downtown Manhattan 2x .The last time, it had been significantly upgraded and was like a stylish boutique hotel.  Will definitely stay again!

title: Ottima posizione, prezzo abbordabile
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per tre notti in questo albergo  a fine maggio. La posizione è comodissima perché molto vicina a Times Square. Bellissima vista dalla nostra camera. I letti erano comodissimi, anche perché quando si va a New York la gran parte del tempo si passa fuori. Il bagno  sempre ben fornito di detergenti, bagnoschiuma e balsamo, aveva come pecca la triste tendina per la doccia che non rappresenta il massimo dell’igiene. Per quanto riguarda la pulizia e la biancheria, abbiamo trovato un buono standard di pulizia. Lo staff dell’hotel è stato cortese ed efficiente. Personalmente lo terremo in considerazione se dovessimo tornare tenuto conto della posizione veramente strategica e del prezzo che ritengo adeguato per il contesto

title: Nice, clean,convenient
text:
We were in room 1003. The room had been updated and was a good size. The room was clean. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning worked great, it was nice having a microwave and fridge and the location off Times Square and access to the Subway was all fantastic. There were even many usb charging outlets for all four of us. Also, what a nice laundry room in the basement-never a wait and very clean with plentiful machines.   

Some things to consider. The room has FULL size beds, not queens.   Being used to sleeping at home in a King size bed, it was tight. I would still stay again though as I couldn’t find many other hotels in this price range with positive reviews. There is a table between the two beds. There is no table on other side of bed so I kept placing my phone and glasses on the floor. There was plenty of room for a bedside table...so it would be great if they would add one. 

Of biggest concern though was the lack of hooks or places to hang towels. There is no hook on wall or bathroom door. With four of us and the intent to conserve daily washing of towels that made it tough.  To take your clothes into the bathroom to shower, there is no surface or hook to place them. 

Also, each day we were given new soaps even though the previous one had only been barely used. It seems a shame to throw the used ones away each day. 

Twice of six days we received no wash cloths?  

There needs to be a bag for the ice bucket. 

Everyone in hotel was helpful and pleasant with exception to the guy that holds your luggage when your room is not ready.  He seemed annoyed on two occasions if you didn’t know his process. 

We asked for an early check in when we reserved the room a month earlier as we arrived on a flight around 10 am. We didn’t get in until after 4. This was disappointing. 

All in all, room was good. We liked it. I felt it was a good size. We had no real problems of any kind and we would recommend it to others visiting.

title: Thank you very much.
text:
This is our 7th stay at the Belvedere Hotel, and they did not disappoint.  We were in New York for my 50th birthday holiday.  

The Belvedere Hotel upgraded us to a room with a view, free wi-fi, and complimentary breakfast.  

Thank you very much for your kindness - I was totally overwhelmed, and suprised.

We love the Belvedere Hotel as its close to Times Square, and the staff are very polite and helpful.

Looking forward to our 8th stay, probably next year.  

xx

title: Péssima experiência - péssimo serviço
text:
Estive no Belvedere com minha família de 6a (08/06/2018) a domingo - péssima experiência e péssimo serviço - a começar dos bellman (que te cobram literalmente pelo simples uso do carrinho) - bateram na porta do meu quarto - e a continuar pelos atendentes de front desk e restaurante. Banheiro do quarto sujo. Fui obrigado a pagar uma taxa extra de USD 22 / dia pela internet (conexão muito ruim), fitness (que não iria usar por falta de tempo) e por 1 hora de vinho (que não bebo).
Enfim, por mais de R$ 1.000 por dia (que foi o que paguei), as cadeias tradicionais são melhores.
Não recomendo e não voltarei jamais !

title: Ok Hotel, Ok service
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and 3 days. The service was inconsistent, depending on who you got at the desk. There was no coffee maker in the room, nor any room service so we had to buy starbucks coffee everyday and store it in the room. We asked for coffee mugs to heat up the coffee and there was some resistance in providing it and when requested they didn't come to collect the used mugs and only provided fresh ones after requesting multiple times, which was odd to me. The restaurant in the hotel which served the breakfast was very good. The breakfast buffet spread was decadent and our family enjoyed it, given we are vegetarians who don't eat eggs. The breakfast was included with the room, which was truly a relief. 
Coming to the room, it was clean but I feel it could be cleaner especially since we stayed a longer time than usual. The size of the room was good. The beds were comfortable.

title: Good 4 nights
text: We all enjoyed our stay  at the Belvedere it was very homely, the rooms where a reasonable size, very comfortable bed with a fridge and microwave . Front door staff very helpful. Overall we really  enjoyed our stay .

title: Solid Hotel in Manhattan
text: We stayed at the Belvedere on a recent business trip to New York City.  It is an older hotel located in the theater district.  The rooms were a decent size for Manhattan and had nice amenities such as a small kitchen.  The staff was friendly but the elevators were small and a little slow.

title: Abbastanza deluso
text:
Lo consideravo il mio Hotel di riferimento a new York ma mi devo ricredere. La posizione è sicuramente il punto di forza, una via poco trafficta vicinissima a Time Square. Quello che mi ha lasciato perplesso è stato il prezzo in relazione ai servizi offerti. L'hotel è piuttosto vecchio e da anni non vengono fatte migliorie. Moquette ovunque che emana un odore non molto gradevole, soprattutto in camera. Le camere appunto dovrebbero essere rimodernate e pulite meglio. Anche i bagni non sono in ottime condizioni e la doccia ha ancora un'antiquata tenda in plastica piena di peli. Personale piuttosto scortese e maleducato. Ho provato la palestra che ho trovato poco funzionale. Anche qui uno strano odore che la rendeva quasi impraticabile.
Se considero quanto pagato posso sicuramente trovare di meglio nella zona

title: Lovely Hotel in Heel's Kitchen
text: A busy and popular hotel in Hell's Kitchen. Close to any thing you may want to do in NYC The area is a delight for foodies. The room was big for New York standards. Over all a pleasant stay at a great location.

title: Fantastic
text: Large 2 bed rooms with frig and microwave,large bath. Looks out to street to see restaurant, people, and new York's famous  skyscrapers. hotel has a cafe and sreakhouse but we chose to eat out, there's so many to choose and I haven't  been  disappointed  yet. The concierge and check in crew were excellent  no problems  what so ever. My advice  don't  stay in, go explore, than come back to rest and do it all over again!

title: Very good!
text: Buon hotel in ottima posizione (molto vicino Times square). Personale gentile. Abbiamo soggiornato per 5 notti durante il viaggio di nozze. Camere spaziose così come il bagno dotata di tutti i comfort compreso un mini angolo cucina. Per quanto riguarda la pulizia direi che si potrebbe far meglio. Rumore onnipresente proveniente dalla strada (ma è New York) ma anche per le finestre poco performanti. Colazione intercontinentale (era inclusa nel prezzo dell’offerta, altrimenti si paga e non poco) ma veramente abbondante per la varietà di cibo che offriva. Consigliato

title: The Belvedere - we will be back!
text: We booked through Expedia, reserving a Deluxe King room.  On arrival, we were told we had a complementary upgrade to the Executive King room.  (Works for me!).  There were no surprises in the hotel charges (all was paid in advance at the time of booking), the only thing extra on the bill when we checked out was the internet charge that we requested be included when we checked in .  The Belvedere Hotel is in an excellent location, not more than a 10 minute walk from nearby attractions or the handy subway stations.  The lobby staff were extremely courteous and helpful, and the daily servicing of the room was also done very nicely,all toiletries and towels were fresh every day and the room was spotless.  We had an executive king room on the 8th floor and it was very clean and comfortable, it looked like it had been updated very recently, we had absolutely no complaints.  This was our second stay at this hotel - we will be back.

title: "Good hotel"
text:
Good hotel and in a prime location. Rooms desperately need of upgrading but are very clean and spacious. On the downside we would recommend that rooms have tea and coffee making facilities. Also we were charged $600 on arrival for 2 rooms we'd booked. This was taken from our bank account and held on to as a retainer. We felt this was un-necessary and a bit naughty as it wasn't explained in any of the booking proceedure and by the staff at check-in hence leaving us a little short on spending money. It also took nearly a week for it to be reimbursed when we got home.
Found scaffolding all round front of hotel which gave it a look of a building site but nothing seems to be being done as we never saw any workmen.
All in all we thought it was a little expensive for this type of hotel, maybe it is due to its location.
And overall we enjoyed our stay but would probably stay a little further downtown next time where we found it a bit quieter and a little cheaper. 
If you want hussle and bussle of Broadway and Times Square which is literally just round the corner, this is ideal. Found the expensive black SUV taxis a suprise when returning to JFK as the hotel has a contract with them so the fare is as cheap as the yellow cabs - ($63) But dont use them from the airport to the hotel as it'll be very expensive.

title: Fantastic hotel, great location and service
text:
We were a party of three generations and the hotel suited everyone. Fantastic location and an easy walk to Central Park, Times Square and the equally good Big Bus hop on hop off service. Hotel staff are extremely helpful and each guest has the offer of free wine from 5-6pm daily. Hundreds of bars and restaurants nearby and the little Italian next door is very good.
Our room was big, comfortable and always cleaned well.
A tip - don’t be taken in at JFK by supposed Uber drivers - we were and ended up paying over double what a yellow cab costs. The hotel concierge is fab - booked us a shuttle for the return and it was efficient, well priced - $24 per person and came on time.
Altogether I would recommend the Belvedere wholeheartedly for a New York break .
We will return.

title: Location, location
text: The hotel is perfectly located in midtown near the 50th street subway stations and you are steps away from Times Square and Rockefeller Center. We had a room with a nice view on the 17th floor. It was very quiet up there but there was a lot of construction nearby so I don’t know about lower levels. Both the blue and red line subway stations are nearby. Our room was clean and adequate but housekeeping was a bit inconsistent. We didn’t have washcloths or Kleenex for awhile. The room could have used two chairs as well. Another thing that was lacking was a coffee maker. The “kitchenette “ that was stated included a fridge and a microwave so I took for granted we could brew some coffee in house as well but not so. There was a breakfast option opportunity in the hotel and a Dunkin Donuts a short walk and elevator ride away though. All in all, we would stay there again though for the location, location.

title: Fantastic family staff
text: Our first time in New York - booked Belvedere through Thomas Cook - very impressed! Great welcome, super service and room exactly as we asked for. I stayed here with my wife and our Son - a family room was great. Very clean, daily serviced and even a nice view as a bonus! We asked reception a few times advice on days out etc and nothing was too much trouble! Only thing I would say it would be nice to have tea and coffee in the room but not a big deal. Location is superb! Would def go back!

title: Great hotel, definitely recommend!
text: Very nice tasteful decor, clean, well maintained. Lovely staff, very welcoming. Located in a nice area which is not crazy busy, but also very close to Times Square, only 1.5 blocks. Also close to restaurants, theatres, many other attractions and a handy corner shop at the end of the road. We had a small kitchenette in our room, handy if we were staying longer, but we were only there for 3 nights so took advantage of the full buffet breakfast, which was $20 pp, very reasonable for NYC, and good quality fresh food. Our room was quite small, but lovely big comfortable bed (bigger than a UK king size), plenty of storage for clothes, suitcases etc.. nice bathroom and toiletries, and on the 16th floor it was quiet, we were never disturbed by any noise from outside or neighbouring rooms. No extra charge to store luggage after check out, as our flight wasn't until later in the day, lots of staff in the lobby to help with bags, ordering taxis, etc.. very much enjoyed our stay and appreciated returning to this lovely relaxing hotel and room after days out in NYC.

title: You're paying for the location
text:
I’ve always wanted to stay in what I assumed was once a fancy hotel in the 1980s. Fake marble, gold trim everything, it is both so tacky and incredibly amazing. It is not at all as terrible as I’m making it sound, but it’s definitely dated. 

You’re less than a block from Time Square. It is the perfect location if that’s what you want.  You’re definitely paying more for a nice room in a STELLAR location. 

Parking is outrageously expensive, but isn’t that expected because of its location? 
Depending on the staff, you’ll either have someone that’s extremely helpful and kind or someone who sort of seems slightly annoyed with your questions. 

I could easily see this room being perfect for a family of four or friends looking for a trip in the city. Definitely recommend the hotel for its location and cleanliness.

title: Les cuento por que no volvería...
text:
Voy a ser objetivo y contar las cosas buenas, malas y malísimas  del hotel:

A - Malísimas:

1. Los ascensores tardan una eternidad. Tiene dos en el medio y uno en cada extremo. Hemos tenido que esperar más de 10 minutos para poder bajar. 

2. Más allá de mi opinión del baño, la regulación del agua fría y caliente era simplemente imposible. Estuve 5 noches y nunca se resolvió. 

3. Aire acondicionado: son de los viejos empotrados a la pared. Hizo un ruido que nos despertaba varias veces por noche. Muy ruidoso.... pero a lo que te imagines duplicarlo.

4. Fui con mi esposa y mi beba. Luego de hacer el check out necesite cambiarla. En los baños no hay cambiador de bebés ni ningún lugar que se asemeje. No pudieron resolvernos la necesidad. Esto es simplemente INACEPTABLE. Ante la pregunta de que hacer, La concierge respondió “no se, no soy madre”. Las personas del front desk fueron más amables pero no pudieron resolverlo. Debería ser algo obligatorio tener que poder resolver esto.

B - cosas malas:

1. Olor en pasillos
2. El hotel parece haber sido reciclado en los 80 y así quedó 

C - cosas buenas:

1. Ubicación del hotel 
2. Wi fi
3. Predisposición del personal que guarda valijas y ayuda con los taxis. 

Por el precio que pague definitivamente voy a buscar otro hotel que tenga mejores prestaciones en el futuro . No soy muy exigente pero lo que paso acá fue casi una falta de respeto.

NO LO RECOMIENDO 

Adrian.

title: Excelente ubicación... solo eso
text:
El hotel Belvedere tiene una ubicación excelente a unos minutos caminando de Times Square. Fuera de la ubicación las Instalaciones son viejas, los elevadores son insuficientes y las amenidades (wifi) no son gratuitas y además te son cargadas obligatoriamente (20 USD/ día) junto con un paquete que incluye una hora de copeo de vinos (wine hour 5-6 pm) y un descuento marginal en su desayuno (15%). 
No estoy de acuerdo en que te impongan un servicio, si no deseas pagar por el wifi porque simplemente no lo necesitas me parece un descaro que te lo cobren de forma obligatoria

title: Grata Surpresa na Times Square
text:
Ficamos hospedados uma semana no mês de maio , após viagem para Cancun. Anteriormente já havia ficado no Hilton, Row, Pensilvânia e radisson lexington.
Acabei fechando o belvedere é estava meio apreensivo por não conhece lo. Mas tivemos uma execelente surpresa com um staff muito agradável , boa localização , enfim, custo x beneficio inquestionável !
Pra começar : ficamos no quarto executivo . 2 camas grandes , mini cozinha, banheiro todo em mármore , Wi-Fi gratuito , tudo muito novo e bem cuidado .
Todos os itens mencionados são difíceis de se encontrar em nyc. 
A localização e a 3 minutos andando da Times Square . Há inúmeras lojas e mercados ao redor do hotel , garantindo alguma economia nessa cidade tão cara .
Aceitaram encomendas nossas sem custo algum, porém vale observar que só recebem  com 3 dias no mínimo do seu check inn. 
Diariamente  fazem uma happy your com vinho gratuito . Muito bacana ! 
Elevadores , como já mencionado , em horário de pico ficam cheios, mas nada que desabone a estada no local . 
Quartos devidamente arrumados diariamente ! 
Gostei demais e nas próximas vezes será minha primeira opção na cidade !

title: Aangenaam!
text: Toen we toekwamen kregen we een gratis upgrade. Zeer mooie kamers,zeer mooie bedden. Personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Goede ligging,op 2 minuten van Times square.1 maal ontbijt intercontinentaap genomen,was niet echt de moeite. We komeb zeker terug!

title: Goed hotel op perfecte plek
text: Bij de check-in kregen we een upgrade en gratis internet omdat we Expedia gold zijn. Personeel is vriendelijk en professioneel. De executive kamer was groot, schoon en netjes onderhouden. Er is niet heel veel bergruimte, maar voldoende voor een paar dagen. De tweepersoons bedden zijn wel wat kort. Badkamer was schoon, goed uitgerust en de waterdruk was goed. Er is een kluisje en koelkastje op de kamer. WiFi in het hotel is super slecht en traag. (Niet van deze tijd) bij de executieve kamers zit het erbij, maar het is zeer zeker geen 13 dollar per dag waard. Heel slecht en vaak uitval. De locatie van het hotel, 1 blok van times square is perfect, alles is dichtbij. 2 blokken van een metrostation.

title: Carino ma...
text:
Con mia mamma e mio fratello ho soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 notti. Partiamo dalle cose positive: L’hotel si trova in una posizione davvero ottima per visitare New York, in una via a senso unico e non troppo trafficata. La nostra camera all’11esimo piano godeva di una vista bellissima. La camera ampia dotata di ogni confort. Colazione fatta in hotel a 15 dollari gustosa e completa. Il personale gentile. Servizio Wi-Fi buono. Cose negative: pulizia della camera scarsa (il pavimento del bagno era sempre pieno di peli, già al nostro arrivo e per tutta la durata del soggiorno, le lenzuola non sapevano di pulito e gli asciugamani presentavano diverse macchie). Finestre (nessuna differenza di rumore esterno tra finestra chiusa o aperta, questo a New York può essere un problema visto il continuo rumore di sirene ecc). Aria condizionata/riscaldamento: per fortuna non abbiamo avuto bisogno ne dell’uno ne dell’altro; abbiamo però provato ad accendere l’aria condizionata ma la stufetta faceva un rumore assordante. 
Detto questo lo consiglierei per tante cose, ma se ci aspettiamo la pulizia dei nostri hotel in Italia scordiamocela!

title: city trip
text: Goed hotel. Wat verouderd,maar heel proper. Personeel heel vriendelijk. Heel centraal gelegen, alles is goed bereikbaar. De metro is ook een heel handig transport middel. Geen aanrader is de hop on-hop off bus. ok Je ziet heel wat. maar je verliest heel veel tijd aan de halte's en in het verkeer.

title: Spacious Rooms
text: We were a family of 4 and the rooms were big to accommodate us all. Our flight arrived early morning and the receptionist was kind enough and gave us an early check in. We even upgraded us to a better room. The location of the hotel is brilliant.. right next to Times Square. Everything was at walkable distance. Staff was very courteous. They have a mini kitchen as well. The wash rooms very neat and clean. Looks like they’ve renovated it recently. Ideal place to stay in NY!

title: Just 2 blocks away from times square! Quiet place! Found my new poace in New York!!!
text: The best location you can find in New York, without sacrificing real vacation as within two blocks from the busy times square you will find this historic hotel in the more quiet side, on both ends of the streets tho, you will be treated with all the restaurants you can imagine. The rooms are of the good size and desgned more on the grand  way. We arrived early and was allowed early checkin, nice of them. There was also a treat of wine to everyone around 5-6pm every afternoon! We love it!!!! They clean the rooms everyday so we love the change of linens as a good treat! Yhe beds tho doublenis more on the smaller side but is still ok.  This will be my fave pace to come back to.  My brother and his family loves this hotel soo much as well.

title: Surprise Fee + Old Dump of a Hotel
text:
Arrived to find out there was a mandatory fee added for each night of my stay.  The fees were $20 per night and were not government related fees / taxes.  Rather they were made up fees created by the hotel to avoid accurate and transparent pricing.  I will be filing a complaint with the BBB over this. 

Other than that the hotel is old.  The elevators are so slow.  The bathtub had dirt rings.  The vents were covered in thick dust.  The drains backed up.  The TV remote didn't work.  Staff were a tad rude. 

Really cannot believe the highly rated nature of this hotel.  I really have to think the positive reviews are fake.

title: Mai più!
text:
Avevo prenotato questo hotel tramite Expedia con 7-8 mesi di anticipo.
Tra le varie opzioni, avevamo scelto una camera Deluxe con letto King e il wi-fi gratuito (cosa per noi prioritaria).
Arrivati in hotel, la reception ci comunica che non ci possono dare il wi-fi gratuito e che per questo ci hanno assegnato una camera migliore e non ci hanno dato alternativa.
Il wi-fi sarebbe stato a pagamento (14$ ogni 24 ore più le tasse che a new york non sono mai comprese).
Capisco che possano nascere delle difficoltà, ma trovo incomprensibile non poter dare all'ospite la possibilità di scelta, niente costava inviare una mail informativa in cui comunicavano l'impossibilità dell'opzione informando preventivamente il cambio camera. A quel punto avrei avuto la possibilità di valutare se mi andava bene il cambio camera o il cambio hotel dove avrei potuto avere il servizio di cui necessitavo.
Assurdo!
Poi c'è molto da discutere anche sulla pulizia delle camere. Nessuno pretendeva che facessero decorazioni, ma inqualificabile l'appallottolare il pigiama e gettarlo sulla sedia come se fosse uno straccio, bastava appoggiarlo delicatamente, ci si metteva poco e l'opinione era completamente diversa (questo particolare notato da mia sorella che lavora nel settore e ha, giustamente, trovato inaccettabile queste minime attenzioni verso il cliente). Inqualificabile!!!
So che in America vivono di mance e durante il viaggio non abbiamo lesinato, ma prima mi fornisci il servizio e poi io ti dò la mancia, non che te la devo dare per avere un servizio che sia il minimo sindacale.
Detto questo vedrò di lasciare anche una recensione su Expedia che non permette a tuitti i suoi clienti di lasciare recensioni sui viaggi, rendendo quindi non totalmente veritiere le opinioni nel loro sito.

title: Great Hotel and Great Location!! Alfred Sr & Alfred Jr
text: I and my son stayed at Belvedere for a few days in May 2018 and it was a wonderful stay at this hotel. Jacob and Anita at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful with restaurant selections and locations and also the wine hostessin in the evening was friendly too.Our check in was smooth we were a bit early but just stored the bags and took off to the city. Ive been to New York many times but this hotel is what i was looking for, clean rooms,uptodate refrigerator, clean beds, microwave, coffee station and sink, manager wine reception at 5pm. Location in Hells Kitchen is where you want to be, plenty of restaurants, short walk to Times Square, easy subway access. Believe me if we liked it you will like it i have no negative reviews its New York! coming back again soon.

title: Terrible, misleading pictures of rooms, no hot water
text:
Arrived may 16th, friendly check in clerk and bellman, as soon as I arrived to the rooms I asked the bellman if there were any diferentes rooms since ir doesnt look like the ones on the web page,no voucher, old fridge, no place yo put your bags so you need to somehow place them on the floor and find a way yo walk on the room, tiny bathroom that could he find on any cheap old cafeteria, horrible noise from the air conditioner so you should pick if you listen the tv or turn the A/C on and of course couldnt sleep.
Next morning went yo front desk yo tell them allá those facts and their answer was that the room shown on the web is an executive room and the one booked was a standard of which there is no single picture on the web soyou don't know until you are there.
Their option was to pay extra for the executive up grade which I took since the original room was really terrible.
Now I'm at the suite and find out there is no hot water, barely warm and the shower holder came off the wall.
Location very good.

title: Great hotel!
text:
This was a great hotel in a great location.
The only thing that bothered me a little was there was scaffolding on the outside covering the entire front, I mean they have to do the work but would of been nice to see the outside!
Rooms where really nice and so was the staff. Had Buffet breakfast once on the last day, thought was a bit pricey but was nice

title: Great location
text:
I stayed at the Belvedere for a few days in May 2018. The hotel is in a great location in relation to the theater district and Times Square. 

The rooms are not modern, as other reviews stated. However, I wasn't really there much so it didn't matter to me. The elevators were slow at certain times of the day, but it wasn't a deal breaker. 

I used the valet service for my car and had no problems. It was very convenient to just drive up to the door, unpack the car and have it parked for the duration of the stay. 

This was a great value for NYC, and I really had no complaints.

title: Top location, top staff
text: The Belvedere was recommended by our traveling agency, and we don't regret it! This is a great hotel, situated near Times Square, short walking distance to Rockefeller or ferry, but also very close to the hopon-hopoff bus stops. Room was spotless, the staff at the reception very friendly and helpful, and the wine hour is just that extra that makes you feel at home right away (we arrived during wine hour, and it was great to relax after a long day of traveling). We would come here again.

title: Nice quiet hotel in the heart of the action
text: Stayed here in early May 2018 with my wife. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were good for our needs. Perhaps the bathroom could do with a little updating but I would stay here again when returning to NYC

title: Mrs J Armour
text: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Belvedere with my daughter, there is nothing I can fault, friendly and helpful staff, rooms were spotless, with spotlessly clean towels and room made up every day, super comfortable beds, central for Times Square and all the popular sightseeing. Got upgraded to a high floor with a stunning night view with all the lights, air con was a bit noisy but we didn’t care about that when it does the job well, some good small restaurants right next to it, pizza place and a Mexican restaurant if you’re in a hurry and no time to look about, overall 5 out of 5 for me would definitely stay again.

title: Lo único bueno:ubicacion
text:
Muy malo la verdad que ni para dormir!. 
Lo único rescatable es la ubicación que es excelente. 
El tamaño de la habitación, por ser una hotel en NYC es razonablemente grandecita, no puede decirse lo mismo de las camas.
Las camas dobles son tan chicas que si te pones de costado te chocas con la otra persona, ni hablar de ponerse los dos boca arriba. Además de eso crujían las camas al menor movimiento, por lo que descansar de noche (que es el único momento que se descansa en una ciudad como NY) fue casi imposible.
Tiene microondas en la habitación pero no tiene ni 1 sola taza para poder calentarse algo, así que no le encontré mucho el sentido. 
No recuerdo ahora la cantidad de pisos, que creo eran 17 pero en una semana solo tuvieron 1 solo ascensor en funcionamiento en el lobby y el de servicio. Por lo que subir o bajar de las habitaciones llevaba su buen tiempo.
Aprovecho a decir que los que suben las maletas son sumamente asquerosos, ni buen día ni buenas tardes, al menos quien me toco a mi tenía muy pocas ganas de trabajar.
Positivo? La ubicación y que tiene una pequeña heladerita en la habitación.
Si vas con bebé, tienen cuna para darte sin costo alguno.

title: The best staff in New York
text:
As a well traveled reviewer I rank this hotel as one of the nicest I have stayed in Nothing is too much trouble everything is done with a smile they even manage difficult ones with good grace Alina and Jacob are both darling looking after so well
I have difficulty with getting in and out of the bath so they moved us the a room with extra safety rails 
Well done to you all and I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a central friendly comfortable hotel would stay again in a heartbeat

title: Mum and daughter trip
text:
When we arrived at 22:30 on the Tuesday from Las Vegas We had a beautiful welcome by reception. I explained that my mum struggled with showers over the tub they didn’t have that kind of room available as they were fully booked but they would have one ready for us tomorrow for us not to unpack and they would have us all settled in by 16:00 on Wednesday they were true to there word we were given a beautiful room and unless you are willing to pay thousands a night your never going to get a view the hotel is very central as you are just off Times Square and Hell’s Kitchen all of the reception staff are fabulous and will do there best to meet all of your requirements Jacob and Alina were especially helpful recommending restaurants places of interest and directions even the line of an umbrella on a particularly wet day we loved staying here the rooms are so comfortable when you are in them not that you are in them for long there is so much to do even a wine hour in the lobby where you can mingle with the other guests and staff and get some great tips on the city when we return to New York this will be my go to hotel 08/05/18-13/05/18
Thank you for our fabulous stay

title: Hôtel très bien, superbe localisation
text: Nous avons séjourné pendant 6 nuits dans cet hôtel  avec nos deux enfants de 10 et 5 ans. Chambre « exécutive » au 12eme étage sur la rue principale - très spacieuse, suffisamment de place pour nous 4, et entièrement rénovée. On avait une vue magnifique sur les buildings sans être dérangés par le bruit. Petite kitchenette ( frigo, microonde, évier) - suffisant pour réchauffer quelques plats à emporter. Le ménage est fait tous les jours, de manière impeccable. Le personnel à la réception très gentil et serviable ( nous avons communiqué uniquement en anglais).Et surtout, la localisation est superbe - tout près de Times Square et métro direct de l’aéroport JFK. Nous n’avons pas testé le petit déjeuner, ni le restaurant de l’hôtel. C’était un super choix pour notre première visite à NYC. Seul petit bémol - la climatisation fait beaucoup de bruit, mais on l’éteignait pour dormir, donc finalement ce n’était pas très dérangeant.

title: Third Visit and Still a Great Choice
text: Haven't been here in a couple years but it was the best price for the nite I needed. Excellent Theater District location and they've been spending some money upgrading the rooms. Very friendly staff - just wish the cafe was open more than just breakfast - and they had a bar!

title: Picture Perfect Old School Charm
text: Hotel Staff was very courteous.  We booked our room through a discount travel site.  They immediately upgraded our room.  Usually the discount sites give the regular rooms & most hotels do not upgrade in that situation.  Room was upgraded & spacious.  Staff was more than generous to offer restaurant recommendations & directions.  24 hour doormen which was helpful leaving for airport at 4:30am.  Location is perfect.  Turn left in the heart of Manhattan go right off the beaten path with great restaurants without the tourist prices.  They were so accommodating in everyway.  Lots of European guest & families.  One of the best I've stayed in NYC.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
Great great hotel, loved the room and the staff were always helpful and friendly, even the coffee was amazing in the room, kitted out with AC, fridge and a TV! What more do you want?!

Location wise it’s great! Walking distance from great places to eat and 5 mins from the Subway, was enjoyable to return to the room after an amazing day in an amazing city

Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone

title: Older Hotel with Incredible Customer Service
text: I give this hotel five stars even though the rooms are not updated and the beds are only so-so. What it lacks in deep comfort, the hotel more than makes up for with roominess and the best hotel customer service I've experienced in a long time. If you're one of those travelers who actually spends a fair amount of time in your room, this is a great hotel because the rooms are large. I have two double beds and enough room to do my daily yoga practice. Also because my itinerary kept changing, I actually ended up with three reservations and the staff was able to keep me in the same room for the whole stay (I'm still here, actually). There is a decent breakfast available made in an actual kitchen. And the best part, I believe, is its location. Belvedere Hotel is very near the theater district, just a few blocks from whatever Broadway play you're going to. But it's very quiet. For the money, I think it's a great value.

title: Mala atención del personal
text:
Tuve un problema : yo tuve a mi mamá 4 días enferma llamando médico a la habitación y nadie, ninguna autoridad se me acercó para ver si necesitaba algo en especial, que me pudieran ayudar, asi sea ayudarme a comprar remedios o algo, y el último día sabiendo que ella estaba enferma no me quisieron extender el horario de check out de la habitación para que ella pudiera esperar tranquila antes de irnos, un desastre!!!
Me traigo muy mal recuerdo de ese hotel
es un hotel que en las fotos parece mucho mejor , está muy avejentado.
Te cobran por el servicio de Internet !!! es una locura que hagan eso !!!!

Las habitaciones son sumamente ruidosas, es muy ruidosa la calle, tendrían que poner doble vidrio para aislar el ruido y que podamos descansar los pasajeros.
El desayuno es carísimo para los pasajeros.
No tiene Room Service

Lo único bueno es la ubicación, pero paga solo por eso me iria a otro lugar.

title: Awesome Hotel, Great Location
text: Just returned from New York and stayed three nights at the Belvedere.  We had an excellent stay.  The check in was quick, the people who worked there were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and it was affordable.  The location was great.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
text: This hotel is superbly located for easy access to most of the attractions in New York. Being just 2 blocks away from Times Square you can quickly get to the "must see" places but is a quiet place to retreat to at the end of the day, the complementary wine hour at 5pm was a nice addition. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and comfortable and the beds made getting a good nights rest very easy.  Will definitely return to this hotel when next in New York.

title: Good Hotel
text: Had a recent stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it. Rooms clean, tidy & quiet plus a nice window view (17th Floor). Great location with most attractions within an easy walk (Times Sq, Rockefeller Plaza etc). If we come to NYC again this would be my preferred hotel.

title: Times square and Broadway
text: We recently stayed in this hotel and definitely would do so again great location for times square and Broadway very well equipped rooms and was a plus staying on the top floor with really good views 4* plus from us

title: Bien situé
text:
Cet hôtel est bien situé, à 2mn à pied de Times Square ainsi que des théâtres de Broadway, au calme si on demande les chambres de derrière mais la vue n’est pas top (bâtiments et chaufferies) 
Attention demandez une chambre rénovée car celles « deluxes » ne le sont pas. 
La salle de petit déjeuner est très petite et sans fenêtres, il ne faut pas être claustrophobe ! 
Je vous conseille de prendre le petit déjeuner à l’extérieur dans des cafés

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: We got put up in this hotel after our original hotel lost our reservation. The Belvedere couldn’t have been more accommodating, upgrading our room. The staff were all so nice also. The location is great, a short walk to Times Square but without all the noise, traffic or pedestrians. Close to lots of great restaurants too. There is a guest laundry which is great for travelers too. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Comfortable and conveniently situated in Midtown Manhattan
text:
It would be a 3.5 for me if I could! Clean, comfortably and conveniently sited on West 48th street within 5 minutes of Times Square, Broadway, the subway on 50th and in the Hell's Kitchen district which is full of great bars and restaurants. 

We booked a Standard Deluxe Double/Double room which was great value, enough space complete with kitchenette and coffee machine once requested. There's a safe, iron & ironing board widescreen TV and aircon which was a little noisy at lower temperature but welcomed as City centre hotel rooms can get stuffy.. The room was at the back of the hotel and whilst the view wasn't the best it was quiet! 

Don't be put off by my average assessment I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: very nice, convenient hotel
text: Stayed here for a weekend visit to celebrate a family event, (had three rooms). Very nice, fairly priced, and convenient hotel to everything around Times Square. Staff was professional, courteous and responsive. Rooms were neat, clean and were obviously updated, (as compared to some older hotels we've stayed in in NYC that looked tired/run-down).

title: Great location
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location. It’s located in Hell’s Kitchen near a vast amount of great food spots and bars and equally it’s close to Times Square! The rooms seem pretty dated and the rooms at the back of the hotel don’t have the best views but that being said it was very comfy. Promotes that you have coffee making facilities on the website but we didn’t have any and had to ask them to put on in our room (which they did). Limited plug sockets and a very noisy air con unit. But I did enjoy the stay - these are just a few things that I picked up on as it’s a perfect little spot for a few nights in the city. Thank you

title: Ni a mis enemigos se los aconsejo
text: Nos hospedamos 1 semana en este hotel, luego nos fuimos unos días a las vegas, y volvíamos al hotel por 1 día para luego regresar y volar. El hotel es insoportablemente ruidoso en general por su ubicación, a las 6 am ya nadie puede dormir. Pero lo peor de mi experiencia fue que al regresar, luego de haber estado alojada una semana antes, cuando regresamos al hotel, nos dijeron que no había habitación. En mi caso hubo unas demoras en el vuelo y llegamos a las 7 am al hotel, me dijeron que como no había confirmado la habitación (ya pagada) no tenían habitación disponible. Les comento que además de haber estado alojada con mi familia la semana anterior, me encontraba embarazada de 7 meses, pero de todas formas fueron totalmente mal educados y desconsiderados... pese a mis reclamos de mal manera nos dieron una habitación que claramente estaba fuera de servicio, por el mal olor y estado de abandono, pero no solo eso sino que le habíamos pedido poder hacer el check in un poco mas tarde dado que habiamos llegado al amanecer y queriamos descansar, no sólo eso fue negado, sino que nos colocaron en una habitacion al lado de una remodelación del hotel, fue imposible descansar un rato, sino que antes de la hora del check out normal, nos vinieron a pedir la habitación, jamas vivi una experincia igual. no volvere nunca! No se lo aconsejo ni a mi enemigo

title: great location and staff pity about the wi-fi and the check-in
text: The location of the hotel is great, the staff is polite and correct and they do a great job. It's clean and comfortable and I'll probably come back. What it's a pity is that as most of hotels even when they are pricy they make you check-in at 16 which is VERY late and it's terrible when you come from a long journey in the morning. Also in the webpage where I made my reservation it said "wi-fi in the room" but it didn't say a word that you have to PAY for it because "wi-fi by a fee" it's quite less appealing. And yes if the room says 162 dollars in hotels.com the price is 209 because there are lot of taxes which you can read later on. After all, what a person cares the most is not how much it's going to pay but how much goes to the state of new york and how much to the hotel.

title: Scandaleux !
text:
L’hôtel Belvedere jouit d’une excellente situation,  à quelques centaines de mètres de Times Square et de la station de métro 50ème rue sur les lignes bleus A, C et E. La ligne E est de plus celle qui rejoint JFK Airport, donc possibilité d’un transfert économique depuis cet aéroport.
Check in expéditif. Suite à la question de ma fille, il est précisé que le WiFi est gratuit. Voir cependant plus loin !
L’hôtel a un charme un peu désuet et parait bien tenu. Parfois un peu d’attente aux ascenseurs qui sont quand même au nombre de 4.
 Les chambres sont meublées et décorées dans un style un peu vieillot mais qui ne manque pas de charme. Elles sont vastes, bien aménagées et les rangements sont nombreux. Coin cuisine avec évier, micro ondes, percolateur et frigo. Très grand lit (« king bed ») équipé d’une literie confortable. Salle de bain d’un autre âge avec WC, lavabo et douche ; elle mériterait sans aucun doute une solide rénovation. Chauffage central  ancien sans régulation thermostatique. Climatisation individuelle (bloc  monté dans le châssis de fenêtre) non testée en raison de la météo ! Attention, certaines chambres n’en sont pas équipées (dont la nôtre !).
Compte tenu du niveau important du bruit extérieur (notamment nombreuses sirènes en provenance d’un centre de secours dans les environs), je conseille vivement de demander un étage supérieur (il y en a 16).
L’entretien des chambres est très déficient : lits sommairement faits, savons jamais remplacés (nous avons été obligés d’utiliser les nôtres), idem pour le papier toilettes. Un soir en rentrant à l’hôtel nous avons constaté que nous n’avions aucune serviette !
Le restaurant et le bar n’ont pas été testés. Il existe de nombreux restaurants bon marchés dans les environs. Je peux vous conseiller le « Patzeria Family & Friends » dans la même rue à moins de 100 m. Accueil très chaleureux au breakfast ; le soir, c’est bondé !
Une très mauvaise surprise nous attendait au check out. Outre les taxes habituelles, notre facture comprenait un « Facility Fee » de 20 $ par chambre et par nuit. On nous a explique qu’il s’agit d’un droit obligatoire et forfaitaire couvrant notamment depuis peu l’utilisation du WiFi, la mise à disposition d’un ordinateur dans le hall et des réductions au restaurant et au bar …
Or nous n’avons jamais été informés de l’existence de ce droit, ni à la réservation, ni au check in. Aucune affichette d’information à la réception, aucun document à ce sujet dans la chambre.
Devant notre protestation véhémente, un manager a té appelé. Celui-ci a consenti à réduire le droit de 7 à 4 jours, soit 80 $ au lieu de 140 $ par chambre. Ce qui évidemment ne nous satisfaisait pas.
Et le montant a été débité de notre carte de crédit sans notre autorisation.
Honteux !
Je suis perplexe car aucun autre avis ne fait allusion à ce « Facility Fee ». S’agirait-il d’une mesure de rétorsion parce que nous n’avons pris aucun repas à l’hôtel ?  Peut-être mais une fois encore, il fallait nous en informer …
Renseignez-vous bien préalablement si vous avez malgré tout l’intention de réserver au Belvedere Hotel.

title: First time
text: We really loved this hotel. The staff were always helpful and courteous. The breakfast was fantastic. The room was very spacious and the bed was excellent. So needed to recover from that jet lag. We found the location perfect.

title: Buena experiencia
text: Acabamos de volver y nos ha encantado la ciudad. La ubicación del hotel excelente. Calle muy tranquila  que contrasta con la calle de al lado con más ambiente,  tiendas de regalos, bares, supermercados. Muy cerca de Times Square. La habitación enorme con dos camas de matrimonio para nosotros dos, colchones muy cómodos. Respecto a la calefacción no me pareció ruidosa y enseguida llegaba  calor deseado. Baño grande y espacioso. Pequeña cocina con nevera por si quieres comer algo durante el día. Recepción muy amables con una señorita que hablaba perfectamente español. Nosotros tuvimos suerte y en nuestro paquete entraba WiFi gratis para 4 días. Cuando se acabaron bajamos a recepción y nos dieron 4 más. Repetiríamos sin duda.

title: Great choice for our first stay in NYC
text: As everyone says, the location was excellent. Two blocks off Time Square but without the noise. Granted we were on the 17th floor so street noise was not a factor. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Some even called us by name. The rooms were clean and average sized but who stays in their room when you can walk to almost everything. Found some great restaurants and coffee shops close by as well. When we return to NYC, this will be our hotel of choice.

title: Top Lage!
text:
Wir waren jetzt schon das 3. Mal während unserer NYC Besuche im Belvedere untergebracht. Wir waren bisher jedes Mal zufrieden, man muss allerding bezüglich Modernität der Zimmer und des Interieurs Abstriche machen, was für NYC allerdings bestimmt normal ist.

Schön sind die relativ großzügig geschnittenen Zimmer Kitchenette. Dad ist zum einen sehr angenehm, dass man nicht über seine Koffer stolpert, Platz incl. Closet ist wirklich genügend und zum anderen jst eine Kitchenette sehr angenehm mit Kühlschrank, Microwelle und separater Kaffeemaschine.

Das Personal war wieder sehr nett, zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmermädchen machten ihren Nob auch sehr gewissenhaft, sodass wir keine Gründe zur Beanstandung hatten.

Die angesprochenr Lage ist natürlich top. Um die Ecke ist direkt eine Subway Station, Central Park und Time Square sind sehr gut und schnell fussläufig zu erreichen.

Jederzeit wieder!

title: A deux pas de Broadway
text:
Une semaine dans cet hôtel parfaitement situé : tout est à proximité , métro, commerces, restaurants dont une pizzeria à côté qui est très bien, time square ...vue du douzième étage dégagée sur les buildings ! Un peu bruyant la nuit parfois si chambre sur rue principale.
L'accueil n'a pas été très chaleureux avec une personne qui n'a pas fait trop d'effort pour se faire comprendre quand on ne maîtrise pas l'anglais parfaitement mais ce n'est pas grave sur tout mon séjour qui a été magnifique !
Vous pouvez réserver dans cet hôtel sans crainte.

title: room with a view
text: good hotel in a great location, negative was the guy at the reception during check in he was not really friendly or helpful, room was good size on the 17th floor but you could still hear some noise from the street

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is in a great location but as far as street noise goes it isn’t fabulous. Being right near a fire house meant constant sirens but also the horns and construction next door made it difficult to sleep. We were also on the 12th floor so not exactly close to the street either. We were in a refurbished room but the window didn’t seal properly which probably didn’t help the noise. The girl at check in was extremely unpleasant, almost like we were an inconvenience to her which after travelling for 34 hours isn’t very nice. Overall though the room was nice and spacious and clean.

title: カウトダウン
text: 新年のカウトダウンをするために適したホテル！タイムズスクエアから歩いて７分くらいで、近くには２４時間ドラッグストアや、食事をする場所もたくさんあり、困ることはなし！インスタントラーメンを食べようとお湯をもらいにホテルへ行くと、外の花屋の隣にあるお店でお湯を買ってと言われた。スタバも近くにあり、非常に便利なホテル。部屋も広かった。

title: 4 nights Girls trip
text:
Arrived on easter sunday and check in was easy and quick. We had 2 rooms sleeping 3 in each. Rooms were great - very clean tidy. Beds were large and comfy. Bathrooms were nice dark marble style, powerful hot shower, mirrors everywhere (always needed when you are a girl!). Small kitchenette where you can make tea/coffee and had a fridge (love it when there is a fridge to keep water in). There was a safe to store valuables in the wardrobe.
The location was perfect - around 4mins walk or 2 block from the M&M store on Times Square! We had free WIFI during our stay also.
We tried breakfast which was around 21dollar and you can choose continental or full breakfast - it was help yourself service. Food was ok but i prefer to find a cafe just off Times square as it cheaper.
There was a nice restaurant attached to the hotel which served steaks etc - we didn't eat in there but it was always busy and looked good.
Overall couldn't fault our stay here - would recommend and will look to stay here again when i'm back!

title: Good location
text:
A good hotel and its central as well. 4 minutes from Time square, and Broadway show.

We arrived around noon after 18 hours travel, and could not have our room before 4pm. That was a little bit "down" for us. The room was ok, but the AC was soooo noisy so thanks for not staying there when its hot outside.

Over all we will recommend the hotel if you are in New York.

title: Agradável e bem localizado!
text:
Super indico esse hotel! 
Quarto limpo, confortável, atendentes super solícitos. A localização é privilegiada! Andamos de metrô só para longas distâncias...o hotel está pertinho da Broadway e de excelentes restaurantes.

title: Great hotel stay
text: I stayed there two nights last weekend.  The room was large, clean and comfortable. I slept like a baby both nights.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  I would highly recommend it and plan on staying there again one day.

title: Great location, always stay here!
text: A few years ago, my daughter found this hotel...I have made 3 trips since and only stay here.  It's a great location but not on a busy street.  Walking distance to ALOT of places.  The staff is accommodating.

title: Good central location
text: Just celebrated my husbands 65th birthday in New York and stayed at this lovely hotel. Couldn’t find fault with this hotel, from the helpful staff, comfy beds and good views over Manhattan. We decided the have the breakfast and wasn’t disappointed, plenty of choice whether you had continental or full breakfast. It saved time when having so much to do In the city and we didn’t have to trawl restaurants - all round good value.

title: good location and clean
text:
I enjoyed my stay.
I found everything to be very clean and in working condition.
but the hotel,is older and the elevators are slow and small.
the staff was friendly.
the location is between 8 th and 9 th avenue on 48 th street.
convenient to everything. i would recommend this hotel.

title: Spring Break
text: Loved the hotel and location. Would for sure stay there again.  The rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. The elevators may be a little scary but tolerable! Lots of room service options. Boutique type hotel. ❤️

title: Great location and staff
text: My husband and I arrived early before our check in time to drop off our bags. Our room was not ready, however they offered to hold our bags so we could explore the city. The kind man at the front desk ended up finding a room that had recently been updated, however it was a queen instead of a king. We decided to go with this free upgrade and were so pleased we did. We were located on the 17th floor and had a great view of the city. We were in good walking distance for Central Park and Time’s Square. We had a great experience with this hotel for our first NYC trip and the staff was very attentive. The room was the perfect size and the bathroom especially was beautiful. Don’t remember how the bed felt, we were so exhausted each night that we probably could have slept fine on the floor.

title: Excellent hotel at a great price
text: We stayed for 2 nights for an anniversary getaway. The hotel staff was excellent. Christian, at the front desk, was especially helpful, though everyone we spoke with was really great.. I've read other reviews that mention outdated rooms. Ours was definitely updated. Lots of outlets near bed for charging devices, microwave, fridge, Keurig coffee maker The hotel has lovely rooms that are quite spacious for NYC. Our room was very near the service elevator (which we used and it was super fast), yet extremely quiet and very comfortable. It had modern decor and the bathroom, though somewhat small, was certainly adequate, with nice amenities and very up to date.. The hotel is very convenient for going to see Broadway shows, but also for any NYC activity. Close to Times Square, but on a quiet street. My only "complaint" is the spotty wifi, though it worked well enough for the short time we were actually in the room. It could use improvement.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We went while it was chaos with the snow. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean.Couldn't get a better location to see all the sights.  My son and his wife are going in June. Brilliant Hotel.

title: ONLY a good location!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The location is perfect as all the big sights are easily walkable. Staff throughout our stay were helpful. 
However, we stayed on the 8th floor on a front facing room & the noise from outside was constant. I know this is out of the hotels control but be prepared. 
The room was spacious but it is outdated. We were hardly in our room but when we were it didn’t feel cosy or somewhere you want to relax after a hard day of sightseeing. The bathroom had a very small bath. Our towels had hairs on them and the facilities were below average. 
If you couldn’t care less what your room looks like then I would recommend this hotel.

title: Excelente Localização!
text: Nos hospedamos por 10 noites entre Fevereiro e Março (2018), foi excelente! Pegamos o quarto reformado/atualizado, com uma cozinha pequena que quebra um galho. Café no hotel é cobrado a parte, bem com o Wifi. A localização é privilegiada, proximo a estações de metro, alguns metros da Times Square e bem próximo ao Porty Autorithy caso queira se deslocar do JFK com Transfer até o Port Autorithy dará para fazer o trajeto a pé mesmo com malas.

title: Boa localização e staff
text: O hotel está um pouco velho mas está em boas condições, boa opção a duas quadras da times square e uma quadra do metrô (rua 50). Tivemos um pouco de dificuldade com os chuveiros (um tanto trick), e as banheiras ficam bem lisas (tivemos uma queda de uma das pessoas conosco). Ahhh, os quartos não tem controle de temperatura individual, se ele pega sol fica bem quente. Os funcionários são bem prestativos, o elevador pode ficar tumultuado nos horário de pico (utilize aqueles nas extremidades do corredor). Café da manhã pago a parte tem opção de continental (U$13,90 frutas, pães, bagel, frios, frutas, iogurte, mingal) ou completo (não me recordo o valor e mais ovos e sausage).

title: Great location, very outdated hotel.
text:
This was our third time staying at Belvedere Hotel in the last 12 years. The last time we stayed here was in 2006. Back then we thought it was outdated and today, in 2018, they have not made any updates. The rooms look and feel old. It is very overpriced for what you get. They don't even have free wifi in the rooms, it is 2018 right?? 

And don't even get me started on the elevators...they are honestly the slowest, smallest elevators I have ever seen. You would have to wait like 10 minutes to get an elevator. And you were lucky if it wasn't full by the time it got to you. This forced us to take the stairs several times, from the 14th floor.

The only thing that saves Belvedere Hotel is the location. Great location, close to Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, Broadway, etc...

But we did some research and it appears you can get a much newer, updated room in the same area for around the same price. Will not be returning to this hotel in the future and would not recommend.

title: Perfect!
text: Just returned from my first visit to New York so will try to write this for anyone considering making the trip for the first time and hopefully answering all those little questions that you "worry about." First off, the hotel is just great and superbly placed, minutes away from Times Square. The hotel staff are professional, helpful and above all else, friendly. The hotel is well kept and clean with comfortable rooms to boot! If you're in a rush in the morning you can take your pick from a continental type breakfast or go for the full bacon eggs etc. This was an additional cost, but for the full breakfast at under $20 ($13 for the continental if I remember) correctly) for as much as you can eat and drink, you can't go wrong. Well cooked and hot! When you've stuffed your face you're ready to hit town! As stated above, the hotel is minutes away from Times Square. As you leave the hotel turn to your left and you can't go wrong. If, like me, you purchase a "hop on hop off" tourist pass, before you go (I got mine from Trailfinders in the UK) the office to redeem your pass and get your actual "pass" for use on the bus and getting into the attractions, is just around the corner at the end of the block as you head towards Times Square. The buses pick up near too, and really you can't go wrong because you can't miss them! This "hop on" ticket costs about £110 each and includes (I think) over 90 attractions. For that, and being constrained by time, I visited the following: The Empire State building, The Rock, 9/11 memorial, Statue of Liberty Ellis Island and did a tour of Brooklyn. So well worth the money! Of course any visit to the Big Apple wouldn't be complete with visiting Central Park, which is about a 20 minute stroll away from the Belvedere. On top of our above tours we also visited the usual shopping suspects that New York has to offer. Getting to the hotel from Newark airport was easy. No messing at all. Simply leave the airport and you'll see a taxi booth where you tell the attendant where you want to go (a good idea is to have the address written down) and they'll print off your "ticket" with the price for you to give to the driver. This cost about $90 including tolls of $20. Getting back for our return flight home was even easier as the hotel is able to book a shared shuttle at about $48 for two. All in all the Belvedere is a great hotel in a great location. The staff are fantastic too! Would I recommend? Yes! Will I go again? Undoubtedly!

title: Good location and vibes
text: we stayed in december, the staff is nice, location is right on times square, staff was nice and attentive to our needs, room was good, most important its located in the good location of Times square, and close to all the amenities.

title: Great Hotel
text: Close to theaters, Central Park, Times Square, pubs/restaurants shopping etc.  The staff are very helpful, the room was very clean & it was wonderful having the kitchenette with a bar sink, fridge and microwave.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text:
Hotel abbastanza accogliente, camera pulita personale disponibilissimo e cordiale, colazione ricca di scelte. Consiglio la formula american breakfast. La posizione è ottimale poiché abbastanza vicino a time square ma non rumorosa. Vengo spesso a New York e posso dire che questo è un hotel che ha un ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.
L’unica nota dolente è la wifi...purtroppo a pagamento. Ma come si esce fuori troverete accessi wifi free ovunque.

title: Great value for money.
text: We found this hotel on booking.com and saved lots. After an eighteen year gap we wanted to return to the Belvedere hotel so were very lucky to manage such a great deal. A request was put in with our booking to ask for a room tenth floor and above. To our surprise the lovely man at the desk mentioned our request and said he was happy to give us a room on the sixteenth floor. That made us very happy. He also mentioned there was a very good Italian restaurant just three doors up and even though it was 11-30pm, the restaurant would deliver or we could visit. Our stay was for seven nights and everyone was super friendly from the front desk to the lady concierge to the housekeeping.  The best part though is the location- midtown Manhattan right in the heart of the theatre district and only a block and a half to walk to Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to travellers and will certainly book there again when I return to this wonderful city.

title: Pretty good
text: Pretty good hotel close to main attractions in NYC, but there was a lack of outlets and no outlets by the beside which was definitely frustrating. I had family staying in the room next to me, and furniture between standard double queen-bed rooms is completely different (for instance, blinds vs blinds/curtains); so there was no option to block out city lights in one of the rooms. Room quality definitely varies!

title: Hotel super bien situé
text:
Très bel hôtel, belles chambres spacieuses (un peu vieillottes mais très confortables)...Attention, les cartes de chambres se démagnétisent... 

Hotel Idéalement placé à deux pas de Times Square et du métro 50 pour vos déplacements...
Prix corrects pour deux personnes avec petit déj...

Vue peu emballante avec une vue sur les toits voisins mais ce n'est pas le plus important... Et puis à New York, il est difficile d'avoir une vue sur la plage :) :) :)  

Petit déjeuner très copieux mais répétitifs après plusieurs jours mais toujours très bon...

Seul bémol, la personne à l'accueil du restaurant qui a voulu chaque jour me faire payer mon petit déj alors que tout était payé et réservé à l'avance...Une fois ça passe, deux admettons mais après y a un moment elle devrait me reconnaître et savoir que tout est ok... Enfin ce n'est pas très important mais pour les personnes ayant un faibles niveau d'anglais pourraient se retrouver à payer plusieurs fois leur petit déj...

Le plus gros avantage de cet Hotel sa proximité avec Times Square , c'est vraiment son point fort!

title: Muy buen hotel
text: El hotel  está muy bien ubicado, a escasas 3 cuadras de times square, rodeado de muchos restaurantes, mercados, farmacias, tiendas de gifts. La atención del personal es muy buena, todos son amables; la habitación siempre aseada, ordenada y dotada de artículos de uso personal a diario.

title: New York, New York on Christmas
text: Planed a last minute trip with all the extended family to New York City. Location is great.  Right at mid town. Classic old hotel Art Noveu style. Breakfast was not included.  Tried he first day but it was just below average.  Bunch of better places around the city to have breakfast.  Did not tried the restaurant.  Reception staff were very helpful. Arrived at 1100 am from an overnight flight and they just check us on at that time!  Nice small to medium sized room. Small bath typical of New York.  Well appointed.  Room had small frig and micro wave

title: Hotel céntrico confortable
text:
Estuvimos una semana en una habitación con dos camas dobles éramos cinco dos adultos y tres niños pero no es un problema porque siempre llevamos un colchón inflable individual qué cabía perfectamente.
Las habitaciones son cómodas y están limpias este hotel tiene en cada habitación un microondas y una zona con la nevera en la que puedes preparar desayunos incluso comidas hay también una cafetera de esta de cartuchos que si los gastas te lo reponen sin coste
La única pena que hemos encontrado en nuestra estancia es que el aire acondicionado era un poco ruidoso cuando arrancaba la calefacción aunque terminamos acostumbrándonos el personal de recepción muy atento y agradable la relación calidad precio de este hotel es magnífica

title: Parfait
text:
Nous sommes restés 4 nuits. Parfait pour nous 4. Chambres rénovées. Bonne literie. Propre. Petit frigo, micro-onde. Service rapide pour nous apporter de la vaisselle.
Tranquille. Que dire de l'emplacement à 5 minutes de Times Square... idéal!.
Aucune mauvaise surprise. Bon rapport qualité-prix. Nous le recommandons.

title: Good hotel in good location
text: Stayed here for Weekend - great Location Close to central park and times square. Friendly staff and rooms are well equipped. Free wifi. Nice Restaurant and bar attached. Would stay here again for work or business

title: Great location
text: The location is great. Close to time square and in a not very crowded street. The hotel is old but nicely renovated. The mattress was too soft. The staffs very friendly and nice. Close to two good restaurants.

title: Very nice--again.
text:
This was our 4th or 5th stay here in the last few years.  Very professionally run.  Its a safe 10 minute walk back at night from the restaurants and theaters a couple of blocks away.  There's a deli/supermarket at the corner that sells beer and snacks and is either open all night or really, really late.    

Elevators can be slow at times, but all and all--its a great place to stay.

title: Absolutely Perfect
text:
I came to NYC to spend a couple of nights touring and celebrating my birthday. I cannot emphasize enough how perfect this location is - you can walk to all the touristy Times Square stuff, but you're just far enough down a side street that it's quiet. My Orbitz history earned me a VIP upgrade - I got a suite on the top floor and free wifi, as well as a discount at breakfast.

I read some complaints about this place before I went and was a little nervous, but those fears were unfounded. While I did have to wait for the elevator a couple times, I didn't think those waits were bad at all, and while I did get some hallway noise, I simply popped in my earplugs (which I always carry with me when I travel) and went right to sleep.

The building's art deco look and history were absolutely sublime, and the staff is what makes this place so special - I felt welcomed and respected the whole time I was there. When I experienced a slight issue with my toilet running, the front desk staff dispatched a repair man right away, and he efficiently fixed the problem.

I can't get over the gorgeous gargoyles outside my window! I have never stayed in a cooler hotel room in my life. The Lindt chocolates on the bedside table were an elegant touch, and the breakfast on my last day was very satisfying.

Do not hesitate to book here. It's an amazing deal in a pricey area, and it's a wonderful experience.

title: Friendly, Clean, and Great Location
text: We had six people, two rooms and stayed four nights earlier this week. Belvedere Hotel was a great choice. The staff was friendly, the rooms were comfortable and clean. The hotel, in my opinion, could not be located better. Near the subway, Times Square (but not too near!), and Restaurant Row. It was quiet and offered a great night's sleep at the end of a long, busy day. Dean (concierge) was SUPER HELPFUL and got us last-minute tickets to Chicago. They were doing some work on the facade of the hotel and the scaffolding distracted from the beauty of the property. Not a complaint so much as a reminder to look at the beautiful historic building. I loved that the rooms were filled with historical Belvedere Hotel memorabilia.

title: NYC Get Away
text: The Belvedere Hotel was an excellent choice, from the staff, the location, to the size and the cleanliness of the rooms.  We were very happy with our choice, would definitely recommend it! We would stay agian!

title: Bien situé, chambre spacieuse, petit déjeuner copieux
text:
Très agréable séjour au Belvedere, l'hôtel est idéalement situé. Deux lignes de métro, la première à deux rues (3-5min de marche) et la deuxième à 7-8min). Les chambres sont spacieuses dans un style américain, moquette au sol, mobilier en bois foncé mais rénové récemment avec une touche plus claire. Salle de bain fonctionnelle, dans les chambres exécutive le wifi est inclus et il y a un mini frigo et in micro ondes. 
Petit déjeuner copieux avec une partie chaude et une partie continental. Ca permet de bien démarrer la journée et même de sauter le repas de midi au profit de petites dégustations dans l'après-midi 😜 
Seul bémol, les réceptionnistes ne sourient jamais et le portier passe plus de temps à l'intérieur à discuter qu'à être à son poste.

title: Amazing stay in the heart of NYC!
text: Our stay was absolutely wonderful, the staff is extremely helpful, the room was very clean, the bed was so comfortable and you really can’t beat the location and the view!! It’s steps from everything you need!! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

title: Excellent service and location
text: Belvedere Hotel is about two blocks walk to Time Square where all the tourists' attractions are. I've been here for many times, and early check-in begins at 2 pm. However, you can check-in as soon as you arrive, they will prepare the room for you. I checked in around 11 am, and got the room key around 1 pm. The room is mostly renovated, roomy and efficient. If you store your bag prior to check-in, it's best to give a tip, they are very nice. There are plenty of excellent places to eat on the 9th street away from the tourists if you are on a business trip like me. The staff is courteous and the room is nice and clean.

title: Short NYC trip
text: We stayed here for just one night.  Overall a decent hotel. The hotel is in a good location if you want to go to Times Square or to a broadway show. It’s really close the the theatre district.  The room was clean and the staff were friendly.  The price is high but that to be expected in NYC.  If you need to park I would try to find a garage nearby because there valet is expensive.  There is a few garages about a block away.  Wifi was not good here. Overall a nice experience.  Don’t be surprised to be charged a $23 facility fee, which is a nonsense fee for use of WiFi and the gym. All the hotels in NYC are doing this to hose tourists out of a few more bucks.

title: Perfect Manhattan Location
text:
Perfect location for the Theatre District and close proximity to Time Square, subway and Rockefeller Centre. Excellent friendly guest services, clean comfortable rooms. Free wine every evening from 5pm to 6pm.
Numerous restaurants within 6 blocks. More than you could eat at if you stayed for 6 months.

title: Gezellig hotel in Theaterdistrict
text: Dit hotel is een aanrader! Gedienstige en vriendelijke ontvangst, mooie ruime kamers, een conciërge die alles voor je regelt... Hier logeer je letterlijk en figuurlijk in de wolken. Uitstekende ligging ook. Enkel minpuntje is de hoge opleg voor wifi.

title: Hmmm ok!
text:
I traveled here for my mothers birthday. I work within the travel industry but was quite let down. We received a very warm welcome wishing my mother a happy birthday so I was happy and looking forward to seeing the room.
We arrived in the room and it was very clean. I had booked the top room type which should of came with robes, luxury toiletries etc - there was 1 robe and the toiletries never got replenished - the WiFi was included so this was worth it.
My mothers birthday came and someone had ordered a bottle of wine to arrive in the room for her - it never turned up! Hope someone else didn't get it!

There is 2 main lifts in the hotel and on a morning you can wait up to 15 minutes for a space to squeeze into - you would ask why I didn't walk but we were on the 12th floor!

Location wise was good for the price we paid, we didn't have breakfast but found a great diner 5 minute walk away which was great.

Overall the Belvedere is a good hotel on a budget but I very much doubt I will be returning.

title: C’est pas cher et vous en aurez pour votre argent
text:
Nous sommes restés 6 nuits dans cet hôtel dans une chambre double deluxe. À notre arrivée la porte de l’hôtel ne s’ouvrait pas... 45 minutes plus tard et des aller-retours vers la réception et le problème fut réglé. La chambre est confortable mais l’équipement est vieillissant, frigo qui congèle ce que l’ont y met, coffre fort inutilisable, climatisation ultra bouillante, châssis non isolants du bruit (une caserne de pompiers se trouve à 50 mètres et toute la nuit on est réveillé par le ballet interminable des véhicules de secours ou des claxons des véhicules de la rue). L’internet est payant 57USD pour 5 jours. 
Service à la réception est très moyen et personnel pas trop sympa: notre vol, en raison de la neige, a été annulé et l’hôtel était complet et aucune possibilité de nous héberger pour une nuit supplémentaire. Nous n’avons reçu aucune aide pour nous aider à trouver un nouvel hotel, pas même un accès à internet pour pouvoir chercher. Nous avons alors quitté l’hôtel pour aller à l’Hilton de la rue à côté et là, ils nous ont offert l’accès à internet avec PC afin de trouver un nouvel hôtel, une personne de l’Hilton nous a conseillé également. Le service cela se paye et au belvédère c’est pas cher...

title: So-so
text: Really good location, close to the metro and walkable to many places with eateries near-by.  The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room size was perfect and kept clean.
