The room decor was shabby and could really do with an update. The aircon machine was very loud, so the ear plugs came in handy! There was a small kitchenette with a microwave which was useful but surprised there were no plates or drinkware provided by the hotel so a bit redundant to have those facilities if the hotel doesn’t provide any means to use them properly! The hotel was mediocre and we managed to find a good discounted deal for our stay. The web prices I think are overpriced and is not value for money. If you’re going to book a stay there - shop around for a good deal.

title: Best service ever
text: I was traveling with 2 children and got snowed in for 2 extra days.  The hotel staff went above all my expectations to make sure my kids and I were safe and had a place to stay even though we went 2 days past our original reservation.  I have never been more happy or grateful to a hotel staff!!!!!  Amazing people working here!!!!!

title: Great location, room nothing special.
text: I've read through some of the reviews here are it definitely appears that the rooms sold through Priceline are directed towards the older/non-updated rooms in the hotel. Looking at the newer styled rooms in the photos my room looked nothing like those. That being said the lobby area is nice, staff were friendly and attentive. I just needed a room for the night because of work and it served it's purposes. The room was clean, but obviously had not been updated in a longtime. Hotel is in a convenient location. I would consider staying again.

title: My favorite NY hotel
text: A few years ago I got this hotel on hotwire, not knowing where I would be staying and only the price.  I was skeptical as I had never heard of this place but since then it is my first choice of hotel in NYC.  I just left there again yesterday after spending 4 days there this week.  I've yet to be disappointed.  My main reason for going to NY is to see shows, this location couldn't be any better, right in the middle of the theater district and Hell's Kitchen.  It is far enough off the beaten path you you don't have all the mayhem of Time's Square but a short walk away.  I have always had one of the renovated rooms which are really nicely done and a good size for a NYC hotel.  The rooms come equipped with a coffee maker and microwave.  The staff at this hotel in my opinion is exemplary.  I have never encountered one person who does not try and go out of their way to help you.  On my most recent visit the remote for my television wasn't working, I called the front desk and they had someone up to my room in less than 5 minutes to solve the problem.  The hotel has a breakfast buffet where you can chose a full breakfast or continental breakfast, this is extra with most room packages and is included with others.  In the cases where it was not included with my room I still found it to be a good deal and enjoyed the food.  I just love this hotel and it will always be my first choice when travelling to NY.

title: Una buonissima accoglienza
text: Hotel confortevole, a pochi passi da Times Square ma in una strada tranquilla. Camere abbastanza spaziose (la nostra era al nono piano), bagno un po' piccolo per le esigenze di 4 persone ma con una bella doccia. Letti comodissimi con materasso in memory e piccolo "cucinino" in camera. Colazione ottima e abbondante a buffet, sia americana (20 dollari) sia continentale (15 dollari) da pagare ogni mattina. Con Club Expedia colazione a metà prezzo. Personale gentilissimo, disponibilissimo e veloce nel soddisfare le richieste. Wi-Fi ottimamente funzionante. Quando tornerò a NY non posso che tornare qui: ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo!

title: I made it to NYC!
text: We were very welcomed by David at the front desk.  Very prompt service and we  were able to check our bags in before our room was ready so we could explore the sights.  Very clean and excellent service by all.  Close to Central Station if you like walking.   Close to Time Square.  Close to Subway. Thank you for making our stay in NYC a great one.

title: Awful.
text: This is a dumpty old hotel, the only good thing is the location. This is not a 3.5 star hotel. It hasn't been renovated since the 1980s. The tub was stained and dirty. The room was sweltering, due to a lack of thermostat. They told me the temperature could not be controlled in the "cheap" Priceline rooms. Our room wasn't cheap at $200 after taxes. Had to sleep with the noisy old window a/c on. The place charged my card three times for the incidentals fee of $75. Did not apologize. Honestly, I stayed at a YMCA in NYC once that was better. Disgusting, old, dishonest. Stay far away.

title: Great Location & Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Belvedere Hotel for 9 nights. (Originally booked for 7 but the New York weather would see us stay for 9). We stayed on the 3rd Floor (Room 315) away from the street so street noise for us was minimal.  

I loved everything about this hotel. The room was clean, the staff were friendly, housekeeping were great. The location was great almost right in the middle of Times Square and Hells Kitchen - yet far away enough from the chaos of Times Square. 

There are 2 main elevators in the foyer and two that are not in plane sight. In saying that for the whole time we were there, there was only one occasion that we decided to wait for another elevator. 

We didn't try the Brazilian Restaurant but did have Breakfast in the Café on our last morning, it wasn't fancy just your standard Buffet Breakfast. The fridge and coffee maker in our room came in very handy during our stay. It's also handy having the option to order in from two local restaurants. 

In our room (Executive Superior King) we also had free WIFI which worked perfectly. 

If I could make a suggestion to the hotel for some a very minor improvement it would be - larger bath towels :-).

Thanks for having us Belvedere Hotel - we hope to see you again one day.

title: 3.5* 9+ Approval Rating Times Square on Priceline $150/Night....
text: and NOT worth it.  I got room 406 and the temp was sweltering.  Front desk actually told me that you can't adjust the temp in Priceline rooms.  I went back for an hour and decided I had to check out early (I've only refused to stay in 2 hotels in my life, and this would be the 3rd.)  This time a maintenance worker came and showed me how to work the air conditioner.  Apparently this combats the high heat that cannot be adjusted.  It worked.  Room and bathroom hadn't been updated since the 80's, so walking on the carpet grossed me out.  It had a small flat screen t.v., mini fridge and microwave.  Judging from the smell in my hallway, people actually cook meals in their rooms.  Two elevators were not enough for a hotel this size, which meant 5 minute waits most of the time.  The block this hotel is on is NOT NICE.  It is on the edge, so don't walk west.  Hotel lobby is bare.  The only good I could find was a double sheeted bed, comfortable bed and a good shower.  It took me a while to figure out how to get bath gel and shampoo out of the shower containers.  You have to lean on the bottles while taking your shower, as there is no lever/button to push.  THERE ARE BETTER PLACES TO STAY FOR SLIGHTLY MORE $$$ IN NYC.

title: Super accueil - Très bien situé !
text: Nous avons séjourné au Belvédère Hotel du 6 au 9 mars et nous avons adoré notre séjour. Dès notre arrivée Ricky nous a aidé avec le stationnement et nous a expliqué le fonctionnement particulier de New York ! Tout le personnel a été très courtois et vraiment accueillant. Notre chambre était très bien et le coin cuisine est hyper pratique avec les enfants. Le mieux.... l’hôtel est à deux minutes de Time Square et de la 9e où on trouve beaucoup de restaurants abordables. Sincèrement, je n’hésiterai pas à y retourner.

title: great hotel great location lots of character
text:
First, this hotel has all of the modern amenities.  It is near many Broadway theaters and 2 Starbucks, so who can argue.  What this has, though, is charm, character and charisma.  The building is beautiful, the rooms are spacious for NYC, and the staff is very friendly.
If you long for the New York experience of ON THE TOWN, GUYS AND DOLLS or BAREFOOT IN THE PARK, the Belvedere is a great place to call home

title: Wonderful location, clean, comfortable beds, friendly staff
text: We stayed here (again!) -you can't bet the location- just off the beaten path so quiet-The beds and linens are comfortable, towels were nice. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. You can get some wonderful rates for this hotel. I highly recommend it!

title: Excelente estadía, recomendable!
text:
Nos hospedamos en el hotel la primer semana de febrero. Desde que entramos nos encantó la habitación. Limpieza y servicio excelente. Lo recomendaríamos sin duda.
Muy buena ubicación!! El personal de la cafetería es super amable.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location,close to time square,the subway,and restaurants,even though it is so close to everything we were not disturbed by street noise,the beds  are a good size,and so so comfortable especially after a long day of sightseeing.The rooms are very clean,yes there only two lifts but we never had to wait more than 3minutes.The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful,especially jacob,who gave my daughter free wifi,as it was her 16th birthday while we were there,and gave us tips on new york,and where to eat,Thank you jacob.Overall a great place to stay,would highly recommemd it to any one.

title: Amazing service! Can’t beat this location!
text:
Had a great stay at the Belvedere. We stayed on the 10th floor and heard the bustling sounds of the city. 

Location is so great - blocks from Times Square, the subway & great restaurants. 

Walls are thin so from our room we could hear the cleaning crew very vividly. But, honestly that didn’t bother us much.

Would definitely stay here again because of the customer service & the location.

title: Location! Location! Location!
text:
We recently stayed here for 11 nights. The best thing about the hotel stay was the location, the location is easy to everything we needed. Times Square is 2 blocks, Hell’s Kitchen is 2 blocks, Greyline Tours office is 1 block. Other then that, on check in the man at reception said he gave us a upgrade, we were staying on Level 12. The room was tiny for 3 people staying 11 nights. Soon as we reached the front door, swiped the card the door lock fell to pieces. We reported this and for the 11 nights, this did not get fixed. We bought a cork screw, so we could have a glass of wine in our room, as they can’t provide one, it was in our room 2 nights, the 3rd night it had disappeared. Again reported this to reception as we feel house keeping may have moved / picked up and there was no response. 
Every day we would return, house keeping would of only performed half a job. Sometimes we had soap, sometimes we had toilet paper, sometimes we had sheets cleaned. We asked for 3 coffee cups, as they provide a coffee machine but only 3 paper cups. They did bring us ceramic cups, but the whole stay did not wash these or replace these. We would of been happy to wash, however there is no liquid and no tea towel, so this wasn’t possible. 
We dined in the cafe for breakfast one morning, there is no real comment on the food or service. All in all, not an amazing stay.

title: Great stay- fab location
text: We got a good price via expedia and couldn't believe our location. So close to times square we could see it from our window on the 17th floor. We were very lucky to receive and upgrade and were offered half price breakfast- we hadn't intended to eat here but had breakfast 3 mornings! Very tasty. Our room was very comfortable and clean and we heard little from other guests. Our view was incredible. We had an issue with the bathroom but it was promptly sorted by the attentative staff. They also looked after our baggage when we checked out. I would 100% recommend the Belvedere to anyone visiting NY!

title: Good location
text: This hotel is close to Times Square. It is an excellent location for getting around. I’d read reviews about it being dated and only having two lifts. We found the rooms to be extremely clean, the bed was comfortable. We were on the 16th floor and never had to wait long for a lift. The staff are friendly and helpful. No negative comments at all

title: Beautiful hotel, upscale feel in excellent location and great price!
text: This hotel will be my go to New York hotel.  It is so close to Times Square yet very quiet.  Excellent customer service.  We were greeted by a friendly doorman followed up by a friendly front desk associate.  The decor was cozy and felt contemporary though the style of the hotel was 1920s Art Deco.  Overall felt like upscale experience at a price I could afford.  Very nice room with coffee maker, fridge and microwave.  Comfortable beds.  Loved this hotel!  Can't wait to go back!

title: Excelente opção em NYC
text: O hotel oferece uma excelente localização, fácil locomoção, muito próximo à Times Square e estações de metrô. Crédito especial ao corpo de funcionários e ao serviço de concierge, muitíssimo educado e prestativos.

title: Ceu e o inferno no mesmo local
text: Nao posso dizer que não gostei do Hotel. Bem localizado na 48 entre 7a. e 8a. aves, ha um quarteirao da Times Square. No entanto devo esclarecer que dei muita sorte no check in. Reservei um apto standard duplo ,Como cheguei as 9:30 da manha e o check in era somente as 15:00 não havia apartamento standards disponiveis. Foi então que o Rickie na recepção me ofereceu um Apto superior por mais USD 25 a diaria, incluiria o WIFI ( que é pago ) e eu entraria imediatamente. Topei na hora. Ao entrar no quarto amamos! Nao era grande, mas estava limpissimo, bem conservado, com um corredor onde havia um armario para roupas, microondas , geladeira , um banheiro todo revestido em marmore novíssimo e uma ampla vista de Manhattan do 17o. ( ultimo ) andar. Tudo ótimo ate começarmos a ouvir conversas de hóspedes nos elevadores e no lobby reclamando dos quartos! um senhor americano que estava com a esposa nos falou que seu quarto que era standard estava bem ruim. Quatro dias depois do nosso check in, chegaram uns amigos que iam se encontrar conosco e haviam reservado um apto standard. Dei a dica para eles pegarem um up grade para um apto igual ao nosso ( Executivo ), porem nao havia mais disponibilidade, so 3 dias depois. Subimos entao e entramos no quarto a eles destinado. Parecia que tinhamos ido para outro ( e bem inferior) Hotel. Quarto mínino, mal conservado, ar condicionado velho cheio de ferrugem e barulhento, banheiro pequenissimo, cheio de infiltrações e com o chuveiro pingando. Fiquei chocado! E acabei entendendo o que estava ouvindo de outros hospedes do Hotel. Muita diferença entre um quarto Executivo e o Standard. Céu e inferno. Outra coisa e isso eu já havia reparado, o Hotel cobra Wifi, cobra para guardar as malas e nos cobrou USD 5 para receber uma correspondencia que era um envelope com cartao de credito. Foi a experiencia mais dubia que tive em um Hotel!

title: Excellent balance of price, location, and services.
text: I give the Belvedere Hotel a great rating, The price was at a economical level, the staff was friendly, helpful, and avaliable. The room was clean and visibly pleasing. Note, it does lack high end features but excellent for the price range. The location is ideal, near to Theaters and Times Square, subways are near by. I parked my own vehicle and the garage was only a 3 minute walk, I was surprised that after checkout my car was staged ready to go at the garage. I noted that the room was hot upon arrival you can not control the heat but using the A/C we maintained a very comfortable temperature. I left the fan in the Always On position adding some white noise for normal NYC street noise.

title: NY Visit 18
text: Belvedere Hotel is a cosy little hotel situated on 48th Street. It is walking distance to time square and other city attractions including the largest shopping complex Macy's and may eateries. Shopping at Macy's during January was awesome due to the many sales with discounts up to 70% in many shopping stalls. The hotel itself was comfortable and reasonable priced. A very convenient spot to all amenities.

title: Great location, very pleasant stay
text: The Belvedere was perfect for our stay. Front desk was very helpful in accommodating an early check in around 11:00, which made things perfect for our busy day and evening ahead. Room was great with a nice 15th floor view to the north. The area is fairly quiet compared to closer times square locations but you're just a block or 2 away. Nice art deco architecture and nicely kept and updated. Would definitely recommend!

title: Excellent value
text:
Stayed in this hotel in February. We were on 8th floor. Had a room with a kitchenette and 2 double beds. Really pleased with the value. Room was large and warm. Spotless too. As previous reviews mentioned the kitchenette doesn't have crockery or cutlery but you can get it from the desk. No kettle. bathroom was nice if a little retro. Bedroom was modern. Beds were comfy. Room across from the lifts but you couldn't hear anything. 

Location is impeccable. Walking distance to many tourist sites and three minutes from a few different metro stops.

title: Location for tourist Time Square
text:
Great Location, beds were so uncomfortable that all three of us staying had backache, rooms were a little battered but clean, staff unhelpful, noisy at night as you are near a fire station and in the city so its to be expected.  Dont get caught out with "free wine happy hour" as they only do a couple of bottles and once gone theres no more so lots of people dont even get a drink.  There is no bar to have a drink and relax at the end of the day.   
Ok for a night or 2 but not for the full week that we had.

title: Great weekend at the Belvedere!
text: We checked in for a two night stay and the staff and hotel more than met our expectations. The location is very convenient to Times Square and Broadway plays. The room was updated with every convenience and was quite clean. We’ll try this hotel again!

title: Great surprise
text: I travel to NY often with friends and family members for weekend and overnight stays, to go to the theatre,opera and museums. This was a delightful suprise of a hotel in a great location, and reasonable (for NYC) rates. Nice staff, nice size rooms and lovely decor. Admittedly the hotel is in the midst of renovations and so some rooms are updated while others are a bit dated, but still not worn out and rundown looking. I hope the rates do not skrocket when the renovations are finished because I plan to make this my first choice for future trips.

title: Ansprechendes Hotel
text: Hotel ist ansprechend, gute Ausgangslage für alle Besichtigungen, da sehr zentral gelegen, die Zimmer sind nicht zu laut, auch verdunkelbar, Frühstücksmöglichkeit vorhanden, jedoch sehr, sehr teuer, wie auch das Restaurant, das dem Hotel angeschlossen ist, sehr überteuert.

title: Super bien situé a 2 min à pieds de times square
text: Nous avons été très bien accueillies, la chambre est assez spacieuse, un peu vieillotte car on était dans une chambre non rénovée mais on avait tout le confort quand même. Sèche cheveux, fer a repasser, coffre fort, micro onde et frigo. Et climatiseur mais très bruillant. Le wifi est a 30 euros les 72heures. On a eu un problème de chauffage et dans les 10min on venait arranger ça. Beaucoup de bruits par contre de dehors, la caserne des pompiers est a une rue... proche de plusieurs stations de metro donc très pratique pour aller et venir.

title: Great location
text:
We were very pleased with the.  Great location. Rooms were large and clean.  Staff was helpful.  
We had purchased the internet 3 day package when making the reservation.  When we got the bill at check out, they tried to charge us an extra $100 for WiFi.  When we questioned it, they told us we would get a new, corrected bill.  So, just be careful and double check your bill.   I took a star away for the aging facility and one star down because if this bill incident.

title: Christmas Surprise
text: My husband booked a package staying at this hotel as a surprise for Christmas. We decided to use the air-train from JFK to Jamaica Station €5 each then pop on the tube €6 for two people to Times Square. This was a good choice as reviews have stated the taxi prices are ridiculous. Got off the tube at stop 50 and walked up the stairs then turned left onto Times Square. The hotel is 5-10 minutes walk from the tube station. Excellent location and very central. Check in was easy however I do think having to pay for WiFi was ridiculous. This should come complimentary with all rooms. We stayed in room 1619 which was a lovely room. Little kitchenette with a very large bed. Room a bit dated but was very clean and suited us. Had breakfast the first morning. €20 a person we thought was expensive. Breakfast was ok but decided for the rest of our stay we would use the little deli’s. We had emailed the hotel prior to our stay to ask about tickets for a show. The concierge had arranged tickets for us to see the lion king and a meal on Times Sq for Valentine’s Day. When we collected the tickets at the hotel we were advised the restaurant was now closed so they could now offer us a 2 day hop on hop off bus tour. We didn’t make a big fuss but we were looking forward to a meal however the hop on hop off bus was a great idea as we saw loads of sights. The staff in the hotel were really friendly and couldn’t do enough to help. I would definitely return to this hotel and have recommended it to friends and family.

title: Excellent Service!!
text:
This hotel is in the perfect location. Clean and terrific rate for New York city.
Best of all it was the service.
We are firefighters from Canada who came down for the 911 memorial and tour the city and Jacob Jasso at front desk was absolutely awesome. He spent a lot of time with us directing us on great places to see and eat and even a Broadway show. 
In our short stay we did a lot with his knowledge of the city we wouldn't of done as much as we did if it weren't for Jacob. So for that Thanks Belvedere hotel for hiring a great employee and Thanks Jacob for all your help.

title: Nice hotel, cheap & close to Times Square
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights in feb, got the metro from the airport straight to the hotel, was easy enough to find & saved a small fortune on a taxi! 
We arrived at 12pm on Sunday, bare in mind check-in isn’t until 4 but they were happy to check us in and to see if they had any rooms available, luckily there was, the only downfall was the room we were given was right next to the elevator so was very noisy in the bathroom within the room, bed was super comfy & huge! fridge&microwave inc
another annoying inconvenience about the room was there isn’t proper curtains to block out the light, there’s only a blind which the light still comes through, so that was very annoying when trying to have a afternoon nap!! Rooms get very hot- so good that they have air-con in them! Everyone was very friendly and helpful.
Great location- would recommend if your looking for a cheap stay local to Manhattan.

title: Adequate but good location
text: Small room for USA. Beautiful toiletries !!! Outrageously expensive restaurant $39 for 2 glasses of wine and $160 for two carveries -  albeit limitless meat but not good value unless you are Fred Flintstone!! Good location for Times Square Broadway etc and easy parking for cabs outside which is rare in NYC

title: Sehr zu empfehlen für einen Trip nach New York
text:
Meine Freundin und ich haben dieses Hotel während unseres New York Trips besucht. Wir waren rundum zufrieden. Der Check In verlief sehr freundlich und speditiv. Das Zimmer war gross, sehr sauber und das Wifi funktionierte einwandfrei. Aufgrund unserer Zimmerkategorie war das WIfi kostenlos. Der Blick aus dem Zimmer im 11. Stock war super.....wir konnten bis zum Times Square sehen. Das Frühstück haben wir nicht probiert, das es in der Nähe sehr viele Gelegenheiten gibt, kostengünstiger zu frühstücken.
Einziger kleiner Kritikpunkt ist der sehr, sehr langsame Hauptlift. Aber das ist wohl dem Baujahr des Hotels geschuldet. Man ist ja im Urlaub und hat eigentlich Zeit.
Ich würde dieses Hotel auf jeden Fall weiterempfehlen.

title: Stunning service
text:
My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Belvedere Hotel from 1st Feb 2018 for 6 nights.  Yes, the hotel is extremely well situated in New York, right near all the "tourist" things.  But what stands out for us is the absolutely stunning welcome we received.  We were greeted by Ricky and were blown away.  He oozed friendliness, professionalism, courtesy etc.  Nothing was a problem.  Then he was joined by Jacob, who ticked all the above too.  We are well travelled (Africa, Europe etc) and I have never come across two staff members in a hotel that had all the attributes that these two had.  South Africa prides itself in its hospitality, these two could show a few things to our guys here. They are an absolute asset to the Belvedere Hotel.
Thats them, as for the stay, I would most definitely stay here again.  The rooms were clean (albeit on the small side) and comfortable, however they need more plugs to charge phones etc.  Thank you Belvedere, you will see us again, thank you New York for an unforgettable experience.

title: Excellent hotel & base for a trip to NYC
text:
We arrived at the Belvedere very late due to a huge delay to our incoming flight. Even at 3.15am they still had two staff on duty and they dealt with us quickly and compassionately. We were lucky enough to be given an upgrade too.
The room was lovely, two large double beds, a walk in closet with it's own lighting, the bathroom was a good size and the shower was excellent. The air con worked well and the TV was a good size and had a wide range of channels.
Throughout our stay (1 week) the staff were always courteous and efficent, the guys on the doors are excellent and always happy to give the best directions to sights and organise taxi's etc.
Some friends stayed at a hotel a couple of blocks up and they constantly complained about the noise and difficulty sleeping, well we had no such trouble at the Belvedere, we slept well on comfy beds with no noise at all.
We really enjoyed our stay, we'd recommend it to anyone and we shall definitely be returning.

title: Great Location!
text: Nice, clean room and great service. Our room had a lovely view and was quiet, even though it faced th3 street. The location is everything and parking close by made this a nice find. We will definitely stay here on our future trips to NYC.

title: Lovely place
text: We had a wonderful stay.  Staff was helpful and polite willing to assist in anyway.  Rooms were clean.   Breakfast is amazing. The manager Vincent was so very helpful and was willing to accommodate our special needs.  I would return to this Lodge next time I am in Cork.

title: Terrific location, fantastic rate, but  very small, slow elevators!
text: This hotel is in an excellent location, very close to Times Square, many theatres, and subway stops.    The rooms were reasonably sized.  There is no restaurant in the hotel that is open for dinner, but the breakfast was pretty good although the croissants were stale.    Other than stale croissants, my only irritation was that we were often waiting for elevators as they are very small and not very fast.   But fortunately we were on the third floor, so using the stairs was always an open.   Also, the rate we paid was fantastic  (the lowest I have ever paid in New York), so we got terrific value for our money.

title: Pas mal sans plus
text:
Chouette localisation à proximité de Time square!
Chambre assez grande et confortable!
En revanche une caserne de pompier a rendu nos nuits infernales et nous avons eu plusieurs soucis avec le thermostat de la chambre avec des variations de température difficile à supporter!

title: Quarto pequeno
text: Fui com minha família (total de 04 adultos). O quarto era pequeno, o banheiro minúsculo e sem prateleiras. Na chegada nos deparamos com a banheira entupida e a TV sem funcionar. Todo dia faltava uma toalha e tínhamos que pedir na recepção. A internet é paga U$14,00/dia, sendo que na rua tínhamos internet gratuita em frente ao hotel. Os móveis são antigos, pisos e revestimentos ultrapassados e de gosto duvidoso. Não indicaria este hotel para ninguém.

title: Buena relación precio calidad
text: El hotel es un poco viejo, pero esta bastante bien mantenido. Las habitaciones son enormes, tienen heladera, cafetera (te dejan cafe y crema todos los días) y microondas. La limpieza muy bien. La ubicación es perfecta. Muy buena relación precio-calidad

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Très bonne expérience dans cet hôtel situé à Manhattan non loin de Times Square, de Central Park et de Columbus Circle. Plusieurs stations de métro sont accessibles à pied en 5 minutes. L’accueil est très aimable, le personnel est disponible et souriant. J’avais une chambre exécutive à 2 grands lits vraiment très confortable. Chambre spacieuse, dotée d’un bureau, télé à écran plat (uniquement chaînes américaines ou hispaniques). Dans le placard : outre le rangement pour les effets personnels s’y trouve un coffre-fort, fer et table à repasser. Salle de bain avec baignoire/ douche, produits d’hygiène approvisionnés régulièrement. A l’entrée, une cuisinette (frigo, petit évier, micro-onde) et une machine café/thé. Là aussi les dosettes sont approvisionnées en suffisance tous les jours. L’air conditionné est contrôlable individuellement. J’avais demandé une chambre dans les étages supérieurs avec vue sur l’arrière du bâtiment. Le responsable à l’accueil a tout fait pour satisfaire mes demandes, ce que j’ai apprécié. Dans cette catégorie de chambre, le WFi est gratuit. 
A rez-de chaussée, local polyvalent (ordinateurs, machine à glaçon et possibilité d’acheter sodas ou bouteilles d’eau). 
Il est clair qu’à la faveur d’une prochaine escapade dans cette ville, je retournerai avec plaisir dans cet hôtel !

title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Good Price
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location a few minutes walk from Times Square, Broadway, and close to a metro line to get to all the main attractions in New York. The Hotel staff were excellent. The rooms and the corridors are quite dated in style but the hotel is very clean and I enjoyed the fact that it was quite an old school style hotel. We were on the 16th floor and had a great view out across a neighbouring park and the many high rises that surrounded it. 

Gym facilities were also very good.  We thought the price was reasonable for our stay, particularly compared to other hotels in the similar area. I would 100% stay here again if I am to return to New York.

title: Bom hotel
text:
Reservei o Belvedere com um promoção muito boa q incluía o café da manhã na diaria, pagando cerca de 280 por noite no hotel. Sobre a localizaçao, é o ponto mais positivo do hotel, dava pra fazer muita coisa andando, metrô perto, muitos restaurantes legais e lojas. O quarto q eu fiquei era bem grande mas achei a decoraçao do hotel todo muito cafona, prefiro hoteis mais modernos.
Sobre o cafe da manha, tinha ovos, bacon, batata, paes, bagels, muffins, alguns folheados, mingau, cereais, frutas, panquecas, sucos (de maquina), chocolate, nao achei ruim mas nao pagaria 15 dolares por pessoa pra comer la caso nao tivesse incluso na diaria.
Um problema que tive foi o ar condicionado do quarto que fazia um barulho muito chato alguns dias e outros nao, fiquei no 1411.

Quanto aos funcionarios achei ok.
Ficaria la novamente se pegasse promoçao de novo, caso contrario, prefiro hoteis mais novos.

title: Perfetto!
text:
Ho alloggiato con mio marito presso l’hotel Belvedere di New York durante la prima parte del nostro viaggio di nozze... ci avevano alloggiato nella stanza numero 1 del 16 piano se non sbaglio, avevamo una vista mozzafiato su due fronti di ny essendo la prima stanza angolare.. ha rispettato in pieno le nostre aspettative, pulitissimo, personale cordiale e gentile nel rispondere alle nostre domande, colazione ottima ricca di cose salate e dolci... la posizione è centralissima, ottima per chi come noi era la prima volta che visitava ny e non aveva moltissimi giorni, abbiamo raggiunto praticamente tutto a piedi... in ogni caso a pochi minuti c’era la fermata della metro!
Consigliatissimo!

title: Great stay!
text: My boyfriend and I had a great stay in the Belvedere hotel last week. The bed was massive and comfortable, however there were some areas of improvement to be had. The heating was on in the rooms all the time, resulting in a very warm environment. The air conditioning box was incredibly loud, and therefore could not be turned on to remedy the problem. The shower would go cold in bursts, even when it was very hot. The staff were pleasant, especially the doorman and the bellboy, however a smile from the people on reception wouldn't go a miss! We enjoyed our trip to New York, and overall I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel close to Times Square but nicely set away from the main hustle & bustle of New York city life
text:
We have just returned (Feb '18) from a week long stay in New York.  We were very happy with the Belvedere Hotel.  Firstly all the staff were very welcoming & courteous.  We felt the position of the hotel was ideal for us being away from the hustle & bustle of New York.  Yes there is a fire station nearby but we never found it that big a distraction.  It was genuinely nice to return on an evening and have some relative peace & calm compared to other 'premier' hotels nestled closer to the main tourist attractions.  The nearby subway stations gave easy access to the city - tip 1 Metro card can be used for up to 4 people which we didn't learn until near the end of our stay so we ended up with a card each.  We used the subway often for the longer distances up to Central Park and down to the financial district - far cheaper & quicker than using taxi's.

Our room was on the 12th floor and had a view of other high rise blocks but set far enough back that it didn't feel enclosed.  The room was clean and the beds comfortable which is essential if you want to recharge after a day of walking.  Styling was a little dated  (characterful maybe) but nothing that would ruin your stay - far better than the soulless boxes you get in some modern hotels.  The room had a little kitchenette which was great for us as on a number of nights we had take out from the various restaurants nearby - Bare Burger on the nearby 46th street a definite highlight for us.  The fridge was well used for drinks & other food stuffs that were available from the nearby corner store.  The only downside was the air conditioning which was pretty noisy however as we visited in February it wasn't an issue as we simply switched it off whilst sleeping.  Only other comment that other travellers might find useful is to check what is included in the free breakfast as ours only covered the continental breakfast - the American breakfast would have been at full cost.  Same for Wi-Fi - we had Wi-Fi access included in our package (an essential to keep our 11 year old happy!!) but if you don't it is an extra you have to pay for.

Overall we were very happy with the hotel hence the excellent rating.  We fully intend to return to New York again in a few years & would have absolutely no hesitation to book the Belvedere Hotel again.

title: Great hotel
text: Lovely hotel, very central, could see some of time square from our room,staff were very friendly, room was much bigger than we expected, bed was huge and having a fridge was very handy, would definitely stay here again.

title: Centrale locatie
text: Vriendelijke ontvangst en goede service. Ruime kamers met mooi uitzicht. Uitgebreid ontbijtbuffet. Ideaal gelegen op 5 minuten wandelen van Times Square. Verschillende diensten zoals reservatie uitstappen en theater. Wij komen terug.

title: Great hotel and location
text: This is my fourth time at this hotel. The rooms are big and the beds are very comfortable. And most important, the are rooms are clean :). Laying in a quiet street and just a short walk to the subway. Friendly staff and very helpful with everything. The rooms and location is the best thing with this hotel.

title: Bom hotel
text: Quarto de bom tamanho, com frigobar, com wi fi, armários de bom tamanho e cômodas com várias gavetas. Pessoal atencioso e camareiras simpáticas e trocavam todos os dias os lençóis. Banheiro bom, reformado, assim como as toalhas novas. A localização é muito boa, pois íamos à pé até a 5a avenida. Perto dos teatros e tem estação de metrô pertinho. Paguei 5 dólares para receber encomenda que comprei pelo Correio. Tem bons restaurantes perto para jantar.

title: Good location, great staff, dated rooms
text:
Fantastic location very close to Broadway and Times Square. The Staff were great - Ricky and Jacob in particular were really friendly and helpful, so thank you to them for making our stay a pleasant one.
The only disappointment was the rooms - we had booked Deluxe King rooms through Expedia and they were not Deluxe. Room 1428 is lovely - it's a corner room with great views over 2 streets. Room 1426 was small and dark and had a cracked sink - the air con unit is stuck in the window - it's so dated, there's nothing deluxe about it at all. We moved to room 1612 which was only marginally better but the views were enough to make us move. You can see the Hudson river from one side and the One World Trade Centre and the New Years Eve ball from the other. The rooms have fridges and coffee machines. There are no mugs or teaspoons, but cardboard cups and stirrers provided with the coffee and whitener/sugar. You can ask for a kettle and buy a mug whilst you're out! The corner store is great for bottled water and breakfast pastries - I can highly recommend Honey Buns! 
Overall, the Hotel was in a great location and the staff were great. The only downside was the rooms which let it down badly. The website deluxe rooms looked so wonderful, but so didn't live up to expectation.
Close to lots of eateries on 9th Avenue (try Kahve coffee shop on 9th) and close enough to Times Square and Broadway for other restaurant options - try John's Pizza and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co in Times Square.

title: Very nice
text:
A very nice old style hotel that’s been tastefully redesigned.  While the rooms are a little small, they are average for New York.   
The staff is friendly and attentive.  
Parking is expensive especially if you have an SUV.

title: Balade dans New-York
text:
Nous avons passé 7 jours dans cet hôtel. Nous y avons été bien accueilli. Le personnel est à l’écoute et bienveillant. Notre chambre était spacieuse et propre située au 15 ème étage où la vue était superbe. Nous avons apprécié le coin kitchenette. La déco de la salle de bain vintage nous a beaucoup charmée.Nous sommes fan de ce style d’hôtel année 1920...
La situation de l’hôtel est parfaite pour partir à la découverte de NY. Il y a différentes lignes de métro à proximité. Time square est à 5 mn... Pour la restauration il y a du choix aux alentours de l’hôtel... Le petit déjeuner est copieux... Je conseil cet hôtel aux familles aussi ...

title: Bravo!!! Excellent Hotel!!!
text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The Belvedere Hotel has a perfect location just a block away from the busy tourist filled Times Square. The subway is located just around the corner too and this goes directly to the JFK airport train at Howard Beach or Jamaica. There are plenty of shops and restaurants also in the vicinity. The staff on reception are very friendly and helpful, and we were delighted to be upgraded on check in. The room exceeded our expectations. The bathroom was a little small, but we didn't mind because the room was quite spacious with a large comfortable bed. I would highly recommend The Belvedere Hotel to anybody planning a trip to New York

title: Grazie
text:
Ho pernottato una notte per stare vicino a mio marito che subiva un intervento alla mano...
Prenotato all’ultimo minuto.
Complimenti per l’accoglienza, la pulizia  e la disponibilità!
Piccolo,ma molto carino!
Grazie mille

title: Top Lage
text:
Wir verbringen hier eine Woche und sind sehr zufrieden;)
Tolle Lage und wir haben in der 16.Etage ein schönes Zimmer mit einer tollen Aussicht... wir können sogar von hier oben das leuchten vom Times Square sehen. Und stört die Geräuschkulisse nicht. Das Frühstück ist auch richtig gut, für jeden was dabei. Wir können es mit gutem Gewissen weiterempfehlen!

title: Good Value!
text: We had a king room on a corner so views from 2 different sides. Very convenient to theaters and Times Square. There is a fire station at the corner so somewhat bothersome at night. I suggest getting a room to the back as it may be quieter. The bed was firm but comfortable. Clean and updated! Would stay again. All of the staff was friendly and accommodating.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: La ubicación del hotel es excelente, a la vuelta tenés la bajada para el metro, a cinco minutos Times Square. La habitación cómoda y la limpieza  muy buena, el baño correcto. Tiene tv por cable, pero el wi fi es de pago y muy caro por cierto. El personal es muy amable y dispuesto a solucionar cualquier inconveniente. Muy buena relación precio / calidad.

title: Prisvärt
text:
Ett hotell med ett bra läge i kombination med priset, inget överdådigt utan ett bra mellanklass hotell. Åker man till New York är det troligen inte för att sitta på ett hotellrum varför läget är viktigt och just läget är det som Belevedere stora fördel.
Frukosten fungerar men jag rekommenderar att gå ut på stan och leta upp något av alla ställen som serverar frukost.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Stayed here beginning of February hotel met all expectations. Very clean and super comfy beds, love the art deco feel and staff helpful and professional. Had breakfast in the hotel which is really good value plenty of choice for all tastes and a lovely environment to eat in. Hope to come back to New York next year and will almost certainly be booking at the Belvedere as it's central location is perfect for exploring the city. Thank you for a lovely stay to our first visit to New York.

title: Good price, nice hotel
text:
I’ve stayed in NYC many times, booked this as the price was very good. It’s certainly the best value hotel I’ve had in Manhattan.
I read some poor reviews before i visited, but nothing I saw could confirm any of them. Staff were efficient, not overly friendly but works for me. Only gripe i had with them was when they told me my package didn’t come with free breakfast (it did), was booked through Expedia and had to trawl through emails to ‘prove it’ .
Hotel was very clean, and loved the Art Deco feel throughout, still had original features like the Cutler Mail Chute. Thought perhaps our bedroom may have benefitted from uplift, especially the bathroom, very 70s feel, but again spotlessly clean. Beds for me were very comfortable,  and I slept well. Room was however very hot, couldn’t turn radiator down, air con was a bit noisy , but could vent by opening window.
Breakfast was good and enough to keep me going all day.
If I’m ever back in Manhattan I’d certainly consider staying here again

title: Perfectly situated
text: We stayed at this hotel 01/02/2018 until 05/02/2018 in room 1612. The hotel itself is lovely I love the decor and all the staff I encountered were really helpful. We ate breakfast at the hotel and the food was very good,we did eat breakfast out on one day but after everything was added on like drinks and tax it was false economy. The hotel is perfectly situated for Times Square and all the attractions nearby.

title: Great Location
text:
This hotel is in a great location for exploring NYC, just a few minutes walk to times square. 

It is a little outdated, and the elevator very old fashioned but the room size was great and we had a comfortable stay.

We did have to call the concierge in the middle of the night as we could hear a commotion in one of the rooms - they were fantastic and responded very swiftly.

The happy hour every evening with a free glass of wine was a lovely touch!

title: Great location for theatergoers
text: Classy Art Deco building with spacious, comfortable rooms. Kitchenettes very handy for snacks & restaurant leftovers. Look for Ricky when you check in. We've been regulars for 20 years, and met people in the elevators from all over the world.

title: Connected
text: Localização privilegiada ! Bom atendimento, confortável com bom custo beneficio ! Ótimas opções de breakfast próximo ao hotel e a poucas quadras da Time Square ! Não precisa de carro pra nada ! A estação do metrô fica próximo e os táxis sao uma boa opção de transporte se vc quiser ir mais longe em Manhattan

title: Good Value
text:
This hotel is in an excellent location in the Hell’s Kitchen area and only 15 mins walk to 34th Street to Empire State & Macy’s.  Good size room, although lack of sockets made charging phones and tablets difficult.  Had to unplug lamp to use the hairdryer.  Think the place could do with a re wire and bathrooms also need updating.  However, this did not spoil our stay as the hotel was clean, warm and staff were very helpful.
Only real drawback, no kettle, only coffee machine.  We brits love our tea!!

title: Good value and location
text:
My sister and I stayed here one night before an expensive Broadway show.  I read many reviews before booking the Belvedere.  I was completely satisfied and think our room was an excellent value.
   I booked the executive upgraded room.  I didn't think I would be satisfied with the others that hadn't been upgraded.  Our wifi was free.  The room is small but adequate.  The mattress, pillows, and bedding were new and I thought they were wonderful, very comfortable.
   I don't like elevators so I walked up stairs to the 3rd floor.  The staircase is not secured - think they should do this.
   The location was fantastic.  
    The price was affordable and good for the location.
    Would stay here again.

title: Location is perfect
text:
My friend and i had a four night stay here and it was great. The hotel is a little outdated but has character. The front desk staff were lovely and helpful, only one bed was booked by our travel agent and they were more than happy to move us to a room with two beds. This place is really close to both time square, broadway and the subway network so transportation was easy.

My only complaints/inconvience were:
- they had signs in the room saying to conserve water hang up your towels and we wont take them, but every single day we hung up our towels they were replaced with new ones.
- in this day and age it is ridiculous to pay $14 usd per night for wifi that wasnt even very good, we had a better connection at Starbucks.
- the heater did its job well but it is ridiculously noisy and woke us up several times during our stay.

title: Great location, enjoyable stay
text: Beautiful old hotel in great location.  Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Buffet breakfast was good. We booked on Expedia and got a great rate, the Belvedere was an excellent value for the price.  Staff arranged private car back to airport and happily answered all our questions about the city.  I would recommend

title: Muy correcto
text:
Tras la estancia en este hotel decir q es como lo describieron. Cerca de todo pero a la suficiente distancia como para estar muy tranquilo. A 5 minutos de Time Square y de todo lo q conlleva
La atención de los empleados d recepción muy correcta y afable. La cama era muy cómoda y la habitación grande con un baño muy correcto. La limpieza diaria y también muy correcta. Si hay algún pero sería el ruido en el aire acondicionado pero era muy soportable. Repetiríamos sin dudas.

title: Excelente Hotel custo/beneficio
text: Gostei muito desse Hotel, excelente localizacao perto de tudo. Bom atendimento, o quarto é grande e possui uma mini cozinha com pia, microondas, geladeira e cafeteira. Voltaria a me hospedar la com certeza.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Fuimos en el mes de Marzo con mi Novia. El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación a unas pocas cuadras de time square y con fácil acceso a  todos los medios de transporte. Justo cuando fuimos la fachada del hotel se encontraba en reparación lo que no nos permitió apreciarlo, aunque esto no fue un problema.
El tamaño de la habitación estaba muy bien, también la cama, baño y limpieza de la misma. Tv con varios canales de cable.
No tiene wifi gratis, y el wifi en la habitación es carísimo. No contratamos desayuno ya que cerca del hotel hay muchos lugares para desayunar a un costo razonable. También hay un supermercado pequeño a una cuadra.
La relación precio/calidad del hotel es muy buena, comprado a otros hoteles de nueva york que valen mucho mas y no poseen una ubicación tan buena.

title: Visit for family service
text:
Booked hotel 
Location is perfectly located a few blocks from Time Square and the Lincoln tunnel..
I was upgraded free of charge on arrival, they offered... beautifully decorated comfy beds clean staff very warm and friendly.
